CHOICE.Phoenix: ( It looks like I was wrong... )

CHOICE.Judge: Wright, Wright, Wright. Try to think before you present again.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( So, he went to get his cell phone back, but when he got there, he lost control of himself. It was probably because he saw something that was really bad for him there... And that " really bad thing " was...! )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads back to "Well, then Mr. Wright..."

text.Phoenix: What Mr. Wellington saw was... the victim.

text.Payne: T-The... The victim!? You mean Dustin Prince!?

text.Phoenix: Dustin Prince had gone on his date right after his shift was over. With no time to change, he went to the park still wearing his police uniform !

text.Judge: Oh!

text.Phoenix: He couldn't have known they were going out so he began to worry. He was afraid the policeman would ask a few questions before returning the phone.
In his mind, it was possible they had already run a check on the phone!

text.Judge: And he went into a panic, is what you're saying?

text.Phoenix: Exactly. Officer Prince was murdered simply because he was in uniform!

text.Judge: Mr. Payne. Do you have any comments?

text.Payne: I, um... I'm thinking...

text.Judge: Hmm, it seems the truth has come out at last. The witness... Mr. Wellington, you are--

text.Wellington: Ha... Ah ha ha... Ahahahahahahaaahahaahahaahahahahaha HahahaAhahahahahaHahahaHahhaaha AAAHAHAhhahahahah AHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAWAHAHAHAHAHAWAHAHAHAHAWAHAAHAHAHWAHAHAHAHAAAAAA Ha ha ha ha... Impressive... Not bad for a person with a third-rate education...

text.Phoenix: What's that supposed to mean!?

text.Wellington: The evidence... Evidence!

text.Maya: Uuugh! That guy is really creeping me out--

text.Wellington: All you've been waving around and talking about is that "suspicious" cell phone. Suspicious phone number this, suspicious con group that! They're all on that phone! But who's to say that phone is really mine!? Where's your proof!? Your evidence!?

text.Phoenix: You want proof that this phone is yours?

text.Wellington: Ahahahaha! Ahehehehehe! I already told you earlier! That phone I lost -- I've already found it! You don't have even the slightest idea who the phone in your hand belongs to! But you can be sure it isn't mine, you simpleton!
text._info: (Changed from [You can be sure it isn't mine, you simpleton!] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: WHAT!?

text.Wellington: Hehehehe... Heh... Hehehehe... It feels good to see you squirm.

text.Judge: Hmm... We do seem to have a problem on our hands with this phone. Whose phone is it? Without knowing that, it's meaningless as evidence.

text.Phoenix: Your Honor! ( This is bad... I can't let him turn the tables on me like this!! Hmm... This cell phone... There has to be something I've overlooked. There's got to be! Hmm... Maybe... )

CHOICE.ACTION: USER SELECTS The phone's stored numbers?

CHOICE.Phoenix: This phone has the names and numbers of those in the con group in its memory. I can show them to you, Your Honor!

CHOICE.Wellington: I don't believe this. What are you talking about!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Uh...

CHOICE.Wellington: What we are trying to determine is who that phone belongs to ! Who cares about what phone numbers are stored on it!? Besides, who knows. Maybe you went and added some of those numbers in yourself!

CHOICE.Judge: The witness is quite right. I'm afraid I have to reject the defense's proposal.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Grr... That jerk is back to his arrogant, annoying self again... )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads back to "Hmm... This cell phone..."
USER SELECTS Fingerprints on the phone?
Leads to "I got it! We should check for fingerprints!"

text.Phoenix: I got it! We should check for fingerprints!

text.Judge: Finger...prints...?

text.Phoenix: Yes, Your Honor. Mr. Wellington must have left some prints on this phone!

text.Maya: Nick! Don't you remember!? When you got that from Maggey, you wiped it off!

text.Phoenix: I what!?

text.Maya: You said there was sand all over it, so...

text.Phoenix: W-Wiped it? I wiped it...?

text.Maya: Pretty thoroughly, too...

text.Wellington: WahahaHahaHAHahaha! It's oh-so-much fun watching third-rate trash babble like morons amongst themselves!

text.Phoenix: ( Aaargh! He's made a complete recovery... )

text.Wellington: How many times do I have to say this: my phone is right here! You see? Oh, and incidentally, you can't check the numbers stored on this phone. It must have glitched because all the numbers just magically disappeared !

text.Phoenix: ( You've got to be joking! He erased all the numbers I was going to use as evidence! ) ... Mr. Wellington...

text.Wellington: What's this? By the tone of your voice, it sounds like you still have some fight left in you.
text._info: (Changed from [From the way you talk to me, it sounds like you still have some fight left in you.] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: Where did you finally find your cell phone!?

text.Wellington: ... ...Heh heh heh... Ah ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha! Oh, you are too much! And of course you have no idea what I'm talking about!

text.Phoenix: I... I... Oh my g-- NOW I REMEMBER!!
Huh, looks like they hung up.

text.???: Ah, good. I finally found it.

text.Phoenix: ( So that's when... )

text.Wellington: What's wrong, Mr. Attorney? Why the harsh glare in your eyes...?

text.Maya: Nick! We've worked so hard to get this far, but if you don't do something quick, he's going to get off scot-free!

text.Phoenix: I know. ( I know this phone has to be his... But how am I supposed to prove something like that!? )

text.Judge: Mr. Wright. If you cannot prove who the owner of that cell phone is, your indictment has no basis, and therefore, no power. It looks like you came up a penny short.

text.Phoenix: ( Where...? Where did I go wrong...? )

text.Wellington: Don't blame yourself, you're merely a third-rate lawyer. You only made one big mistake. Who are you? What are you? That's something you haven't figured out for yourself yet.

text.Phoenix: ( Who... I am? )

text.Judge: The court hereby concludes the cross-examination!

text.Wellington: Heh heh heh... If that will be all, I'll have to bid you gentlemen and ladies goodbye. I have a reservation at that ultra-fancy restaurant on the upper side of town.

text.Payne: Thank you for your assistance. You've had a stressful day, so please, bon appetite!

text.Phoenix: ( What am I supposed to do!? Am I supposed to just let it go at that? )

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( It's no use. I can't do any more. There's nothing left. Nothing left but to go back home and... Not that I know where that is... )
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [Nothing left but to go back to my hometown... But where in the world is that, anyway?] in the original release)

CHOICE.Maya: What are you mumbling about!? You're... Well, you're YOU, Nick! And because you're you, you can't give up now!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( "If I were me"...? ) Alright. If I were me, then what would I do?

CHOICE.Maya: That's easy! For starters, you'd raise your voice and object!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( So for now, I should at least say something! )
HOLD IT!
HOLD IT!

text.Phoenix: Please wait, Your Honor!

text.Maya: Alright, Nick!

text.Phoenix: I think I may be able to prove it!

text.Judge: "Prove it...?" Prove what, Mr. Wright?

text.Phoenix: Everything!

text.Payne: Objection!
Y-Your Honor! The cross-examination has already ended! Besides, the defense is just going to badger the witness with more inane questions...
text._info: (Changed from [If he questions the witness with any more of his badgering...] in the original release)

text.Judge: You will not harass the witness. Is that clear, Mr. Wright?

text.Wellington: Did you hear that? No harassment allowed, Mr. Attorney.

text.Phoenix: Please, Your Honor!

text.Judge: ... Very well. But this is your last chance, Mr. Wright.
You may present one piece of evidence to the court.

text.Phoenix: ( I only get one shot at this! )

text.Judge: If you cannot "prove" everything... It's over. For your client, and for you. Do you fully understand?

text.Phoenix: Yes, Your Hon--

text.Payne: Objection!
I'm sure you are well aware, Your Honor, but the cross-examination period has ended!

text.Judge: Were you paying attention, Mr. Payne? I said that Mr. Wright could present only one more piece of evidence.

text.Payne: Oh...

text.Judge: Now then, Mr. Wright. This is your last chance.

text.Phoenix: ( It all comes down to this! It's Go time! )

text.Judge: Please present the one piece of evidence that will explain everything!

CHOICE.ACTION: USER SELECTS Present Phoenix's Business Card
Leads to "Why, thank you. How nice."

CHOICE.Judge: ... Is this your final answer? It's a bit disappointing.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Nonono! That was just a friendly gesture!

CHOICE.Wellington: Ha ha ha. You sure know how to send a friendly gesture to me, at least.

CHOICE.Judge: This is your absolute last chance, Mr. Wright. So no more of these "friendly gestures"!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yes, Your Honor... Sorry...

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads back to "Please present the one piece of evidence that will explain everything!"

text.Judge: Why, thank you. How nice. Here, please have one of mine.
Wait, what am I doing!? This isn't the time to be exchanging business cards!

text.Phoenix: Your Honor. There is something very important about that card. And that is...

CHOICE.ACTION: USER SELECTS The name on the card

CHOICE.Phoenix: The name on that card tells people who I am! It even told ME that I'm "Phoenix Wright"!

CHOICE.Judge: ...Did you not know that?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Nope!

CHOICE.Payne: Objection!
Wh-Wh-What's the meaning of this nonsense!?

CHOICE.Judge: Mr. Wright! Get a hold of yourself and start behaving like a proper lawyer!

CHOICE.Maya: Ouch... Talk about a tongue-lashing, Nick...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Urk. I should probably try this from a different angle... )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "This card is important because of what is on the back!"
USER SELECTS The back of the card
Leads to "This card is important because of what is on the back!"

text.Phoenix: This card is important because of what is on the back!

text.Maya: Hmm? You wrote your cell phone number on the back, but...

text.Phoenix: But that's exactly it. Can you please call this number from your cell phone?

text.Maya: Huh? Right now!? But court is still in session!

text.Phoenix: It's OK. You'll see.

text.Maya: OK, if you say so.

text.Judge: Is the defense preparing something, Mr. Wright?

text.Phoenix: We are going to call my cell phone now. And then the court will see everything for what it is!

text.Wellington: O-Of all the idiotic, stupid things to...
Aaagh! Wh-What!? Why is my phone...? And what is with this stupid-sounding ringtone!?

text.Phoenix: Mr. Wellington.
Hmm... How strange... I could almost swear that you're holding MY phone!

text.Wellington: Y-Your... AAAAAAAAAAAH! No, no, no, no, no! It can't...!!

text.Phoenix: By the way, before I forget, thank you very much for the lump on my head this morning.

text.Wellington: Nnnnngh...

text.Phoenix: I don't think I need to explain any further, except to say: When you went to retrieve your cell phone, you mistakenly took the wrong one!

text.Wellington: ...Mmgh... Aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAaaaaaaaagggggggghhhnn!

text.Judge: So that is what happened. You were knocked out by Mr. Wellington...

text.Phoenix: He is a man who lives on his pride and self-image alone. And in order to hide his involvement with the con artists' group, he has become paranoid, and has lost all ability to make rational judgments.

text.Judge: Hmm...

text.Payne: Then... Then, Mr. Wright... The phone you're holding...

text.Judge: Speaking of that man, how is he, Mr. Payne?

text.Payne: Ah, he was arrested and has been taken away, Your Honor.

text.Judge: Very well. Now then, this court finds the defendant, Maggey Byrde...
That is all. This court is adjourned!

text.ACTION: September 8, 2:16 PM District Court Defendant Lobby No. 1

text.Byrde: I knew that the real you would shine through eventually! I am so moved by what you've done for me, sir! Thank you so much, Mr. Wright!

text.Maya: I feel really bad for Dustin. He didn't do anything to deserve this...

text.Byrde: ... It's probably because of me...

text.Phoenix: Huh?

text.Byrde: My whole life has been nothing but a whirlwind of bad luck and failures.

text.Maya: Your whole life? It couldn't have been that bad, could it?

text.Byrde: Since I was 6 months old, when I fell from the 9th floor of my apartment building, I've been hit by all sorts of vehicles, gotten sick from all sorts of foods, failed at almost every test I've ever taken, experienced almost every kind of disaster, and never won or even tied at a game of tic-tac-toe! My life has really been nothing but a string of disasters .

text.Phoenix: That is, uh... pretty bad...

text.Byrde: Up until I went to college, I was known as the "Goddess of Misfortune". And then, at the academy, everyone called me "Lady Luckless".

text.Maya: "Lady Luckless"...

text.Byrde: What's worse is that my misfortune always seems to latch onto those around me.

text.Maya: What do you mean?

text.Byrde: When I see someone in trouble, I always try to help...

text.Phoenix: Ah, that's right. You were talking about this earlier.

text.Byrde: It happened again recently, too, sir. There was an old lady pacing back and forth by the pedestrian crosswalk. I gave her my hand and... before I knew it, we were having dinner at my house.
I'm sure that Dustin's gone because of me...

text.Maya: That's not true!

text.Byrde: That glove didn't even have any sort of special meaning. It was just a present to say thanks for covering one of my night shifts.

text.Maya: Oh, I see...

text.Byrde: Everything is all my fault! Dustin's death, your head being all messed up...

text.Phoenix: Uh, well, I don't think my head is that messed up yet...

text.Byrde: I'm going to find a new life for myself starting now. The next time we meet, I'm sure I'll... I'm sure I'll have found a whole ocean's worth of good luck by then, sir!

text.Phoenix: Yeah. After all, the " Goddess of Misfortune " is only a name!

text.Byrde: You bet! I'm gonna make it! I promise! Next time we meet, I'll only be an " Unlucky Person ", instead of a goddess!

text.Phoenix: Y-Yeah! That's the spirit!

text.Byrde: Well, Mr. Wright, Maya, I should get going.

text.Maya: OK! Good luck to you!

text.Byrde: Thanks! You take care of yourselves, too!

text.Phoenix: * sigh * What a horrible day... I've gotten my memory back, but things are still a little fuzzy...

text.Maya: But you're OK, and that's what counts. You really had me worried! Come on, let's go back to the office.

text.Phoenix: ( Hmm... I'm afraid to ask, but here goes... ) So, this might sound bad, but... uh... Who are you...?

text.Maya: What!? I thought you said you got your memory back!

text.Phoenix: ( At that moment, everything really did come back to me... )
( And this girl... ) ...Maya...?

text.Maya: You... You finally remembered!

text.Phoenix: ( This is Maya Fey, my assistant. That's right... I have so many unforgettable memories about her. For example... )

text.Maya: Earth to Nick! What's wrong? You keep staring at me! Don't tell me you've missed me?

text.Phoenix: Uh, well, yeah I suppose I have. I feel like I haven't seen you in ages.

text.Maya: Oh? Well, I'm back now. So it's time for us to create new memories together!

text.Phoenix: Alright. Sounds good. ( All the phone numbers on my phone were erased by Mr. Wellington. I guess I have to start over from the very beginning... )

text.Maya: Come on, Nick! Let's go to our usual burger joint!

text.Phoenix: OK, OK. ( Actually, it hasn't even been two months since she came back into my life. )

text.LOCATION: Episode 1: The Lost Turnabout THE END

text.Maya: I finally get to see you again, and...

text.Phoenix: It's not your fault. You didn't do it.

text.Maya: No, I... I did it... I killed that person.

text.Phoenix: But that wasn't you.

text.Maya: It doesn't matter. It might as well have been me.

text.Phoenix: ( I can't believe something like this happened...The events of that gloomy, rainy afternoon that started this whole mess...keep playing through my mind... )

text.ACTION: June 16, 3:34 PM Wright & Co. Law Offices

text.???: What depressing rain... Do you understand how depressed that makes me!? Do you!?

text.Phoenix: Uh, I guess...

text.???: But actually, more than being depressed, I'm angry. Angry at that weather girl on TV. "I think our little rainy spell will take a break with a day of sun!"...is what that girl said! I'd stake my life on it!

text.Phoenix: Well, it's the weather...

text.???: But that's why I didn't bother to bring an umbrella today. What nerve, calling herself a weather girl! She's going to hear about my $1500 suit!

text.Phoenix: Um... About your case... Unless you're planning on suing the weather girl...?

text.???: ... I'm sorry. I thought that before we got down to business, we could have some friendly chatter. My name is Dr. Turner Grey. I'm a surgeon.

text.Phoenix: ( Remind me never to end up under his knife... )

text.Grey: I'm here today because of this incident.

text.Phoenix: "Malpractice at Grey Surgical Clinic. Fourteen In-Patients Lose Their Lives!" ...Oh. You're... the doctor at...?

text.Grey: It's really quite upsetting. Did you hear me!? UPSETTING!

text.Phoenix: Yes, yes, I heard you. I agree, it's quite upsetting, Dr. Grey.

text.Grey: The one that screwed up was that nurse! It was her that got the medications mixed up and killed those 14 patients! And yet! Now listen good! And yet! That nurse had the nerve to go and die before admitting to her wrongdoing! She didn't even offer any sort of explanation to me! And this is the kicker! She up and has herself a grand ol' accident and crashed her car! Smash! Crunch! Instantly transforming her car into the accordion model!

text.Phoenix: ( That's right... About a year ago, all the tabloid shows were talking about it. Fourteen victims of medical malpractice and the nurse's mysterious fatal accident. There were rumors that Dr. Grey had actually caused that crash. People said it was to forever hide the person responsible for the malpractice incident. )

text.Grey: Why would I...? Now, I'm just going to say this once -- Why on Earth would I want to kill that nurse? She's the one who killed those 14 patients! Not me!

text.Phoenix: I think you need to take a deep breath, doctor, and focus... More to the point, this case is over a year old. Why bring it up now...?

text.Grey: That's simple! Because the situation is slipping out of my grasp. This just won't do. My clinic isn't seeing nearly as many patients nowadays. Do you understand what that means!? It means they're not coming to my clinic!

text.Phoenix: ( You don't say...? If it were me, I don't think I'd want to go either. ) So... what would you like me to do about it...?

text.Grey: I want you to help me prove I'm innocent.

text.Phoenix: Um, you do realize I'm a lawyer, not a private investigator, right?

text.Grey: No, this is something only you can do.
Maya Fey. You know this girl, correct?

text.Phoenix: ...! ( Maya! Why would he know her name...!? )

text.Grey: I heard you were working under her for a little while.

text.Phoenix: Well, yes... I mean... Hey, wait a second here! I worked UNDER her !?

text.Grey: Yes. Am I wrong? She told me, so I'm not quite sure if...

text.Phoenix: Well, we worked a few trials together. But she went back to her hometown to undergo more training.

text.Grey: Ah, yes, I heard. It must be lonely for you.

text.Phoenix: Wh-What!? Wait... I'm not...!

text.Grey: She must be an extraordinary girl to handle such rigid training.

text.Phoenix: Huh?

text.Grey: I have an acquaintance who knows a lot about these mystical sorts of things. She's the one who introduced me to Ms. Fey.

text.Phoenix: ( Is Maya... really that famous...? )

text.Grey: And I've already set up an appointment.

text.Phoenix: For what?

text.Grey: What else!? A channeling! I'm going to have her call the spirit of that nurse that went and got herself killed!

text.Phoenix: O-Oh. ( Maya... I wonder what she's up to right now... )

text.Maya: We, the women of the Fey clan have always been spirit mediums. It's because the power to communicate with spirits flows strongly through us.
text._info: (Changed from [We, the women of the Fey family, have always been spirit mediums.] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: ( That's what she told me... I guess she's learned to accept her responsibilities and become an adult... )

text.Grey: Not counting training, this will be her first time channeling a spirit, so she gave me one condition before accepting my request.

text.Phoenix: A condition...?

text.Grey: The condition is you, Mr. Wright. She said that she wouldn't do the channeling without first seeing you again.
And that is why I've searched you out! You want to see her too, don't you!?

text.Phoenix: ( And so... that is how I ended up visiting Maya's hometown with the doctor... )
( So this is Kurain Village; Maya's hometown. )
W-Why, hello there.
Hmm... What an odd little girl.

text.???: Hey! Wait up, Pearly!!

text.Phoenix: ( Hm? Someone else is coming this way... )

text.???: Niiiiiiiick!

text.Phoenix: M-Maya. How are you...? It's good to see you again.

text.Maya: Wow, I didn't think you'd really show up!

text.Phoenix: It's not that big a deal. You made it sound like you were soooo far away.

text.Maya: Well, maybe I exaggerated... just a little.

text.Phoenix: It was only 2 hours by train. If I had known you were this close, I'd have visited more.

text.Maya: No! You're not allowed. I already decided, you know. Until I become an adult, I have to work hard and be strong by myself...

text.Phoenix: Oh... well... Anyway, congratulations. I'm glad to hear training is going well for you.

text.Maya: Heh, heh...

CHOICE.Phoenix: It's an old-style phone booth. I can't say it fits in with this area too well. My cell phone doesn't get reception up here, so who knows. I may need it later.
An old bus stop. It says "Kurain Village" on the sign post. The buses seem incredibly inconvenient since they only come 3 times a day.

A giant rock that seems to be reaching for the sky. Its origins are written on a beat-up, old sign. It looks like this giant rock is called the "Kurain Boulder". There's a really complex explanation written here, but long story short, it's a big stone for spirits to live in... Or something like that...

Rustic, thatch-roofed houses where the other villagers live line the street. They're nowhere near as large or as nice as the manor in front of me. It's kind of odd that I don't see any of the other villagers walking around, though...
The biggest, most elegant of the buildings I can see from here. This is Fey Manor; the place Maya calls home. It's easy to be overwhelmed by its presence...
Looks like you've finally become a full-fledged medium, taking on your first job.

CHOICE.Maya: Yeah. I didn't think it would be this soon.

CHOICE.Phoenix: But this case... Do you know the messy story behind it...?

CHOICE.Maya: Ha ha ha, behold the power of the Maya Intelligence Network! Let's see. Fourteen people died because of malpractice on Dr. Grey's part, right? And to pin the blame on the nurse, he killed her in what appeared to be a car accident!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Huh? Um, so what is this "Maya Intelligence Network" anyway...?

CHOICE.Maya: The tabloids.

CHOICE.Phoenix: That's what I thought.

CHOICE.Maya: ... Ha ha ha. I'm just pulling your leg, Nick! What really happened is the exact opposite. I heard all about it from Dr. Grey.
Oh, come on, Nick! I wouldn't take a crazed killer as a client! That's too scary, even for me.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Y-Yeah, I guess so. )
So this is your hometown, huh, Maya?

CHOICE.Maya: Yup! Kurain Village... But I've heard people call this place "Medium Valley", too.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Interesting... So everyone that lives here is a spirit medium?

CHOICE.Maya: Pretty much. Most of my ancestors were too, I think...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( That's probably true since the Fey ability to communicate with the dead is so strong... )

CHOICE.Maya: Actually, only the women of this village are mediums.

CHOICE.Phoenix: So what do the men do?

CHOICE.Maya: They usually work someplace outside the village.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Oh yeah, I wanted to ask you about that girl I saw earlier. Do you know her?

CHOICE.Maya: Oh, you mean Pearly?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Pearly?

CHOICE.Maya: Pearl Fey. She's my cousin. Isn't she adorable? Just like yours truly!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Cousin... Wait, then that means... Is she also a...?

CHOICE.Maya: Yup. She's a medium, too. Pearly's a real genius when it comes to channeling!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Hmm, I see. I hope I didn't scare her when I tried to talk to her earlier.

CHOICE.Maya: Nah, it's not you. My aunt drilled it into her head that "if a suspicious-looking person tries to talk to you, run away".

CHOICE.Phoenix: S-Suspicious-looking...!?

CHOICE.Maya: Well, you're not wearing training clothes, for starters...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Of course not.

CHOICE.Maya: Pearly is my aunt's most valued treasure, so she's not allowed to go outside of town. She doesn't know much about the world outside of Kurain Village.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Aunt?

CHOICE.Maya: Pearly's mother is my aunt, duh. Come on, Nick.
Ah, it's good to see this tarnished badge again.

CHOICE.Phoenix: What do you mean by "tarnished"...?

CHOICE.Maya: Well, look. This badge is like every other. It's bound to lose its color and shine after years and years. But you know, polishing it up once in a while wouldn't be a bad idea.
Ha ha ha. I'm warning you! I'm not the same weak Maya you knew a year ago, Nick!

CHOICE.Phoenix: You seem to have a lot of faith in yourself.

CHOICE.Maya: You'll see soon enough. I think you'll be totally shocked by how good my hamburgers are now!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Were you training to be a medium or a cook? )

CHOICE.Maya: Hey, it's my client!

CHOICE.Phoenix: "Client," huh? You're really serious about your work, aren't you?

CHOICE.Maya: I thought I'd say it once, just to try it out, like how you always say, "My client."
Hmm, nothing really comes to mind, Nick.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Don't say that with such a big smile on your face.

CHOICE.Maya: Ha ha. What can I say? I'm in a good mood today.

CHOICE.Phoenix: What do you think about this person?

CHOICE.Maya: Hey, have I told you this one yet, Nick? We have a legend in this village. It goes like this. "All the woman of the Fey clan are beauties." Well?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...And that's a legend now?

text.Maya: Well, Nick, I've got to get going. It's about time for the channeling to start.

text.Phoenix: Huh? Oh, yeah...

text.Maya: I'm doing the channeling in my house, so come on in, OK? After I'm done, we can grill up some juicy burgers!

text.Phoenix: Alright. Good luck, Maya.

text.Maya: Thanks!

text.Phoenix: ( Well... At least she's still the same perky Maya. )

text.Grey: Ah, Mr. Wright. I'm so glad you showed.

text.Phoenix: Some nice weather we're having today. Aren't you happy?

text.Grey: No, not at all. That stupid weather girl made the wrong call again. "It will rain cats and dogs today!" she said with a straight face. I can't believe they allow such misguided reports on the public airwaves!

text.Phoenix: ( Looks like talking about the weather with this guy is just asking for punishment... )

text.Grey: ...But anyway, this is a splendid manor.

text.Phoenix: ( No argument there... It's hard to believe that this is Maya's house, though... )

text.Grey: I was given a guidemap to this building. Here, Mr. Wright. I have a copy for you too.

CHOICE.Phoenix: A door that leads to the Channeling Chamber, the place where spirits and people meet. The iron in this door was tempered, making it very solid. It looks like there is a strong lock on this door to top it off.

Someone with a lot of skill wrote these four Chinese characters with a brush. Oh look, here's a translation: "Once in a Lifetime." Its message is people should value their ghostly meetings as once in a lifetime chances.

A piece of cloth with a ton of finely-written characters jammed onto it. Probably esoteric knowledge only mediums should know. ...Hmm, let's see... Here's one in English... It says... "100 Ways to Save Money". ... Being a medium sounds like a rough way of life...
This door leads out to the Winding Way. The weather outside looks really nice.
What are you going to do once the nurse's spirit has been called?

CHOICE.Grey: Isn't it obvious? I'm going to have her write a signed confession.

CHOICE.Phoenix: A signed confession?

CHOICE.Grey: Yes, a confession. Pay attention! I'll have her write this: "One year ago, on May 2nd, 14 patients died due to my negligence. And then, on May 24th, I fell asleep at the wheel and died in a car accident due to my further negligence. I'm sorry and I apologize for being negligent." That's what I'll have her write! With a confession, the rain falling on my soul can finally stop.

CHOICE.Phoenix: O-Oh, I see...
So, how did you hear about Maya Fey...?

CHOICE.Grey: I heard about her from an acquaintance; a girl studying the occult at the college. That girl introduced me to this village. This is the home of the Kurain School of Channeling.

CHOICE.Phoenix: The home, huh...?

CHOICE.Grey: And Ms. Maya is a daughter of the "Master" , I hear.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Master...?

CHOICE.Grey: Anyway, do you see that door? That's the room where people and spirits meet. Ms. Maya's aunt is in there right now. Would you care to meet her...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Look, here's my attorney's badge.

CHOICE.Grey: Are you trying to compete with me and my profession with that piece of scrap?
I am a surgeon. Compared to you lawyers, I'm practically a saint! Yes, well, I don't exactly have any patients right now, but, and listen good! I'm not the one that made the mistake!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( This doctor needs his head examined... )
Wow, this manor is really nice, don't you think?

CHOICE.Grey: Do you honestly think this place is all that impressive? Don't make me laugh.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Huh?

CHOICE.Grey: This is the countryside. Land here is dirt cheap. I will have something much greater one day! I will build my own grand mansion! Did you hear me!? A grand MANSION! This manor will seem like nothing!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Uh, could you keep that shaking fist away from my face? Thanks... )

CHOICE.Grey: She's still young, but one day, she'll bear a big responsibility. She'll be the Master, you know. The MASTER!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I guess there are "Master" mediums, too... )

CHOICE.Grey: That's Ms. Maya's aunt. Earlier, she made me eat some sort of traditional dessert the size of a tea saucer! Hmm, I wonder if Ms. Morgan ever performs channelings herself...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: What do you have to say about this person, Dr. Grey?

CHOICE.Grey: ...This person... Hmm... Judging by their face...

CHOICE.Phoenix: W-What is it?
R-Really...

text.Phoenix: ( Wow... It's such a strange atmosphere in here... These flickering lights... I guess they're candles... )

text.???: Good sir! Who might you be...?

text.Phoenix: Aaah! I-I'm, uh, my name is Phoenix Wright...

text.???: Oh... You must be that good sir...

text.Phoenix: ( "Good sir"...? Is she talking about me? )

text.???: You are a lawyer, are you not, good sir? I have heard much about you from Mystic Maya.

text.Phoenix: Is that so? ( "Mystic" Maya...? )

text.???: I am Mystic Maya's aunt, Morgan Fey.

text.Phoenix: N-Nice to meet you.

text.Morgan: Ah, I had wanted to speak with you about a certain incident, good sir. It would seem that perhaps you ask too much of Mystic Maya in performing your duties. Most unbecoming, I'm afraid.

text.Phoenix: Huh?

text.Morgan: Don't tell me you have already forgotten? That was it not for Mystic Maya and her assistance, you would surely not have won...

text.Phoenix: ( First a girl that runs away, and now an old lady who says I stink at doing my job... When did I become the poster boy for "How Not to Make a First Impression"...? )

text.Morgan: The past is the past though. Let us speak of the present now.

text.Phoenix: ...Ah, thank you...

CHOICE.Phoenix: The Meditation Room is on the other side of this very heavy-looking door. There is a giant iron lock where the handle is. It feels like a curtain that separates the normal world from the spirit one.
This is where the medium sits, I assume. There are 4 panels of this flooring. The straw in the flooring feels a little damp, probably from the humidity in the air.

I guess this is an altar. Whatever it is, it feels very important. A mirror-like object with a cloudy reflective surface, and some branches of a sacred tree have been set in a pre-determined arrangement.
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [I guess this is an alter [sic]. Whatever it is, it feels very important.] in the original release)

CHOICE.Morgan: Good sir! I wonder if you would please not touch the sacred objects. Those objects are being offered to the spirits. If you were to touch them, good sir, they would become cursed. Yes, cursed.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( She really didn't have to talk down to me. I'm not that much of an idiot... )

This folding screen is really showing its age. All of its edges are a bit tattered. The lettering is fading too. I think I recognize a few of the characters on here... ...Ku ...ra ...in... I'm pretty sure that's what it says... Maybe I'll ask Maya about it later...
There is some empty space behind the folding screen. The light of the candles can't reach back there, so it's completely dark.
So why do you add "Mystic" to Maya's name. Isn't that a little... strange?

CHOICE.Morgan: Good sir!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yes!

CHOICE.Morgan: How dare you be so rude and disrespectful towards Mystic Maya!

CHOICE.Phoenix: I-I'm sorry.

CHOICE.Morgan: She must be addressed by her proper title, good sir. You must call her "Mystic Maya"!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Um, uh... So, about Mystic Maya... Uh...

CHOICE.Morgan: It is the blood .

CHOICE.Phoenix: Excuse me? "Blood"?

CHOICE.Morgan: Mystic Maya carries the blood of the Master. In actuality, she is the only one remaining.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Only one remaining...? What's that supposed to mean? )

CHOICE.Morgan: Mystic Maya is the last of the rightful heirs of the Kurain Channeling Technique.

CHOICE.Phoenix: OK... Then... where do you stand...?

CHOICE.Morgan: That is a little more complicated... Although a woman of the Fey family, I am merely a member of the branch family .

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...Branch family? What's that?

CHOICE.Morgan: It is as it sounds. For a member of the branch family, no matter her spiritual power, she can never become the Master of the Kurain School.

CHOICE.Phoenix: So... how strong are you...?

CHOICE.Morgan: ... It is a shame, however I will admit. I can not even begin to compare the lowliness of my power to the Master's.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( So that's how it is... )
So today's channeling will be her first?

CHOICE.Morgan: Yes, good sir. Because the spirit of a person who dies in a traffic accident is usually very strong, it is usually easier to call that person to our world.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( "Traffic accident" indeed. )

CHOICE.Morgan: The channeling will take place here, in this Channeling Chamber, good sir. As you can see, I am in the process of preparing.

CHOICE.Phoenix: So... this room is the... Channeling Chamber...?

CHOICE.Morgan: The place where a spirit medium speaks with those who have departed.

CHOICE.Phoenix: I don't suppose you'd mind if we observed the session...

CHOICE.Morgan: Do not even think of such nonsense! Only the medium and the client may enter here.

CHOICE.Phoenix: O-Oh.

CHOICE.Morgan: The secrets of the Kurain Techniques can not be seen by just anybody.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( That never stopped Maya from doing it in front of me before... )

CHOICE.Morgan: It is also for your safety, good sir, if something were to go wrong. That is why, while channeling is being performed, that heavy door is securely locked...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Oh, that's what the lock is for...

CHOICE.Morgan: Good sir!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Y-Yes!

CHOICE.Morgan: When did you... take a hidden picture of Mystic Maya!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Wh-Wh-What!? Wait... It's not like that at all!

CHOICE.Morgan: It is unforgivable!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ow-ow-ow! ( Why did she slap me? )
About this person...

CHOICE.Morgan: Oh! It is that man, is it not? A man who wishes to borrow a departed spirit's power to hide the lack of his own. What an insignificant man.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Insignificant...?

CHOICE.Morgan: That would mean you are that man's insignificant little friend, dear sir.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Then I guess that makes Maya my insignificant little assistant, huh? )

CHOICE.Morgan: Good sir!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ack!

CHOICE.Morgan: We would like to begin the channeling at 3 o'clock. If you don't mind, good sir, would you mind allowing me to make preparations?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Uh, um, sure... go ahead... ( She's a Fey alright! Just as odd as the rest. )

text.Morgan: ... Oh, yes. I wonder if you have yet to meet Pearl, good sir.

text.Phoenix: Pearl?

text.Morgan: She is an adorable, angelic young girl.

text.Phoenix: Oh, that odd...

text.Morgan: She is my daughter. Now then, what was it you were about to say...?

text.Phoenix: Wh-What a cute daughter you have... Ahaha...

text.Morgan: A pure heart that knows not of the evils in this world is a powerful thing, good sir. Please refrain from affiliating with her, I request.

text.Phoenix: ( Well, it's not like I had the chance to anyway... )

text.Morgan: I must insist and stress that you not let it occur.

text.Phoenix: Okay, okay, I get it!
( Wow. This garden is really breath-taking. Someone put a lot of love into it. What is that over there...? ...Is that an incinerator? It looks a little out of place in a garden like this... )

CHOICE.Phoenix: A splendid garden with a small lamp and traditional decorations. It's a bit small to walk around in... Although, that incinerator piques my curiosity...
It's a small incinerator. I don't think garbage trucks come all the way out here to a little village like this. So every family has to burn their own trash.
It looks like there's a room over there, too. A peaceful feeling is emanating from it.
It's a really old urn. The ashes of a person long dead are inside. It looks like something with a long history... Other than that, it's not very interesting, so time to move on.

text.Phoenix: ( So this is... the Side Room. Looks like it's more of a break room. There is bedding spread out on the floor. It looks like someone's sleeping in one. I shouldn't disturb them... )

CHOICE.Phoenix: It's a decorative wooden bear sculpture. There's a plate attached to the base. "Kurain Village - The Heart of Channeling" What the!? It's a souvenir. So does this mean it's easy to spot bears here... And for them to spot you...? * gulp *

It's a small alcove. I have no idea what it's supposed to mean or symbolize. If I had one of these in the office, it would end up as storage space. But here, it's decorated with some pretty flowers and a beautiful hanging scroll.
This is the first time I've seen a sliding door like this in person. From here, I can see the Winding Way and the little garden in the courtyard.

There's bedding spread out on the floor. Is that someone sleeping in one over there? She's probably an exhausted medium taking a break and catching some z's. If I wake her up, she might be grumpy and throw a spell on me. It's probably a good idea to not disturb her sleep...

text.???: Hey! You! Hold on, now! This gal's got a few questions to ask!

text.Phoenix: ( Hmm... I'm sure I've heard that southern accent somewhere before... )

text.???: Oh, well I'll be! It's Mr. Phoenix Wright! How ya been!? Haven't seen you in, what, a year!?

text.Phoenix: Um... You... are... uh...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Um, Lotta Hair, was it?

CHOICE.???: L-L-Lotta Who!? Wait, you best not be making fun of my hair, now!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ah, no, um, I wasn't "making fun"... I was "complimenting" you on your fine hair...

CHOICE.???: Hmph, I dare say yer one heartless man, Mr. Wright. It was cause of my testimony that yer friend got outta being guilty. But looks like you already forgot that.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Hold up... you were working with the prosecution at first as one of their witnesses, and came after us as if we were a piece of sirloin steak...

CHOICE.???: Minor detail. Stop being so uptight; lettin' little things get in the way. The name's Hart. Lotta Hart. Don't you go forgetting it!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Oh yeah! That's it!

CHOICE.Lotta: Now listen here. I'm here to take some pictures today. Gonna get myself a real scoop.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ah, so I guess you're still at it? Being a photographer, I mean.

CHOICE.Lotta: You betcha! The hardest working one out there, I reckon! Didn't I say I was gonna make a name for myself as a famous "paranormal photographer"!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: You're Lotta Hart, right...?

CHOICE.Lotta: Bingo! I'm the one and only "paranormal photographer", Lotta Hart!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ah, so I guess you're still at it? Being a photographer, I mean.

CHOICE.Lotta: Of course! And today, I'm gonna get myself a real scoop! You wait and see!

CHOICE.ACTION: USER SELECTS Who are you again?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Sorry, but who are you again?

CHOICE.???: Oh Lawdy! I've met some cold men in my days, but you... You're in an icebox of yer own!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Come on, am I really that bad...?

CHOICE.???: Put yer noggin to some use! You've gotta remember who I am! It was cause of my testimony that yer friend got outta being guilty.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ah! You're the one from that trial!

CHOICE.???: See, I knew you could remember if you tried!

CHOICE.Phoenix: You were working with the prosecution at first as one of their witnesses, and came after us as if we were a piece of sirloin steak...

CHOICE.???: Why don't we let bygones be bygones, now. It's yesterday's news, right? Name's Lotta Hart. Don't you go forgetting it, ya hear!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Um... So what brings you here today?

CHOICE.Lotta: Hah! You should already know! I'm here for the big scoop! I can feel it!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ah, so I guess you're still at it? Being a photographer, I mean.

CHOICE.Lotta: You betcha! The hardest working one out there, I reckon! Didn't I say I was gonna make a name for myself as a famous "paranormal photographer"!?

text.Lotta: Oh, that's right! This ain't no time to be wastin' time! The channeling's about to get started!

text.Phoenix: Is it that time already!?

text.Lotta: We all should hurry up and get to the Meditation Room. ...What are you waiting around for!? Come on!

text.Phoenix: ( Lotta Hart, huh? I've been judging her harshly because of that case, but, I guess looking back, we had some good times, too... )

text.Morgan: We will now begin the channeling. Mystic Maya and honored guest, please proceed into the Channeling Chamber.

text.Grey: With this, I can finally swat all those pesky flies, once and for all! You hear me!? They won't be able to say a single bad thing about me after this! You would love to hear them apologize, wouldn't you? Wouldn't you, Mr. Wright!?

text.Phoenix: Me!? Oh, uh, yeah, I sure would.

text.Morgan: Mystic Maya, do you have the Channeling Chamber key?

text.Maya: Yup, right here.

text.Morgan: That is most satisfactory. That key is one-of-a-kind, so please take care of it well.

text.Maya: It'll be fine, Aunt Morgan. I won't lose it, trust me! OK, Dr. Grey. Let's get started.

text.Grey: Finally! Let's go!

text.Morgan: Now let us wait patiently out here for them. Please have some lovely bitter green tea and jaw-droppingly large strawberry desserts...

text.Lotta: Hold on, now, granny!

text.Morgan: ...Granny?

text.Lotta: How come we ain't allowed in that room!?

text.Morgan: Dear madam, you have an "impressive" grasp of English. From where did you learn it?

text.Lotta: What!? I'm from the heart of the heartland!

text.Morgan: Is that so? Then I humbly request that you return to this "Heart of the Heartland".

text.Lotta: Wh-What are ya...?

text.Morgan: This is Kurain Village. If you can not follow our traditions and rules, we request that you leave!

text.Phoenix: ( Wow. She shut Lotta up! Now THAT's impressive! )

text.Morgan: Now then, let us wait.

text.Lotta: Hey now! Wh-What was that just now!?

text.Phoenix: ( It came from inside the Channeling Chamber... )

text.Lotta: Hey! Th-That's a gunshot!

text.Morgan: E-Excuse me!?

text.Lotta: I've heard that sound before. It's a gunshot! I'd bet my afro on it!

text.Phoenix: ( M-Maya! Maya's in there! )

CHOICE.ACTION: USER SELECTS Break into the Chamber

CHOICE.Lotta: Well, Mister Lawyer! What's the plan!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: What else!? We're going to break in!

CHOICE.Lotta: What!? But... But there's only one key and that kid's got it.

CHOICE.Phoenix: We're going to have to break the door. Is that alright, Ms. Fey?

CHOICE.Morgan: Well, yes... But there is one matter... That is...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Don't try to stop me! You can send the repair bill to the Wright & Co. Law Offices later!

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "Yeah! Now that's what I call being a man!"
USER SELECTS Ask Morgan what to do

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ms. Fey! What should we do!?

CHOICE.Lotta: Yellow-bellied chicken liver! What are ya waiting for!? Kick it down already!

CHOICE.Phoenix: But... The key...

CHOICE.Morgan: That key is one-of-a-kind. In this world, there is only that one. Even I am powerless to open that door.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Hmm, there is really no other way... ) Alright. Stand aside! I'm going to break the door down!

CHOICE.Morgan: W-Wait! Please! That sort of recklessness...

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "Yeah! Now that's what I call being a man!"

Lotta! At a time like this!?

text.Lotta: Times like this are perfect for snapping up shots! But anyway... what's going on here!? This gal... Is she... ...Maya!?

text.Morgan: Please leave this area to me. Go quickly and inform the police!

text.Phoenix: But, but...

text.Morgan: Hurry! Before there are more victims here!

text.Lotta: Hey, let's go, City Boy! Leave this to the granny!

text.Phoenix: ( My cell phone doesn't get reception way out here... So I ended up using the phone booth to call the police... )

text.Lotta: And...?

text.Phoenix: They're on their way.

text.Lotta: That's good. Lawdy, I saw a genuine "mysterious phenomenon"...

text.Phoenix: ( She seems really on edge because of all this... Not that I blame her... I'm scared to death by what's going on... )

CHOICE.Lotta: Hey, Mister. That gal... Maya. She wasn't the one that pulled the trigger, was she...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Oh, yeah... Lotta doesn't know that when Maya is channeling, her whole physical appearance changes . )

CHOICE.Lotta: Then again... Weren't there only the two of 'em in there? I reckon she musta done it then...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Lotta, what do you know about Dr. Grey?

CHOICE.Lotta: Not much, but I did some digging... That's one gent with a bad reputation.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Really?

CHOICE.Lotta: I hear he's good at surgery and stuff, but his personality stinks like wet sheep.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I sort of got the same impression myself... )

CHOICE.Lotta: He's real controllin'. Soon as his nurse or patients don't do what he says, he starts a-hollerin'. Musta been real rough to work for him.
Hey, they'll be here soon, right? The police, I mean. I reckon you should be gettin' back to the crime scene, now.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Yeah, I guess so... )

text.Morgan: Ah, Mr. Wright.

text.Phoenix: Ms. Fey! How's, um... Mystic... Maya?

text.Phoenix: Let me see her, please!

text.Morgan: She is still unconscious. I humbly request that you wait outside for her recovery.

text.Phoenix: ( Guess I just have to wait... * sigh * )

text.Phoenix: What are you doing all the way out here, Detective Gumshoe?

text.Gumshoe: It's actually kinda funny. I was in the area for a business trip, pal. Well, time to check out the crime scene. I'll have to question everyone here later on, so just sit tight, alright?

text.Phoenix: ( Why is he grinning at me...? )

text.Morgan: Shall I show you to the scene of the crime, Detective Gymshoe?

text.Gumshoe: Um... My name isn't Gymshoe...

text.Phoenix: ( The two of them went into the Channeling Chamber... I guess all I can do for now is see what everyone else has to say... )
( She's probably scared out of her wits after having a murder take place right near her. ) Lotta?
