text.Phoenix: Please stay calm, but... there has been a murder!
text._info: (Changed from [Please stay calm, but... a murder has taken place!] in the original release)

text.???: ... Um, so, like... A murder is that thing where, like, one person kills another, right?

text.Phoenix: Yes! A person has killed another person!

text.???: Oh, that's... Uh... What are the words I'm looking for...? It's like... ...like totally a bummer.

text.Phoenix: ...Yeah... ( After all that effort, that's all she had to say? )

text.???: Oh, I'm sorry. I forgot to, like, introduce myself.

text.Mimi: My name is Ini Miney. Um... At the college, I'm researching and studying "parapsychology".

text.Phoenix: "Parapsychology"?

text.Mimi: That's right. Um... I think people, like, usually call it, "occult studies" or something. Like supernatural phenomenon, ESP and psychic powers. That sort of stuff.

text.Phoenix: ( That's pretty out there... ) I'm Phoenix Wright, attorney at law.

CHOICE.Phoenix: You left the blanket a mess. Are you going to fold it?

CHOICE.Mimi: Like I had a really good nap, and, like... I was thinking of leaving it like this, so, like, it's all set for tonight.

CHOICE.Phoenix: So what brings you here today?

CHOICE.Mimi: Um, like, so... I was the one who told Dr. Grey about this place. He asked me, like, "Do you know of a good spirit medium?"

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Hmm, Dr. Grey did say something about being introduced to this place. )

CHOICE.Mimi: Cause, like, talking to dead people and, like, multiple personalities are my thing...

CHOICE.Phoenix: I see... Then why were you taking a nap here?

CHOICE.Mimi: Like... I wasn't feeling good.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Huh?

CHOICE.Mimi: I'm, like, allergic to sesame seeds. They, like, must've put some in the food they served for lunch.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Oh, that doesn't sound fun.

CHOICE.Mimi: So I, like, felt sick, and came in here to, like, sleep. I totally feel, like, I've wasted my time 'cause I, like, slept a long time.

CHOICE.Phoenix: So you were sleeping here the entire time?

CHOICE.Mimi: Yeah. Ever since lunch...

CHOICE.Phoenix: So you don't know anything about the murder that took place?

CHOICE.Mimi: Like, what? Oh, that! I, like, totally know nothing. So who was, like, you know, killed...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: The surgeon that requested the channeling, Dr. Grey.
You and Dr. Grey knew each other, right?

CHOICE.Mimi: ...! I don't know any Dr. Grey!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Oh really...? Then what was all that talk about him earlier?
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [That's not exactly what Dr. Grey said...] in the original release)

CHOICE.Mimi: Huh!? ...Well, uh... Like, a long, long time ago... I was, like, a patient, yeah.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( She sounds like she's trying to hide something... )

CHOICE.Mimi: Oh, hey! That's, like, Maya Fey, right? She's, like, totally waaaay famous! Like, well, for people like us, like, you know?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( "Waaaay famous"? Maya? )

CHOICE.Mimi: I mean, like, she's, like, the daughter of the Master, right?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Hmm... Well, at least she remembers some things. )

CHOICE.Mimi: Um... This face... Like, I think I've seen it somewhere before...

CHOICE.Phoenix: What!? ...Y-You're joking, right?

CHOICE.Mimi: Ha ha, like, of course I am, silly!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Oh, thank goodness... )

CHOICE.Mimi: Like, I'm really sorry, but I'm not all that smart... so I don't, like, get it.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Hmm. Why does it feel like she's just putting on an act? )

CHOICE.Mimi: I'm, like, totally bad at remembering people's names.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Oh?

CHOICE.Mimi: But I, like, remember seeing that face somewhere before, like, I think...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Well, thanks for trying. ( I didn't think it was possible for someone to be this much of an airhead... )

text.Phoenix: ( There's no one here... as usual. ) Ack! ...H-Hey... How are you?
You're Pearl, right?
( Hmm. Silent as ever... ...? What's that she's got in her hand? I've seen it somewhere before... )

CHOICE.Phoenix: Um...
( ...What is it!? Is it my hair? Is it too spiky? Not spiky enough!? )
Um...
( ...What is it!? Is it my hair? Is it too spiky? Not spiky enough!? )

text.ACTION: After clearing "Any ideas" Talk option in Kurain Village and clearing all Talk options in Fey Manor - Channeling Chamber and Fey Manor - Side Room:

text.Morgan: Oh, dear madam... You have such impeccable timing.

text.Mimi: Like, what's all the buzz?

text.Gumshoe: Ahem. Alright everyone, listen up! You too, pal! I'm going to give you all a brief update! Right now, it looks like the investigation's not going to be done until real late...

text.Morgan: That is a terrible shame. I propose that everyone sleep here under the roof of the Fey Manor tonight.

text.Phoenix: ( What a mess. I can't believe how crazy this day turned out... Maya was arrested and taken away by the police. And I don't see myself getting any sleep tonight... )

text.ACTION: June 20, 8:02 AM Fey Manor Meditation Room

text.Phoenix: ( * yawn * Uuugh... Morning... I guess I must have nodded off at some point... I hope Maya's OK. I should hurry and get to the Detention Center, ASAP! )

text.ACTION: June 20, 10:34 AM Detention Center Visitor's Room

text.Maya: N... Nick! Nick! I...!

text.Phoenix: Maya!

text.Maya: What am I going to do!? I never imagined it would turn out like this!

text.Phoenix: Calm down, Maya! Take deep breaths. ( Come to think of it, the first time I met her... It all started right here, in this detention center... )

text.Maya: I finally... I finally get to see you again, and...

text.Phoenix: It's not your fault. You didn't do it.

text.Maya: No, I... I did it... I killed that person.

text.Phoenix: But that wasn't you.

text.Maya: It doesn't matter. It might as well have been me. I was too weak... and I... I couldn't control the spirit's power, so...

text.Phoenix: ( I don't want to bring up the case quite yet, but... )

text.Maya: ...You don't have to be nice to me. I understand.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Smile, you're on candid camera.
This guard monitors the visitor's room. I wonder if he's bored. Not that I can tell since he never looks over this way.
So you're the Master or something of the Kurain School of Channeling...?

CHOICE.Maya: Actually, my mother is for now. But since that title is passed from mother to daughter, I guess I will be someday...

CHOICE.Phoenix: But many people think that channeling isn't real, that it's all just an act.

CHOICE.Maya: You believe in us, don't you?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah... because I've seen it with my own eyes. ( When Maya's channeling a spirit... not only her voice, but her whole physical appearance changes. It's a supernatural phenomenon that occurs every time. It happened this time, too... Dr. Grey said that he wanted to call the nurse , so... Maya's body must have taken on that nurse's appearance... )
What exactly happened in the Channeling Chamber?

CHOICE.Maya: ... I went into that room with Dr. Grey, locked the door... and sat down across from him.

CHOICE.Phoenix: OK...

CHOICE.Maya: We closed our eyes...and I began the channeling.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( This is sounding kind of creepy... like the beginning of a scary story... )

CHOICE.Maya: And that's the last thing I remember...

CHOICE.Phoenix: What?

CHOICE.Maya: After a spirit comes into my body, I lose my self, my consciousness.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Then, you don't remember a single thing?

CHOICE.Maya: When I came to, I was being held in my aunt's arms. And there was blood... all over my clothes.
Oh! But... I do remember having a dream .

CHOICE.Phoenix: A dream...?
What kind of dream did you have while you were channeling...?

CHOICE.Maya: Um... I can't remember it all that well, but... I was dead and buried in the ground. I couldn't move... and it was unbearable... Really suffocating... ...It went something like that.

CHOICE.Phoenix: I... I see... ( I have no idea what to say to that... )

CHOICE.Maya: There was a really familiar smell too...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Under the ground?

CHOICE.Maya: Yeah, I can't quite place it, but I know I've smelled that same scent before...
I... I can't face myself...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I should've known better... )

CHOICE.Maya: !! T-The... That's the guy I k-killed...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ack! I'm sorry! ( Why did I pull this picture out!? )

CHOICE.Maya: Pearly... She definitely has more than me...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Huh? What are you talking about?

CHOICE.Maya: Who I think the next Master should be... I mean, she's got more spiritual power than me, and she really works hard at her training...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Talk about bringing the mood down even further... * sigh * )

CHOICE.Maya: I... I can't face my aunt right now... Not now... that this has happened...

CHOICE.Phoenix: It's alright, Maya. I'm sure she understands. She's on our side, after all.

CHOICE.Maya: Yeah, I know... But still...
That's Lotta Hart... right?

CHOICE.Phoenix: That girl is still after the next sensational photo.

CHOICE.Maya: Ha ha. I guess some things never change.
I felt terrible during the questioning session... I mean, Gumshoe kept looking at me... with these really sad eyes... ...
Sorry, Nick, but there's nothing really special about it.

CHOICE.Phoenix: So... what do you think about this person...?
( I guess I can't expect her to know anything about this person. )

text.Phoenix: ... ( ...I guess this is about all the information I'm going to gather for today... ) I'll be back later, Maya. In the meantime, please make sure you prepare it, OK?

text.Maya: Huh? "It"? What is "it"?

text.Phoenix: The document requesting me to be your attorney, of course.
What's wrong?

text.Maya: Are you sure? I mean, I'm guilty! I'm a murderer!

text.Phoenix: No one's decided that yet.

text.Maya: But I did! I killed that person... with these... two hands...!

text.Phoenix: That's enough, Maya.

text.Maya: It's hopeless! If you defend me, you'll lose, I'm sure...

text.Phoenix: Stop it!

text.Maya: ... ...Help me... Nick, help me... I'm scared...

text.Phoenix: Don't worry, I will. When is the trial?

text.Maya: It sounds like tomorrow.

text.Phoenix: ( As usual, zero prep time... ) Alright. I'm going now.

text.Maya: Wait.
This jewel... This is called a Magatama . It's a magical charm and it's always protected me. Give this to Pearly... And I'm sure she'll lend you her spiritual powers.

CHOICE.Maya: Make sure you show that to Pearly, OK, Nick? I'm sure she'll be a big help to you.

text.Phoenix: Phew. It feels like I've been gone forever. But it's only been one day... ( Oh, that's right! ) Where's that newspaper Dr. Grey brought the other day...? ...Ah, here it is. Right on top of my desk. ( This is the only thing he left behind that's going to be of any help... )

CHOICE.Phoenix: There is a giant building just outside the window. It's the Gatewater Hotel, a high-class, luxury hotel. Until recently, it had been a normal, business-class hotel.
Charley. A quite decorative plant. It's a memento of my boss, Mia... who passed away. The rest of the room may be in shambles, but I always manage to care for this little fella.

A poster of the TV action hero, the Steel Samurai. Maya stuck it up here right before she left. I wouldn't say that the Steel Samurai and an attorney's office are a good match, but Maya threatened to curse me with some magic spell... so I guess it can stay.

Difficult-looking legal books stand in a formidable row. They mock me. ...Actually, I've neglected them for so long, a layer of dust has started to form. One of these days, I should try to build up the courage to read one... Maybe.
It's my desk. I keep it neat for those rare occasions when I actually have a client in the office.

text.ACTION: After visiting Wright & Co. Law Offices or Kurain Village:

text.Phoenix: ( Maya must still be in questioning... I hope the detectives are taking it easy on her, but... these kinds of cases aren't taken lightly. I guess I'll come back later. )
( I have to save Maya, no matter what! It's her life on the line! What in the world happened in that room yesterday? )
( The Meditation Room nurtures all mediums young and old. Even mediums in training, I'd wager. But it's pretty deserted today... ...probably because of the murder yesterday... )
It looks like Detective Gumshoe isn't here today... I should take this chance and thoroughly check this room. If I'm lucky, I might uncover a clue or two...

text.Morgan: Oh, Mr. Wright.

text.Phoenix: Good morning.

text.Morgan: I am on my way to go meet Mystic Maya, and I thought to bring her some items to make her feel more at home. Namely, tea so bitter you lose your tongue and jaw-droppingly large strawberry desserts.

text.Phoenix: I'm sure Maya will be very grateful...

text.Morgan: That's "Mystic Maya", good sir!

text.Phoenix: ( Urk. She is one scary lady. )

text.Morgan: Oh, dear, sweet Mystic Maya... Pearl wept constantly for you last night, as did I.

text.Phoenix: ( I know it's important for me to search the site, but I should ask her some questions too, while I have the chance... )

CHOICE.Phoenix: The Meditation Room is on the other side of this very heavy-looking door. The lock on it is broken, because, well... I broke it. It doesn't seem possible, but I managed to break it pretty badly. When we want to do something bad enough, people can do the most amazing things.

This is where the medium sits, I assume. There are 4 panels of this flooring. The straw in the flooring feels a little damp, probably from the humidity in the air. No matter what I do, my eyes keep getting drawn to the pool of blood in the center here.

I guess this is an altar. Whatever it is, it feels very important. A mirror-like object with a cloudy reflective surface, and some branches of a sacred tree have been set in a pre-determined arrangement. I'd guess they're used during the channeling...
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [I guess this is an alter [sic]. Whatever it is, it feels very important.] in the original release)

CHOICE.Phoenix: It's a beautiful and expensive folding screen. It also looks quite old. There seems to be some sort of sacred text written on it, but I can't read it. ...¬†! Th-This is... It's a hole! Could this have been made by a bullet?
There is some empty space behind the folding screen. The light of the candles can't reach back there, so it's completely dark. I hope no one is hiding back there.
I would like to ask you a few questions about what happened yesterday.

CHOICE.Morgan: Do you mean that awful tragedy?

CHOICE.???: That man... ...murdered me... ...so I killed... him...

CHOICE.Phoenix: M-Maya?

CHOICE.Morgan: Please leave this area to me. Go quickly and inform the police!

CHOICE.Phoenix: What happened here in this room after I left?

CHOICE.Morgan: Well... First, I struck Mystic Maya on the head.

CHOICE.Phoenix: To make her go unconscious, correct?

CHOICE.Morgan: That is correct. Next, I performed the Spirit Severing Technique.

CHOICE.Phoenix: " Spirit Severing Technique "?

CHOICE.Morgan: The spirit of that nurse was inside of Mystic Maya's body. I used the technique to send the nurse's spirit back to the other world.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I wonder if this kind of testimony is even admissible in a court of law... )
By the way, what is this room exactly...?

CHOICE.Morgan: The Channeling Chamber? This room was created for the sole purpose of preventing such a tragedy as yesterday.

CHOICE.Phoenix: What do you mean?

CHOICE.Morgan: Sometimes, when an inexperienced medium calls an especially strong spirit, that spirit may become violent and revolt, as you witnessed yesterday.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Revolt? But how?

CHOICE.Morgan: When a spirit enters a medium's body, she loses her will and her self steps aside. To put it another way, the spirit is borrowing the medium's body, good sir.

CHOICE.Phoenix: But isn't that extremely dangerous?

CHOICE.Morgan: An experienced medium has little problem controlling a spirit.

CHOICE.Phoenix: But Maya... I mean, Mystic Maya... That was her first channeling...

CHOICE.Morgan: And that was why I insisted on locking the door. However, I never thought that would be calling danger upon the client himself... I am grateful that one of our heirlooms was not damaged in this horrible incident.

CHOICE.Phoenix: And that would be...?
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [And that is...?] in the original release)

CHOICE.Morgan: That folding screen there. It is the Kurain Sacred Writings. Along with the Kurain Sacred Urn , they are this village's most treasured possessions. If I ever found out that something had happened to either one... Oh, the inhumanity...
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [It is that folding screen there. It is the Kurain Sacred Writings.] in the original release)

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Odd for her to be worrying about the folding screen at a time like this... I guess this isn't just some dilapidated old screen after all... )
So... How is Pearl today...?

CHOICE.Morgan: Mr. Wright.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Y-Yes?

CHOICE.Morgan: In this world, Pearl is my most treasured possession. When compared to even Mystic Maya, Pearl has the spiritual power to become a Master.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Th-That's very impressive.

CHOICE.Morgan: Until now, the women of the branch family have thought themselves to be inferior. .. But. Pearl is different! Her spiritual strength is so great; even greater than some of the main family! Yes, Pearl is a channeling prodigy and is the pride of the branch family!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Wow... She's really fired up now... )

CHOICE.Morgan: In any case... Our world is so different from yours, perhaps it is best for you to quit, good sir.

CHOICE.Phoenix: "Quit"? Quit what?

CHOICE.Morgan: ...Oh my!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Wh-What is it?

CHOICE.Morgan: That... That is Mystic Maya's Magatama. Why would you have this in your possession!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: I-I'm sorry!

CHOICE.Morgan: Return it to Mystic Maya at once!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Y-Yes, madam! ( Why did I feel like I was being scolded by my own mother just now...? )

CHOICE.Morgan: Ah, so even someone such as yourself can take interest in something like this. This is the Kurain Channeling Technique Sacred Writings. There are 6 panels in all.

CHOICE.Phoenix: I see... But that's not what caught my eye. You see this hole here...?

CHOICE.Morgan: It is an old screen, you see. It is only logical that perhaps a bug or worm of some sort is the culprit.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Even though this looks nothing like the eating patterns of any bug I know... )

CHOICE.Morgan: I can hardly believe Mystic Maya has become like this. Directly influenced by the likes of you, and becoming caught up in a situation such as this...

CHOICE.Phoenix: I'm sorry... ( ...Hey, hold on! How is all this MY fault!? )

CHOICE.Morgan: I told her so many times, as I have also told Pearl, "Do not associate with strange old men you don't know".

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Well, that shouldn't apply to me then, especially since I'm hardly an "old man" yet!! )

CHOICE.Morgan: That doctor was one of those people. Those who intend harm upon the spirits receive harm in return; it's karma at work. It seems that he was the one to take the nurse's life, wouldn't you agree?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I guess that's possible... )

CHOICE.Morgan: Good sir!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Y...Yes?

CHOICE.Morgan: When did you take this picture!? This is one of those... what are they called...? Those... "hidden camera" pictures!

CHOICE.Phoenix: N-No!! It's not one of those at all!!

CHOICE.Morgan: Such an unforgivable offense! You will hand it over to me!

CHOICE.Phoenix: N-No! I won't! ( If I ever want to talk about Pearl again, I should be much more careful... )

CHOICE.Morgan: It shows the same face as the one I see in the mirror every day.

CHOICE.Phoenix: And? Anything else?

CHOICE.Morgan: No. That is all.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Why in the world did I bother to show this to her!? )

CHOICE.Morgan: I will be leaving shortly to meet with Mystic Maya. I simply do not have the time to look at such trivial matters.
We usually do not welcome strangers into our village as they disturb the aura here. Especially people like you, good sir.

CHOICE.Phoenix: H-Hey, what do you mean, "especially people like me?"

CHOICE.Morgan: You selfishly make Mystic Maya help you with your work... You should be thankful I have not taken your life for such a disrespectful act.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Y-Yes, madam...

CHOICE.Morgan: And even more importantly, remember that if anything were to happen to Pearl...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( What is that supposed to mean!? )

text.ACTION: After clearing all Talk options and examining folding screen:

text.Morgan: Well, then, I do believe it is time for me to take my leave.

text.Phoenix: Alright. Please tell Maya I said hi.

text.Morgan: What was that!?

text.Phoenix: Uh, I mean, Mystic Maya.

text.Morgan: I will tell her.

text.Phoenix: ( Little Pearl isn't here today... Maybe she's at school? )

text.Mimi: Oh, hey! Like, you're that guy from yesterday... The, uh, dentist guy...

text.Phoenix: No, no, I'm a lawyer.

text.Mimi: That's right! Um... Mr. Smith, Esquire.

text.Phoenix: ...That's "Wright". Wait, I mean, you're wrong. My name is "Wright".

text.Mimi: "Smith", "Wright"... Well, I got, like, three letters, at least.

text.Phoenix: ( I don't think she gets the point... ) Anyway, why are you here?

text.Mimi: So, like, I study this thing called "parapsychology" at this college and...

text.Phoenix: Um, you told me about that yesterday. The sesame allergy, too. What I'd really like to know is why you're still here today?

text.Mimi: Oh! So, like, that's what you meant! Like, you shoulda been more, like, clear about it!

text.Phoenix: S-Sorry. My bad.

text.Mimi: No, it's OK. Like, it's really...

text.Phoenix: ...That's it? Why'd you stop mid-sentence!?

text.Mimi: Did I? ...So, like... what was I talking about again...?

text.Phoenix: ... ( If Lotta ever wanted another "genuine mysterious phenomenon", it's right here. )

CHOICE.Phoenix: It's a decorative wooden bear sculpture. There's a plate attached to the base. "Kurain Village - The Heart of Channeling" What the!? It's a souvenir.

CHOICE.Mimi: Isn't it cuuuuute? I, like, totally bought that!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ah... so it's yours, huh?

CHOICE.Mimi: Yeah. So, like, this village is really famous for, like, channeling and bears.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Heh. ( ...Wait. Famous for bears!? )

CHOICE.Mimi: But it's, like, OK. If you ever, like, see a bear, you just play dead, and they, like, leave you alone.

CHOICE.Phoenix: I-Is that right?

CHOICE.Mimi: Yeah. Cause, like, fighting back is totally of no use.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Has she actually tried to fight one!? )

Hmm, now where did this box come from? I'm sure this wasn't here last night. It looks like a box for storing clothes... But it's pretty big for just clothes... It's mostly empty, but a few folded pieces of channeling costumes sit at the bottom.
So? Why are you still here today?

CHOICE.Mimi: Like, there's so much for me to, like, study here!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Like what?

CHOICE.Mimi: Like, the medium's training, or like, how they inherit their spiritual power.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I suppose... This village is the real thing, after all. )

CHOICE.Mimi: So, like, I asked if I could stay here for, like, a little longer.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( She sure seems like the care-free type, at least, on the surface... )
Have you heard about the murder?

CHOICE.Mimi: It's, like, totally scary.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( ...she says, with a silly smile plastered on her face... ) ...So do you know anything about it that might help?
( Somehow, I don't think she has a grip on reality, let alone what's going on here. )
About the victim, Dr. Grey...

CHOICE.Mimi: I don't know who you're talking about. ...Like... Wait, I think you asked about him, like, yesterday, too...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( That's right... Her reaction yesterday when I asked was... )
You and Dr. Grey knew each other, right?

CHOICE.Mimi: ...! I don't know any Dr. Grey!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Oh really...? Then what was all that talk about him earlier?
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [That's not exactly what Dr. Grey said...] in the original release)

CHOICE.Mimi: Huh!? ...Well, uh... Like, a long, long time ago... I was, like, a patient, yeah.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( OK, she is definitely hiding something from me... )

CHOICE.Mimi: ...Like, is something wrong?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Would you take a look at this?

CHOICE.Mimi: Hey! It's, like, one of those little badges people in Congress all wear...

CHOICE.Phoenix: No, no, no. I'm a lawyer. L-A-W-Y-E-R!!

CHOICE.Mimi: ...? Like, so is that what you are?
Wow! It's a Magatama! Aww, you shouldn't have!

CHOICE.Phoenix: It's so totally not for you!

CHOICE.Mimi: Hey! Like, it's not nice to freak me out like that!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( That should be my line... )
I wanted to ask you about this girl...

CHOICE.Mimi: Oh, that's, like, Maya Fey. She's, like, the Master's daughter.

CHOICE.Phoenix: You surprise me. You knew that?

CHOICE.Mimi: Well, like, I totally know everyone related to the occult. Maya is, like, an idol among spirit mediums.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Maya an idol? I guess stranger things have happened. )

CHOICE.Mimi: That's Morgan Fey. Like, she's been totally helpful.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Did she just bow to the picture...? )

CHOICE.Mimi: So what about her?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Oh, nothing in particular. I just wanted to know what you knew about her.

CHOICE.Mimi: Um... Well, she's, like, a really good person.

CHOICE.Phoenix: I see.

CHOICE.Mimi: Like totally.

CHOICE.Phoenix: OK. ( This is going nowhere... )

CHOICE.Mimi: Um... This face... Like, I think I've seen it somewhere before...

CHOICE.Phoenix: What!? ...Y-You're joking, right?

CHOICE.Mimi: Ha ha, like, of course I am, silly!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Oh, thank goodness... )

CHOICE.Mimi: Like, I'm really sorry, but... And I know, like, you totally had your heart set on it, but I can't, like, take it.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Who said anything about giving this to you!? )
What do you know about this person...?

CHOICE.Mimi: I'm, like, sorry, but it's totally, like, time for my nap...

CHOICE.Phoenix: * yawn * ( Ack! She's even got ME yawning! )

CHOICE.Mimi: And I, like, totally don't care about that person anyway...

text.ACTION: After clearing all Talk options and examining folding screen in Fey Manor - Channeling Chamber, and clearing "The victim" Talk option in Fey Manor - Side Room:

text.Phoenix: Ack! Y-You surprised me!
And how are you today?
( Hmm... I guess she isn't open to friendly chatting... Huh? She's still holding something in her hand... ...It looks like the same thing she had yesterday... )

CHOICE.Phoenix: Um...

CHOICE.Pearl: Aaaah!

CHOICE.Phoenix: H-Huh?? ( If only I had something that would catch her interest. Maybe then she'd talk to me. )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "Oh yeah. Maya said to give this to you..."

CHOICE.Phoenix: Can you take a look at this? Please?
( Urk... She's really scrutinizing my face... )
( Th-That's enough already! I'm not that shifty-looking, am I!? )

text.Phoenix: Oh yeah. Maya said to give this to you...
( Ack! I'm in trouble now!! If Morgan sees us like this, I'll be the next one they're channeling... )

text.Pearl: Th-That's... That's Mystic Maya's...

text.Phoenix: ...Huh!? ( Sh-She actually spoke! )

text.Pearl: Who are you...?

text.Phoenix: I-I'm Phoenix Wright. I, uh, worked with Maya...

text.Pearl: ...Y-You worked with Mystic Maya...? You... You're Mr. Nick, right?

text.Phoenix: ...Uh, excuse me? ( I bet I know who she picked "Nick" up from... )

text.Pearl: I know who you are. You're... You're Mystic Maya's... "special someone"...

text.Phoenix: WH-WH-WH-WHAT!?

text.Pearl: So then... Of course! You're going to help Mystic Maya, aren't you? That's what you're going to do, right?

text.Phoenix: W-Well, yeah... I will...

text.Pearl: Oh wow... It's like a beautiful fairy tale! That earnest look shining brightly in your eyes... It must be true love...

text.Phoenix: ...Wh-What!? ( Why am I being boiled into a bright red lobster by this little kid!? )

text.Pearl: I'm so jealous of Mystic Maya! Ah, what a wonderful relationship...

text.Phoenix: W-Wait... I... uhh... I mean... We aren't... Things aren't like...

text.Pearl: Hee hee, I can tell you're a good person. Alright, Mr. Nick! I may be small, but I'm going to help you in any way I can!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Pearl, are you friends with Maya?

CHOICE.Pearl: I feel very grateful to be friends with her... She's so great. I want to be like Mystic Maya when I grow up. I really look up to her.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Wow, I had no idea Maya was so... revered.

CHOICE.Pearl: Usually when people don't use Mystic Maya's title, I get mad.

CHOICE.Phoenix: O-Oh, sorry.

CHOICE.Pearl: But if it's you, Mr. Nick, then it's OK. Because... Because... you're "special" to her.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Where in the world did she get an idea like that?? )

CHOICE.Pearl: By the way... this may be rude, but which channeling school are you from?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Which channeling school?

CHOICE.Pearl: Yes. For example, I study the Kurain technique.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ... Ah, I get it! No, no, no. I'm a lawyer. A lawyer.

CHOICE.Pearl: ...Law...yer?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yup.

CHOICE.Pearl: ...Is that related to spirit mediums in any way...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Um... None that I know of... ) Wait, are you telling me you don't know what a lawyer is?

CHOICE.Pearl: I'm sorry, but I have no idea.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Maya did say Pearl doesn't know much about the outside world ... )
So what's that you've got there, Pearl?

CHOICE.Pearl: Oh, this? I found it yesterday.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Hmm...

CHOICE.Pearl: If you want it, I can give it to you.

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "Alright, well, if you really want to give it to me..."

CHOICE.Phoenix: I can't take something this important from you, Pearl.

CHOICE.Pearl: Oh...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( But I'm sure I've seen that key somewhere before... ...and it might be an important clue later on... )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "Alright, well, if you really want to give it to me..."

CHOICE.Phoenix: Alright, well, if you really want to give it to me...

CHOICE.Pearl: Hee hee. You look like a child at a toy store, Mr. Nick!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( ...She not only speaks in a refined manner, but laughs in one, too! )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "Alright, well, if you really want to give it to me..."

CHOICE.Phoenix: I can't take something this important from you, Pearl.

CHOICE.Pearl: Oh...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( But I'm sure I've seen that key somewhere before... ...and it might be an important clue later on... )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "Alright, well, if you really want to give it to me..."

CHOICE.Phoenix: So this is...

CHOICE.Pearl: That is Mystic Maya's Magatama. It's one of the most important heirlooms of Kurain Village. Please make sure to take good care of it.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Y-Yeah, I will. ( Is it really OK for me to have such a priceless object? )

CHOICE.Pearl: Are you interested in Kurain's traditional things too, Mr. Nick? The Kurain Sacred Writings are on this folding screen.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Oh? Is that what's written on it? Actually, what caught my eye was this "hole" in it...

CHOICE.Pearl: It's a very old screen, so I think that maybe bugs made it by eating through it.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( ...It sure doesn't look like something bugs can make... )
About this key...

CHOICE.Pearl: I found it while I was playing in the garden yesterday.

CHOICE.Phoenix: I've seen it before too, you know?

CHOICE.Pearl: ...? Really?

I look up to Mystic Maya a lot. She's my role model. She's so smart, and pretty, and kind, and loving. She's always cheerful, never gets sick, isn't picky, and has good sleeping habits. She always wakes up before me, and always eats breakfast before me too. And she has you; such a wonderful person with whom she can share a lo-

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ack! OK, OK! I get the idea! ( She really thinks the world of Maya, doesn't she? )

CHOICE.Pearl: To tell you the truth, I really want to grow my hair out, just like Mystic Maya. But my mother won't let me.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Your hair now suits you quite well, though, I think.

CHOICE.Pearl: R-Really? Th-Thank you! * fidget, fidget *

CHOICE.Phoenix: * fidget, fidget *

CHOICE.Pearl: Oh, it's my mother! She takes really good care of me and loves me very much. She says I'm the "pride of the branch family"... But I don't know what that means.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( "Branch family"... That concept is probably still too hard for little Pearl... )

CHOICE.Pearl: I'm sure it is helpful to you in some way, but I'm still in training, so I don't know anything about it. I'm really, deeply sorry.

CHOICE.Phoenix: No, no, no, it's OK. I shouldn't have shown you something so trivial anyway. I'm very sorry. ( This feels so weird, talking to a kid like this... )

CHOICE.Pearl: Hmm, I'm sorry I don't know who this person is.

CHOICE.Phoenix: I guess that makes sense... You've never left Kurain village, after all.

CHOICE.Pearl: I'm really sorry, Mr. Nick. I just don't really know anyone outside the village.

text.Pearl: Um, Mr. Nick...?

text.Phoenix: Yes, Pearls? I can call you that, right? You're too cute to just call you Pearl.

text.Pearl: Sure, Mr. Nick... Umm... Are you sure it's OK for me to have this Magatama?

text.Phoenix: Yeah, it's OK. I was told to give it to you.

text.Pearl: But, I can't accept something like this! ...All I really should do is charge this Magatama with spiritual energy ...

text.Phoenix: Spiritual energy?

text.Pearl: Please take this. I'm sure it will be helpful.

text.Phoenix: ...What do you mean?

text.Pearl: It will let you see people's secrets.

text.Phoenix: See people's... secrets...?

text.Pearl: Yes. ...If it's alright with you, I would like to accompany you for a little while. I can explain the Magatama's power to you when we meet someone hiding a secret.

text.Gumshoe: Hey, it's you, pal! So you're going to be her lawyer, I bet.

text.Phoenix: Yes.

text.Gumshoe: Oh... I really feel bad for you, pal. Just this once, I wish I could be on your side.

text.Phoenix: Detective Gumshoe...

text.Gumshoe: Yeah, but I shouldn't be saying that kind of stuff to you. Hey! You're a cute kid.
Ha ha ha. I'm not scary. Honest!

text.Phoenix: ( Wow, I never knew Gumshoe liked kids... )

text.Gumshoe: H-Hey! I know! I'll show you something cool! How's this? It's a real, genuine pistol...

text.Phoenix: D-Detective Gumshoe!! What are you doing showing her something that dangerous!

text.Gumshoe: Oh, sorry...

CHOICE.Phoenix: What about Maya and the charges against her?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: I don't think you can win, pal. If you're talking about proof, we've got a few pieces.

CHOICE.Phoenix: You've got proof...?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Yeah, pal. That puffy-haired photographer's going to testify tomorrow.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( He must be talking about Lotta. Actually... speaking of Lotta... )

CHOICE.Lotta: I took some hot pictures earlier!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Huh?

CHOICE.Lotta: Remember!? I took some pictures at the murder scene inside!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Lotta's " hot pictures "... I wonder what her camera captured...? )

CHOICE.Gumshoe: ...Besides, you must've realized by now, pal. There's no way anyone other than Maya Fey could've done it.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( What am I supposed to say to Pearls now...? )
About Dr. Grey...

CHOICE.Gumshoe: The victim wasn't super famous, but people still knew who he was. His face was all over those tabloid shows last year.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah, I know.

CHOICE.Gumshoe: I was looking through some newspapers from last year, and... ... Huh? I could've sworn I had... I cut an article out, but I guess I must've lost it...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( He's searching through his pockets... And boy, are those big... )

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Hmm... It looked really interesting, too. Hey, do you have a copy, pal?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( A copy of that article...? I think Dr. Grey might have brought a copy to the office when he came by... )
About Maya's trial tomorrow...

CHOICE.Gumshoe: I've got two pieces of news for you, pal.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Two ?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Yeah. "Bad news" and "even worse news." So which do you want to hear first?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...I don't really care... It doesn't change the fact that I'm not going to like it.

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Alright, pal. Well, the prosecutor for the trial is Prosecutor von Karma .

CHOICE.Phoenix: WHAT!? Von Karma!?

( Manfred von Karma... He was an awe-inspiring veteran prosecutor. He never lost a case in the 40 years of his career, and he raised a fearsome disciple. The horrible aftertaste of the evil he force-fed me is something I'll never forget. )
... Wait a sec. But didn't Von Karma stand trial and...

CHOICE.Gumshoe: That's where the other piece of bad news comes in... The Von Karma you're facing tomorrow is actually his successor ...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Successor...?
So, um... Who is this "successor" to Von Karma?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Literally, pal, it's Prosecutor von Karma's kid. His kid became a prosecutor real young... like 13, and hasn't lost a trial since. That's what they call a "prodigy," pal.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Hmm... Kid, huh... ... W-W-Wait a sec! Th-Th-Thirteen!? The kid became a prosecutor at the age of THIRTEEN!? I mean, a prodigy like that... I would have heard something about...

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Oh, no, no. The kid was born and raised in Germany, pal. That country's got a lot of stuff and is a great place to develop a person's talents.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Germany, huh? That's probably why I've never heard of this person. Ugh... Still, all it takes is someone mentioning the name "Von Karma", and I get terrible flashbacks to that case . Stop it! Get a grip on yourself, Phoenix! None of that matters anymore... now that he's gone... ( Changed from [That person is already gone...] in the original release ) )
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [Stop it! Get over it, Phoenix!] in the original release)

CHOICE.Phoenix: Hey, look. It's my attorney's badge.

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Ha ha. Good one, pal. You're always good for a laugh with your little badge. But a real man... A real man has a police badge.

CHOICE.Pearl: Uh, um... Mr. Nick?

CHOICE.Phoenix: What is it, Pearls?

CHOICE.Pearl: I was wondering if I could see it, too?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ah, no, it's OK. It's not that important anyway.
What do you think about this...?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Hey, that's a pretty nice-looking brooch! You should stop wearing that ugly old attorney's badge, and start wearing that, pal.

CHOICE.Pearl: Hee, hee. That detective is so nice! Aren't you happy, Mr. Nick?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Happy?... About what? )
Um, Dr. Grey brought this over to my office the other day, and...

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Hey! It's that news story! The one about the malpractice suit!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Fourteen patients died and it caused a huge stink.

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Yeah, but that's not all, pal. Things only got worse after that.

CHOICE.Phoenix: You mean the car accident the nurse died in?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: ...Hmm... Oh, here we go. I brought my own clipping with me today. Here, pal, this is for you.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Alright. Thanks.

CHOICE.Gumshoe: The nurse that killed the patients ended up getting killed in an accident. Dr. Grey wound up on a lot of tabloid shows because of that. Now, there was a smart man. I'm sure that was a great way to advertise for his clinic.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Uh, huh. Scaring people off is always the best way to get more patients. )
So about this key...

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Hey, is that your house key or something, pal?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Come on, does this look like a house key to you?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Then what's it for?

CHOICE.Phoenix: It's... ... ( Hmm, actually, I should probably keep that a secret... ) It's my bicycle key.

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Oh. Nothing special, huh?
I'm sorry things had to turn out this way, pal.

CHOICE.Phoenix: It's too early to give up! No one's proven her guilty of anything, yet!

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Look, even if there were a zillion of you, pal, this is a case you... * sigh *

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Now why is he sighing? )

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Oh, so that's little Pearl.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Do you know her?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Only that Ms. Fey was looking for her earlier. Something about being worried that she'll end up talking to the weird guy. So, you have any idea who this "weird guy" is, pal?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...Nope. Not a clue.

CHOICE.Gumshoe: That's Maya's aunt, right? I got to eat one of her giant strawberry desserts earlier. It was really good!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Aw, I didn't get to eat one yet... )

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Boy do I look scary in this picture. I guess if I want people to stop thinking cops are scary, I have to change myself. Gotta smile, gotta smile!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( There's that classic Gumshoe goofy smile again... )

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Ooh, I'd better shut my mouth.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Uh, what?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: I'm not gonna give you any information about evidence, pal.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Oh.

CHOICE.Gumshoe: I don't have anything to tell you about this one, pal.

CHOICE.Phoenix: You don't have to be so mean about it.

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Not. A. Word.
H-H-Hey! Don't look at me like that!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( That girl has one intense stare... * gulp * )

text.Phoenix: Hello again. We seem to be seeing a lot of each other today.

text.Mimi: Aww, she's, like, tooootally cute! Is she, like, your daughter?

text.Phoenix: W-What!? NO! ( How old do you think I am!? )

CHOICE.Phoenix: I want to ask you about the victim, Dr. Grey.

CHOICE.Mimi: I, like, totally don't know him.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Aaack! What is that!?

CHOICE.Pearl: You can see it, can't you, Mr. Nick? You can see the " lock " on that person's heart.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Huh, what...?

CHOICE.Pearl: This is the power of the Magatama. Only you can see these " Psyche-Locks ", Mr. Nick.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Psyche-Locks, huh... )

CHOICE.Pearl: The more someone wants to hide their secret, the more locks you will see. If it's only one, I think you can easily unlock it .

CHOICE.Phoenix: "Unlock"...? But how?

CHOICE.Pearl: Please use Mystic Maya's Magatama on this person, and let's remove the lock.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I have no idea what she's talking about, but... Guess I'll give it a try. )

CHOICE.Pearl: You must be careful, though, Mr. Nick. If you make a mistake, it will hurt you. If you don't think you have the proof you need, you must have the courage to stop .

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Well, I've got to start somewhere. Let's give this Psyche-Lock thing a try. )
Iim going to ask you again. Did you know Dr. Grey?

CHOICE.Mimi: I totally don't know that guy. Like, you're totally more presistent than a roach!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( This girl is hiding something! I'm sure of it! I guess I have no choice but to remove this lock. Alright, so first, I have to use Maya's Magatama ... )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "Please, tell me all you know about Dr. Grey."

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ini Miney. I believe you do know who Dr. Grey is!

CHOICE.Mimi: I told you! Like, how many times do I, like, have to repeat myself? If you're, like, so totally sure, then where's, like, your proof?

CHOICE.Phoenix: While it may be possible that you never actually met Dr. Grey in person, I do believe you might have at least, indirectly known of him.

CHOICE.Mimi: Like, what do you mean, like, "indirectly"...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I should try to show that the possibility existed for now... ) ( Hmm, so, something that shows a possible connection between Ini and Dr. Grey... )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "Take a look at this newspaper clipping."

CHOICE.Phoenix: Here is your proof!

CHOICE.Mimi: Like, what is that...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ouch... I guess it doesn't have anything to do with it, huh? ( Pearls did warn me... "If you make a mistake, it will hurt you," she said. If I don't have enough evidence, I should probably " stop ". I should take another look at the Court Record and think it through one more time. )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads back to "While it may be possible that you never actually met Dr. Grey in person,"

CHOICE.Phoenix: Take a look at this newspaper clipping.

CHOICE.Mimi: Like, what is it? ... A story about an accident?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Please read the victim's name.

CHOICE.Mimi: Um..." Mimi Miney "...

CHOICE.Phoenix: "Miney" is a pretty rare last name, wouldn't you say? Ms. Mimi Miney wouldn't happen to be a relative of yours, would she?

CHOICE.Mimi: ...! So you noticed. Sh-She was my older sister.

CHOICE.Phoenix: I'm sorry about your loss... Your sister... Was she a nurse... Perhaps at Dr. Grey's surgical clinic ?
Grey Surgical Clinic... I don't think I need to tell you that the clinic was run by the victim, Dr. Turner Grey . Which is how you knew of Dr. Grey; you knew him through your sister!

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "Take a look at this newspaper clipping."

CHOICE.Phoenix: Here is your proof!

CHOICE.Mimi: Like, what is that...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ouch... I guess it doesn't have anything to do with it, huh? ( Pearls did warn me... "If you make a mistake, it will hurt you," she said. If I don't have enough evidence, I should probably " stop ". I should take another look at the Court Record and think it through one more time. )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads back to "While it may be possible that you never actually met Dr. Grey in person,"

text.Phoenix: Please, tell me all you know about Dr. Grey.

text.Mimi: My... My sister's name was Mimi Miney. She was, like, a nurse at Dr. Grey's clinic.

text.Phoenix: ( That's what I thought... )

text.Mimi: I heard that, like, Dr. Grey was really tough on people. Like, a total slave driver. My sis was, like, always coming home totally wiped out 'cause she was overworked.

text.Phoenix: Wiped out? So is that why she fell asleep at the wheel?

text.Mimi: That guy, like, drove my sis so hard, so, like, that's why the accident happened.

text.Phoenix: The one where 14 patients died from malpractice?

text.Mimi: Yeah, like, I think that was the doctor's fault, too. My sis was pushed by, like, everyone's expectations and, like, her duties and stuff. And that pushed her to her death.

text.Phoenix: Oh... I'm sorry...

text.Mimi: So, like, are we done? I've, like, already told my story to, like, everyone...

text.Pearl: Do you understand now, Mr. Nick? This is how a Psyche-Lock works.

text.Phoenix: ...Well, I don't plan to pry into people's hearts unless I absolutely need to...

text.Pearl: The lock this time was pretty easy, but... you might meet people who aren't as willing to give in later on. If you don't have enough proof, be careful and know when to stop trying.

text.ACTION: After clearing "Successor" Talk option in Fey Manor - Meditation Room and clearing "The victim" Talk option upon breaking Psyche-Lock in Fey Manor - Side Room:

text.Pearl: Mr. Nick.

text.Phoenix: Hmm? What's wrong?

text.Pearl: I have never left Kurain Village.

text.Phoenix: R-Really? Wow, that's, um, pretty amazing...

text.Pearl: You are going to meet with Mystic Maya... aren't you? Please tell her I said hi.

text.Phoenix: Hey, wait! ( She ran off... Again. Well, I know Ini's secret now, but... I still don't have any idea how I'm going to save Maya. I don't even know if I should go in there with a smile or a straight face... * sigh * )
( What am I supposed to do!? I'm almost out of time! Can I really do anything? Can I really save her...? )

text.???: Sorry to keep you waiting.

text.Phoenix: ( Huh? Must be Maya... )

text.???: It's been a long time, hasn't it, Phoenix?

text.Phoenix: ...! ( That voice... ) M-Mia!

text.Mia: Even without me being here, it looks like you've learned to stand on your own.

text.Phoenix: ( Mia... She's Maya's older sister, and my mentor. She was a top-notch defense lawyer, but a certain case forced her into "retirement". But... whenever I'm in trouble, she comes to help, just like this. Her spirit comes back from the other world and borrows Maya's body for a bit... )

text.Mia: Phoenix, you can't make that kind of face in front of your client.
A lawyer is someone who smiles no matter how bad it gets, and especially when it's bad.

text.Phoenix: Mia...

text.Mia: You can't smile at the end if you haven't been smiling the whole way there. In any case, the face you're making now is no face to show a client, Phoenix.

text.Phoenix: B-But!

text.Mia: So, tell me all about it. I'm going to guess that my sister is in a lot of trouble again...

text.Phoenix: ( I told her everything about what had happened in the last two days. Mia closed her eyes, deep in thought, while she listened... )

text.Mia: ...I see...

text.Phoenix: Mia... What am I supposed to do?

text.Mia: ... It's pretty clear what a good lawyer does in this situation.

text.Phoenix: A-And that is!? Tell me, please!

text.Mia: Believe in your convictions. And fight for the complete acquittal of your client.

CHOICE.Phoenix: You think Maya's not guilty !? How can you be so sure!?

CHOICE.Mia: I know she is. And I'll give you a hint as to why.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Y-Yes?

CHOICE.Mia: Mediums can't have dreams.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Can't have " dreams "...?

CHOICE.Mia: From what you told me, it sounds like Maya was having a dream while channeling.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah... She said she dream that she had died and had been buried in the ground.

CHOICE.Mia: But that is impossible . You've heard it from her, I'm sure. When a medium channels, her own spirit disappears. Which means that it's impossible for her to dream during that time.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...! Then... What does this mean!?

CHOICE.Mia: I think it's safe to bet that Maya was set-up .

CHOICE.Phoenix: A set-up!?

CHOICE.Mia: It's up to you to blow the lid on this case tomorrow and show how she was set-up.

CHOICE.Phoenix: How am I supposed to prove her innocence when I have nothing to go on!?

CHOICE.Mia: If you're looking for a clue, it's already in your hands.

CHOICE.Phoenix: I-It is!?

CHOICE.Mia: Just as it sounds, Phoenix, you already hold the " key ".

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( R-Really...? )

CHOICE.Mia: Come on, show me the "key" to this case.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( The " key ", huh? Alright, I'll show it to her; the "key" I hold. )
Mia...

CHOICE.Mia: * chuckle * Wow, this badge brings back a lot of memories, doesn't it...? I would love to stand with you at the defense table one more time.
This is... Maya's Magatama, isn't it? Why do you have it...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Maya gave it to me, but...

CHOICE.Mia: I see... ... This is something very important to me. Take good care of it, OK?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( She looks at it with such a soft look in her eyes... )
Mia, have you seen this key before?

CHOICE.Mia: Ahh, the key... It's literally, the key to understanding everything that's happened in this case.

CHOICE.Phoenix: This key?

CHOICE.Mia: Phoenix, listen. Right now, that key is sitting in your hand. However, it shouldn't be. ... It contradicts the " facts ".

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( What does she mean...? )

CHOICE.Mia: I'm certain this key will be the piece of evidence that makes your case tomorrow.
I can't see Maya... when I'm in her body like this... But I can tell. She's very lonely and sad. Take good care of her, will you, Phoenix?

CHOICE.Phoenix: I-I will...

CHOICE.Mia: Pearly! She's really grown up... I left Kurain Village a long time ago. She probably doesn't remember a thing about me by now...
I'm afraid I might have caused Aunt Morgan a lot of stress. When I left Kurain, I left Maya in my aunt's care. And now something like this happens...

I've seen this man somewhere before... He had a strange name... and I'm almost sure I've questioned him before. I remember him making a show of confidence at first, but after five minutes, he breaks down and... ...you end up feeling bad for the poor guy...
That's right. I'm already dead. But I feel very grateful to have been born a Fey... so I can talk with you like this...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Could you take a look at this?

CHOICE.Mia: ...Do you have anything more useful? There's no time left. Try to show me something that will help you in tomorrow's trial.
I'm sorry, but I don't remember who that is...

text.ACTION: After clearing all Talk options and presenting Black Key:

text.Mia: ... ... You already know everything you need to know. You know what the "key" to this case is... That is enough...

text.Phoenix: But... But! How can I win tomorrow without knowing who the real murderer is!? Who... Who could have...?
( I didn't know it at the time, but this day was going to end with a turn for the surprising... )
text._info: (Changed from [At the time, I didn't know,] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: M-Mia!? Wh-What...!?

text.Mia: What's wrong?

text.Phoenix: ( That's right. Only I can see the Psyche-Locks... Which means... Mia must know something about the real murderer ! But for this to be something that she would hide under lock and key from even me... What in the world is going on!? )

text.ACTION: June 21, 9:48 AM District Court Defendant Lobby No. 3

text.Maya: Whaaaaaaaat!? Prosecutor von Karma!? You mean...?

text.Phoenix: No, I heard it's his successor this time...

text.Maya: Successor...? ... Manfred von Karma... was a really sinister man. He pulled all sorts of nasty tricks; all so he could win.
text._info: (Changed from [Manfred von Karma. He was a really sinister man.] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: ( He was a man obsessed with the word " perfection "... He had a perfect record... for forty long years. Who knows what sorts of dirty tricks he used to get each of those guilty verdicts? And now, his successor... I wonder what kind of person they will turn out to be... )

text.Maya: It's no good...
Pearly! You showed up! Thanks for coming all this way!

text.Pearl: I was really worried about you...

text.Maya: Hey, where's your mother? Didn't you two come together?

text.Pearl: Mother is watching over the trainees. She said they have training for two days straight with no breaks.

text.Maya: Huh!? Then... Then... You came all by yourself?

text.Pearl: Yup! I snuck out of the manor and followed a map.

text.Phoenix: Don't tell me you walked all the way here...

text.Pearl: Of course not! ...I ran!

text.Phoenix: That's... I can't... Oh my... ( If it takes two hours by train... Oh man... )

text.Maya: Pearly... What about the train?

text.Pearl: Huh? What's a... "tray-in"?

text.Phoenix: ( I give up... )

text.Pearl: ...It's time, isn't it?

text.Maya: Um... I'm really scared... What if Von Karma tries to do something to me? At least I know Mr. Edgeworth would be nicer to me than Von Karma!

text.Pearl: Mr. Eh-ji-werth? Who is that?

text.Maya: Um, he's Nick's rival... Well, he's also a friend. I still remember him as though I'd seen him only yesterday. Every trial was a scorchingly fierce battle until the very end. ( Changed from [Every trial was a scorching fierce battle until the very end.] in the original release ) It was always back and forth with them. But when you're rivals for life...
text._info: (Changed from [I still remember him as if I had just seen him only yesterday.] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: Maya! Please don't mention that name ever again...

text.Maya: Huh...? But why, Nick?

text.Phoenix: I'm... I'm sorry, Maya. I forgot you don't know... He... He's... He's gone... And he's not coming back...

text.Maya: Whaaaat!? W-W-Wait... Wait a second!! What's that supposed to mean!?

text.Bailiff: Court will commence shortly. Please proceed into the courtroom.

text.Phoenix: ... Let's go. Now's not the time to talk about that anyway.

text.Maya: N...Nick...?

text.ACTION: June 21, 10:00 AM District Court Courtroom No. 2

text.Judge: Court is now in session for the trial of Maya Fey. Are the prosecution and the defense prepared?

text.Phoenix: ... ( What is with this kid...? )
text._info: (Changed from [... (What is with this girl...?)] in the original release)

text.Judge: ... * Ahem! * Mr. Wright!! Are you prepared!?
text._info: (Changed from [*Ahem!* Mr. Wright!! Are you finally prepared!?] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: Huh? A-Ah, yes, Your Honor. ( Why does he always seem mad at me!? )

text.???: Mr. Phoenix Wright.
You must be a little shocked because I am a woman, correct?

text.Phoenix: ( ...Hold on. So SHE'S the famed "successor" to Prosecutor von Karma...? )
text._info: (Changed from [...Hold on. So this kid is the 'famed' Prosecutor von Karma...?] in the original release)

text.Franziska: I am Franziska von Karma, the Prodigy.

text.Phoenix: I... see...

text.Franziska: I gave up a promising career in Germany and came to this country for one sole reason. Revenge.

text.Phoenix: Revenge ...? ( Is this about her father, Manfred von Karma...? )

text.Judge: Um... If it's something of a personal nature, I'm sure you can... Oww!

text.Franziska: I'm talking. If you interrupt again, my whip will do the speaking for me.

text.Phoenix: ( Please speak with your mouth like a normal person... I beg of you... ) Yeow!!

text.Franziska: Make no mistake; I will defeat you! Prepare to go down, Mr. Phoenix Wright!

text.Judge: Prosecutor von Karma, your opening statement, please...

text.Franziska: Those of Von Karma blood have only one fate. And that is "perfection". The defendant, Maya Fey, will find no escape from her guilt on my watch.

text.Judge: V-Very well... What is the defense's position?

text.Phoenix: Your Honor.

text.Judge: Does the defense wish to enter a plea of "not guilty"?

text.Phoenix: ...Yes.

text.Franziska: Foolish fool who foolishly dreams of foolish dreams... Ten minutes. I give the defense ten minutes before it changes its plea. That's right. I'll have you running for the " justified self-defense " plea in no time.

text.Phoenix: ( " Justified self-defense "... A plea usually reserved for when a person unintentionally kills in defense of themself. We could very easily make a solid case that it was self-defense, but... ) The defense stands by the plea of " not guilty ", Your Honor! ( Because to plead "justified self-defense" is to say you did kill someone. )
text._info: (Changed from [A plea usually reserved for when a person unintentionally kills in defense of himself.] in the original release)

text.Franziska: How foolish. If that's how you want to play it, Mr. Phoenix Wright, then I shall now call the first witness.

text.Phoenix: ( She's just as scary as her father. Like father, like daughter I suppose. )

text.Franziska: Witness, your name and occupation?

text.Gumshoe: Yes, sir! My name is Dick Gumshoe. I'm a detective at the local precinct. Aah!!

text.Franziska: Get to the point already. Explain to the court the details of this murder.

text.Gumshoe: Y-Yes, sir! Um, if everyone would please look at this map. The Channeling Chamber has no windows and the door was locked shut. At the time of the murder, only the victim and the defendant were in the room.

text.Judge: What were they doing in there?

text.Gumshoe: Um... They... Well, they were channeling... a spirit... Sir.

text.Judge: Ch-Channeling a spirit??

text.Phoenix: ( That's quite the look of disbelief there, Your Honor... )
text._info: (Changed from [The look of disbelief on the judge's face is...] in the original release)

text.Gumshoe: * ahem * Anyway, a few minutes after the channeling started, gunshots were heard coming from inside the room, sir. A few of the witnesses broke the door down, and rushed into the room.

text.Judge: Ah, and that's when they found that the victim was already dead, correct? Hmm, I believe this is one of the most open and shut cases I have ever presided over.
So, how was the victim killed?

text.Gumshoe: I was about to get to that...

text.Franziska: Stop wasting my time, then.

text.Gumshoe:
The direct cause of death was a pistol shot to the forehead, sir. 
The shot was fired from point-blank range. 
But before the victim was shot, sir, he was stabbed in the chest. 
The wound was very severe, but not enough to cause instantaneous death. 
The murderer used the pistol to finish the victim off after the stabbing.

text.Judge: Hmm... So the victim was stabbed before being shot...

text.Gumshoe: This is the victim's autopsy report, sir.

text.Judge: The court accepts it into evidence. Mr. Wright, you may question the witness.

text.Gumshoe: The direct cause of death was a pistol shot to the forehead, sir.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
The murder weapon, Detective Gumshoe. Whose pistol was it?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: It was the victim's .

CHOICE.Phoenix: The victim? Now, why would he have...

CHOICE.Franziska: Objection!
"Why would he have a pistol?" Who cares? The point that you are missing is whose fingerprints are on that pistol. If you're not already paying attention to that, then I suggest you start.

CHOICE.Judge: Fingerprints? There were fingerprints?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Along with the victim's, the defendant, Maya Fey 's were also on the grip, sir.

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm. So the defendant's fingerprints were left on the murder weapon...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Argh...! I walked right into her hands there. )
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [Hmm... I walked right into her hands there.] in the original release)

text.Gumshoe: The shot was fired from point-blank range.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
Point blank, huh? So about how far away was it?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: It was anywhere between 12 to 20 inches away.

CHOICE.Phoenix: And how do you know he was shot at point blank?

CHOICE.Franziska: Tsk, tsk, tsk. Mr. Phoenix Wright. I grow tired of the foolish foolery of the foolish fools of this foolish country...

CHOICE.Phoenix: E-Excuse me!?

CHOICE.Franziska: Gunpowder burn.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...Gunpowder burn?

CHOICE.Franziska: When something is shot from point blank, a burn area is left around the bullet hole.

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Gunpowder exploding is what makes a bullet fire, and that gets real hot, pal. And there were definitely some gunpowder burns left on the victim's forehead!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Wow... Never knew that... Live and learn, I guess... )

text.Gumshoe: But before the victim was shot, sir, he was stabbed in the chest.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
Stabbed... And what was he stabbed with?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: A fruit knife.

CHOICE.Judge: I see. And whose knife was it?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: It looks like it belongs to the Feys, sir. And of course, Maya Fey's fingerprints are all over it.

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm... All over it, huh?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Urk. This does not look good... )

CHOICE.Franziska: Ha ha ha. What will you do now, Mr. Phoenix Wright?

text.Gumshoe: The wound was very severe, but not enough to cause instantaneous death.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
How severe was the wound?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: If it had been half an inch more to the right, it would've hit the victim's heart. After a stab like that, it's impossible to fight back, let alone stand.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( This testimony makes Maya look like she had stabbed him with the intent to kill... )

text.Gumshoe: The murderer used the pistol to finish the victim off after the stabbing.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
Are you sure he was stabbed first , then shot?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Yup. Sure as sure can be. One look at the wounds and you'd come to the same conclusion too, pal.

CHOICE.Franziska: A fool is a fool who will only listen to the foolish opinions of other foolish fools... A pistol shot to the forehead at point blank is certainly enough to kill instantly. Does it matter, then, which was first? Think a little more before you open that big mouth of yours, Mr. Phoenix Wright!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Grr... What a pain... )

text.Phoenix: ( Nothing sounds out of place so far... I should try to learn more about the murder weapons , for now... )

text.ACTION: After pressing first, second, third, and fifth statements:

text.Judge: That's enough! We have clearly established how the victim was murdered.

text.Gumshoe: I brought the two murder weapons with me today.

text.Judge: Very well. The court accepts them into evidence.

text.Franziska: The date and time of death was June 19th at 3:15 PM. Eyewitnesses claim to have heard two gunshots at this time.

text.Judge: And two murder weapons, both with the defendant's fingerprints on them, huh... Hmm... This does seem like an open and shut case.
text._info: (Changed from [And the two murder weapons, both with the defendant's fingerprints on them...?] in the original release)

text.Franziska: Naturally!

text.Phoenix: ( This is going from bad to worse... As if the summary just now wasn't oversimplifying things to the extreme... )

text.Franziska: Your Honor. Feel free to slam that little gavel of yours. After all, there is no room left for doubt, is there?

text.Judge: That is quite true... Mr. Wright.

text.Phoenix: Y-Yes?

text.Judge: Even in the face of all this, do you still wish to plead "not guilty"? It's the opinion of this court that if you do not adjust your plea, you stand to lose.

text.Franziska: See, just as I promised, Mr. Phoenix Wright. You would change your plea in less than ten minutes...

text.Judge: What will you do, Mr. Wright? Will you change to "justified self-defense"? Because now would be the time to do so. This is your final chance.

text.Phoenix: ( This is a huge decision! I'd better think this through all the way! )

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( If Maya is convicted, then it's all over. I really should play it safe, and try to soften the blow... ) Your Honor. The defense would like to change its plea to "justified self-defense"...

CHOICE.Franziska: Hah.

CHOICE.Judge: Understood. Let the record show that the defense has entered a new plea.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( ...There's nothing else I could do... Mia...? )

CHOICE.Mia: ...You already hold the key... ...If you don't believe, you cannot win...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( ...! If we plead "justified self-defense", we would basically be confessing to murder! After the trial, Maya's life would be destroyed, and she'll be labeled a murderer ... Can I really... Can I really let that happen!? ) Your Honor!

CHOICE.Judge: Y-Yes?

CHOICE.Phoenix: The defense... The defense retracts its previous statement. And instead, will prove beyond the shadow of a doubt that the defendant is not guilty!

( If we plead "justified self-defense"... we would basically be confessing to a murder! After the trial, Maya's life would be destroyed, and she'd be labeled a murderer ... I can't let that happen! ) Your Honor!

CHOICE.Judge: Have you reached a conclusion, Mr. Wright?

CHOICE.Phoenix: The defense will not change its plea. We will accept nothing short of complete acquittal!

text.Franziska: ...You. You have sealed your fate, Mr. Phoenix Wright. Detective!

text.Gumshoe: Y-Yes, sir!

text.Franziska: Present the final portion of your testimony -- the final strike.

text.Gumshoe: Um... Y-Yes... sir...

text.Judge: N-Now, see here! Proceedings are run by... Eek!
Oh, yes, of course. Go ahead Detective and give your testimony...

text.Franziska: I think the court would like to hear about the other piece of incriminating evidence !

text.Gumshoe:
Sorry, pal, but there's an even more incriminating piece of evidence. 
This is the costume the defendant was wearing at the time of the crime. 
As you can see, it's covered in blood. 
The defendant attacked and killed a person who, without a doubt, was not fighting back.

text.Judge: So this is the costume... There certainly is evidence of a back spray of blood on this.

text.Gumshoe: This piece directly links Maya Fey to the crime, sir.

text.Judge: I see... The court accepts this into evidence.
Alright, Mr. Wright.

text.Phoenix: ( Maya's fingerprints on both murder weapons and blood splatters on her clothes... Could this situation get any worse?? )

text.Franziska: Hah. What's wrong? You seem to be at a loss. I think this is the last piece of testimony the prosecution should have to offer. Feel free to sulk off with your tail between your legs, Mr. Phoenix Wright!

text.Phoenix: ( Please stop calling me by my full name. It's disturbing. )

text.Gumshoe: Sorry, pal, but there's an even more incriminating piece of evidence.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
Why didn't you say so in your testimony earlier!?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Uh... You're kinda scary today, you know, pal?

CHOICE.Judge: Come now, Mr. Wright... There is no need for that kind of attitude in my court...
A-Alright. Just, please stop glaring at me like that...

text.Gumshoe: This is the costume the defendant was wearing at the time of the crime.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
Maya's... costume?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Yeah. She was wearing this when we arrested her.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Maya... She's wearing her channeling costume today too... Is she not allowed to wear anything else...? )

text.Gumshoe: As you can see, it's covered in blood.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
This blood on the costume...

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Lab results show that it is the victim's blood.

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm... So there is blood from the victim on the defendant's clothes.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Definitely not good... ) So, where there any other clues you could gleam [sic] from this piece of evidence? ( Changed from [Hmm, where there any other clues you could gleam [sic] from this piece of evidence?] in the original release )
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [Definitely not good... Urk.] in the original release)

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Um, well...

CHOICE.Franziska: Objection!
If you must change the topic, then the good detective here must testify again. But too bad. Not enough time. Let's move on.
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [But too bad. Not enough time. Time to move on.] in the original release)

CHOICE.Judge: Ah, yes, Ms. von Karma is perfectly correct...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Grr... Now even the Judge is on her side! But if I bite off more than I can chew here... What should I do!? )

( Why is Ms. von Karma suddenly putting up resistance? There must be a reason as to why she suddenly threw out an objection like that... There must be something about this costume...! I just have to look harder! )
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [There must be a clue somewhere on this costume!] in the original release)

CHOICE.Judge: Mr. Wright. Ms. von Karma's logic is perfect. There is no way for you to poke a hole in it.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Argh! Looks like my time is up. So, about the costume... )
( If I pursue this and I turn up nothing, it could be disastrous... ) You're right, Your Honor. There is absolutely nothing more to this.

CHOICE.Judge: Good. Well, Detective, please continue with your testimony.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Your Honor. Actually, there is something very wrong with this piece of evidence.

CHOICE.Judge: Wh-What!?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: What are you talking about, pal!?

CHOICE.Judge: Wh-Where is this problem you are talking about!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I've come this far... There's no turning back now! ) The problem I have with this piece of evidence is here!

CHOICE.ACTION: USER SELECTS Present bullet hole on left sleeve
Leads to "I ask the court to please take a look at the sleeve of this costume."

CHOICE.Phoenix: The problem is obviously the blood splatter here!

CHOICE.Judge: B-But... We've determined that the blood splatter is from the victim. Where is the problem in that?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Yeah, where, pal?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah... I wonder about that too...

CHOICE.Judge: That last antic of yours just pushed me over the top, Mr. Wright. I hereby declare this cross-examination over...
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [I am declaring that this cross-examination period is over...] in the original release)

CHOICE.Phoenix: P-Please wait, Your Honor! ( Ack! I'd better not mess up again... )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads back to "The problem I have with this piece of evidence is here!"

CHOICE.Phoenix: There is a problem... somewhere around... here!

CHOICE.Judge: Wh-What does he mean, Ms. von Karma?

CHOICE.Franziska: There's nothing wrong with it. The only thing wrong here is the defense's head.

CHOICE.Judge: Well said. You certainly do take after your father!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I've just been made to look like a fool again... Alright... Focus, Phoenix! )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads back to "The problem I have with this piece of evidence is here!"

CHOICE.Phoenix: I ask the court to please take a look at the sleeve of this costume.

CHOICE.Judge: The sleeve? ...! There is a tiny hole here...

CHOICE.Gumshoe: ..A... A hole...? But that wasn't in the report.

CHOICE.Judge: Hold on! What's this around the hole? I-It smells faintly of gunpowder !

CHOICE.Gumshoe: G-Gunpowder!? No one ever told me!

CHOICE.Judge: A hole that smells of gunpowder...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( It looks like I've found the " hole " I was looking for! ) Your Honor, the only logical conclusion you can make is that it must be a bullet hole !

CHOICE.Judge: Order! Order! Order!! This is a very grave matter. It's best we correct the Court Record first before anything else.

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Sorry about that. I guess we messed up, sir.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...! ( I-Is she actually... smiling !? What else is she hiding!? )

CHOICE.Franziska: Pull yourself together, Detective. That tiny "hole" doesn't change a thing. The strength of the evidence still holds. Continue with your testimony. That, just now, was a fluke. Nothing more.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Objection!
H-How can you say something like that!? This is a huge oversight!

CHOICE.Judge: While I agree it is a mistake on the part of the police, what Prosecutor von Karma has said is true. The evidence still stands. If you do not find a more definitive problem with the evidence, then...

CHOICE.Phoenix: No way!!

CHOICE.Judge: Detective Gumshoe, please continue with your testimony.

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Y-Yes, sir.

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "I ask the court to please take a look at the sleeve of this costume."

CHOICE.Phoenix: The problem is obviously the blood splatter here!

CHOICE.Judge: B-But... We've determined that the blood splatter is from the victim. Where is the problem in that?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Yeah, where, pal?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah... I wonder about that too...

CHOICE.Judge: That last antic of yours just pushed me over the top, Mr. Wright. I hereby declare this cross-examination over...

CHOICE.Phoenix: P-Please wait, Your Honor! ( Ack! I'd better not mess up again... )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads back to "The problem I have with this piece of evidence is here!"

CHOICE.Phoenix: There is a problem... somewhere around... here!

CHOICE.Judge: Wh-What does he mean, Ms. von Karma?

CHOICE.Franziska: There's nothing wrong with it. The only thing wrong here is the defense's head.

CHOICE.Judge: Well said. You certainly do take after your father!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I've just been made to look like a fool again... Alright... Focus, Phoenix! )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads back to "The problem I have with this piece of evidence is here!"

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( If I pursue this and I turn up nothing, it could be disastrous... ) You're right, Your Honor. There is absolutely nothing more to this.

CHOICE.Judge: Good. Well, Detective, please continue with your testimony.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
Alright. I'll give you that the blood spatter is from the victim, but... what is this hole in the sleeve?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Um... Sorry, pal. We must've thought it was just a tear in the seam...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Missing the hole is not what I'm asking you about. I'm talking about the hole itself! The smell of gunpowder clearly gives away that... it is a bullet hole!

CHOICE.Franziska: Objection!
As if little things like that matter.

CHOICE.Phoenix: But they do.

CHOICE.Franziska: A "bullet hole" in the sleeve, blood splatter all over the costume... Neither of these things can change the fact the defendant killed the victim.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( ...Grr... I know there's something more to that costume. )

CHOICE.Franziska: Come now Detective. You're wasting precious time.

CHOICE.Gumshoe: ... Yes, sir.

text.Gumshoe: The defendant attacked and killed a person who, without a doubt, was not fighting back.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
He wasn't " fighting back "? How do you know if he was or wasn't!?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: We could find no evidence that the victim put up any sort of struggle, pal.

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm... So did the murderer have a fight with the victim, or not? Depending on this, the circumstances around this murder change drastically.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Ugh... We're in real trouble now... If only I had something to prove that the victim did fight back ... )

CHOICE.Phoenix: Objection!

text.Phoenix: ( That Von Karma! She thinks she can decide the verdict with this testimony alone! I have to somehow find a critical contradiction and then I'll have her! )
Detective Dick Gumshoe!

text.Gumshoe: Y-Yes? Heh, having you call me by my full name is kind of a weird feeling...

text.Phoenix: You said that my client killed "a person who, without a doubt, was not fighting back ."

text.Gumshoe: Yeah, I did.

text.Phoenix: Then what, may I ask, is the bullet hole you police overlooked supposed to mean!?

text.Gumshoe: Eh, um... What does it mean?

text.Phoenix: I'll tell you what it means. It means that the victim had fired off a shot . Is this what it means to " not fight back "?

text.Gumshoe: A-Ah! You're right!

text.Judge: It seems you are correct! If the victim had tried to shoot the defendant, then... it would change everything... ( Changed from [If the victim tried to shoot the defendant, then... It would change everything...] in the original release )
text._info: (Changed from [It would seem that way!] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: ( Alright! The wind seems to be shifting... )

text.Franziska: Hah.

text.Phoenix: ( What is with that "are you finished yet" laugh? )

text.Franziska: Are you finished yet, Mr. Phoenix Wright?

text.Judge: Ms. von Karma?

text.Franziska: It seems... that Maya Fey was shot at by the victim. However, that is only grounds enough to support a " justified self-defense " plea.

text.Judge: That is correct.

text.Franziska: But I'm sure you remember, Your Honor, what the defense clearly said. They rejected "justified self-defense" and pleaded " not guilty ."

text.Phoenix: Ack!

text.Gumshoe: Now that you...

Y-Yes, sir! Right away, sir!

During the channeling, the defendant saw her chance to stab the victim in the chest. 
Of course, the victim used the last of his strength to fight back, sir. 
While the two were fighting, the victim took out his gun. 
The victim took a shot, but because they were too close, he missed. 
The defendant then picked up on the opening, took the victim's gun, and ended it...

text.Judge: Hmm... This scenario you have put together does make sense...

text.Gumshoe: Yes, sir.

text.Judge: Well, Mr. Wright?

text.Phoenix: ( On the surface, it does seem to make sense... However, I won't give up that easily! )

text.Judge: P-Please refrain from glaring at me like that... Now then, your cross-examination, please.

text.Gumshoe: During the channeling, the defendant saw her chance to stab the victim in the chest.

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Now that you mention it... Yeah, I guess...

You think you can get away with such flimsy reasoning? Mr. Phoenix Wright! Maya Fey was in the middle of channeling , was she not?

CHOICE.Phoenix: You really won't tell me what you were doing at the time of the murder...?
