CHOICE.Phoenix: But with the Magatama, I can unlock your Psyche-Locks, right?

CHOICE.Pearl: Yes... Ah, what should I do...? Should I tell you what my secret is...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( If you would just tell me, it would be easier for the both of us... )

CHOICE.Pearl: I'm so nervous...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Pearls is holding the key to this whole case! I can feel it! ...Speaking of keys, this one turned out to be quite important too... I didn't think it would literally be the "key" to today's trial. )

CHOICE.Pearl: So... that's a lawyer's Sacred Treasure?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Huh?

CHOICE.Pearl: I feel like it has a mysterious power, just like my Magatama...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Hmm, well, I guess I can let her think what she wants on this one... )

CHOICE.Pearl: So you like things about spirit channeling too? The Kurain Sacred Writings are on this folding screen.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Oh? Is that what's written on it?

CHOICE.Pearl: There are six lines to the Sacred Writings. Cleanse thy soul... Open the door to the spiritual realm beyond... Converse with the departed... ... Cast on thyself Protection... Maintain the spell... Release the spell...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( So basically, this has nothing to do with the murder... Well, that's super. )
About this key, Pearls... You found it on the day of the murder, right?

CHOICE.Pearl: Yes.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Now, where you found this key is very important. So, please tell me, Pearls. Where did you find this?

CHOICE.Pearl: Um... I found it in the incinerator ...

CHOICE.Phoenix: The incinerator? ( Hmm, is she talking about the one in the garden? )

CHOICE.Pearl: The door on it was a little open, so I took a peek...

CHOICE.Phoenix: When was that?

CHOICE.Pearl: It was after the channeling, when everyone was in a panic.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Hmm...

CHOICE.Pearl: Um... Mr. Nick?
Are you going to tell my mother?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Huh? You mean, tell Morgan what you did?

CHOICE.Pearl: Yes. If she finds out that I was playing in the left-over trash, I'll get a spanking.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...Ah, gotcha. Well, let's keep it a secret from her then, alright? ( Hmm, the incinerator, huh? Sounds like a good place to search next... )

CHOICE.Pearl: I've seen this knife before.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Really!? Where!?

CHOICE.Pearl: M-My kitchen...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Oh... That's right... This knife belongs to the Feys... )

CHOICE.Pearl: I'll skin and cut up some apples for you later, Mr. Nick!

CHOICE.Phoenix: O-OK... Thanks.

CHOICE.Pearl: Th-That's Mystic Maya's!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Ack!! I shouldn't have shown her something this violent... )

CHOICE.Pearl: I-I-Is that... Blood!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Umm... It's nothing. Really. Just forget your ever saw this, okay? ( What was I thinking? I can't show stuff like this to a child. )
( On second thought, showing her this picture might cause severe trauma... )

CHOICE.Pearl: I knew her for a little while. Mystic Mia was your teacher, right? I'm sure she was a great Master of Lawyers.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( "Master of Lawyers"... I guess...? I mean, it's not exactly a martial art... )

CHOICE.Pearl: You should keep training, Mr. Nick.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Y-Yeah, you're probably right.

CHOICE.Pearl: To tell you the truth, I really want to grow my hair out, just like Mystic Maya. But my mother wouldn't let me.

CHOICE.Phoenix: I think your hair now suits you perfectly.

CHOICE.Pearl: R-Really? Th-Thank you! * fidget, fidget *

CHOICE.Phoenix: * fidget, fidget *

CHOICE.Pearl: Ah! This person! I can't let her get away with bullying Mystic Maya like that! I'm going to cast a curse on her!

CHOICE.Phoenix: C-Can spirit mediums really do that...?

CHOICE.Pearl: ... Actually, no, I guess not... Grr... I have to find something I can do, then!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( When they're mad, the women of the Fey family could give Medusa a run for her money... )

text.Phoenix: This case has had me out of the office most of the time... I can come back tomorrow. Helping Maya should be my top priority now.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Charley. A quite decorative plant. He's a handful but I've grown quite attached to the little fella. He also helps me to remember all the good times with Mia.

text.Phoenix: ( Maya must still be in questioning... She'll probably be done in a little bit, so I'll come back later... )
( It's really empty... There's supposed to be training held today, but I guess it's already over... )

CHOICE.Phoenix: A door that leads to the Channeling Chamber, the place where spirits and people meet. The iron in this door was tempered, making it very solid. But I guess it wasn't strong enough to withstand The Phoenix!

text.Phoenix: ( ...Hmm, looks like Morgan's here too, but she hasn't noticed me yet... What is she doing...? She looks like she's talking to a picture... )

text.Morgan: ...Don't you see? Take a look around... Finally, my chance has come... I've waited for this day for so long! That's right... Prepare yourself, dear Misty...

text.Phoenix: ( What in the...!? )

text.Morgan: Who's there!? ...Oh, if it isn't Mr. Wright...

text.Phoenix: Um... Just curious, but that picture you were just looking at...

text.Morgan: Oh, today was that event, was it not, good sir? I heard you did well.

text.Phoenix: Huh, oh, yes... Thank you.

text.Morgan: I am terribly sorry I could not attend the trial today. Please accept my apology. I had a previous engagement, as I had to watch over the trainees' training today.

text.Phoenix: ( I get the sense she really doesn't want to talk about the picture... )

text.Morgan: All because the Master can't be here with us, you understand. And that is why a lowly branch family member such as myself must do this.

CHOICE.Phoenix: There is some empty space behind the folding screen. The light of the candles can't reach back there, so it's completely dark. There wasn't anyone back here at the time of the murder... Or that's what Lotta testified in court... ( I knew I should've taken a look... I can always count on Lotta to make things hard... )
Have you remembered anything about the murder?
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [Have you remembered something about the murder?] in the original release)

CHOICE.Morgan: No, I told you everything I know already.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Were you in this room the whole time when Lotta and I went to call the police?
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [Where [sic] you in this room the whole time when Lotta and I went to call the police?] in the original release)

CHOICE.Morgan: Yes, of course. I was by Mystic Maya's side the entire time. I performed the Spirit Severing Technique and held her in my arms afterward.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Hmm, you said that yesterday as well. Did anything else happen?

CHOICE.Morgan: I would like to say more did, however that is all that occurred.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Ah, I was really hoping for some new info... )

CHOICE.Morgan: I suppose nothing happened in the end, good sir. Sorry to have played on your hopes.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Could you possibly be more patronizing...? )
CHOICE._info: (Chnaged from [Why do I feel like I was just made fun of in the worse way possible...?] in the original release)

CHOICE.Phoenix: So do the students train every day?

CHOICE.Morgan: Yes, absolutely. They were given a day off the day after the murder, of course, however...

CHOICE.Phoenix: And I assume both Maya and Pearls went through this training...?

CHOICE.Morgan: Mr. Wright!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ack! Yes, yes! ( Wow, she got real scary, real fast... )

CHOICE.Morgan: How many times must I tell you before you understand, good sir? They are to be addressed as Mystic Maya and Mystic Pearl.

CHOICE.Phoenix: S-Sorry... I meant Mystic Maya and Mystic Pearl... Wait... I'm sorry, but "Mystic" Pearl? Isn't that going a bit too far...?

CHOICE.Morgan: Next question, please.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Oh man... She's really being a pain in the butt about this... )

CHOICE.Morgan: Please remember to watch not only what you say, but how you say it, good sir.

CHOICE.Phoenix: So the Master is... um, Maya's mother, right?

CHOICE.Morgan: ...Mystic Misty... She is a brilliant medium.

CHOICE.Phoenix: And where is she now...?

CHOICE.Morgan: We are not sure.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Not sure?

CHOICE.Morgan: About 16 or 17 years ago, Mystic Misty failed at channeling a certain spirit. And after that... she simply disappeared.
I don't believe she will return to this village, in any case. And in four years' time, her name will be forever erased from this village.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...Erased?

CHOICE.Morgan: A person who has been away from the village for over 20 years is considered dead...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Oh, I see.

CHOICE.Morgan: And that is four years from now for her. When that happens, a new Master will be appointed to Kurain Village.

CHOICE.Phoenix: And...?

CHOICE.Morgan: Mystic Maya was supposed to become the next Master... However with this... murder, I'm afraid...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I must be imagining things... I thought she was laughing to herself for a second there... )

CHOICE.Morgan: There are six parts to the Kurain Sacred Writings. To think that this valued treasure of our village... and Mystic Maya were both shot by a gun...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Well, that's...

CHOICE.Morgan: Even if it was something that occured during a channeling, it is an unforgivable act.
This... This is the key to this room!

CHOICE.Phoenix: That's right.

CHOICE.Morgan: B-But why do you have it, good sir!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: That, I'm not telling.

CHOICE.Morgan: R-Return it at once!

CHOICE.Phoenix: I... I can't. It's evidence, after all. ( I think she knows exactly how important this key is to this murder... But what is this feeling I'm getting from her? It feels... Hmm... I can't describe it. )

CHOICE.Morgan: That is Mystic Maya's costume, isn't it...? It's a shame. I never thought anything like that would happen to her...

CHOICE.Phoenix: But we don't know that it was Maya that did it...

CHOICE.Morgan: Oh, poor Mystic Maya.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Do you ever listen to anyone other than yourself? )

CHOICE.Morgan: That is Mystic Maya before I applied the Spirit Severing Technique... This picture... It was taken without my express permission. I knew allowing a person like her from the "Heartland" into our country was a bad idea.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( You do realize that the "Heartland" is a part of this country, right...? )
About this person...

CHOICE.Morgan: Oh! It is that man, is it not? A man who wishes to borrow a departed spirit's power to hide the lack of his own. What an insignificant man. And see how pitifully he died.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Insignificant...?

CHOICE.Morgan: That would mean you are that man's insignificant little friend, dear sir.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Then I guess that makes Maya my insignificant little assistant, huh? )

CHOICE.Morgan: ...Oh, my... I think I may know of this person from somewhere...

CHOICE.Phoenix: It's Mia. You know, Maya's older sister?

CHOICE.Morgan: ...! Aah! Yes, that is who she is...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( ...How could you forget a daughter of the Master...!? )

CHOICE.Morgan: If memory serves, she became a lawyer. Oh, how splendid for her, don't you think?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( That soft, kind smile... It's the kind that tells you a pair of devil horns are not too far away... )

CHOICE.Morgan: Come to think of it, I don't believe I have seen my child today. Would you happen to know where she is, good sir?

CHOICE.Phoenix: N-No, I wouldn't.

CHOICE.Morgan: Honestly! Take one day off from training, and it is neigh impossible to make it up. Good sir! I pray you are not teaching her strange, fiendish things in her time off!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Oh boy. Here comes her anger. ...And we were having such a civil conversation too... )

CHOICE.Morgan: Being born as one of the Fey family, but of weak spiritual power... It makes the people of this village look down upon you, you know?

CHOICE.Phoenix: I-I didn't know that...

CHOICE.Morgan: But I will be alright. ...As long as I have Pearl. I am satisfied because I have my Pearl.

CHOICE.Phoenix: What do you think about this?

CHOICE.Morgan: I am terribly sorry, but I am afraid my spiritual powers are not as strong as you might think... I really am terribly sorry.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Um, but this has nothing to do with your spiritual power... )

text.Phoenix: ( Looks like there's no one here... And even though the weather is gorgeous today, it's raining inside my heart... )

CHOICE.Phoenix: That's the "Side Room". Looks like guests can use it as a place to take a break when they feel tired.
It's a really old urn. There are the ashes of a person long dead inside. It looks like something with a long history... Other than that, it's not very interesting, so time to move on.

text.Phoenix: ( The bedding is all laid out today too. Guess I'll leave them alone for now... )

CHOICE.Phoenix: It's still charming to see a real sliding door like this in person. From here, I can see the Winding Way and the little garden in the courtyard.
...Excuse me... ... ( Who am I talking to? There's no one here. )

Hmm, I keep wondering about this box. I'm sure this wasn't here before the murder took place. It looks like a box for storing clothes... But it's pretty big for just clothes... It's mostly empty, but a few folded pieces of channeling costumes sit at the bottom.

text.ACTION: After presenting Black Key in Kurain Village:

text.Phoenix: ( Hey, there's someone by the incinerator... Ooh, looks like they've noticed me. And are now running at top speed towards me... )

text.Mimi: Oh, hey! * huff, huff * Like, * huff, huff * You're that dentist guy.

text.Phoenix: Actually, it's Phoenix Wright, attorney at law. Nice to see you again.

text.Mimi: Ooh, like, real suave. So, it's, like, my turn. It's nice to see you, too.

text.Phoenix: So, what's up? You're all out of breath...

text.Mimi: L-Like, huh? Oh! Like you mean... Like, I'm just totally happy and like, totally excited to be here.

text.Phoenix: Excited?

text.Mimi: Like, I mean, there are so many things to, like, see! It's, like, the real deal here!

text.Phoenix: Oh, really? For example...?

text.Mimi: For example... Like, that urn over there. Do you, like, know about it?

text.Phoenix: ( All I see is an old, cracked piece of pottery... )

CHOICE.Phoenix: That's right... Pearls said she found this key inside the incinerator. I guess I should take a look inside for myself... ... Th-This... This is from Maya's costume...! There's blood on it... A tiny bit, but still...
So, this piece of cloth was burned in this incinerator. And this key was also found in there. Hmm, I get the feeling this incinerator plays a crucial part in this murder...

So there's a spirit in this urn, huh? Hmm, all I see are a bunch of cracks. But I guess maybe the spirit could live in the space between the cracks... Hmm, looks like something's written on it... " I AM "? Huh? Weird...

So there's a spirit in this urn, huh? Hmm, all I see are a bunch of cracks. But I guess maybe the spirit could live in the space between the cracks... Hmm, looks like something's written on it... " I AM "? Huh? Weird...
Is there some sort of legend connected with that urn?

CHOICE.Mimi: Like, yeah! It's, like, this village's treasure!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Huh. Didn't know that.

CHOICE.Mimi: And, like, it's sealed inside that urn.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...Um... "It's"...? What are you talking about?

CHOICE.Mimi: Like, you know! Ami Fey's spirit!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ami... Fey...? Who's that?

CHOICE.Mimi: Like, jeez, Mr. Smith. Get with the program! Everyone knows the lady that founded the Kurain Channeling Technique was Mystic Ami.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Um, you don't have to get upset with me...

CHOICE.Mimi: So, like, as long as her spirit, like, lives in that urn, the spiritual power of the Fey family'll stick around. Like, isn't that totally romantic?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Umm... Romantic, huh...? ( If that urn is really as important as she says, it could be a vital clue... )
Ini, I want to ask you about the murder...

CHOICE.Mimi: Murder...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Dr. Grey's... Remember...? ( As if there's another one? )

CHOICE.Mimi: Oh, that one! Like, you shoulda said so in the first place! So, like, I totally don't know anything 'cause I was, like, sleeping in the Side Room.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Well, that's not much help... Did you notice anything at all?

CHOICE.Mimi: Like, come on. What a total bore. I, like, totally have nothing to do with this, like, murder thing...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Oh, yeah. You only introduced Dr. Grey to Kurain Village. No relation, sure. Even if you were only "acquaintances", that still means you knew him. Furthermore, your sister, who died in that accident, was a nurse at his clinic... )
Alright then. Why don't you tell me about your sister's fatal accident.

CHOICE.Mimi: ... Like, why? You think, like, it's got something to, like, do with the murder?

CHOICE.Phoenix: I don't know yet, but I'm trying to chase down every lead I can...
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [I don't know yet, but I'm trying to chase down every lead I have...] in the original release)

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( ...Psy... Psyche-Locks!? )
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [...A... A Psyche-Lock!] in the original release)

CHOICE.Mimi: Like, what is it?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Looks like I'm going to need something to pry her mouth open on this one... )
Um, about the accident, Ini...

CHOICE.Mimi: Like, you're totally not gonna give up, are you?

CHOICE.Phoenix: No, I'm not.

CHOICE.Mimi: I totally want to forget about my sister, you know? Time to move on and all that.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Guess I have no choice but to remove those locks... )

CHOICE.Mimi: Wow, so, like, the Kurain technique is the real deal. I'm gonna, like, have to write about it in, like, my report for school. Hey, so, like, you'll give me this picture for, like, the report, right?

CHOICE.Phoenix: No way!

CHOICE.Mimi: She's, like, in a lot of trouble, huh?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( She's stealing quick glances at the picture while smiling like a cheshire cat... )

CHOICE.Mimi: But, like, this will totally prove the power of channeling.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( ..."This"? What "this" is she talking about...? )

CHOICE.Mimi: Like, that's totally Mystic Maya's cousin, right?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yes. Her name is Pearl.

CHOICE.Mimi: Hmm? So, like, this little kid is, like, the next Master...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Oh, no, no, no. Maya is the next in line to be Master.

CHOICE.Mimi: Ah, oh yeah. Like, that's right.

text.ACTION: After clearing all Talk options in Fey Manor - Channeling Chamber, and presenting Black Key in Kurain Village, then examining incinerator in Fey Manor - Winding Way:

text.Maya: Hey, Nick... I've been waiting...

text.Phoenix: ( ...She looks so helpless... )

text.Maya: So? So? How was it!? What did you find out!?

text.Phoenix: Um... Well... I found a few things...

text.Maya: Is it so bad that you can't even look me in the eye?
text._info: (Changed from [My eyes are tearing up, Nick. Don't make me cry...] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: I... I just need a little more time. It'll all come together by tomorrow, I promise.

text.Maya: I'm sorry, Nick. Every time I see you, all I do is cause trouble...

CHOICE.Phoenix: So how was it? Today's trial, I mean...

CHOICE.Maya: You were fantastic, Nick! Every time I thought our goose was cooked, you managed to turn it all around. I bet it would make a great Hollywood movie!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Don't be silly. We have to concentrate on the trial. We're going to win this, Maya!

CHOICE.Maya: ...Thanks a lot. Really. Hey, Nick? The person who shot Dr. Grey wasn't me, was it?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Of course not. You're completely innocent.

CHOICE.Maya: If that were true, then I'd be really happy, but... there wasn't anyone else in that room with the two of us, right?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Well, did you check behind the folding screen?

CHOICE.Maya: Um... I took a quick glance, but there wasn't anyone there.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Hmm... ( That's exactly what Lotta said too... )

CHOICE.Maya: Um, Nick...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah?

CHOICE.Maya: Why do you believe in me? Why do you think I didn't kill Dr. Grey?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...Because of something Mia told me.

CHOICE.Maya: My sis? What did she tell you?

CHOICE.Phoenix: She said that spirit mediums can't have dreams. When you're channeling, it's impossible for you to dream because your soul leaves you.

CHOICE.Maya: Now that you mention it... Wait, then... then... I really am...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: You are not the real murderer. I think that... maybe before you even called the spirit, you were drugged.

CHOICE.Maya: Drugged...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: I think this was planned from the very beginning. And you were set up to take the blame for killing Dr. Grey.

CHOICE.Maya: That's... That's...

CHOICE.Phoenix: I want to ask you something about Pearls.

CHOICE.Maya: Pearly? What about her?

CHOICE.Phoenix: No matter what I try, she won't answer me. I want to know what she was doing at the time of the murder.

CHOICE.Maya: Huh!? W-Wait! Nick! Y-You don't think she did it, do you!?
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [Hmm...] in the original release)

CHOICE.Phoenix: No, no, nothing like that...

CHOICE.Maya: She'd never do anything like that! You hear me!? Never! She's a great kid, and really cute... And really great... And cute.

CHOICE.Phoenix: I didn't really think she was the murderer. But... she's definitely hiding something.

CHOICE.Maya: Hmm...

CHOICE.Phoenix: You were with her on that day, right?

CHOICE.Maya: Yeah. The two of us. We were playing with her ball.

CHOICE.Phoenix: A ball, huh? ( Sounds like a dead-end to me... )
So, about this ball...

CHOICE.Maya: It's nothing really special... Just a plain old ball. I think she was still playing with it when I started the channeling job that day. Pearly really loves to play with that ball.

CHOICE.Phoenix: She "loves to play with that ball", huh...?

CHOICE.Maya: When she wants to get it, she always climbs right into the clothing box .

CHOICE.Phoenix: The clothing box?

CHOICE.Maya: Yeah. Pearly's always hiding in there. You know the Side Room? There's a clothing box in there. It's really big, so once you see it, I'm sure you'll know what I'm talking about.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( The clothing box in the Side Room, huh? )

CHOICE.Maya: It's the same as the last time I saw it. You just like to show it off, don't you, Nick? Are you that thrilled to be a lawyer?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Th-That's not what I meant by it, but... I mean, I don't really think about it. I just sort of shove it in people's faces... Force of habit, I guess.

CHOICE.Maya: That hole... It looks an awful lot like a bullet hole...

CHOICE.Phoenix: That's probably what it is.

CHOICE.Maya: That's TERRIBLE! How could this happen to such an important screen!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ... Um, instead of dwelling on the hole, let's focus on the fact that you weren't shot...

CHOICE.Maya: ... Hey, you're right! So I was the one who was about to get shot, huh? Th-That's TERRIBLE! Who'd want to shoot little ol' me!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I guess she didn't realize she was the one being shot at until now... )

CHOICE.Maya: Ah! That's... The Channeling Chamber's...

CHOICE.Phoenix: This is the only one in the world, right?

CHOICE.Maya: Yeah. During the trial, I was kinda wondering why you had it...

CHOICE.Phoenix: I got it from Pearls.

CHOICE.Maya: That's weird... I swear I locked the door... and then put the key into one of my pouchy sleeves...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Your sleeve? But how and when would your sleeve leave the room? It didn't grow a pair of legs...

CHOICE.Maya: I wonder where Pearly found that key...
That's a knife from my family's kitchen. I'll never be able to use it again...

CHOICE.Phoenix: It's alright. I'll buy you a new one, OK?

CHOICE.Maya: Argh! That's not the point! ...I don't ever want to see another knife... ever again...
That... That's... That's mine, isn't it?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Dammit! I upset her again... )

CHOICE.Maya: It really was me, wasn't it? Wasn't it, Nick?
This... This is me, right? I guess I really did shoot Dr. Grey...

CHOICE.Phoenix: But that's not you!

CHOICE.Maya: Is too!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Is not!

CHOICE.Maya: Is too, is too!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I should've kept this picture to myself... )

CHOICE.Maya: That's Kurain's Sacred Urn. Mystic Ami's soul is sealed inside of it.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah, I know all about it. About how she's the founder of the Kurain Technique.

CHOICE.Maya: Ooh, look at Mr. Smarty here! Thinks he knows all! You sound like an occult fanatic.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( ...Trust me, this isn't going on my resume any time soon... )

CHOICE.Maya: You know, I haven't looked at this in a long time. I wonder when it became so cracked?
...What is it?

CHOICE.Phoenix: I'm not too sure myself, but I found it just now inside the furnace.

CHOICE.Maya: Huh? Is it trash burning day already?

CHOICE.Phoenix: That's not something I would know about... ( I guess she didn't notice the bloodstain. Probably better that way... )

CHOICE.Maya: What am I supposed to do, sis!? ...
Pearly... She definitely has more than me...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Huh? What are you talking about?

CHOICE.Maya: Who I think the next Master should be... I mean, she's got more spiritual power than me, and she really works hard at her training...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Way to go Phoenix... Way to bring the mood down even further... * sigh * )

CHOICE.Maya: So she's Prosecutor von Karma's daughter, huh?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Looks like it.

CHOICE.Maya: Well, then... she'd know about that person, right?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( "That person"...? Is she talking about "him"? ) It's alright. We don't need to talk about that right now...

CHOICE.Maya: ...Mystic Ami. She's a Legendary Spirit Medium. I like the way that word sounds... "Legendary"... Ever since I was young, I've dreamed of being a "Legend".

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Well, this murder will make you into a "legend", alright... Hmm... I probably shouldn't say that last thought out loud... )

CHOICE.Maya: Um, I can't think of anything special about it...

text.ACTION: After clearing "Ball" Talk option in Detention Center - Visitor's Room:

text.Phoenix: Ah!

text.Lotta: AAAAAAAAH!

text.Phoenix: H-Hey! Wait! Please! Lotta! ... ( She ran off into the manor... )
Lotta...

text.Lotta: Aaack!

text.Phoenix: H-Hey!
Hey! Morgan!

text.Morgan: Yes, what is it? ...And must you be so noisy!? We have a rule here: "The hallway is not for running" Now then, in a calm manner ask your question.

text.Phoenix: Okay... Anyway, did you see Lotta come by here?

text.Morgan: Ah, that girl from the "Heartland"... I'm sorry, but she did not pass by here at any time.

text.Phoenix: ( Grr... Lotta! You sure know how to waste a man's time... )
I'm pretty sure I saw Lotta run in this direction... but it doesn't look like she's here...

CHOICE.Phoenix: It's Pearl's ball. Maya said that it's always kept in the clothing box ... So then, what is it doing on the floor...?
It's the clothing box where Pearl's ball is usually kept. I wonder what's inside...
Whaaaa!? Wh-Wh-What were you doing in there!? What were you thinking!?

CHOICE.Lotta: I'm a bad person! Just another piece of human trash. I needed a hole to crawl into...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ... ( So you crawled into this clothing box because there wasn't a hole to crawl into? Oh man... ...Huh? ) There's a small hole in this clothing box... And it's about... 8 inches off the ground! That's the same height as the hole in the folding screen ! Then, could this...?
It's the clothing box where Pearls keeps her ball. I thought I felt my soul shake when Lotta jumped out at me. So it's big enough to fit a grown adult... Well, if she can be called an adult...

text.Pearl: Oh, Mr. Nick! That person ran by here just now.

text.Phoenix: What person?

text.Pearl: Um, you know... The person with the fluffy cotton candy hair...

text.Phoenix: ( Ah, she means Lotta. )

text.Pearl: She said, "Don't look at me with 'em eyes!" but... I'm not that scary, am I...?

text.Phoenix: ...I don't think that's quite what she meant.

text.Pearl: Oh, that's right. She also wanted me to tell you, "Goin' on a trip to find myself, so don't ya bother findin' me!"

text.Phoenix: O-Oh... Well, thanks.

text.Pearl: You're welcome.

CHOICE.Pearl: Around when Mystic Maya started the channeling on that day, I was playing in the Winding Way... with my ball.

CHOICE.Phoenix: And that's when you... broke the urn?

CHOICE.Pearl: Y-Yes... I broke it... I... I accidentally let Mystic Ami's spirit fly away!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Don't worry. Morgan will never know, OK?

CHOICE.Pearl: I'm a bad child... Breaking a village treasure is unforgivable. I thought... that maybe they would make me leave the village. But the broken pieces were pretty big, so...

CHOICE.Phoenix: You thought you could put them back together, and no one would notice?

CHOICE.Pearl: ...Yes.
I found some glue and brought it to the hallway... and fixed the urn there.

CHOICE.Phoenix: The hallway? You mean "Winding Way"?

CHOICE.Pearl: Yes. The channeling had already started, so I didn't think anyone would walk by.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Hmm, I see... So, about how long did it take you? It must have been a nasty repair job.

CHOICE.Pearl: Yes. I might be strong at spiritual things, but when it comes to arts and crafts, I am not nearly as skilled. When I had finished fixing the urn and looked up, I saw you coming into the manor...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( So that's around when Lotta and I were coming back inside after reporting the murder. )

CHOICE.Pearl: When I saw that, I packed everything up in a hurry. Um... Mr. Nick?

CHOICE.Phoenix: What is it, Pearls?

CHOICE.Pearl: I'm... I'm going to get banished, aren't I?

CHOICE.Phoenix: I really don't think that's going to happen. I mean, I bet Mystic Ami's happy to be free from that cramped urn.

CHOICE.Pearl: Y-Yeah, I hope so...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( No harm done, and a happy resolution... Phew! )

CHOICE.Pearl: I found some glue and brought it to the hallway... and fixed the urn there.

CHOICE.Phoenix: The hallway? You mean "Winding Way"?

CHOICE.Pearl: Yes. The channeling had already started, so I didn't think anyone would walk by.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Hmm, I see... So, about how long did it take you? It must have been a nasty repair job.

CHOICE.Pearl: Yes. I might be strong at spiritual things, but when it comes to arts and crafts, I am not nearly as skilled. When I had finished fixing the urn and looked up, I saw you coming into the manor...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( So that's around when Lotta and I were coming back inside after reporting the murder. )

CHOICE.Pearl: When I saw that, I packed everything up in a hurry. Um... Mr. Nick?

CHOICE.Phoenix: What is it, Pearls?

CHOICE.Pearl: I'm... I'm going to get banished, aren't I?

CHOICE.Phoenix: I really don't think that's going to happen. I mean, I bet Mystic Ami's happy to be free from that cramped urn.

CHOICE.Pearl: Y-Yeah, I hope so...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( No harm done, and a happy resolution... Phew! )
Pearl. You have to tell me what you were doing when the murder happened, OK?

CHOICE.Pearl: Um... But what if I can't just tell you what happened...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Then I'll guess what happened. How does that sound?

CHOICE.Pearl: What!? Y-You can do that?
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [Eh!? Y-You can do that?] in the original release)

CHOICE.Phoenix: You'll tell me if I guess something right, won't you?
Now, when the murder was taking place, you were here, right?

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "You were here, weren't you Pearls -- in the Winding Way?"

CHOICE.Phoenix: I'm pretty smart, Pearls. I know you were right here.

CHOICE.Pearl: No, I wasn't...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Huh? I'm wrong?

CHOICE.Pearl: Ooh, I feel a little better.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Ooh, I feel a little warmer... from embarrassment. ...I'd better try again... )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads back to "Now, when the murder was taking place, you were here, right?"

CHOICE.Phoenix: You were here, weren't you Pearls -- in the Winding Way ?

CHOICE.Pearl: W-Wow! ...Y-You got it.

CHOICE.Phoenix: So? Do you think you can tell me now?

CHOICE.Pearl: ...I'm sorry... Not yet...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Man, oh man... Alright, what next...? OK, I think I know what you were doing there.

CHOICE.Pearl: D-Do you really know that much?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Well, I am a lawyer, you know. Now, what was it Pearls was doing in the Winding Way?

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "You were... playing with this ball, right?"

CHOICE.Phoenix: So?

CHOICE.Pearl: I feel just a little better.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Huh?

CHOICE.Pearl: You are a lawyer, but you're also still a person, after all...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Sorry, I'll get it right this time...

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads back to "OK, I think I know what you were doing there."

CHOICE.Phoenix: You were... playing with this ball, right?

CHOICE.Pearl: Ah! That's right! How... How did you know...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Maya told me that you love to play with your ball.

CHOICE.Pearl: Um... Yeah. I was playing with my ball.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Un, huh. And then?
Something happened, huh? ...Something really bad...

CHOICE.Pearl: * gulp! * Wh-What do you mean, "something"!? N-N-Nothing happened...!

CHOICE.Phoenix: This is it. While you were playing with your ball, this happened!

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "This urn... It's a village treasure, right?"

CHOICE.Phoenix: Were you so surprised that you were shocked into silence?

CHOICE.Pearl: ...Yes, at how wrong you are, even though you were so sure of yourself...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...Huh? ( Way to embarrass yourself in front of an 8 year old, Wright... ) Ah, sorry, sorry. Just see if you were paying attention... Ah heh heh.

CHOICE.Pearl: It's okay Mr. Nick. You can always try again.

CHOICE.Phoenix: This urn... It's a village treasure, right?

CHOICE.Pearl: Ah... Um...

CHOICE.Phoenix: And the spirit of the founder of the Kurain technique is sealed in here, isn't it?
What's this? It's cracked all over, isn't it? There's even a few gaps here and there...

CHOICE.Pearl: Um... Please don't tease me...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Pearl, you broke the Sacred Urn, didn't you?
The ball smacked into it and knocked it over, right? And if Morgan found out, she'd get really mad, huh?
( She doesn't seem to be fighting back... I think I hit the bull's-eye this time. But it's strange that the lock hasn't broken yet... )

CHOICE.Pearl: I-It's... It's a really old urn, isn't it?

CHOICE.Phoenix: I-I guess?
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [Eh?] in the original release)

CHOICE.Pearl: I-I-It's so old... So it's not that weird... to have a few cracks...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Her voice is shaking... )

CHOICE.Pearl: H-How can you tell that urn has been broken!?

CHOICE.ACTION: USER SELECTS Present Ami Fey profile
Leads to "Who started the Kurain Channeling Technique?"

CHOICE.Pearl: ...I'm sorry. I don't want to be mean, but...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( * sigh * I figured... )

CHOICE.Pearl: Um, do you want to try again?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah. ( I'm sure I can get it if I think about it some more! The thing I'm missing... must have something to do with what's written on the urn... )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads back to "H-How can you tell that urn has been broken!?"

CHOICE.Phoenix: Who started the Kurain Channeling Technique?

CHOICE.Pearl: Huh? Oh, um, it was Mystic Ami... ( Changed from [Um, it was Mystic Ami...] in the original release )
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [Eh?] in the original release)

CHOICE.Phoenix: That's right. And how do you spell her name? Do you know?

CHOICE.Pearl: How do I spell her name? Um... I don't know...

CHOICE.Phoenix: It's spelled " A-M-I ".

CHOICE.Pearl: * gasp! *

CHOICE.Phoenix: I thought it was a little odd when I saw " I AM " written on this urn.
And that's how I knew that someone must have broken this urn. And made a mistake in spelling when they put it back together again...

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "You were here, weren't you Pearls -- in the Winding Way?"

CHOICE.Phoenix: I'm pretty smart, Pearls. I know you were right here.

CHOICE.Pearl: No, I wasn't...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Huh? I'm wrong?

CHOICE.Pearl: Ooh, I feel a little better.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Ooh, I feel a little warmer... from embarrassment. ...I'd better try again... )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads back to "Now, when the murder was taking place, you were here, right?"
Leads to "You were... playing with this ball, right?"

CHOICE.Phoenix: So?

CHOICE.Pearl: I feel just a little better.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Huh?

CHOICE.Pearl: You are a lawyer, but you're also still a person, after all...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Sorry, I'll get it right this time...

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads back to "OK, I think I know what you were doing there."
Leads to "This urn... It's a village treasure, right?"

CHOICE.Phoenix: Were you so surprised that you were shocked into silence?

CHOICE.Pearl: ...Yes, at how wrong you are, even though you were so sure of yourself...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...Huh? ( Way to embarrass yourself in front of an 8 year old, Wright... ) Ah, sorry, sorry. Just see if you were paying attention... Ah heh heh.

CHOICE.Pearl: It's okay Mr. Nick. You can always try again.

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "Who started the Kurain Channeling Technique?"

CHOICE.Pearl: ...I'm sorry. I don't want to be mean, but...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( * sigh * I figured... )

CHOICE.Pearl: Um, do you want to try again?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah. ( I'm sure I can get it if I think about it some more! The thing I'm missing... must have something to do with what's written on the urn... )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads back to "H-How can you tell that urn has been broken!?"

text.ACTION: After examining the "Clothing box" in Fey Manor - Side Room and adding it to the Court Record:

text.Phoenix: M-Mia!

text.Mia: Phoenix, it's good to see you. I was really worried so I thought I'd see how you were doing.

text.Phoenix: ...You might get caught on film again...

text.Mia: There are certain risks you have to take in life, or in my case, death. Anyway, how are you doing? Have you found anything useful?

text.Phoenix: Um, only a little. I think I'm slowly beginning to understand everything, piece by piece.

text.Mia: Everything will resolve itself by tomorrow, somehow.

CHOICE.Mia: There's still a whole slew of questions for you to answer before the trial tomorrow.

CHOICE.Phoenix: You mean like how did the real murderer get into the room and kill Dr. Grey...?

CHOICE.Mia: Yes. Also, when did the murderer enter the Channeling Chamber...? You guys were all standing around in front of the room after the channeling started.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Which means that the murderer must have gone into that room before the channeling...

CHOICE.Mia: That's what I think, in any case.

CHOICE.Phoenix: But Maya's already said there wasn't anyone else in there.

CHOICE.Mia: ...That's true... But if we can't figure out the murderer's movements, we're stuck like a beached whale.
I thought I'd never see this day. Are you actually asking me about spirit channeling?

CHOICE.Phoenix: This case is all about spirit channeling. And I feel like I don't understand a thing about it...

CHOICE.Mia: Well, that's only natural... After all, spirit channeling isn't exactly an everyday thing, is it?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah, I guess you're right.

CHOICE.Mia: The power to change your physical appearance into the person you're calling was something our ancestor, Mystic Ami Fey acquired.

CHOICE.Phoenix: I've heard that name before...

CHOICE.Mia: The Fey family was originally a family known for its service to the gods. When Mystic Ami was born, she was given a certain fate through her name. Because, you see, she was named after one of the Buddhas of Buddhism, "Amit√°bha". To this day, her soul is still sealed in the Kurain Sacred Urn. It usually sits in the Winding Way, and has her name written on it.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Um, yeah...

CHOICE.Mia: Aww, come on, Phoenix. It's just a fairy-tale.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Are you saying that me being able to see you is just a fairy-tale too...? )

CHOICE.Mia: Come on, Phoenix. We don't have time to be looking at things like this. We need to find out everything we can for the trial tomorrow.

text.Mia: Well, it's about time I left.

text.Phoenix: M-Mia!

text.Mia: We'll be in big trouble if the guard sees me here... Phoenix...

text.Phoenix: Yes, Chief!

text.Mia: There is still a lot of dirt left in this case. Once you think you've gathered all the evidence, then come back.

text.Phoenix: ...Yes, Chief.

text.ACTION: After clearing "Sacred Urn" Talk option in Fey Manor - Meditation Room:

text.Phoenix: ( Phew. I think I've found everything I can. But I can't see how it all adds up... Hmm... )
text._info: (Changed from [But I can't see how they all add up... Hmm...] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: ( And is Ini Miney being here just a coincidence...? )
( How is it that the spirit Dr. Grey wanted to call just happened to be that nurse, and that nurse turns out to be Ini's sister... It's too... convenient... )
( I wish I knew a little more about Ini, but where am I going to find info like that? )
Aah! L-Lotta!

text.Lotta: Oh, so ya finally noticed!

text.Phoenix: ( I thought I heard a mosquito buzzing in my ear, although I couldn't understand a word... )

text.Lotta: Well, I gotta hand it to ya. Ya sure know how to chase down garbage! I mean, I'm grateful to ya for chasin' this large lump of one around like this.

text.Phoenix: Um... Thanks...?

text.Lotta: But ya know, you're just wastin' yer time. I'll be fine on my own.

text.Phoenix: Wh-What are you going on about? And as for "following" or "chasing" or whatever it is, isn't that what YOU'RE doing!?

text.Lotta: Um, well, ya see... Well, yer not exactly a real gentleman with a lady's heart, are ya?

text.Phoenix: ( You're not exactly the world's number one charmer either, sister. )

CHOICE.Lotta: Look, I'm really dang sorry about today! When I get all fired up about somethin', it's impossible to stop me.

CHOICE.Phoenix: You hurt Maya really badly, Lotta.

CHOICE.Lotta: Um... I don't suppose you could forgive a gal like me...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Well, I guess. You did help Maya out too, after all.

CHOICE.Lotta: For real?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah, for real.

CHOICE.Lotta: Ah, thank goodness... I'm still...

CHOICE.Phoenix: "I'm still..." what...?

CHOICE.Lotta: N-No, no, nothing, nothing at all. Just talkin' to myself, ya know, gibberish... ...Now then! Lotta Hart, at your service!
I'll share with ya all the dirt I've dug up!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Th-Thanks.

CHOICE.Lotta: Hey, don't be all surprised! Tell ya what, I'll even give ya all this info for free!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Lotta not taking money? Now I KNOW this one's an alien clone... )
I'm not done...

CHOICE.Lotta: Um...

CHOICE.Phoenix: And to think we trusted you, Lotta, and what do you do!? You stab us in the back! You stressed us all out and even gave Maya a few strands of white hair!

CHOICE.Lotta: Urngh...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Now I'm going to have to pray she makes it, or she may come back as a ghost...

CHOICE.Lotta: Ack! That's enough! Ya can stop right there! Look, I'll tell ya everything I know! Everything! I'll spill it all!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Everything?

CHOICE.Lotta: Yeah, ya got it! Everything! But... Well, actually... Tell ya what, I'll even do it for free!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( You were expecting me to pay you after what you did to us!? )
If Maya is not the real murderer, then... who do you think is, Lotta?

CHOICE.Lotta: Well heck, ain't it obvious? It's that occult freak!

CHOICE.Phoenix: You mean Ini Miney?

CHOICE.Lotta: Well, there ain't anyone else it could be, right? That granny, you and me, we were all together that whole time...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( So, Lotta suspects Ini... Which means she might have already found some info about our mysterious Ini... )
Speaking of Ini, do you have any other information about her?

CHOICE.Lotta: Sure.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Well, what is it!?

CHOICE.Lotta: Ha ha ha... It'll cost ya... And it'll cost a lot!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Oh, silly me. Here I thought "free" meant "no money necessary". )

CHOICE.Lotta: That girl was hospitalized about half a year ago.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Hospitalized...? But why?

CHOICE.Lotta: Well, heck, you can go find out on yer own.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Huh?

CHOICE.Lotta: Here, I'll give ya the clinic's address. Maybe ya can find out something.

CHOICE.Phoenix: "Maybe"...? What's that supposed to mean!?

CHOICE.Lotta: Well... See, actually, it was gonna be annoying, I reckoned, so I didn't actually go there.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Aargh...

CHOICE.Lotta: Well, that's the way the gumbo spoils, right?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Spoiled gumbo sounds... Eww... I mean, look, don't blame this on... Oh, never mind! ( Looks like I don't have much of a choice. Better go check out this " Hotti Clinic "... )
About this clipping...

CHOICE.Lotta: Now, you listen here, boy, and listen good. You can't go lookin' at such an old piece of paper, ya hear!? People's got eyes on the front side. You know why? So they can see in front of themselves! Not behind! So how about it? You feelin' my energy?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Nope, not an electron. )

CHOICE.Lotta: Ya think I could have the guts to carry one of these around? A celebrity photographer with a gun? Ya think it'd work? "Bang, bang!!" ...Nah... Thanks, but nah. I can't see myself like that.
Aaaaah! Th-There's... There's blood on it!! Get that away from me! Where do you get off showin' somethin' like this to me!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Oops, guess that was the wrong thing to show her... )

CHOICE.Lotta: I'm a real natural, aren't I? I caught the murder just right, and even managed to make it mysterious.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Mysterious!? All you managed to do was forget to focus your lens!

CHOICE.Lotta: Shaddup! That's my technique! My technique, now, ya hear!?
Hey, it's that Dr. Grey guy. It's a pity what happened to him. Pretty scary what ghouls and ghosts can do to a man, huh? Gawd rest his poor soul.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Hmm... Since when was Lotta so religious...? )

CHOICE.Lotta: Now, this kid -- I think she needs to be taught some manners. This here's her second time in the stew, right? My Pa woulda slapped me straight!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Y-Yeah...

CHOICE.Lotta: Ya know what they say, if there's a second time, there's bound to be a third, and a fo- OW! Nngh... Ya didn't have to slap me. I get it, I get it. Sorry...
Hmm... I overlooked this little kid.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Wh-What do you mean?

CHOICE.Lotta: I mean, I didn't think it, but ya know how it's always 'em silent types?

CHOICE.Phoenix: H-Huh!? Wait, wait, wait...

CHOICE.Lotta: The little tyke's nothin' but a ball of happy goodness, right? So I reckon, she's the type to have done it! Well, now, that's just how the world turns.

CHOICE.Phoenix: I don't think this has anything to do with how the world turns...

CHOICE.Lotta: That old lady sure can be forceful. She scared me that day. ...Well, only a little, now, ya hear?
Heh, that's Ini Miney, right?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah. I was wondering if you know anything about this girl...

CHOICE.Lotta: Ya know! Actually, I did a little checkin' up on her the other day. Her sister, she's the one that Dr. Grey wanted to call back from the spirit world.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah, I had heard as much... I had also heard that Ini was the one to introduce Dr. Grey to Kurain Village.

CHOICE.Lotta: Ya don't say? That's one sneaky gal, if you ask me... Hey, ya want me to tell ya more about her?
Ya know, I'm beginnin' to get sick of this hairstyle. Next time I go to the salon, I'm gonna get my hair straightened, I reckon. What do ya think, Phoenix?

CHOICE.Phoenix: I think if you got rid of your afro, I wouldn't recognize who you were.

CHOICE.Lotta: Yeah, that's kinda the problem, ain't it?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Please, can we get on with the important stuff...? Say, like the murderer... )

CHOICE.Lotta: Hey, this is that prosecutor gal. The one that likes breakin' all the rules. Switches are for horses and lights, not people! How's that? I made a pretty clever pun, didn't I?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...Sorry, didn't hear you.

CHOICE.Lotta: Ah, well, I'll forgive the wax in yer ears this once and tell it to ya one more time.

text.ACTION: After clearing "Ini Miney" Talk option in Kurain Village:

text.Phoenix: ( ...So, this is where Ini was hospitalized... )

text.???: Hmm, yes... Are you here to visit a patient? Hmm...

text.Phoenix: Ah, yes... Are you a doctor here...?

text.???: Hmm, yes... I'm Director Hotti... Hoh, hoh.

text.Phoenix: ( Ack! I didn't think I'd be speaking with the Director himself... )

text.Hotti: Hmm, yes...? So what can I help you with? Uh, huh...

text.Phoenix: I'd like to ask you a few questions about Ms. Ini Miney.

text.Hotti: Hmm? Ms. Miney? Ms. Ini Miney? ...Hmm... Yes... Hmm... OH! Her! Ah, it's too bad. I'll tell you something. That girl left here a long time ago.

text.Nurse: You know you shouldn't be up and about! Come on, it's back to your room with you!

text.Hotti: Ah, Sweet'ums! Calm down, calm down. Don't be so harsh to an old man like me.

text.Nurse: Don't you dare start that "Sweet'ums" thing with me! If you don't behave, you'll get yourself tossed out of this hospital!

text.Phoenix: ( Wow. I didn't think nurses could be this direct or forceful towards their boss. )

text.Nurse: Come now. Be a good boy and give me the Director's white lab coat!

text.Hotti: OK, OK. I got it. I. Got. It. Hmm, yes...

text.Phoenix: Um...
Don't "Hmm, yes" me. Who in the world are you?
( The nurse went off somewhere... Oh the inhumanity. Only person I can talk to... ...is this guy... ...Uuuugh... )

CHOICE.Phoenix: This must be the waiting area. It's got the feeling of one and there are sofas lined up... but I don't see all that many patients.

CHOICE.Hotti: Hmm, yes... Well, it's the quality, not quantity that counts. Uh huh...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( What in the world did that have to do with anything...? )
( I wonder where that door way down there leads to...? )

CHOICE.Hotti: Oh, that's the X-ray room. Hmm, yes...

CHOICE.Phoenix: H-H-How did you know what I was thinking!?

CHOICE.Hotti: Hmm, yes... Well, it's... Because that's the X-ray room... Uh huh, yes...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( There is something very peculiar about this guy... Because I know it's not me... )
This patient is undergoing rehabilitation.

CHOICE.Hotti: And look at that strained face twisting in all those ways... and that oily sweat... hmm... His whole body is swaying back and forth, wobble-wobble, like he's about to fall. Hmm, yes.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Hey! Don't just cut into my monologue like that! I'm explaining things here!

CHOICE.Hotti: Ah, sorry. Hmm, yes... Most sorry... Yes... Uh, huh...

CHOICE.Phoenix: This is the clinic's reception desk, but it doesn't look like there's anyone at the counter. On the wall is this month's "Word to the Wise: Do something in vain, and your only reward is tiredness." Hmm, not exactly the best thing to be telling your patients, is it?
So, what exactly do you treat at this clinic...?

CHOICE.Hotti: Hmm, yes... We treat all sorts of... doctory, clinical stuff, uh, huh, yes...

CHOICE.Phoenix: D-Doctory, clinical stuff?

CHOICE.Hotti: Well, I don't actually know or particularly care about the details. Hoh, hoh.

Hmm, hmm... Yes... What is that look for? A-Ah, yes. There's a really big general hospital around the corner. Hmm, yes... When they can't accommodate everyone, they move some of their patients here. Uh, huh.

CHOICE.Phoenix: You do surgeries here, right?

CHOICE.Hotti: Hmm, yes... We do some plastic surgery here, it seems... Hmm...

CHOICE.Phoenix: It... seems?

CHOICE.Hotti: Hmm, yes... Uh, huh... It seems that way.

CHOICE.Phoenix: What do you know about Ms. Ini Miney?

CHOICE.Hotti: Now you're talking! Hmm, yes. That girl, she was transferred from the general hospital.

CHOICE.Phoenix: From the general hospital...? To here? What kind of surgery did she need?

CHOICE.Hotti: Hmm, yes... Well, she needed surgery. It was really bad. Really bad.

CHOICE.Phoenix: So what kind was it...?

CHOICE.Hotti: Hmm, yes... Well... No, no... You see, that is something... No, I can't tell you.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( So you say with a happy smile on your face... "Mr. Director"... )

CHOICE.Hotti: See, there's this thing about how doctors aren't allowed to talk about patient stuff. It's in all those TV shows too, right? You've seen them, right? Hmm, yes?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I'm never going to get him to unzip those broken zipper teeth of his at this rate... There's got to be something I can show to this old coot... )

CHOICE.Mia: Maya's life is on the line! Concentrate harder!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Mia's especially strict today... )

CHOICE.Mia: So? Have you gathered your thoughts?

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads back to "Alright, then. Tell me who you think I'm protecting."

CHOICE.Phoenix: Morgan Fey, of course. There is no one else you would protect like this, Mia...

CHOICE.Mia: Well done, but... While the murder was being committed, my aunt was outside with everyone else. Which means she already has an alibi.

CHOICE.Phoenix: That's true...

CHOICE.Mia: Show me some evidence that would cast suspicion onto my aunt.

CHOICE.Phoenix: My evidence is this black key.
At the beginning of the channeling, Maya had possession of this key. And yet, somehow, it magically ended up in the incinerator in the center garden.

CHOICE.Mia: ...You're right.

CHOICE.Phoenix: There is only one person who could have done that while I was busy calling the police. The person taking care of Maya -- Morgan.

CHOICE.Mia: Someone could have found the key somewhere and dumped it into the incinerator.

CHOICE.Phoenix: But that's...

CHOICE.Mia: That prosecutor would use something this small to shred your case. Do you have something other than just the key to cast suspicion on Morgan?

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "This is the other piece of evidence that points to Morgan as the culprit."

CHOICE.Phoenix: H-However?

CHOICE.Mia: Like I said in the beginning, my aunt has an alibi.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah... She was with us the whole time...

CHOICE.Phoenix: How she did it, huh...?

CHOICE.Mia: I want to hear your thoughts. In order for my aunt to murder Dr. Grey, who or what did she need...?

CHOICE.ACTION: USER SELECTS Present Ini Miney profile

CHOICE.Phoenix: ... ( No idea... Just throwing things out now... )

CHOICE.Mia: ...And you were so close too, Phoenix.

CHOICE.Mia: There is no way my aunt could have done it herself . So, thinking logically, where does that leave you? Should be easy for you to figure out...

text.Mia: ...Something's been bothering me all this time. This crime is something no normal person could carry out. The person would have to know a lot about Fey Manor and the village itself to do this.

text.Phoenix: ...But Morgan already has an alibi...

text.Mia: Yes, which is why I can't figure out how it was done. We can assume that Ini Miney is involved somehow...

text.Phoenix: But we have one big problem on our hands.

text.Mia: ...A problem? With what?

text.Phoenix: We don't have a motive . Why would Morgan want to kill Dr. Grey? Why would she have to? Also, we don't really know for sure that she was cooperating with Ini.
( Mia doesn't have a clue either, huh? )

text.Mia: Hmm... Then, there is only one possibility...

text.Phoenix: Huh!?

text.Mia: Think about it, Phoenix. Why would my aunt do something like this? And why would she do it in such an underhanded fashion?

text.Phoenix: Um... because...?

text.Mia: Mother... She is the one who holds the key to this.

text.Phoenix: Mother? Whose? Mine?

text.Mia: Don't be silly. Mine, of course! Misty Fey.

text.Phoenix: ( Mia and Maya's mother? Why would she bring her up now...? )

text.Mia: Now then... Looks like we've gathered everything we could. All we have to do is win tomorrow! Everything will become apparent then.

text.Phoenix: R-Right, Chief! We won't lose!

text.ACTION: June 22, 9:51 AM District Court Defendant Lobby No. 3

text.Maya: Um... Nick...

text.Phoenix: Yeah?

text.Maya: Did you know that Von Karma's daughter is only 18... Just like me...?

text.Phoenix: Um, yeah. ...Why?

text.Maya: I was just thinking about how strong she is... I mean, she's been in Germany all this time all by herself, and she's so grown up!

text.Phoenix: ...Yeah, and I'm sure she felt a lot of pressure from her father's reputation.

text.Maya: ...And then you look at me, and, well... I'm the daughter of the Master, but I'm still just a little girl. And on top of that, I'm the suspect in a murder trial.

text.Phoenix: ( Um... But I think you're really strong too, Maya, for all you've gone through... )

text.Pearl: Good morning! The two of you look like you're doing well today. I'm happy for you!

text.Maya: Hey! Morning, Pearly!

text.Pearl: You'll be safe today, Mystic Maya!

text.Maya: Huh? What do you mean?

text.Pearl: My mother is coming today to show her support!

text.Maya: Y-Yeah... Yeah! That's right, Pearly!

text.Phoenix: Hey, Pearls...

text.Pearl: ...? Yes, Mr. Nick?

text.Phoenix: Um, do you think you could do me a big favor? Could you channel Mia today too?

text.Pearl: Huh? ...I was sort of hoping to sit in the audience today and watch...

text.Phoenix: ...Please. It's very important to me. I don't feel confident enough without her help...

text.Pearl: Mr. Nick! That's enough! You can't show weakness in front of the person you love!

text.Maya: P-Pearly! N-Not this again...

text.Phoenix: Please, can you do this for us, Pearls?

text.Pearl: Um... Alright. I'll do it. I'll do it for Mystic Maya's sake. See you later, then! I'll leave you two to your alone time!

text.Phoenix: ...Phew, thank goodness.

text.Maya: Nick?

text.Phoenix: This way, Pearls won't be able to see today's trial...

text.Maya: ...Wh-What do you mean...? What's going on...?

text.ACTION: June 22, 10:00 AM District Court Courtroom No. 2

text.Judge: Court is now in session for the trial of Maya Fey.

text.Phoenix: The defense is ready, Your Honor.

text.Franziska: Let's start already. Mr. Phoenix Wright. I look forward to tonight's news with great joy. The image of your defeated face will be transmitted all over the world!

text.Mia: All over the world, huh? Sounds like you've made quite a name for yourself, Phoenix.

text.Franziska: Don't be foolish, you foolish fool wearing the foolishly foolish clothes. The famous one is me! I'm the prodigy who has never lost a case since becoming a prosecutor five years ago. Naturally, the world's eyes are on me, as I conduct my first trial in this country!

text.Mia: Uh, huh... That's nice, Ms. von Karma.

text.Franziska: Hmph. Glad to see you're in such good "spirits" today, Ms. Fey.

text.Phoenix: ( Uhh... It's true what they say... Women really are scary when they fight... * gulp * )

text.Judge: Now then. A very interesting theory was presented during yesterday's session.

text.Franziska: That the defendant could have left the Channeling Chamber, correct?

text.Judge: Yes. And this key is proof of that. This key, the only key to the Channeling Chamber, was not where it should have been.

text.Franziska: Your Honor, I would like to say one thing before we begin.

text.Judge: A-Alright... Let's hear it.

text.Franziska: The prosecution has determined that from the time of the murder to the time of arrest, the defendant did indeed leave the room at one point.

text.Phoenix: Wh-What!?

text.Judge: But... Ms. von Karma! Then... How do you explain this picture? Are you saying then, that the person in this picture is not the defendant...?

text.Franziska: I never said that wasn't the defendant.

text.Judge: Th-Then what is the meaning of this...?

text.Franziska: All I am saying is that Maya Fey, after killing the victim , exited the room. And I believe that is when she dropped this key.

text.Judge: Can you substantiate your claim?

text.Franziska: Isn't that what I'm here for? The prosecution would like to call the defendant's aunt, Morgan Fey, to the stand.

text.Mia: ...Just as I suspected. Aunt Morgan...

text.Phoenix: ( Poor Mia... She seems really torn by this... )

text.Franziska: Witness. Name and occupation.

text.Morgan: My name is Morgan Fey, and I am a spirit medium, in a manner of speaking...

text.Judge: I'm sorry, but what do you mean, "in a manner of speaking"...? Aaah!

text.Franziska: I don't think anyone really cares. Now then, after the murder took place, you kept watch over the defendant, correct?

text.Morgan: Yes, that is correct. I performed the Spirit Severing Technique on Mystic Maya then.

text.Judge: S-Spirit Severing Technique?

text.Morgan: A technique to remove a spirit from a body and send it back to the other world. That is...

text.Judge: Yes...? That is...? Mmfph!

text.Franziska: You. Be quiet. Now, witness. Something happened while you were performing this technique, correct?

text.Morgan: ...Yes, that is correct.

text.Phoenix: Wh-What in the world could've...!?

text.Morgan: Mystic Maya... She escaped from the room...

text.Judge: Wh-What!?

text.Franziska: And here we come to the heart of the matter. Maya Fey, while in a possessed state, managed to escape from the Channeling Chamber!

text.Judge: Order! Order! Order! Ms. Fey! Please testify to this court what happened during that time!

text.Morgan: Your Honor, I will try my best...

text.Mia: I think someone just upped the ante on this trial...

text.Morgan:
After we heard the gunshots, those two broke the door open and entered the Chamber. 
I requested that Mr. Wright and the other lady please contact the police. 
A pistol was hanging from Mystic Maya's hand and she was in a daze... 
Then, quite suddenly, she thrusted me away from herself and escaped from the room. 
With great strength, she hit the base of my neck and I fainted for a short while... 
I'm afraid I have no knowledge of where she went after that.

text.Phoenix: Why have you hidden this until now!?

text.Morgan: I... I did not wish to cause more trouble for Mystic Maya. However... I must correct falsities when they arise.

text.Franziska: That's right. She is simply correcting a falsity, Mr. Phoenix Wright.

text.Phoenix: ( Why is she making it a point to take a stab at me... Never mind. )

text.Judge: Mr. Wright, your cross-examination, please.

text.Mia: My aunt is a very smart and sly person. It's going to be hard for us to find a crack in her testimony...

text.Morgan: After we heard the gunshots, those two broke the door open and entered the Chamber.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
Just now, you said, "those two." Who were the two people you were referring to?

CHOICE.Morgan: I was referring to that foreign lady and yourself, good sir.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Um, Lotta's not a foreigner... despite how she talks...

CHOICE.Morgan: Oh, is that so? I'm sorry... I simply could not understand her atrocious English, not to mention she looked awful!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I can already see people in the heartland gearing up for a riot... )

CHOICE.Morgan: In any case, I have already sent the repair bill to your office, Mr. Wright.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Oh, uh, thanks.

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm... What did you do after that, Ms. Fey?

text.Morgan: I requested that Mr. Wright and the other lady please contact the police.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
Was it really necessary to have two people do something so simple as call the police? If there was a possibility of escape, then one of us should have stayed behind!

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm, yes. That is a very good point.

CHOICE.Morgan: At that time, I, myself, was a little confused. On top of which, there was another...

CHOICE.Judge: Another what, madam?

CHOICE.Morgan: Oh, it's nothing. No need to concern yourself.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I want to hear the end of that sentence... )
There was another reason you wanted both of us out of that room, wasn't there!?
You must testify! Why did you chase us out of the room!?

CHOICE.Morgan: ...I simply did not wish for there to be more victims.
"The lives of both the good sir and that camera woman may be in danger..." is what I thought to myself.

CHOICE.Judge: Well, that was very noble of you, Ms. Fey.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( This is bad... Now people have a good impression of her and a bad one of us... )

CHOICE.Mia: Looks like she caught us napping. That's my aunt for you...

CHOICE.Judge: Are you satisfied now, Mr. Wright? Ms. Fey, please continue.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( The last bit of her sentence sounds like a red herring... If that's the case, I'm not going to fall into her trap today. )

CHOICE.Judge: If the defense has no further questions, let us press on.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( The last bit of her sentence sounds like a red herring... If that's the case, I'm not going to fall into her trap today. )

text.Morgan: A pistol was hanging from Mystic Maya's hand and she was in a daze...

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
During our investigation, you stated that you struck the defendant on the head, and this strike caused Maya to lose conciousness. Do you stand by this statement?

CHOICE.Morgan: I'm afraid I don't. The statement I gave you was a lie...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...! B-But why would you lie about something like that!?

CHOICE.Morgan: It is very painful for me to say this, however...

CHOICE.Franziska: Objection!
The witness was lying to cover for the defendant .

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( She was... covering for Maya...? )
So, you were "covering for the defendant"!?

CHOICE.Morgan: Well, yes... It was only later that I was informed of what had occurred. That the renegade Mystic Maya had done something very unexpected...

CHOICE.Judge: S-Something unexpected!? What, pray tell, did sh-- Oogh!

CHOICE.Franziska: This witness didn't and couldn't have seen what happened. If you want to know what this unexpected thing was, there is always later.

CHOICE.Judge: Y-Yes, very well...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Ugh... Why does it suddenly feel like there's a rock in the pit of my stomach...? )

CHOICE.Franziska: Now, witness, continue with what happened.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I'm sure Von Karma's allowing this testimony because it's advantageous to her... ...Which means I shouldn't press Morgan any further... )

CHOICE.Franziska: You're finally beginning to understand, aren't you, Mr. Phoenix Wright... Now, witness, continue with what happened.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I'm sure Von Karma's allowing this testimony because it's advantageous to her... ...Which means I shouldn't press Morgan any further... )

text.Morgan: Then, quite suddenly, she thrusted me away from herself and escaped from the room.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
Was it really that easy for her to escape from you?

CHOICE.Morgan: I'm ashamed to admit to such a thing, however, yes...

CHOICE.Phoenix: But you are physically larger and stronger than the defendant. There is no way she could have escaped from you so easily...

CHOICE.Franziska: Objection!
Have you forgotten already, Mr. Phoenix Wright? What about this picture!? Remember that at the time, the defendant was not physically "Maya Fey".

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...Ack!

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm... Growing old is such a mysterious thing. Trust me, I know first-hand.

CHOICE.Morgan: Basically, Mystic Maya's body was still that of the nurse she had called.

CHOICE.Phoenix: But if she had run away, wouldn't you have given chase right away!?

CHOICE.Morgan: Well, yes, I would have... however...

text.Morgan: With great strength, she hit the base of my neck and I fainted for a short while...

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
You fainted...?

CHOICE.Morgan: I became dizzy, and then collapsed onto the floor.

CHOICE.Judge: How long were you unconscious?

CHOICE.Morgan: I... I'm not sure. About ten minutes, perhaps.

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm... And the defendant almost certainly went somewhere in that time...

CHOICE.Franziska: Happy? Witness, elaborate on that point for us.

text.Morgan: I'm afraid I have no knowledge of where she went after that.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
Is that because you were unconscious?

CHOICE.Morgan: Why, yes...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Great, well, now what...? )
So while you were unconscious, you have absolutely no idea where the defendant went?

CHOICE.Morgan: I would think that's obvious, good sir.

CHOICE.Phoenix: If that's true... then how can you know for sure that the defendant left the Channeling Chamber at all!?

CHOICE.Judge: Now that you mention it... I have to wonder myself!

CHOICE.Franziska: It's true that this witness is not able to confirm this. But the key word here is "this" witness.

CHOICE.Phoenix: What do you mean by that!?

CHOICE.Mia: It means she has another witness up her sleeve. That's what. It looks like Ms. von Karma is ready to move on to her next witness.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( If she fainted, then there's no way she can testify any more than she has... If I press her, I'm not going to get anything useful anyway... )

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm... Well, then... Let's continue on with the testimony, shall we?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( If she fainted, then there's no way she can testify any more than she has... If I press her, I'm not going to get anything useful anyway... )

text.Mia: I can't see a crack in her testimony...

text.Phoenix: Wh-What should we do...?

text.Mia: For now, we should try and get more information out of her. After we get more information from her we may be able to use it later to our advantage.

text.ACTION: After pressing second, third, fourth, and sixth statements:

text.Judge: That's enough! From what I can tell, there is nothing wrong with this witness's testimony. And from what she has said, we can establish that Maya Fey did leave the Chamber.

text.Phoenix: ( Hmm... I hope this isn't going to come back and bite us in the butt... )

text.Franziska: Now, let's take the next logical step and ask, "Where did the defendant go after leaving the Channeling Chamber?"

text.Judge: Yes, yes... That is exactly what we should b-- Eeek!

text.Franziska: Be quiet, you! Now then, what the escapee had done was she had gone to speak with a certain person!

text.Phoenix: She... She went to speak with someone!?

text.Judge: Wh-Who was it!?

text.Franziska: The prosecution calls Ms. Ini Miney, who was sleeping in the Side Room at the time.

text.Phoenix: I-Ini Miney...?

text.Mia: I think you can see where this is headed...

text.Franziska: Witness. Name and occupation.

text.Mimi: Um... OK, so my name is, like, Ini Miney. I'm, like, researching, like, parapsychology stuff at the, um, university.

text.Judge: What is this "parapsychology"?

text.Mimi: Um... Let's see... It's, like, I guess, most people call it "occult stuff".

text.Judge: Even if that's what most people call it, I can't say I understand what that means...

text.Franziska: Then I suggest you go home and research it yourself.

text.Judge: Yes, sir.

text.Franziska: Now then, Ms. Miney, after the murder took place, you spoke with the defendant, Maya Fey. Is this correct?

text.Mimi: Um... Well... Hmm... Like, I guess...

text.Franziska: If that's the case, then let's hear your testimony. That IS alright, isn't it, Your Honor?

text.Judge: Yes, sir.

text.Phoenix: ( For the love of all things good, Your Honor, have some spine... For my sake... )

text.Mimi:
Like, when the channeling started, I was, like, sleeping in the Side Room. 
Like, a little later, someone came into the room, like, really suddenly. 
It was, like, oh my gawd, totally my sister! 
I, like, hadn't seen her in like, so long... I was so happy in, like, a sad way... 
My sister... She, like, told me something, like, totally terrible.

text.Judge: Now hold your horses, young lady! You're saying the person that entered was your sister !? Don't you mean the defendant, Maya Fey ...?

text.Franziska: Really, now... Your Honor. Maya Fey was still in the middle of channeling at that time.

text.Judge: A-Are you saying that the spirit was the spirit of this witness's sister !?

text.Franziska: Yes, Mimi Miney. She was a nurse at Dr. Grey's clinic.

text.Judge: Oh... W-Well... This is...

text.Franziska: Witness.

text.Mimi: Like, yeah?

text.Franziska: In your testimony, you mentioned a " terrible " thing. Why don't you tell the court what this terrible thing was? I'm sure we'd love to hear about it.

text.Mimi: ...Um, like... Do I totally, like, really have to?

text.Franziska: Of course.

text.Judge: Ms. Miney... please.

text.Mimi: ... My sister... Like, this is what she said to me.

text.Judge: She " took her revenge ?" Are you sure that's what she said?

text.Mimi: Y-Yes...

text.Franziska: There, are you satisfied, Your Honor?

text.Judge: ...I still can't believe it. I can't believe that a spirit would go so far as to use a medium to get revenge...

text.Franziska: It is a bit hard to swallow, however, all the evidence and testimonies point to this as the truth! ...The end.

text.Judge: ...What do you think, Mr. Wright? It certainly seems like all the loose ends are accounted for...

text.Phoenix: ( This... This testimony just now... Was it all made up? Was it just one huge lie...? )

text.Mia: Of course it was, Phoenix.

text.Phoenix: ...Mia! What do you mean?

text.Mia: It's well constructed... but that's all it is. But even the most well-spun lies can be undone. We can do it, Phoenix. Let's find that one loose thread and unwind this tapestry of lies.

text.Phoenix: Your Honor! There is room for doubt, so the defense will cross-examine this witness. We believe that our cross-examination will reveal the real truth behind this murder!

text.Franziska: Yet again the foolish fool spouts out more foolishly foolish drabble... I wonder if you'll make this one more entertaining than the last...

text.Mimi: Like, when the channeling started, I was, like, sleeping in the Side Room.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
Was that because of your, um... sesame allergy, was it?

CHOICE.Mimi: Like, that's right. I, like, think there were sesame seeds, like, in the lunch they served that day. I had this, like, premonition that it was going to totally be a "seedy" day.

CHOICE.Franziska: Yes, indeed.

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm... I see...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( ...Am I the only one who missed the boat here...? )

CHOICE.Judge: Anyway, so you were taking a nap. Did something happen while you were sleeping?

text.Maya: Why are you doing this!? Why are you trying to take revenge on Nick!? Nick had nothing to do with what happened to your dad.

text.Franziska: Don't you have something better to be worrying about? Say, your own situation?

text.Maya: Ugnn... ...Looking down on me, even though we're the same age...

text.Phoenix: Are you done yet? You've caused me enough pain and suffering.

text.Franziska: Not yet. My goal is to defeat you, and let the whole world know of your defeat.

text.Phoenix: ...But even if you do that, it won't bring your father back...

text.Franziska: ... Hmph. ...Whatever. In the meantime, let's bring this match to its conclusion. And then we'll know who the real winner is.

text.ACTION: June 22, 12:10 PM District Court Courtroom No. 2

text.Judge: Court will now reconvene. Mr. Wright.

text.Phoenix: Yes, Your Honor?

text.Judge: Can you prove Ms. Ini Miney had a motive?

text.Phoenix: Yes, I believe I can. ( Ini Miney and Dr. Grey have only one point of connection. And that is the car accident one year ago. The motive I'm looking for must be there... ) Ms. Miney. Please testify to this court about your car accident last year.

text.Mimi: Huh? I thought, like, you wanted to, like, ask about my, like, motive. I, like, don't see the point in, like, bringing up the past.

text.Judge: Ms. Miney, if you please.

text.Mimi: ...OK, OK. Like, I totally don't think it'll do any good, but...

That was... like, last year, in May. 
Like, something really bad had happened at, like, my sister's clinic around then... 
And like, the night of the accident, my sis was totally tired while she was driving. 
I was, like, totally pooped too, so I, like, fell asleep in the passenger's seat... 
I, like, woke up 'cause of a jolt, and, like, it was a sea of flames around me. 
I, like, opened the door and, like, got away.

text.Judge: Hmm... I think I've heard of this incident.

text.Phoenix: It was all the talk on the tabloid shows, day after day, last year.

text.Judge: Yes, and there was talk about Dr. Grey... drugging your sister...? Gwuugh!

text.Franziska: Those were merely "rumors". ...Totally baseless gossip.

text.Judge: Hmm, yes... Mr. Wright, you may question the witness.

text.Mia: Right now, it's impossible to prove that Dr. Grey did in fact drug Ms. Miney's sister.

text.Phoenix: Yeah... Which means I'll have to work this from another angle.

text.Mimi: That was... like, last year, in May.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
Didn't some sort of medical malpractice happen at your sister's hospital then...?

CHOICE.Mimi: Yeah, like, that was in May too. Like, the thing with all the patients dying was, like, May 2nd, and like, our accident was, like, on the 24th.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Two accidents back to back... Do you assume it's just a coincidence?

CHOICE.Mimi: My sis was, like, totally tired, so that's why, duh.

text.Mimi: Like, something really bad had happened at, like, my sister's clinic around then...

CHOICE.Franziska: Objection!
That incident has nothing to do with our murder here. Besides, the police report has already documented that it was entirely Mimi Miney's fault.

So then, why didn't you ask to switch places?

CHOICE.Judge: True, true.

Like, around that time, I was, like, really close to getting my license. 
My sis was, like, this totally big fan of cars and, like, really valued them. 
She, like, had just gotten this really shiny, bright red sports car. 
She, like, would say things like, "No way am I letting a newb drive my car!" 
So, like, that's why I ended up in the passenger's seat that night too.

text.Franziska: Th-Then, the body they found at the crash site...

text.Phoenix: That was the body of the real Ini Miney. Isn't that right... Ms. Mimi Miney!?

( That car accident one year ago... The one who died that night was Ini Miney . Her sister, Mimi, then stole her face... And was reborn as Ini. With this, she effectively erased "Mimi Miney" from existence! )

text.Mia: Your Honor. I'm sure you can now see why Mimi had to kill Dr. Grey.

text.Judge: Wh-What do you mean? Aaah!

text.Franziska: What is the meaning of this nonsense!?

text.Phoenix: Dr. Grey wanted to call back the spirit of a dead person. Specifically, the spirit of his nurse that died in the crash, Mimi Miney . However, that would not have been possible! Because "Mimi Miney" was still, in fact, alive ! And that fact would have been discovered had the channeling been conducted. So this witness had to stop that from happening... ...at all costs!

text.Franziska: And... And... And that's why she had to kill Dr. Turner Grey? Is that what you're saying!?

text.Phoenix: Yes. Before the channeling, Dr. Grey had the misfortune of consulting this witness about communicating with the dead. And in that moment, his fate was sealed!

text.Judge: W-W... Well, Ms. Ini...? I mean, Ms. von Karma... Eek!

That quack doctor... He got what he deserved in the end. And I was so close to finally ditching "Mimi" too. So close...

text.Judge: But... But why!? Why would you go so far to throw away your self...? To become your own sister!?

text.Phoenix: ( I think I understand why... Mimi Miney wanted her self to disappear because of this... )
