CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "I suppose I will let you all in on my thinking regarding this matter..."
USER SELECTS This is all a dream, right?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Right now, I can't believe any of this! I'm not even sure if this day hasn't been some kind of Kafkaesque dream... OWWW!!

CHOICE.Franziska: Now do you think it's still a dream!? Huh, Mr. Phoenix Wright!?

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "I suppose I will let you all in on my thinking regarding this matter..."

text.Judge: I suppose I will let you all in on my thinking regarding this matter... "The criminal disappeared into the sky." I'd love to believe that... But I just can't wrap my head around how that could actually happen.

text.Franziska: You imbecile!

text.Judge: If you disregard a need for proof, Ms. von Karma's case is sound. However... I've got the feeling that this case is in dire need of more investigation.

Thus I will conclude today's proceedings at this point! It's an undisputed fact that the criminal left no footprints at the scene. Tomorrow, I want us to find out the reason behind this mystery of mysteries.

text.Phoenix: Umm, uhh...

text.Franziska: Grrr...

text.Judge: I believe that's enough for today. Court is adjourned!
text._info: (Changed from [I believe that's enough for today. Court is now in recess!] in the original release)

text.ACTION: December 29, 2:33 PM District Court Defendant Lobby No. 5

text.Max: Hey! Sweeties! What in the world is going on!?

text.Phoenix: That's what I want to know!

text.Maya: They say the criminal flew off into the air and disappeared!

text.Phoenix: Max, I can't believe I'm asking this, but you didn't fly that night, did you?

text.Max: I know you didn't mean to ask me such a fabulously stupid question! I can't fly whenever I please. It's not that easy!!

text.Maya: But it looks so effortless for you on stage...

text.Max: It's not that simple!! I'm not actually flying on stage! I use invisible wires and have them hoist me through the air!

text.Maya: Wow... You just told me the secret to your magic!!

text.Max: NO!! I broke the first rule... The cardinal rule... The ONLY RULE!

text.Phoenix: I'm sorry, Max. We made you break a magician's creed to never reveal the secret to their tricks.
text._info: (Changed from [I'm sorry you had to break a magician's creed to keep the magic tricks secret...] in the original release)

text.Maya: Nick! What do we do now!?

text.Phoenix: All we can do now is hope we find the flying criminal in court tomorrow.

text.Maya: Great idea! Let's do our best and catch this sucker!

text.ACTION: December 29, 3:03 PM Wright & Co. Law Offices

text.Maya: Umm... Nick?

text.Phoenix: What is it?

text.Maya: I've got a confession to make... I'm terrible at figuring out magic tricks...

text.Phoenix: Magic tricks?

text.Maya: Yep. Magic tricks are by their very definition tricks, right? But I can never figure out the tricks when I see them.
text._info: (Changed from [But I can never figure out the tricks when I see them. I'm just not good at it...] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: That's because the tricks are performed by pros. They do it so you can't guess the trick.

text.Maya: But but... The trick Pearly showed me was incredible!

text.Phoenix: Pearls did a magic trick? Hmm... What kind of trick was it?

text.Maya: Let's see. It looked like she pulled the end of her own thumb off!

text.Phoenix: Heh...

text.Maya: First she put her right thumb next to her left hand, and then it just separated! She could move it up and down and everything! It was incredible!

text.Phoenix: Really? Was it kinda like this...?

text.Maya: WHAT!? WOW! HOW'D YOU DO THAT!? Nick, you're like a real magician! See this is why I just can't figure out magic... I'm no good at it... Especially hard tricks like flying away from the scene of a murder...

text.Phoenix: You'll take all the fun out of magic if you keep trying to figure it out.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Difficult-looking legal books stand in a formidable row. They mock me.

CHOICE.Maya: Hey! I'm reading that one! You know I'm studying the law now, right!? I put that bookmark on the page I was reading... Don't you dare move it!

CHOICE.Phoenix: What!? You're reading!? THESE!? A bookmark, huh... Hmm... You mean this thing? It was only on the second page.

CHOICE.Maya: Well, you have to start somewhere right?

CHOICE.Phoenix: You do realize that you have 1000 pages to go right?

CHOICE.Maya: ... Maybe you really should sell all these books, Nick.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Charley. A quite decorative plant.

CHOICE.Maya: Nick, you've been watering the plant everyday, right? I've been thinking about watering it too.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Maya, we don't want to drown poor Charley.

CHOICE.Maya: But he'd get bigger!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Does she want the office to look like a tropical rain forest or something? )
My desk. Since I don't have time to sit, it's unusually clean...

CHOICE.Maya: Umm... It's covered with dust. Maybe you should use your desk every now and again.

CHOICE.Phoenix: A poster of the newest member of the "Steel Samurai" universe.

CHOICE.Maya: You know about the new "Steel Samurai" movie they are making, don't you Nick?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah, I heard that they're making a movie starring the new cast.

CHOICE.Maya: It's already out! Critics say, "Time to commit 'hara-kiri' if you miss this action epic!"

CHOICE.Phoenix: You don't say...

CHOICE.Maya: You know, I bet the star will win this year's Hero of Heroes Grand Prix!!

CHOICE.Phoenix: * yawn * Uh huh...
Alright already... I'll go see the movie!!

CHOICE.Maya: Yay! Let's hurry and wrap this case up so we can see it!

CHOICE.Phoenix: There is a giant building just outside the window. It's the Gatewater Hotel, a high-class, luxury hotel.

CHOICE.Maya: Lately they've been holding huge events at the Gatewater. It seems they've really become a top-class hotel. I wonder if that bellboy would remember us?

CHOICE.Phoenix: I don't see any way out of this. We're stuck between a rock and a hard place.

CHOICE.Maya: There's no way we can solve the mystery of a criminal flying by tomorrow... I was thinking... Do you really think the criminal flew through the air? The only one who thinks that is Moe, right? He says that he saw it.

CHOICE.Phoenix: That's true... Moe looked awfully serious when he said that.

CHOICE.Maya: Do you think he might be trying to frame Max?

CHOICE.Phoenix: If that was it, he would have simply said "I saw Max". That would have been enough. There's no reason why anyone would believe "he flew".

CHOICE.Maya: But... What if the criminal really did fly? There's only one person who could do that... Max.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( You're really not helping my confidence here, Maya... )

CHOICE.Maya: Everyone seems to hate Max. Ben, Trilo, Moe... They all have nothing nice to say.

CHOICE.Phoenix: That magician does seem rather full of himself, doesn't he? Especially when he says things like customers only go to the circus to see him.

CHOICE.Maya: He even hit Ben over the head with a bottle. But...

CHOICE.Phoenix: But what?

CHOICE.Maya: But that doesn't seem enough to frame another person for murder!!

CHOICE.Phoenix: And it was proven that neither Ben nor Moe lied on the stand.

CHOICE.Maya: Maybe Ben saw the Ringmaster wearing Max's costume, but Moe clearly said that he saw Max himself.
Oh yeah... The picture of the scene. I wonder what that wooden box is?

CHOICE.Phoenix: It was probably left at the scene.

CHOICE.Maya: I can't believe there was only a bottle of pepper in that thing. It must be related to the crime somehow... This is fun, isn't it Nick?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Not really... It may be fun to solve mysteries, but don't forget this is a murder case.

CHOICE.Maya: Awww... You're right. I should take things more seriously.
No matter how you look at it, this is definitely Max's silk hat.

CHOICE.Phoenix: There's even a feather stuck in it.

CHOICE.Maya: There's something wrong with this hat though.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Moe's testimony, right? "He left the scene wearing that dumb silk hat!" That's what he said, but the hat was found on the ground at the scene.

CHOICE.Maya: Hmm... This really is a mystery.
Whoa. Max used a broken bottle to crack Ben over the head?

CHOICE.Phoenix: No no no... It broke because Max cracked Ben over the head with it.

CHOICE.Maya: He must have really hit him hard then... I guess I should give it a try... For research purposes. Come here... I've got a nice bottle right here for you Nick...

CHOICE.Phoenix: YEOW!!

CHOICE.Maya: That's weird. It didn't break.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Of course it didn't!! You hit me with a plastic bottle!!

CHOICE.Maya: Can you believe this cost three months of pay? Three months!! Trilo doesn't skimp when it comes to Regina. He's really in love.

CHOICE.Phoenix: It looks like a real glass stone. Its brilliance is amazing.

CHOICE.Maya: I bet Money would love to get his hands on this again.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I'll have to give this back to Trilo sometime... )

CHOICE.Maya: Twenty pounds, huh? That's pretty heavy.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Especially since the only thing inside was a small bottle of pepper.

CHOICE.Maya: The more you think about it the more it starts to make your head hurt. But compared to tomorrow this will all be a happy memory.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Tomorrow!? Don't get ahead of yourself Maya... Let's concentrate on today.

CHOICE.Maya: You wanna know something Nick? I love to put pepper on my hamburgers. But I also like to put pepper on peanut butter and jelly sandwiches. Do you think I'm weird?
You don't seem to be in a very good mood today.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Of course I'm not... I have to find a criminal who has discovered the ability to fly .

CHOICE.Maya: Yeah. I guess that would put you in a bad mood.
If Moe says that he saw a flying criminal, that means it must have been...

CHOICE.Phoenix: What's the matter with you!? You know that people can't just up and fly!

CHOICE.Maya: But Max... He is a magician.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Without their bag of tricks, magicians are incapable of magic. Besides, what's the likelihood someone set up a flying device at the crime scene? Near zero.

CHOICE.Maya: What if they set something up so they could trick Moe?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Umm... Maybe. But I get the feeling that would have been pointless...
What about this?

CHOICE.Maya: Umm... Yeah... Sorry. I got nothing.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( She must have been trying to think up a joke or something. )

text.Max: Oh! My sweeties!! You mind hurrying up and getting me out of this place!?

text.Phoenix: We're doing our best, Max. Just hang in there.

text.Max: A little while ago, some people from a local TV station came by... And since I'm a famed magician, they said, "Let's make you your very own TV special!"
text._info: (Changed from [They said that, since I'm a famed magician, 'Let's make your very own TV special!'] in the original release)

text.Maya: Really? What kind of TV special?

text.Max: "Maximillion Galactica: The Great Prison Escape" It would be aired live.

text.Maya: Hey! That sounds like it would be an awesome special!

text.Max: But if I do the special before I'm acquitted, they'll never let me out of here for real.

text.Phoenix: Well, it would surely be an unnecessary addition to your troubles with the law.

text.Max: That's what I was thinking... But the production staff is already working on the show! If you don't get me out quick, I'll have no choice but to stage a real prison break.

text.Phoenix: You seem awfully calm about that possibility...

text.Max: I'd have no choice. It would be a contractual obligation... That's show business.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Umm. The night of the crime... You didn't happen to fly off into the sky, did you?

CHOICE.Max: Here is how everything went down, sweetie. At the time of the murder, I was sitting in the Ringmaster's room. Not to mention... Flying off into the sky is not just something I can do at will. I don't care what the stoogey clown says, it wasn't me.

CHOICE.Maya: Max! Max! Do you mind teaching me the trick behind flying?

CHOICE.Max: Hmm... You'll have to forgive me, sweetie. The difference between me and cheap imitation magicians is that I keep my mouth shut. I don't teach people tricks, but I will say this much. It's much harder than you think.

CHOICE.Maya: I was thinking about this in court today... I've got a favor to ask of you.

CHOICE.Max: Anything for you, sweetie.

CHOICE.Maya: Be friends with the other performers in the circus!

CHOICE.Max: FABULOUS! A great joke!! Why would I be friends with a bunch of hacks like them?
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [FABULOUS! A great joke!! Why would I be friends with a bunch of hacks like that?] in the original release)

CHOICE.Maya: But...!

CHOICE.Max: I've won on the world stage! I won the International Grand Prix !

CHOICE.Phoenix: International Grand Prix?

CHOICE.Max: Performers should always look to perform on the world stage! But the performers at this circus are completely and utterly devoid of ambition! That is something that I can simply not tolerate!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Ambition, huh...? )

CHOICE.Maya: Something about what Max just said rings true to my ears...

CHOICE.Max: Oh my! My sweeties want to hear all about the Grand Prix, don't they? To be honest though, I've told this story like 100 times already, so it's a bit boring.

CHOICE.Phoenix: We're sorry to make you tell it again.

CHOICE.Max: You must not have heard me... I am really sick of telling this story. But what can you do? I'm Maximillion Galactica. I suppose I can tell it again. ... Voila! Here, take a look at this! I just happen to have a picture from the Grand Prix with me. Just look at that fabulous stage!! That is the first stage that I ever flew on. I flew right over the audience! The crowd erupted into applause! At that time, I thought to myself that I could die right then and die a happy man. I'll never forget how I felt that night. The emotions... The acclaim...

CHOICE.Maya: Wow.

CHOICE.Max: * ahem * By the way... I think everyone who is a performer should get to experience that feeling. I just wish I could explain that to the other people in the circus!

CHOICE.Maya: That's incredible Max... I want a trophy too! Hey Nick! How about you buy me a trophy!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: That's not how you earn a trophy Maya!

CHOICE.Max: My sweeties, you can have this picture of my triumph... Just make sure you show it to all the other members of the circus. "Look and learn!" That's what you should tell them.
CHOICE._info: (Changed from ['Watch and learn!' That's what you should tell them.] in the original release)

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Learn how to get thrown in jail? )

CHOICE.Max: Oh my! My sweeties want to hear all about the Grand Prix, don't they? To be honest though, I've told this story like 100 times already, so it's a bit boring.

The crowd erupted into applause! At that time, I thought to myself that I could die right then and die a happy man. I'll never forget how I felt that night. The emotions... The acclaim...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Learn how to get thrown in jail? )

CHOICE.Max: This is definitely my silk hat. I don't suppose I'm allowed to wear it anymore am I?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Max, this one of your uppi... I mean, excellent symbols, right?

CHOICE.Max: That's right. Honestly though, I only like it because of the feather in the brim.

CHOICE.Maya: Max! How could you!? How could you hit poor Ben over the head with this!?

CHOICE.Max: I've been thinking about that lately... But he did call me a "no-good talentless hack of a fast food magician"...

CHOICE.Maya: You mean Trilo said that? Not Ben, right?

CHOICE.Max: There is no Trilo or Ben. There is only one Benjamin Woodman.

CHOICE.Maya: Hmm... I guess you're right.

CHOICE.Max: I'm normally fabulous, but in this picture, I'm the king of the world! I even got a fabulous trophy and a super fabulous bust.

CHOICE.Maya: That's really cool! I wouldn't mind seeing your trophy some day.

CHOICE.Max: If you want to see one of my awards, you should just go to the cafeteria.

CHOICE.Maya: The cafeteria? You mean the one inside the circus tent?

CHOICE.Max: Of course. The trophy isn't there, but the bust that I won is!

CHOICE.Maya: It's in the cafeteria? We were just there yesterday. Nick, did you see a bust anywhere inside the cafeteria?

text.ACTION: December 29 Berry Big Circus Circus Entrance

text.Maya: You hear that? It sounds like two people arguing...

text.Trilo: Alright, let's do it. Are you ready?

text.Ben: Y-Yes... A-Ah... Wait...

text.Trilo: Quit your whining! Let's just give this a shot already! Alright! Let's go!

text.Ben: Row-row-row-your-boat!

text.Trilo: Row-row-row-your-boat!
What are you doing!? Gently-down-the-stream! C'mon, you know that!!

text.Ben: I'm trying my best, but... Trilo, this just isn't going to work...

text.Trilo: Do you enjoy saying dumb things? You're going to have to be on your own someday! If you can't handle something as simple as this, what are you going to do then!?

text.Maya: Hello Ben. Hello to you too, Trilo.

text.Trilo: What are you doing here!? Can't you see we're on a secret crash training course!?

text.Maya: I'm sorry...

text.Phoenix: Secret crash training! Whoa.

text.Ben: Yes. Trilo wouldn't give up until I said we'd try out his idea for a new routine. So... We were trying to sing in a round for our new ventriloquism act.

text.Maya: In a round!? You can really do that!? That's incredible!

text.Trilo: See! See! Even they are surprised by the idea!! I told you!!

text.Ben: They're not the only ones!! You even surprised me with your idea!!

text.Trilo: Once we've got a grip on the basics, then it's just a matter of practice!

text.Ben: Y-Y-You t-t-think so?

text.Maya: Oh, I almost forgot! I wanted to give this back to you.

text.Trilo: Ahh! There it is!! Now that I've got this ring back, it's time to take one more shot at Regina!

CHOICE.Maya: The murder took place right over there..

CHOICE.Phoenix: You never really get used to the feeling of being where someone's life was taken.

CHOICE.Maya: I know... The Ringmaster seems like he was such a good man. It * so sad... For everyone.
CHOICE._info: ([sic])

CHOICE.Maya: Umm... I know that you already testified in court today...

CHOICE.Trilo: You want to talk about what we saw, right?

CHOICE.Maya: Yes.

CHOICE.Trilo: Well, at first we thought it was the old man... Just looking at his walk and how he acted. Right Ben?

CHOICE.Ben: Huh!? Oh, oh yeah. That's right.

CHOICE.Trilo: But then we said hello and didn't even get a reply. Not to mention he was draped in those gaudy symbols.

CHOICE.Maya: What would you have thought if he wasn't wearing those symbols?

CHOICE.Trilo: Hmm... What do you think Ben?

CHOICE.Ben: What!? Oh... Umm... I would have thought it was the Ringmaster.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Hmm... Something just isn't adding up here. I wonder who they really saw? )

CHOICE.Maya: I was hoping I could ask you about Regina...

CHOICE.Trilo: I'm completely serious about her! That's why I'm waiting for her even now!

CHOICE.Maya: Really? That's so sweet... But if you really wanted to see Regina, shouldn't you check out the tent?

CHOICE.Trilo: Hah! You haven't got a clue about things, do you sweetheart?

CHOICE.Maya: Eh?

CHOICE.Trilo: Waiting like this is part of being in love.

CHOICE.Maya: How so?

CHOICE.Trilo: If you had a clue, you would know that waiting is such sweet, wonderful torture. When your body aches for your partner's love... That's one of the best parts!!

CHOICE.Maya: Umm... Y-Yeah... I-I knew that...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Poor Maya... She's so red she looks like a vine ripe tomato! )

CHOICE.Maya: So how is this new routine working out?

CHOICE.Trilo: Will you two just take a chill pill already!? Our routines are secret!! We're going to take the ventriloquism world by storm! It'll be a real revolution!

CHOICE.Maya: That sounds incredible!

CHOICE.Trilo: But let me make one thing clear... We're not going to take on the world just because that stupid jerk said we should...

CHOICE.Trilo: Max Galactica. "Performers should aim for the world!" Who does he think he is!?

CHOICE.Maya: Trilo, you seem to really be fired up about all this!!

CHOICE.Trilo: He needs to realize that he isn't the only one who can conquer the world stage!

CHOICE.Maya: You're right! You're right!

CHOICE.Trilo: Mark my words... I, Trilo Quist, will win the Grand Prix!!

CHOICE.Maya: You're the man now, doll!

CHOICE.Trilo: "Row-row-row-your-boat!" will be the key to a glorious victory!!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Umm... Not to rain on your parade, but wouldn't a more mature song be best?

CHOICE.Trilo: Hey... You've got to start somewhere right?
Don't screw this up! You've gotta be a part of this too.

CHOICE.Maya: Would you mind taking a look at this?

CHOICE.Ben: Um... Umm... Uh... I-I-I-I... Umm... That... U-U-U-Uhh... I-I-I-I-It's...

text.ACTION: December 29 Berry Big Circus Big Top

text.Maya: Huh? Where's Regina?

text.Phoenix: I dunno... But if she's with that tiger, I don't want to find out!! Let's hurry up and get out of here!

text.Maya: Hehe... Nick. You're kinda a chicken, aren't you?

text.Phoenix: No no no no no... I'm just... Umm... Allergic to wild tigers!

text.Maya: Max and the Ringmaster had their talk in this room.

text.Phoenix: That could have been when the Ringmaster put on Max's costume and went outside.

text.Maya: Why'd he do that? Maybe it was cold or something?
They still haven't cleaned this place up yet. If Pearly got one look at the state of this place... She'd slap whoever was in charge across the face!!

text.Phoenix: ( Remind me to never invite her to my office. )

text.Gumshoe: Oh, it's you two.

text.Phoenix: You look like you just got hit by a truck. Shouldn't you get some rest?

text.Gumshoe: * sigh * I'm taking a rest right now, pal. I've been listening to some crazy clown's life story. Ms. von Karma told me to come down here and do this for her.
text._info: (Changed from [Nah... I'm taking a rest right now, pal.] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: Yeah, I figured as much...
text._info: (Changed from [Being bossed around by a woman... I know how you feel.] in the original release)

text.Gumshoe: Let me tell you something, pal. Listening to that old clown sucks all your energy. Every time he's done talkin' he looks at you like you should be doing something...

text.Phoenix: Umm... I think he's waiting for you to laugh at his jokes.

text.Gumshoe: I know that, pal. Do you have any idea how much your face hurts if you fake laughing that much?

text.Maya: Franziska really set you up bad this time, didn't she? If you ask me, she should be listening to Moe herself...

text.Gumshoe: No way, pal. You're not gonna get me to backbite a woman with a whip. No way.

text.Maya: Why are you defending her?

text.Gumshoe: Prosecutor von Karma's always got her eyes on us. And every time you definitely don't want her to show up... * poof * There she is!! Don't show up... Don't show up... Don't show up... Don't show up... Don't show up...

text.Phoenix: ( Looks like she's wound him pretty tight... )

text.Gumshoe: She's directly above us as we speak.

text.Maya: Huh? How's that possible?

text.Gumshoe: According to the clown, the criminal jumped from here and disappeared into the sky. If that's what happened, it means the killer passed right by this window , pal.

text.Maya: Oh, I see... Who lives in that room behind the window up there?

text.Gumshoe: The acrobat's got his room up on the third floor, it seems. Pretty soon, Ms. von Karma's gonna start her investigation up there. So don't get any ideas of going up to the acrobat's room, got it pal?

text.Maya: * shivers * F-Franziska von Karma...
text._info: (Changed from [*shivers* V-Von Karma...] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: ( Once she's done with her investigation, I think I'll go up there and check it out. )

text.ACTION: December 29 Lodging Hall 1st Floor Moe's Room

text.Phoenix: Moe's not here...

text.Maya: If he was here, you would have been able to tell even before you stepped into his room. I'm sure you would've heard him laughing away... "Aha! Aha! Aha! Aha! Aha!"

text.Phoenix: What do you think he is laughing at when he's all by himself?

text.Maya: I always thought he was just thinking up new jokes.

text.Phoenix: ( Hmm... He must really love his work... )

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Maybe you should start with spirit channeling... Just a thought... )

CHOICE.Maya: This is where Moe witnessed the crime.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Well this is where Moe witnessed some craziness... ( I mean, c'mon... A flying criminal... Jeez... If we had a normal judge, he'd never believe something like that... )

CHOICE.Maya: These carrots like like they are the pick of the crop, don't they?

CHOICE.Phoenix: I still don't get why he went with carrots...

CHOICE.Maya: Hmm... What do you think about this theory? A long time ago, the circus was down on its luck. Moe was so hungry that he had to steal the horses food to survive. But he got addicted to their orangey goodness... Ha ha ha ha ha.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I'd laugh, but I think Maya might not be too far from the truth. )

CHOICE.Maya: Tee hee... Clown equipment is so funny looking!

CHOICE.Phoenix: He's got a balancing ball, a unicycle... He's even got a trampoline!! ... But they're all broken.

CHOICE.Maya: Well, you've got to give them all a shot. Trying is the most important thing!!

text.Moe: Ah! Wright!! Welcome to the wonderful, the fabulous, the cafeteria!

text.Phoenix: ( Yikes... He's in an awfully good mood... )

text.Moe: Alright! You know what time it is!! Riddle time!! Why does everyone cry when they eat Mexican pizza?

text.Phoenix: Umm...

text.Moe: C'mon! You can answer this! It's easy!!

text.Phoenix: ...Because cafeteria Mexican pizza is possibly a weapon of bowel destruction?

text.Moe: * BUZZ * Wrong! Try again! OK! What do you think, girlie?

text.Maya: Umm... Ahh! I got it!!

text.Moe: OK!! What is your answer?

text.Maya: Because they are in the Caf√© Teary Eye!

text.Moe: Exactly!! It's an incredibly sad place, that caf√©. Aha! Aha! Aha! Aha! Aha! Aha! Aha! Aha! Aha! Aha! Aha!

text.Maya: I did it!!

text.Phoenix: ( What's going on? He's being too nice... )

CHOICE.Phoenix: The kitchen is over here.

CHOICE.Moe: Oh yeah! Oh yeah! I wrote a new joke about the kitchen... Let's see... How did that joke go... Umm...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Lemme guess... "What did the chef say to the chicken before dinner? Knife to meet ya!" It's gotta be something dumb like that... )

CHOICE.Moe: What did the chef say to the chicken before dinner? Knife to meet ya!

CHOICE.Maya: That's a great one Moe. I would have never thought of that.
"Keep Our Cafeteria Clean!"

CHOICE.Moe: Take a good look at that sign girlie.

CHOICE.Maya: Huh? It says... "Keep Our Cafeteria Clean!?"

CHOICE.Moe: I added a question mark on there... I'm thinking that might be why the cafeteria is so dirty.

CHOICE.Phoenix: There are dirty dishes all over the place... It must have been too hectic that night to clean up.

CHOICE.Maya: You know I can't stand a mess Nick! I think you and I should clean this place up for them!

CHOICE.Moe: Yay! You two are going to help us restore order to this cafeteria!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: What are you talking about? You're gonna help too!

CHOICE.Moe: Clowns can't clean!! We're here to throw pies, not clean them up! I'm a bust-a-gut boy, not a bus boy! Get it... It was two jokes in one! I'm fat and funny! Get it!? Aha! Aha! Aha!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yes. Moe. We got it.

CHOICE.Maya: Uhhh...

CHOICE.Phoenix: It looks like they've left it exactly as it was on the night of the murder.

CHOICE.Moe: I was in charge of the cooking that day. It was going to be a special menu.

CHOICE.Maya: Really? What were you going to cook?

CHOICE.Moe: Moe Moo Burgers.

CHOICE.Phoenix: What are those?

CHOICE.Moe: A beefy burger filled with laughs and a sauce that tastes like my jokes. They're outstanding.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( So those burgers leave just as bad of a taste in your mouth as his jokes then. )
The chair's been knocked over.

CHOICE.Maya: That's what it looks like.

CHOICE.Moe: Looking at all this brings back lots of memories.

CHOICE.Phoenix: What do you mean?

CHOICE.Moe: I proposed here... To a girl on horseback. Of course, I was much younger back then.

CHOICE.Maya: So what happened? What was her answer?

CHOICE.Moe: Well... Let's just say that my love was put out to pasture.

CHOICE.Maya: Today's been a really crazy day, hasn't it?

CHOICE.Moe: You're telling me! I didn't think it was going to be so tough.

CHOICE.Maya: Tough?

CHOICE.Moe: Yeah. It was a tough crowd. That's what you call a crowd that refuses to laugh. For instance, it was such a tough crowd last night I had to smash watermelons.

CHOICE.Maya: Hmm...

CHOICE.Moe: I told them all a great story and even greater jokes, but no one busted out laughing...

CHOICE.Maya: You even used the famed "No shoes, no shirt, no service" joke!

CHOICE.Moe: Exactly! How can you not laugh at stunning comedy like that!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Are you 100% sure about your testimony today?

CHOICE.Moe: I saw that I saw! I swear! That creep just...

CHOICE.Maya: Flew through the air?

CHOICE.Moe: It wasn't exactly flying per say... It was more like floating. The silhouette of his face made me positive it was Max!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I don't see a Psyche-Lock... He must be telling the truth. )

CHOICE.Moe: Max's bust should be on that small table over there.

CHOICE.Phoenix: There's nothing over there.

CHOICE.Moe: Really? ... Oh yeah. Hmm... When was it...? I'd say about five days ago, all of a sudden... The bust disappeared.

CHOICE.Maya: It disappeared?

CHOICE.Moe: If you want to see it, there's a photo on the bulletin board over there. Max just had to put the picture up.

CHOICE.Maya: Hmm... Hey! This thing is really cool! Nick! Nick! I want someone to make a bust of me!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Sure, as long as I'm not paying for it.

CHOICE.Maya: Aww...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Is there anything else that's changed about this place?

CHOICE.Moe: Nope. Nothing's changed that I can see...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I wonder if he's actually thinking about this, or if he is setting up a bad joke? )

CHOICE.Moe: Nope nope... I'm drawing a blank here.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( A quiet Moe is a good Moe in my book. )

CHOICE.Maya: I guess there really aren't any other things that have changed, huh?

CHOICE.Moe: Well... There is this one tinsy tiny thing that does seem different.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Tell us! Tell us!

CHOICE.Moe: Max's bust should be on that small table over there.

CHOICE.Phoenix: There's nothing over there.

CHOICE.Moe: Really? ... Oh yeah. Hmm... When was it...? I'd say about five days ago, all of a sudden... The bust disappeared.

CHOICE.Maya: It disappeared?

CHOICE.Moe: If you want to see it, there's a photo on the bulletin board over there. Max just had to put the picture up.

CHOICE.Maya: Hmm... Hey! This thing is really cool! Nick! Nick! I want someone to make a bust of me!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Sure, as long as I'm not paying for it.

CHOICE.Maya: Aww...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Is there anything else that's changed about this place?

CHOICE.Moe: Nope. Nothing's changed that I can see...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I wonder if he's actually thinking about this, or if he is setting up a bad joke? )

CHOICE.Moe: Nope nope... I'm drawing a blank here.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( A quiet Moe is a good Moe in my book. )

CHOICE.Maya: I guess there really aren't any other things that have changed, huh?

CHOICE.Moe: Well... There is this one tinsy tiny thing that does seem different.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Tell us! Tell us!

CHOICE.Moe: Well... On the morning of the crime, over on that bulletin board... This piece of paper was posted front and center.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Piece of paper?

CHOICE.Moe: It's torn, so I don't know what it said, but I could see its title.
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [It's torn, so I don't know what it said, but I could see it's [sic] title.] in the original release)

CHOICE.Maya: Yikes! It says, " To The Murderer!! "

CHOICE.Phoenix: M-M-M-Murderer!?

CHOICE.Moe: Yup, that's what it says. But the rest of it has been ripped off. And I don't know who posted it.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Umm... When did you find this?

CHOICE.Moe: The morning before the murder .

CHOICE.Maya: Before the murder!?

CHOICE.Moe: Yes. The Ringmaster was killed the night after this paper was discovered.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Who in the world posted this thing...? )

CHOICE.Maya: Nick! I think we'd better follow up on this important lead!
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [Nick! I think this is a very important clue!] in the original release)

CHOICE.Moe: Well... On the morning of the crime, over on that bulletin board... This piece of paper was posted front and center.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Piece of paper?

CHOICE.Moe: It's torn, so I don't know what it said, but I could see its title.
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [It's torn, so I don't know what it said, but I could see it's [sic] title.] in the original release)

CHOICE.Maya: Yikes! It says, " To The Murderer!! "

CHOICE.Phoenix: M-M-M-Murderer!?
Umm... When did you find this?

CHOICE.Moe: The morning before the murder .

CHOICE.Maya: Before the murder!?

CHOICE.Moe: Yes. The Ringmaster was killed the night after this paper was discovered.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Who in the world posted this thing...? )

CHOICE.Maya: Nick! I think we'd better follow up on this important lead!
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [Nick! I think this is a very important clue!] in the original release)

CHOICE.Moe: I can't stand Max and his attitude sometimes!

CHOICE.Maya: I know...

CHOICE.Moe: But lately...

CHOICE.Maya: Huh?

CHOICE.Moe: It's just... Lately I've started to understand what he is always going on about.

CHOICE.Maya: What is is then?

CHOICE.Moe: Well... Umm... I'm not sure if I can explain it all that well just yet...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Just when you think it's impossible, Moe flashes a glimpse of maturity... )

CHOICE.Moe: Ahh! Not this picture!! He showed it to you guys too?

CHOICE.Maya: Huh? You've seen it as well?

CHOICE.Moe: Well, you know what they say about Maximillion Galactica... He really gets around. Aha! Aha! Aha! Aha! Aha! Aha! Aha! Aha! Aha! Aha!

CHOICE.Maya: Hehe.

CHOICE.Moe: Oh yeah... He didn't just show me the picture!

CHOICE.Maya: What do you mean?

CHOICE.Moe: He showed me his bust too. Let me tell you, that thing is enormous! It's in the picture, I think. He'd make us worship it... Everyday. He made us bow to his greatness.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( He's got a... big... bust? I wouldn't mind hearing more about Max's bust... Not that I'm into that sorta thing... )

CHOICE.Moe: The morning of the murder, this was posted up on the bulletin board. That's when Max clonked Ben over the head. Sorry I hadn't remembered it until now. It was torn down before anyone really paid any attention to it.

CHOICE.Phoenix: So you don't know what was written on it, do you?

CHOICE.Moe: Unfortunately I don't. But I betcha they would know!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Who are "they"?

CHOICE.Moe: Max and Ben . They were at the cafeteria earlier than I was that morning.
Sorry, but I don't know anything about that.

CHOICE.Maya: I see...

CHOICE.Moe: After all, I'm just a clown.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I concede Moe's a clown, but I get the feeling he's not your average clown... )

CHOICE.Maya: Do you know anything about this note?

CHOICE.Phoenix: The morning of the murder, it was posted on the wall in the cafeteria...

CHOICE.Max: I do know all about that note. When I read it, my heart certainly skipped a beat.

CHOICE.Maya: Your heart skipped a beat?

CHOICE.Max: While I was enjoying my morning tea, the Ringmaster and company entered the room.

CHOICE.Phoenix: And company...?

CHOICE.Max: I guess it wasn't really a company... It was just the Ringmaster and my sweetie pie. When the Ringmaster read the note, he turned an incredible bright red. All of a sudden he tore it off the wall and shoved it into the pocket of his tailcoat !

CHOICE.Maya: Really!? Out of curiosity, what in the world was written on that thing?

CHOICE.Max: ... Let's see...

CHOICE.Maya: Uh-huh...

CHOICE.Max: Oh I don't want to steal the fun from my sweeties! Go and find out on your own! I'm sure you can find it somewhere. You might also want to ask my sweetie pie princess.

CHOICE.Maya: Hey, do you see that? There's a scrap of paper shoved into the pocket of the tailcoat.

CHOICE.Phoenix: You know... I've got a feeling I know what that is...

CHOICE.Maya: I bet that's the other half of the note that Moe gave us. Then let's hurry up and check this thing out, Nick! I knew it! It fits perfectly with the other piece.

CHOICE.Phoenix: What does it say? What does it say? "To The Murderer! I have conclusive evidence of what took place. Meet at 10:00 PM tonight at the lodging house plaza."

CHOICE.Maya: Tonight at 10:00 PM ?

CHOICE.Phoenix: That's when the murder took place!

CHOICE.Maya: Now we need to find out who called out the Ringmaster!!

CHOICE.Phoenix: The Ringmaster's tailcoat.

CHOICE.Maya: It's been expertly cleaned and pressed. It's got one perfect crease.

CHOICE.Phoenix: The Ringmaster must have liked things neat and tidy.

CHOICE.Maya: This is kinda pointless isn't it? There's no way this beats Moe's room. Now that's cool!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( All I can hear in my head right now is "Aha! Aha! Aha! Aha!" )

text.ACTION: After presenting Note in Detention Center - Visitor's Room, then examining tailcoat in Big Top - Ringmaster's Room:

text.Maya: Wha...? Moe's gone.

text.Phoenix: There's a message on the bulletin board. "I'm hungry so I'm off to get some hamburgers! Love, Moe."

text.Maya: Mmmm... Hammburrgeerrrr... Just thinking about it is making me hungry! All of a sudden I need a burger bad!!

text.Phoenix: ( All of a sudden, I need a new partner... BAD!! )

text.ACTION: After presenting Note in Detention Center - Visitor's Room, then examining tailcoat in Big Top - Ringmaster's Room:

text.Maya: Hey Detective Gumshoe! I'm sure you did a good job as usual.

text.Gumshoe: Well, I am done with the investigation of the acrobat. Finally. But with Ms. von Karma...

text.Maya: Nick, what is that? That beeping sound?

text.Phoenix: Hmm...

text.Gumshoe: It's Ms. von Karma.

text.Maya: Huh?

text.Gumshoe: Every time I hear that sound, she's usually not very far behind!

text.Phoenix: Some sort of pager or something?

text.Gumshoe: If you don't mind pal, I'm gonna go ahead and get outta here... Quick. See ya, pal!!

text.Maya: I didn't know that Gumshoe could run that fast! So much for being a flatfoot.

text.Phoenix: ( Never seen a grown man so afraid of a girl still in her teens! )

text.Maya: Well, let's go inside... It's freezing out here! The wind's as biting as... OWWWW!! ...As biting as lashes from a whip!! ( Changed from [That whip could cut right through me...!!] in the original release )
text._info: (Changed from [Uh oh... The whi...] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: Von... Von... Von... Karma!! ( She really did appear!! )

text.Franziska: It was a real battle today in court, wasn't it... Mr. Phoenix Wright!?

text.Phoenix: Did you have to jump out and scare us like that? What can I do for you?

text.Franziska: Tomorrow will be the day. The day my dream finally comes true!

text.Phoenix: You mean the story of my defeat at your hands making the national news?

text.Franziska: Ha ha ha... National news? You possess such a small sense of scale... The global news, Mr. Phoenix Wright! Your miserable plight will be known internationally!

text.Phoenix: ( I think she might be overestimating the importance of a win by just a smudge... )

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ms. von Karma... It appears you got your hands onto something big, huh?
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [Von Karma... It appears you got your hands onto something, eh?] in the original release)

CHOICE.Franziska: Hah! I'm amazed you picked up on that much.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Anyone could. You couldn't hide that look of victory with ten paper bags on your head! )

CHOICE.Franziska: I've got "conclusive evidence" and a "conclusive witness"... Need any more hints?

CHOICE.Phoenix: "A conclusive witness"... You must mean the acrobat, right?

CHOICE.Franziska: I'm putting in the summons for him to be called as a witness as we speak. It's the final nail in your coffin, Mr. Phoenix Wright!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Yeah, yeah, yeah, I get it already, you want to beat and destroy me. I can't worry about her. I've got to try and find out more information myself. )

CHOICE.Maya: Why do you keep giving Nick the evil eye!? It doesn't matter if you prove the defendant guilty tomorrow... Nothing will be able to bring your dad back!

CHOICE.Franziska: ... My... "dad"? You must mean the esteemed Manfred von Karma.
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [My... Dad? You must mean the esteemed Manfred von Karma.] in the original release)

CHOICE.Maya: Of course! Your dad! I know you miss him...

CHOICE.Franziska: Enough out of you... One more word and you'll get a mouthful of whip. Now. When did I ever bring up my papa's name in this, or any other conversation...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: !! Then... Then what's this "revenge" thing you're talking about?

CHOICE.Franziska: You wouldn't understand, Mr. Phoenix Wright. I have to see "him" again, one more time.

CHOICE.Phoenix: "Him"?

CHOICE.Franziska: I'm sure you know to whom I refer... Miles Edgeworth!!

CHOICE.Maya: What!? Edgeworth!? Mr... EDGEWORTH!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: M-M-Mi-Miles E-Ed-Edg-Edgeworth!!
Miles Edgeworth... Why would you even bring him up!?

CHOICE.Franziska: You haven't forgotten, have you? Do you know who it was that trained the gifted prosecutor, Miles Edgeworth?

CHOICE.Maya: !! Manfred... von... Karma...

CHOICE.Franziska: Exactly right. It was my papa.

CHOICE.Maya: That means that Edgeworth was...

CHOICE.Franziska: Right again. Miles was like a little brother to me.

CHOICE.Maya: Huh? Little brother? Edgeworth and Nick are the same age...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Edgeworth... The man who inspired me to become an attorney. I fought against him in a few cases... But after "that" case was over... He "vanished"... )

CHOICE.Franziska: It's your fault he is gone.

CHOICE.Maya: HUH!?

CHOICE.Franziska: It's the truth, isn't it, Mr. Phoenix Wright?

CHOICE.Maya: Nick! What does she mean!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Edgeworth was never quite the same after that case, and then, with the case after that one... He never set foot into court again... And then one day, he just vanished. All he left was a simple note at the prosecutor's office.
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [After that case, Edgeworth was in a peculiar state, and he got worse everyday.] in the original release)

CHOICE.Franziska: "Prosecutor Miles Edgeworth chooses death."

CHOICE.Phoenix: That was one year ago. It was a few months after you left to go back home.
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [It was right after you left to go back home.] in the original release)

CHOICE.Maya: Mr. Edgeworth... He's dead?

CHOICE.Franziska: I don't believe it. He's still alive. I'm sure of it... Somewhere in this world, he's still alive. "Prosecutor Miles Edgeworth chooses death?" Of course he did! You ruined his reputation as a prosecutor! You effectively killed the prosecutor in him. Just like your victory muddied the honorable name Von Karma! I'm going to find him... And then, I'm going to teach him his rightful place with my own two hands!
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [Then I'm going to teach him the difference between right and wrong with my own hands!] in the original release)

CHOICE.Maya: What about this? OWWW!! She hit me again.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Maybe you should hold off on the wild goose chases.

text.Maya: N-N-Nick! Umm... About Mr. Edgeworth...!
text._info: (Changed from [N-N-Nick! Umm... About Edgeworth?] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: Maya, I already told you this once. Don't make me do it again. Don't bring up his name in front of me again, OK?

text.Maya: N-Nick...?

text.Phoenix: Ms. von Karma?
text._info: (Changed from [Von Karma?] in the original release)

text.Franziska: What?

text.Phoenix: I don't know if you are god's gift to prosecutors or not, but I've had about enough of you!! Him, too!

text.Maya: Wha... What in the world happened...?
text._info: (Changed from [Wha... What happened?] in the original release)

text.Franziska: Hmph. This dog is all bark and no bite. He's already been defeated... Regardless, I have nothing to inform you two of today. Tomorrow will be the greatest courtroom battle this country has ever seen!!

text.Maya: Nick?

text.Phoenix: Let's go. We need to talk with the performer on the third floor.

text.Maya: I'm sorry I brought it up, Nick...

text.ACTION: December 29 Lodging Hall 3rd Floor Acro's Room

text.???: You must be Phoenix Wright.

text.Phoenix: Y-Yes.

text.???: Pleased to meet you. I'm Ken Dingling.

text.Acro: But here at the circus, everyone just calls me Acro.

text.Maya: Mr... Acro.

text.Phoenix: Ummm... How do you know my name?

text.Acro: The detective told me. He said you'd definitely show up here.

text.Maya: Acro, you're a member of this circus as well?

text.Acro: That's right. I mainly performed on the tightrope or the flying trapeze. But nowadays... All I perform in is my wheelchair.

CHOICE.Maya: Eww... It's a huge pile of trash!

CHOICE.Phoenix: One man's trash is another monkey's treasure.

CHOICE.Maya: I guess you're right. Look! They're all shiny things.

CHOICE.Phoenix: He's even got a motorcycle exhaust. What do they call this thing? Oh... A tuba right?

CHOICE.Maya: Of course it's a tuba, silly! You didn't know that!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Hey... It's a picture of Regina.

CHOICE.Maya: Well, she is a shining beauty.

CHOICE.Phoenix: No objections here.

CHOICE.Maya: Hehe... It's a monkey calendar!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Acro must really love monkeys.
Acro, why did you join the circus?

CHOICE.Acro: When I was a kid, my parents failed miserably at business. Then one night, they decided to run away from it all... Without me.
The only person who was willing to take my parents' place was the Ringmaster. The Ringmaster took such incredible care of me. He was truly a lifesaver.
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [The only person who was willing to take my parent's [sic] place was the Ringmaster.] in the original release)

CHOICE.Maya: It seems like the Ringmaster was truly a saint.

CHOICE.Acro: He was... That's why I decided to do something very important. I decided that I would devote my entire life to finding a way to repay him... And now... Look how someone repaid him for all the good in his life!!

CHOICE.Phoenix: It's such a shame.

CHOICE.Acro: Sometimes I think that he was almost too kind... Perhaps he was too kind to his performers... Perhaps he was too kind to his daughter.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Hmm... I wonder if he spoiled Regina? )

CHOICE.Maya: Regina is so cute!! She's truly a princess.

CHOICE.Acro: Truly a princess? Are you sure that's a good thing?

CHOICE.Maya: Umm...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Hmm... Do I detect a hint of a grudge against Regina... )

CHOICE.Maya: Umm... I'm sorry to ask, but why are you in a wheel chair?

CHOICE.Acro: The nerves in my legs were badly damaged.

CHOICE.Phoenix: And you can't walk now?

CHOICE.Acro: I can't even stand now. And since I live on the third floor, I can't even leave this building by myself.

CHOICE.Maya: That's awful...

CHOICE.Phoenix: The accident happened during an acrobatics session, right?

CHOICE.Acro: Umm...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( A Psyche-Lock! It doesn't seem like Acro's injuries were acrobatic in nature... )

CHOICE.Acro: What's on your mind, Mr. Wright?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Well... Exactly when were you injured?

CHOICE.Acro: It's almost been six months since I was hurt. I injured my legs during practice.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Six months ago ... What in the world went on at this circus then!? )

CHOICE.Acro: I'm still undergoing rehabilitation for my injuries. I still can't stand, but the doctor's * say that I'll be able to recover and walk again.
CHOICE._info: ([sic])

CHOICE.Maya: Out of curiosity, what kind of accident was it again?

CHOICE.Acro: I don't really have much more to add beyond that.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Acro's hiding what really caused his "accident". Maybe it's related to what happened to the Ringmaster? )
I stopped by yesterday and noticed that you weren't in your room.

CHOICE.Acro: I was at the hospital all day yesterday.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ahh... You went there for rehabilitation? What about the murder?

CHOICE.Acro: Of course I knew about it... I spoke with the police before they allowed me to go to the hospital. Before I got the call from the prosecutor, I was convinced that it was all a dream.

CHOICE.Maya: Huh?

CHOICE.Acro: I just couldn't believe it. When I saw what I saw...

CHOICE.Phoenix: "What you saw"...? ( Jeez, that sounded really ominous... )
What did you see, Acro?

CHOICE.Acro: That night... I was in bed sleeping when I heard a huge sound coming from below my window.

CHOICE.Maya: I see... The scene of the crime was right below your window.

CHOICE.Acro: That's when I looked out the window...

CHOICE.Maya: What did you see?

CHOICE.Acro: He was flying straight up into the air...

CHOICE.Phoenix: H-He?

CHOICE.Acro: Maximillion Galactica.

CHOICE.Maya: Whaaatttt!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( That's what I thought he'd say... ) You're absolutely positive that it was Max you saw flying?

CHOICE.Acro: I am absolutely sure. There's no doubt in my mind.

CHOICE.Maya: N-Nick...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Acro, please take a look at this photo for us...

CHOICE.Acro: No problem... Ahh... This is how it ended for him... Such a shame...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( He seems awfully calm... But his eyes have a look of sorrow and profound pain... )

CHOICE.Acro: If my legs weren't like this... I would have been able to prevent this from happening! That's an absolute certainty!

CHOICE.Maya: Acro...

CHOICE.Acro: Maximillion Galactica, right? You'll have to forgive me, but I try not to think about him.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Acro won't even look at it... )

CHOICE.Maya: It looks like something is really weighing on him.

CHOICE.Acro: Heh... Money is a great friend to me.

CHOICE.Phoenix: That pile of "treasure" over there is his collection, huh?

CHOICE.Acro: It is indeed. Money will bring anything back with him.

CHOICE.Maya: Aww... That's so cute!

CHOICE.Acro: Yeah, I'm not great with the ladies... But I seem to be pretty popular with the animals.
Hmm... What's this?

CHOICE.Phoenix: That's what we want to know.

CHOICE.Maya: It was posted in the cafeteria the morning before the murder.

CHOICE.Acro: In the... Cafeteria?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( W-What happened? He suddenly looks incredibly serious... )

CHOICE.Acro: ... If it's got something to do with her, then you should go straight to the source.

CHOICE.Maya: Her?

CHOICE.Acro: Regina. Ask her about it.
You want to know about Max? Well, his colleagues in the circus all seem to hate him.

CHOICE.Phoenix: What about you, Acro?

CHOICE.Acro: I've got my issues with him as well. But he just also happens to have a diamond shining in his soul.

CHOICE.Maya: A diamond shining in his soul?

CHOICE.Acro: I guess you could say it is his pride as a performer. We didn't have that pride in ourselves before Max arrived. Honestly, I think he brought something wonderful to this circus when he came.

CHOICE.Maya: Acro...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( This guy is really different from the other members of the circus... )
I was hoping you could shed some light on Ben...

CHOICE.Acro: Well, he'll always be here. And as long as he's here, he really can only continue to be a ventriloquist. Whether that's a good thing for him or not... I'm afraid I can't really say.

text.Judge: What's the meaning of this?

text.Franziska: We have discovered a new witness. Or shall I say, a new eyewitness. One that saw Maximillion Galactica fly off from the scene of the crime.

text.Judge: Order! Order! I had a feeling something like this would come up...

text.Franziska: Due to this revision, we are now prepared to explain how the defendant flew that night. An explanation the prosecution will present if the need so [sic] arises... In fact, my detective stayed up all night creating a mockup of the scene, on my orders.

text.Franziska: Name and occupation.

text.Acro: Ken Dingling, but everyone calls me Acro. I'm employed as an acrobat at the Berry Big Circus.

text.Franziska: Where were you the night of the crime?

text.Acro: I was in my room that night.

text.Franziska: If you look at the map, you will see the witness' room is near the crime scene.

text.Acro: My room is on the third floor. The crime scene is below my window.

text.Judge: Hmm...

text.Franziska: The night of the crime, the witness saw something quite shocking. Would you tell us what you witnessed?

text.Acro: OK...

It was just after 10:00 PM, and I was resting in my bed. 
Around that time, I heard a large "THUMP" noise from outside the window. 
Then a few moments later, I saw someone... flying... Right by my window. 
It was Max Galactica... I only saw him from behind, but that's who it looked like. 
To be honest, when I saw that, I thought I was dreaming...

text.Judge: Hmm... This witness's testimony matches up exactly with that of the clown.

text.Franziska: If that's the case, there is very little the prosecution need add... All that's left is to explain how the defendant disappeared into the sky that night.

text.Acro:
I suppose I could have lifted something the size of that bust. 
I have a strong upper body from working as an acrobat, and only my legs were injured. 
However, lifting the bust and looking out of the window would've been impossible. 
There's no way I could have exerted that kind of force on my lower body. 
That makes it impossible for me to have known the location of the Ringmaster's head. 
Thus it would be unrealistic to drop the bust on him. Don't you think?

text.Judge: The box also has carrying handles on either side, doesn't it?

text.Franziska: Fool!!

text.Phoenix: ( Does he even bother to listen to me anymore...? )
text._info: (Changed from [Does she [sic] even bother to listen to me anymore...?] in the original release)

text.Acro: I've heard what you've had to say...
I must admit, I'm shocked at your imaginative skills.

text.Judge: Y-You... Did you do it? Did you place this wooden box in the plaza?
text._info: (Changed from [Y-You... Did you drop it? Did you drop the bust onto the Ringmaster!?] in the original release)

text.Acro: Mr. Wright may have a vivid imagination, but I could never have done what he's proposing.
text._info: (Changed from [What are you talking about!? Even if I had wanted to do such a thing, I couldn't.] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: What...!?

text.Acro: Mr. Wright... Do you recall the original location of Max's bust?
text._info: (Changed from [Mr. Wright... Do you recall the original location of this bust?] in the original release)

CHOICE.Phoenix: Of course I remember. It was on top of the table in the cafeteria.

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm... Then what happened to it?

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "I'd like you to remember one important fact, Mr. Wright..."

CHOICE.Phoenix: Uhh... I kinda forget.

CHOICE.Maya: N-N-Nick!! Don't tell me you're losing your memory already!

CHOICE.Phoenix: No no no no no... Let's not get carried away...

CHOICE.Maya: Hey, stick out your head a little! I've got just the thing... A MAYA KICK!!

CHOICE.Judge: Enough of that! No horseplay in this courtroom! And no kicking the defense attorney!! According to the Court Record, the bust "disappeared from the cafeteria."

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "I'd like you to remember one important fact, Mr. Wright..."

text.Acro: I'd like you to remember one important fact, Mr. Wright... I could not possibly leave the lodging house by myself.

text.Maya: Ah! That means...

text.Acro: You understand what I mean, don't you? I may very well have been able to drop the bust from my room. However, how would I have gotten the bust from the cafeteria to my room ?

text.Franziska: You see, Mr. Phoenix Wright!! Explain that! Don't forget... You said, "There was no accomplice!"

text.Phoenix: Arrrggghhh!

text.Franziska: Tell us exactly how the witness would have carried the bust from the cafeteria!

text.Phoenix: ( Yep... We definitely have a problem here... But this is no place to get perplexed! I've got to get my wits about me and prove how things happened once and for all! )

text.Judge: Alright, Mr. Wright. Let's hear your explanation. How did the witness get the bust from the cafeteria back to his room?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Here is the evidence that proves how he carried it!

CHOICE.Judge: What do you think about this evidence, Ms. von Karma?

CHOICE.Acro: What do you think about this evidence, Mr. Wright?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Hmm... OWWW!!

CHOICE.Judge: Here's one from me too!!

CHOICE.Maya: MAYA KICK!!

text.Judge: A monkey?

text.Phoenix: Everyone knows Money... He loves shiny objects of any size.

text.Judge: Oh, like when he stole the ventriloquist's ring...
text._info: (Changed from [For instance, he stole the ventriloquist's ring...] in the original release)

text.Franziska: So? Are you saying the witness had a monkey steal the bust?

text.Phoenix: Of course he didn't order the monkey to steal it!! The monkey stole it on his own and then brought it back home.

text.Judge: "Home"...?

text.Phoenix: Money lives in Acro's room .

text.Judge: ACRO'S ROOM!?

text.Franziska: Objection!
But the bust was bronze, wasn't it? Bronze isn't all that shiny...

text.Phoenix: Objection!
Maybe you should put the whip down sometimes and read the Court Record!

text.Judge: My, those are some very nice cards he's holding.

text.Phoenix: Yes, and they are made of platinum... which is very shiny!

text.Franziska: GWWWAAAAHHH!!

text.Phoenix: Acro!! Money is a strong monkey, right!? It'd be easy for him to bring the bust back to your room!!

text.Acro: ... If he wasn't able to handle that himself, I'd be on the market for a new roommate.

text.Judge: Order! Order! I SAID ORDER!! MS. VON KARMA!! Where is the bust in question at this moment!?

text.Franziska: Umm... Umm... Umm... I... Umm... I don't know. We're searching for it as we speak...!

text.Judge: Hmm... This is a rather strange turn of events. But let's say that the monkey had not stolen the bust ... ( Changed from [If that monkey did not steal the bust...] in the original release ) What would have happened then? ( Changed from [Then what happens to this case?] in the original release )
text._info: (Changed from [Hmm... This is a strange turn of events.] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: Well, in that event... Something else would've been used as the murder weapon.
text._info: (Changed from [Something else must have been used as the murder weapon.] in the original release)

text.Maya: Hmm... Wait...! Then you mean this bust was the murder weapon... purely by accident !? ( Changed from [Or maybe this bust was the murder weapon... But it was used by accident.] in the original release )
text._info: (Changed from [Well... Hmm...] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: It's possible. Maybe Acro saw Money's mountain of stolen goods and thought to use one of them.
text._info: (Changed from [That's possible.] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: Anyways... I think we've more than proven one critical fact. Namely, that it was entirely possible that Acro was the murderer!

text.Franziska: MORON!!

text.Judge: Mr. Wright's argument was so circular, I'm still a bit dizzy! However... His argument does hold water... There's no denying that. OWWW!!

text.Franziska: Don't seem so flamboozled! Especially by this fraud of an attorney!

text.Phoenix: Fraud...?

text.Franziska: You've forgotten the absolute, most important thing, Mr. Phoenix Wright!!

text.Phoenix: And what is that?

text.Franziska: You should know!! You forgot that your fraud of a magical client was spotted at the scene of the crime!

text.Phoenix: AHHHHH!!

text.Franziska: There is no reason to doubt the clown's testimony!

text.Judge: T-That's true! How do you respond to that, Mr. Wright!

text.Maya: Nick! Don't let her beat you now!

text.Phoenix: ( I won't! This is my chance to turn this trial around ! )

text.Franziska: When the murder occurred, there were two people at the scene of the crime! One was the victim, Russell Berry, and the other was the murderer himself! Answer this and only this, Mr. Phoenix Wright! Who was the murderer the clown saw!?
text._info: (Changed from [The clown saw the murderer! Who was it then!?] in the original release)

CHOICE.ACTION: USER SELECTS Present Max G. Bust

CHOICE.Judge: What is this supposed to mean!?

CHOICE.Franziska: Yes! What is that supposed to mean!?

CHOICE.Acro: Do you mind explaining that to me, as well?

CHOICE.Maya: You're getting barraged with questions, Nick...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Why is that?

CHOICE.Maya: It's because you're on the wrong track!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ohh...

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads back to "When the murder occurred, there were two people at the scene of the crime!"

text.Phoenix: He saw Max's B-- OWWW!!

text.Franziska: I asked who was the other person Moe saw on the scene! That evidence has nothing to do with the question!

text.Phoenix: Objection!
Au contraire, mon fr√©re! It does indeed have something to do with the question!
Moe said that he saw Max's silhouette... But he did not actually see the man himself! It wasn't a human being he saw!

text.Judge: H-H-How is that possible!?

text.Phoenix: It's simple, really. What Moe actually saw that night was Max's bust !

text.Franziska: Objection!
What are you talking about!? Have you tried using your brain at all in this case!? The silhouette he saw was wearing a cloak!
text._info: (Changed from [The silhouette he saw just happened to be wearing a cloak!] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: Objection!
There's no reason why you couldn't attach a cloak to the bust ! It would be easy to hang one off of the cards in the bust's hands!
text._info: (Changed from [Or a cloak like that could easily get snagged on the bust if they came into contact.] in the original release)

text.Franziska: Idiot!! Who in their right mind would put a cloak on a bust!?

text.Phoenix: It doesn't matter who put it on the bust!

text.Judge: Just wait a minute now, Mr. Wright! Who put the cloak on the bust? That question is of the utmost importance to this case, don't you agree!?

text.Phoenix: ( Doh! He caught me... )

text.Judge: So let's have it Mr. Wright... Who put the cloak on the bust?

CHOICE.ACTION: USER SELECTS Present Russell Berry profile

CHOICE.Franziska: Hmm... I wonder, Mr. Phoenix Wright... Didn't the defendant wear his cloak the entire time he was at practice?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Uhh...

CHOICE.Franziska: So then how did this person get a hold of the cloak?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Well...

CHOICE.Franziska: Furthermore, how would this person have gotten the cloak onto the bust, I wonder? Because this person was not spotted at the scene...

CHOICE.Phoenix: I'm... I'm sorry. ( When she's so nice about telling me I'm wrong, it hurts even more... ) OWWW!!

CHOICE.Franziska: The famous Von Karma "carrot and whip" approach!

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads back to "So let's have it Mr. Wright..."

text.Franziska: F-F-FOOL!! H-HIM...!?

text.Judge: You are saying it was the victim himself!? Russell Berry!?

text.Phoenix: That's what I'm saying!

text.Franziska: He... I mean, the victim himself, placed the cloak on the bust!?

text.Phoenix: "Placed the cloak" isn't really the right way of putting it...

text.Judge: Then what would be the right way of putting it, Mr. Wright?

text.Franziska: Explain yourself!

text.Maya: Nick! Do you really have a handle on all of this?

text.Phoenix: I'm fine, Maya. I'm finally putting all the pieces together... There's really only one picture I can paint, anyways. Alright... So you want to know what really happened that night? Let's step back in time. Acro used a rope to lower the wooden box onto the scene. Then he attached that rope to the bust , and dangled the bust out of his bedroom window, directly above the wooden box . At the same time, the Ringmaster told Max to wait in his room, and went to the scene. Of course, at the time, the Ringmaster was wearing Max's costume . Perhaps he didn't want anyone to recognize him that night. But just as he feared, he was spotted at the entrance of the lodging house. By none other than a ventriloquist and his puppet, Ben and Trilo. When the Ringmaster arrived at the scene, he bent over to lift the wooden box. And that's when Acro took his chance and released the rope! Now this is when the magic happens... At the very instant that the bust hit the victim...

text.Franziska: You just wait a second there, Mr. Phoenix Wright!! As much as you try... As much as you scheme... This just isn't true! It can't be!

text.Phoenix: It's still a little early to be getting so upset, Ms. von Karma... This circus isn't over yet.

text.Franziska: What...?
text._info: (Changed from [Eh...?] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: The impact of the bust on the victim threw the cloak up, which snagged onto the bust. That impact also caused the sound a certain witness heard, prompting him to take a look. ( Changed from [That's when the sound was heard by a witness and he took a look out of his window.] in the original release ) That witness was, of course, Lawrence "Moe" Curls, the clown. When Moe looked out his window, the cloak had already snagged onto the bust. Now... Having completed the crime, Acro naturally went about pulling up the murder weapon . Of course, he had no idea that Moe saw the bust being raised with the cloak dangling on it . Primarily because, in his wheelchair, he couldn't see out of his window. So he just kept pulling the bust up. And that is how the "magical murderer disappearing into the sky" came to be.
text._info: (Changed from [With the shock of impact, it threw up the cloak and it got snagged onto the bust.] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: So you see, the only person who could've pulled this off... is the one person who was able to drop the murder weapon from above the crime scene! ( Changed from [And now you know who was able to drop the murder weapon from above the scene!] in the original release ) Acro! It could only have been you!
text._info: (Changed from [Now you know how the murder actually took place...] in the original release)

text.Maya: Acro's been playing mind games with all of us!

text.Phoenix: ( He sure has... But he has come to the end of his rope now. )
What now!?

text.Franziska: You've graced us with a rather long-winded tale... But do you have any evidence to prove that your fairy tale is true !?

text.Judge: ... E-Evidence...?

text.Franziska: In this court, only two things matter. The power of evidence, and the power of my whip.

text.Judge: Don't forget the power of my gavel as well! Mr. Wright, the prosecution brings up a good point. Can we see some evidence?

text.Maya: Nick... They say they want evidence...

text.Phoenix: I just explained how there can only be one possible murder method. But there is still something unusual about Moe's eyewitness account.

text.Maya: "Unusual"?

text.Phoenix: A contradiction , actually.

text.Maya: OK then! Use that and get out of this jam!

text.Judge: That's enough talking amongst yourselves. Proceed, Mr. Wright. Present some evidence to the court that backs your claims. I want hard proof that you have unraveled the trick to this magic case...!

CHOICE.ACTION: USER SELECTS Present Silk Hat or Max G. Promo Poster
Leads to "The problem is Max's three symbols..."

CHOICE.Judge: Try again.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( If they would have been silent for two more seconds, I would have screamed! )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads back to "Nick... They say they want evidence..."

text.Phoenix: The problem is Max's three symbols ... You know... The silk hat, the cloak, and the white roses.

text.Judge: Those symbols were a problem numerous times during yesterday's proceedings.

text.Phoenix: Yesterday, there were two contradictions in Moe's testimony.

text.Franziska: The silk hat was one. The white roses were the other.

text.Phoenix: But the theory I just presented explains all of these contradictions!

text.Franziska: You fool! Do you ever shut up!?

text.Phoenix: Max's silk hat was found at the scene of the crime. However! Remember what Moe said yesterday. He testified that the criminal he saw fleeing the scene was wearing a silk hat ! There's only one explanation for that! The "silk hat" that Moe saw was actually the bust's!
text._info: (Changed from [The 'silk hat' that Moe saw was actually the bust!] in the original release)

text.Judge: Makes sense... If you look at it that way, then he did see the silk hat, well, sort of.

text.Franziska: Objection!
Fine, you've got one, but what about the other contradiction!?

text.Judge: The other contradiction...?

text.Franziska: Remember what that ventriloquist said in court! He said that he witnessed " white roses " on "Max's" chest that night! But the clown's testimony doesn't match! The clown said that there were no "white roses"! I'd like to see you try and explain that one away!!

text.Maya: Can you do it, Nick!?

text.Phoenix: Of course! I can explain all of it!

text.Franziska: What was that...!?

text.Phoenix: Please recall the instant when the cloak snagged onto the bust! If the cloak snagged onto the bust, what happened to the white roses? Do you get it yet? If the cloak got snagged onto the front of the bust... It means that the white roses would end up on the back of the bust !

text.Franziska: AHHHHH!!

text.Phoenix: Which explains why Moe didn't see them! The white roses were not visible because they were on the back side of the bust !
text._info: (Changed from [Which explains why Moe didn't see it!] in the original release)

text.Judge: Order! Orderrrrrrrr!
... This is quite the shocking state of affairs. Mr. Wright's theory still sounds a bit absurd to me. However... Let's just keep going down this road for a while and see where it leads!

text.Maya: Let's do this, Nick! Then maybe Von Karma will finally throw in the towel...
Well... So much for that theory.

text.Acro: Mr. Wright... Do you mind?

text.Phoenix: What is it?

text.Acro: You took the time to research our circus, didn't you?

text.Phoenix: Well... Yes, I did... Is there something making you think that I didn't?

text.Acro: If you did, then maybe you'll understand why I think you're off track.

text.Phoenix: Umm... Why is that?

text.Franziska: Motive. This witness feels an incredible debt of gratitude towards the Ringmaster. Anyone with any relation to the circus is well aware of this.
Thus, there is absolutely no way someone like this would kill the Ringmaster!

text.Judge: Hmm...

text.Franziska: Your Honor, I'd like you to hear Acro's story! Learn about his relationship with the Ringmaster, and his life up until now...

text.Maya: W-What do we do!? There's no doubting that Acro deeply respected the Ringmaster!

text.Phoenix: ( Acro's motive... Hmm... )

text.Judge: It seems that this case isn't over yet... Very well. However, I feel this is a good place to take a break. I will listen to the rest of Mr. Dingling's testimony after recess.
This court will now take a 10 minute recess.

text.ACTION: December 30, 2:17 PM District Court Defendant Lobby No. 5

text.Max: I can't believe it!! Acro!?

text.Phoenix: It's pretty shocking, isn't it?

But, but... I'm nothin' but a littl' ol' nobody, ya know...?

text._info: (Changed from ['Judgment comes at the very last instant.'] in the original release)

text.Maya: What did he mean by that... "the very end" part.
text._info: (Changed from [What did he mean by that... 'The very last instant' part.] in the original release)

text._info: (Changed from [Hmm... Everything he said seemed pretty cryptic to me...] in the original release)

text.ACTION: December 30, 2:27 PM District Court Courtroom No. 2

text.Judge: Court is now back in session. Ms. von Karma. Please continue from where you left off.
text._info: (Changed from [This court is now in session. Shall we continue our proceedings?] in the original release)

text.Franziska: I'd like to continue with Acro's testimony, starting with his relationship to the victim. I'd also like to get proof from the defense... Proof of what kind of motive Acro would have to commit this crime.

text.Judge: Understood. Now, Mr. Dingling.

text.Acro: Yes, Your Honor.

text.Judge: Please proceed with your testimony.

text.Maya: Finally we get to the motive! Wait... Nick, are you OK?

text.Phoenix: Just do me a favor and don't ask questions you don't want the answer to...

text.Maya: ... * gulp *

text.Acro:
When we were little, we were abandoned by our parents. 
That's when the Ringmaster of the Berry Big Circus, Russell Berry, took us in. 
I became an acrobat at around nine years old. 
I wanted to find a way to repay the Ringmaster. That was my sole purpose in life...

text.Judge: Hmm... You're such a thoughtful young man.

text.Franziska: As you heard, the witness deeply respected the victim. I wonder how anyone could think that Acro could kill the man he held in such esteem.

text.Judge: You are absolutely right... How could anyone think that, Mr. Wright? Which is why there's no real need for a cross-examination, is there?

text.Phoenix: ( Actually, that's the question I'm trying to answer myself... " Why would Acro kill the Ringmaster? "... This might be my last chance to answer that question. )

text.Maya: Where is Max's bust...? The defense needs time to prepare to present its lace... I mean case. Sorry, I'm a bit nervous and I just bit my tongue.
text._info: (Changed from [The defense needs time to prepare to present it's [sic] lace...] in the original release)

text.Judge: Huh?

text.Franziska: What?

text.Phoenix: We need time to do WHAT!?!? OWWW!!

text.Franziska: Why are you the most surprised person here!? She's YOUR aide, isn't she!?

text.Judge: D-Do you really have a-a case to present, Mr. Wright!?

text.Phoenix: W-Whaaa--!? Are you asking ME!?
text._info: (Changed form [W-Whaaa!? Is he talking to me!?] in the original release)

text.Maya: The rest is up to you, Nick! Good luck!

text.Phoenix: H-Hey... Wait... You can't be serious...

text.Maya: Acrobats always have their lives on the lines, don't they? That's how Acro's lived his life up until now. Now it's time for us to walk across our own tightrope! If we don't, we're certain to lose!
text._info: (Changed from [Acrobat's [sic] always have their lives on the lines, don't they?] in the original release)

text.Judge: Very well... The defense may proceed.

text.Acro: He doesn't have a clue... And I don't think he'll be finding one anytime soon.

text.Phoenix: ( ...Walking the tightrope of logic... There's no room for a false step! Sink or swim... The only way through is forward! )

text.Franziska: The murder weapon... Where is Max's bust now!?

CHOICE.ACTION: USER SELECTS Somewhere in the Lodging House

CHOICE.Phoenix: There is no doubt in my mind! The bust is somewhere around the Lodging House!

CHOICE.Judge: You don't say!?

CHOICE.Franziska: He better not say...!

CHOICE.Phoenix: In fact, allow me to be even more specific as to its location! You can find it...
Indeed, it is in Moe's room!

CHOICE.Franziska: T-That clown...? You don't mean!?

CHOICE.Judge: Why would the bust be in Moe's room?

CHOICE.Phoenix: That's simple... I couldn't think of any other rooms it could be in! OWWW!!

CHOICE.Franziska: Refrain from making yourself look stupid!

CHOICE.Maya: Nick! What about where Ben and Trilo were standing!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Hmm... Maybe she's on to something here... )

CHOICE.Franziska: We searched that room inside out and there was absolutely no sign of a bust!

CHOICE.Phoenix: L-Let... Let me try again!

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads back to "...Walking the tightrope of logic... There's no room for a false step!"

CHOICE.Phoenix: Without a doubt, the bust is in... Acro's room. OWWW!! L-Let me finish... J-Just let me finish... OWWWWW!!

CHOICE.Franziska: I already told you that we searched his room from top to bottom! Prepare to taste your own tears... Mr. Phoenix Wright!

CHOICE.Judge: The court orders Mr. Phoenix Wright to get a grip on himself immediately!

CHOICE.Phoenix: I'll... Uhh... Go back and think things over.

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads back to "...Walking the tightrope of logic... There's no room for a false step!"

CHOICE.Phoenix: It's buried in the plaza!

CHOICE.Judge: N-Near the scene of the crime? And no one noticed it!?

CHOICE.Franziska: How could you possibly think that!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Haven't you ever heard the old saying... "It was hiding right under your nose?" That about sums it up!
I should rethink that, shouldn't I?

CHOICE.Judge: Yes, you should.

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads back to "...Walking the tightrope of logic... There's no room for a false step!"
USER SELECTS Somewhere in the Big Top

CHOICE.Phoenix: It must be somewhere in the Berry Big Top!

CHOICE.Franziska: I-It's... It's in the Big Top!?

CHOICE.Judge: Mr. Wright! Where exactly in the Big top would we find the bust?

CHOICE.Phoenix: To be specific, I believe it is in the Ringmaster's room.

CHOICE.Franziska: Once again... You are so predictable, Mr. Phoenix Wright. Enough of your bluffing. The Ringmaster's room was thoroughly searched... There was no bust found. There's absolutely no way I'm wrong. I'd even stake my life on it!

CHOICE.Judge: Oh... There's no need to be staking lives on things... OWWW!!

CHOICE.Franziska: And you get one too!

CHOICE.Phoenix: OWWW!!

CHOICE.Maya: Nick! You've gotta think things over again...

CHOICE.Phoenix: You're right... If I think things through, I should figure it all out!

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads back to "...Walking the tightrope of logic... There's no room for a false step!"

CHOICE.Phoenix: Of course, it is obviously in the cafeteria!

CHOICE.Franziska: The c-c-cafeteria...!

CHOICE.Judge: Why would it be there!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: That's easy enough... It's the messiest place in the entire circus! OWWW!!

CHOICE.Franziska: Spare us the jokes!

CHOICE.Maya: That reminds me! Our office is just as messy as that cafeteria!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I wouldn't go that far. It's not that messy... )

CHOICE.Franziska: We went over that cafeteria with a fine-toothed comb and found no sign of a bust!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ack! I've gotta rethink things!

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads back to "...Walking the tightrope of logic... There's no room for a false step!"

CHOICE.Phoenix: It is on the circus's stage!

CHOICE.Judge: W-What is it doing there!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Haven't you ever heard this the [sic] saying... "You keep your treasure inside your castle." It's kinda like that!
Looks like it's time to give things some more thought.
