CHOICE.Judge: I agree.

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads back to "...Walking the tightrope of logic... There's no room for a false step!"
USER SELECTS Somewhere in this courtroom

CHOICE.Phoenix: It's obvious! The bust is inside this very courtroom!

CHOICE.Judge: It... It's obviously WHERE!?
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [It's... O-O-Obvious...?] in the original release)

CHOICE.Phoenix: Allow me to pinpoint the location of the bust once and for all!

CHOICE.Judge: W-W-W-What!? Why did you stop talking all of a sudden!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Well... I'm just not really sure if I should say anything or not because the bust is... Under Your Honor's bench!

CHOICE.Franziska: ...You had to think about whether it was a good idea to say that!?

CHOICE.Judge: GWWWWAAAAHHHH!! WHAT DID YOU JUST SAY TO ME!? THAT'S A PENALTY!!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Arrrgghhh!

CHOICE.Judge: WHAT'S THAT!? YOU WANT A DOUBLE!? HERE YA GO!!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Double arrrggghhh!! ( Ahh... I knew I had a bad feeling about that... )

CHOICE.Judge: Now hurry up and fix things!

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads back to "...Walking the tightrope of logic... There's no room for a false step!"

CHOICE.Judge: W-W-W-What!? Why did you stop talking all of a sudden!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Well... I'm just not really sure if I should say anything or not because the bust is... Under the prosecutor's bench!

CHOICE.Judge: No... You don't mean that... MS. VON KARMA! OWWW!! OWWWWWW!! OWWWWWWWWW!! OWWWWWWWWWWWW!! OWWWWWWWWWWWWWWW!!

CHOICE.Franziska: Don't think you're getting off either!

CHOICE.Maya: N-Nick! Get up, Nick!

CHOICE.Franziska: ...Proceed, Your Honor.

CHOICE.Judge: I will when Mr. Wright opens his eyes...

CHOICE.Maya: Nick... Are you OK?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( ...? W-W-Who is this girl? ... This is no time for me to be losing my memory!! )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads back to "...Walking the tightrope of logic... There's no room for a false step!"

text.Phoenix: Acro... I'm sorry to ask this, but do you mind if I take the blanket off your wheelchair?

text.Acro: ... I'm sorry, I didn't quite hear you, Mr. Wright.

text.Phoenix: Well... You are a big guy... And you have a pretty big wheelchair because of it... I just wanted to make sure you weren't hiding anything under that blanket. Because it seems to me that it'd be really easy to say... hide a bust under there ...

text.Acro: ...Hah hah hah hah hah... Once again, your penchant for humor hits me where it hurts, Mr. Wright.

text.Phoenix: I think it's pretty amazing that you could laugh in your position... However, your lightheartedness doesn't change the fact that the bust is under there.

We all know that you couldn't leave the lodging house by yourself in your condition. That proved inconvenient when Ms. von Karma happened to search your room yesterday. If she had found the murder weapon in your room, it would have been all over. Which is why you had to hide it. In the only place that you could hide it... Under your wheelchair.
Which is why, Acro, I have to ask you again. Would you please remove the blanket from your lap?
text._info: (Changed from [Could you please remove the blanket from the wheelchair?] in the original release)

text.Acro: ... Well done, Mr. Wright. Masterfully played.

text.Franziska: ...You!! You fool! How could you...!?

text.Acro: You've got me. I've been bagged by a real pro. Actually, two of them...

text.Phoenix: ( Two of them ...? )

text.Acro: Ms. Franziska von Karma and Mr. Phoenix Wright.

text.Franziska: ...What!?

text.Acro: There's just one think I'd like to know... How did you know to launch the surprise search on my room last night?

There were two decisive pieces of evidence... The cloak and the bust... I burned the cloak in my room and threw the ashes away with the trash. ...Regina always took my trash out every morning, you know. But the bust... Obviously I couldn't throw that away. When you executed your search, all I could do was try and hide the bust. And the only place that I could hide it quickly was under this wheelchair... Ms. von Karma, you had things all figured out, didn't you? I was completely sucked in by your calculated strategy... And now to be caught in the middle of court hiding the murder weapon... ...There's no way I can escape that. So you've got me. Well done, Mr. Wright. Well done, Ms. von Karma.

text.Judge: Hmm... It all makes sense now.

text.Maya: I can't believe that Von Karma thought that far ahead... It's amazing!

text.Phoenix: Uh huh... You definitely couldn't tell by looking at her. I know I sure couldn't.

text.Franziska: ...I can't believe it... Me...! Make a mistake! Why did I order a surprise search of your room... If only I hadn't done that...
text._info: (Changed from [...I can't believe it... I... Failed!] in the original release)

text.Judge: It seems we've arrived at the truth. Acro.
text._info: (Changed from [It doesn't matter now though. It seems as if we've arrived at the truth.] in the original release)

text.Acro: Yes, Your Honor.

text.Judge: Did you kill the Ringmaster of the Berry Big Circus, Mr. Russell Berry?

text.Acro: Yes, Your Honor. I'm responsible for that crime.

text.Maya: Acro...

text.Acro: ... All my brother wanted... was for Regina to like him. That's why he'd tease her. One day, my brother sprinkled some pepper on Regina. She started sneezing so hard... You couldn't help yourself from laughing. That's why Regina thought it'd be funny to get him back in the same way...
text._info: (Changed from [All my brother did... was want Regina to like him. That's why he'd tease her.] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: And that's why she covered the scarf in pepper...

text.Acro: I know she didn't mean for anything bad to happen... I know this... She just wanted to make my brother sneeze a few times, too... But... I just couldn't forgive her! No matter what. What am I truly guilty of? ...I'm guilty of never, ever being able to understand her. "Your brother became a star." Regina believed in that so purely... that she would laugh innocently when saying it... Too innocently... I just couldn't stand it... No matter how hard I tried.
text._info: (Changed from [I know she didn't want anything bad to happen... I know this...] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: That's when you decided to do something about Regina...

text.Franziska: How... dreadful...
text._info: (Changed from [What do you mean by that...?] in the original release)

text.Judge: So are you saying that you are a victim in all of this as well?

text.Acro: No... That's not what I mean. I'm nothing but a murderer. That's who I am... At first, I thought I'd kill myself. Then I pondered giving myself up... But... I couldn't just up and leave... I just couldn't... Not yet... That's why... I tried... to pin this... on Max. Max... I'm so sorry...! I just... I just... I just couldn't up and leave yet...
text._info: (Changed from [But... I couldn't just up and leave... I just couldn't...] in the original release)

text.Judge: This has been such a strange case... It's almost a reflection of the circus itself.

text.Franziska: I'm... An... Idiot... I can't believe it... You... Beat me... Again.

text.Judge: I believe this case is now beyond any point of possible discussion. Thus, I'd like to declare my verdict.
This court is adjourned.

text.ACTION: December 30, 4:27 PM District Court Defendant Lobby No. 5

text.Max: F-F-F-FABULOUS!! But to be honest, I can't really be too happy about this.

text.Maya: Acro, the Ringmaster, Regina, and Bat... Not a single one of them was a bad person inside, huh?

text.Max: That's a good question. And one I don't know the answer to.

text.Moe: Many congrats! But only, at max, a million of them!
text._info: (Changed from [Congratulations! Congratulations Mr. Max!] in the original release)

text.Max: T-Thank you. ...

text.Moe: What's with the vibe in this room?

text.Maya: We're just thinking about Acro...

text.Moe: No no no no no! If you worry about people too much, then you'll be like this forever, and never be happy!

text.Maya: Huh?

text.Regina: WAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHH!!

text.Moe: ...She's been like this for a while now.

text.Regina: WAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHH!!! IT'S ALL MY FAULTTTTTT!! WAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHH!!

text.Max: S-S-Sweetie... Sweetie pie...

text.Regina: Bat and Acro... They're never coming back!! Now... Now everyone's gonna split up!!

text.Maya: Regina...

text.Regina: Mr. Wright! Tell me something!

text.Phoenix: W-What do you want to know, Regina?

text.Regina: Acro said something right at the end...
...Does that mean Acro... Is he gonna try and get his revenge on me!?

CHOICE.Regina: Uwwaaahh... WAAAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHH!! Y-You're right...! He won't ever forgive me will he!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Yikes! It looks like I struck the final blow on Regina... )

CHOICE.Maya: Poor Regina...

CHOICE.ACTION: USER SELECTS I don't think so.

CHOICE.Phoenix: He's not gonna do that to you, Regina.

CHOICE.Regina: Are you sure? You're really sure!? I can believe that...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yep. Acro doesn't have any desire for revenge anymore...

CHOICE.Regina: If that's true... Then I want to see some evidence!!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Huh?

CHOICE.Regina: Acro said that all the time to you, so I thought it'd work for me too...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Acro didn't want to get caught for a reason. He wanted to see his brother open his eyes again...

CHOICE.Regina: B-Bat...!

CHOICE.Maya: That's right, Regina... He's still alive you know.

CHOICE.Regina: I... never knew... But now that Acro's been caught...
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [He is, huh...?] in the original release)

CHOICE.Maya: Uh huh...

CHOICE.Regina: I know!

CHOICE.Maya: What...?

CHOICE.Regina: I'll do it! I'll stay next to Bat as long as it takes! Until he opens his eyes... And then until he can meet Acro again!

CHOICE.Phoenix: That's so sweet of you, Regina.

CHOICE.Regina: I'm sorry, Acro... I'm sorry, Bat...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Well, hopefully this is enough to give her a little piece of mind... )
So what about this? Now do you understand there's no need to worry?
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [So what about this? No [sic] do you understand there's no need to worry?] in the original release)

CHOICE.Regina: Uwaaahhh... WAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHH!! You were lying to me!! No one ever tells me the truth!! No one ever tells me what's going on!!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Doh! Looks like I made a mistake with that one... )

CHOICE.Maya: Poor Regina...

text.Moe: Hey, Max.

text.Max: What is it, Moe?

text.Moe: We really put you through a lot, didn't we buddy? I'm sorry about what happened. So whenever you'd like to leave us, I'll pay your fee and rip up the contract.

text.Max: I understand! What a fabulous thing to do for me... I might even leave tomorrow. ... What's going to happen to the circus now?
text._info: (Changed from [I understand! Such a fabulous thing to do for me... I might even leave tomorrow.] in the original release)

text.Moe: Ahh... That's the big question. Our Ringmaster was really an amazing person, wasn't he?
Even though he's not here anymore, everyone is sticking together. The staff, the performers... No one wants to leave the circus. That's why I've made a decision...

text.Max: What is it?

text.Moe: I've decided that I will take over as the new Ringmaster. I'll turn this circus into the best circus this world has ever seen!

text.Max: ... The best circus the world has ever seen!?

text.Moe: D-D-Don't laugh!

text.Phoenix: That's quite the goal...
text._info: (Changed from [Amazing...] in the original release)

text.Maya: Yay! I can't wait!!

text.Max: Then I guess that changes things...

text.Moe: Huh?

text.Max: There's only one thing the best circus in the world has ever seen needs. The world's best illusions... Which means this circus needs the best magician the world has ever seen!

text.Moe: Max...

text.Max: Let's work together and make our circus SUPER FABULOUS! Whaddya say, big guy?

text.Moe: I don't know what to say... All I can say is thank you.

text.Phoenix: Umm... Regina, you're gonna help them out too, aren't you?

text.Regina: Umm... I don't know. Maybe the circus would be better off without me.
text._info: (Changed from [Umm... I don't know. Maybe the circus would be better of [sic] without me.] in the original release)

text.Moe: What are you talking about, Regina? Why do you think that I brought you to court today?

text.Regina: Uhh...

text.Moe: We've got to work together to make the Berry Big Circus bigger than it's ever been!

text.Regina: M-Moe...

text.Max: Moe's right, sweetie pie! It can't be the Berry Big Circus without Regina Berry!

text.Regina: M-Max...

text.Maya: Nick!

text.Phoenix: It seems like everything is going to turn out alright here...

text.Maya: I can't wait to go see the best circus the world has ever seen!

text.Max: We'll save you the most fabulous seats!

text.Moe: It'll take us a while to get ready, but I'm going to order special whoopee cushion seats! Aha! Aha! Aha! Aha! Aha! Aha! Aha! Aha! Aha! Aha! Aha! Aha! Aha! Aha! Aha! Aha! Aha! Aha!

text.Gumshoe: Yesterday's surprise raid . It really paid off, just like you said it would, sir! Umm... You had it all figured out, didn't you? ( Changed from [Umm... You had it all figured out yesterday, didn't you?] in the original release )
text._info: (Changed from [Just like you thought... Yesterday's search really paid off, sir!] in the original release)

text.Gumshoe: You mean Mr. Wright ?
Understood, sir! I'll be waiting for you... Mr. Edgeworth! ( Changed from [I'll be waiting for you! Goodbye Mr. Edgeworth!] in the original release )

text.LOCATION: Episode 3: Turnabout Big Top THE END

text.ACTION: March 20, 7:42 PM Gatewater Hotel Viola Hall

text.Maya: Alright! Yes! Did you hear that, Nick!? Did you!? The Nickel Samurai! He did it!

text.Phoenix: Yeah, he sure did... * sigh * I'm getting too old for this.

text.Will: Ah, I'm proud of the guy for doing the series justice.

text.Pearl: U-Um... So the person everyone was cheering for... I guess he got the prize?

text.Maya: Yup! You know who we're talking about, right Pearly? "The Nickel Samurai"!

text.Pearl: No. Every Sunday, I only watch the Educational Channel's "Kids' Masterpiece Theatre".

text.Maya: OK, that's it! From now on, it's "The Nickel Samurai"! All the kids watch it!

text.Pearl: Do you like "The Nickel Samurai" too, Mr. Nick?

text.Maya: Nah, Nick's an old fart, so he's not allowed to watch it anymore.

text.Phoenix: That's right. But I do like "Kids' Masterpiece Theatre".

text.Maya: Hey, I didn't know you were so young at heart, Nick!

text.Pearl: Mr. Nick! You're a grown-up! You're not allowed to watch it anymore! You're supposed to act your age and have interests that match. ...It's very important.

text.Maya: Aw, give it a rest, Pearly!

text.Will: Looks like I made the right choice in inviting everyone here. I'm glad you're all having a good time.

text.Maya: Aaaaah... It's like a dream!

text.Will: Too bad for the Jammin' Ninja, though. Last year, he lost to The Pink Princess: Warrior of Little Olde Tokyo. I thought this might be his year...

text.Maya: Yeah... Oh, hey, did anyone else think that the Jammin' Ninja was a bit different today?

text.Pearl: Different? What do you mean?

text.Maya: Um, well, he wasn't carrying his bright red guitar.

text.Will: Hey, you're right! Strange he'd walk around without his signature guitar.

text.Phoenix: ( ... * sigh * I will never understand these people and their shows... ) Anyway, Mr. Powers, thank you very much for tonight.

text.Will: A-Aw, it was nothing... I owe you one, so it's just my way of saying thanks.

text.Maya: Hey, Nick! Come on! It's time to get going to the lobby! There's a post-ceremony stage show that's supposed to start real soon.

text.Will: And then, I heard there's going to be a press conference after that.

text.Phoenix: A press conference? Is he going to make a speech about winning this year's prize?

text.Will: Uh, well, not exactly... Something about the Nickel Samurai confessing something.

text.Phoenix: Confessing...? Sounds pretty serious.

text.Maya: Argh! Nick! COME ON! You don't want us to be the last ones there, do you!?

text.Pearl: Yeah, Mr. Nick! Do you!?

text.Phoenix: ( Why me...? The show doesn't even start for another 20 minutes... )

CHOICE.Phoenix: There's a grand set of doors over there.

CHOICE.Will: And behind those doors is an equally grand lobby.

CHOICE.Pearl: Shall we go and take a look, Mr. Nick?

CHOICE.Maya: Hey, wait up! This grand dessert is calling to me... It's saying, "Eat me now!"

CHOICE.Phoenix: This sure is one luxurious hotel. Almost to the point of gaudy, with how it blends together everything "fancy" imaginable. ( Speaking of fancy, didn't that bellboy give me something like that last year? )

CHOICE.Maya: That chandelier is really something, isn't it?

CHOICE.Pearl: I thought it was a kind of space ship...

CHOICE.Maya: Hey, Nick. How about we get one of these for the office?

CHOICE.Phoenix: One of those hanging from our poor, weak ceiling? I don't think so.

CHOICE.Maya: If this is all a dream, I don't ever want to wake up! And all the directors and stars that were here to see the heroes, wow.

CHOICE.Phoenix: I had no idea who most of them were.

CHOICE.Pearl: Neither did I.

CHOICE.Maya: Nick, you've got to cut that "news only" habit out. Your new show is going to be "The Nickel Samurai!" Every Sunday morning at 8! Oh, I know! We can watch it together starting next week! I'll come wake you up extra early to make sure, OK?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ah, I'm fine... You know, you really don't have to on my account...
The awards ceremony was just held on that stage. It was really fabulous.

CHOICE.Pearl: You just reminded me of the circus for a second.

CHOICE.Maya: Well, shows like that are guaranteed to be good, you know?
What can I say? This is a really high-class hotel!

CHOICE.Pearl: I've never eaten this kind of salad before.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Poor Pearls, having eaten only vegetables all her life. She's been missing out... )

CHOICE.Maya: Don't worry! Any leftovers belong in my happily awaiting stomach anyway!

CHOICE.Phoenix: You're such a glutton, Maya.

CHOICE.Will: Ah, I lose this one to Maya. You sure can eat.

CHOICE.Maya: Well, a growing girl needs her nutrients!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( A growing girl? Exactly how big do you plan on getting...? )
Thank you very much for inviting us today.

CHOICE.Will: Aww, it was nothing really. Guys like us don't get to come to a place like this often, so I thought I'd invite you all.

CHOICE.Maya: Hey, Mr. Powers! What have you been up to lately?

CHOICE.Will: Well, since "The Pink Princess" successfully wrapped up last month, I've been on a kid's exercise show... ...while wearing a rabbit mask over my face...

CHOICE.Maya: Oh, I see.

CHOICE.Will: I'm still really sorry about all the headaches I caused you that time, Mr. Wright.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ah, well. What's done is done, so let's forget about it. ( This is Will Powers. He's an action star. His popularity exploded when he was the Steel Samurai. And he was the first case Maya worked on with me. )

CHOICE.Maya: It's too bad you look scary, or people'd know you're a real softy who's good with kids.
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [You can't tell by looking at you, but you're a really nice guy with a love of kids.] in the original release)

CHOICE.Will: Um, thanks.
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [Ah, thanks.] in the original release)

CHOICE.Phoenix: I can't believe they're going to make a movie based on the Nickel Samurai.

CHOICE.Maya: I can't believe it either, but for a different reason!

CHOICE.Phoenix: The Steel Samurai. An epic story of one hero in a desperate fight against his arch-enemy, the Evil Magistrate in the city of Neo Olde Tokyo. And last year, they started a new series, "The Nickel Samurai". The new series seems to be a hit with the kids, too.

CHOICE.Will: I'm really attached to the Steel Samurai as a show, so I was hoping that maybe I'd get a chance to do something in this new one... ( Changed from [so I hoped that maybe I'd get a chance to do something in this new one...] in the original release )
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [The Steel Samurai is a show I have a lot of strong feelings for,] in the original release)

CHOICE.Maya: Yeah, it's too bad... It'd been [sic] awesome to see you with the new actor, Matt Engarde. He's super popular right now. ( Changed from [With the new actor, Matt Engarde. He's super popular right now.] in the original release )
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [Yeah... It's too bad... It'd be great to see you on the show...] in the original release)

CHOICE.Pearl: Mr. Un-gard...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Looks like Pearls doesn't know who he is. )

CHOICE.Maya: This year it's going to be the Nickel Samurai vs. the Jammin' Ninja at the box office!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...Jammin' Ninja...? Who's that again?
So who is this "Jammin' Ninja" again?

CHOICE.Maya: He's a hero, duh. His symbol is a bright red guitar he's always carrying.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( A ninja who's always carrying around a bright red guitar...? How does that even work!? )

CHOICE.Maya: With a scarf around his neck and a guitar in hand, he rises to stardom in an ancient time.

CHOICE.Phoenix: A ninja... Who becomes a star??

CHOICE.Maya: Yeah! A ninja who becomes a star!

CHOICE.Will: There's a strong rivalry between the two of them. Global Studios' Nickel Samurai and Worldwide Studios' Jammin' Ninja. They even air at the same time.

CHOICE.Maya: You know what I heard? I heard those two don't get along at all. The Nickel Samurai's Engarde and the guy who plays the Jammin' Ninja, I mean.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( The Nickel Samurai speaks French!? Oh, you mean Matt Engarde, the actor... ) I guess even the world of heroes isn't a sparkling, happy place.

CHOICE.Will: Y-Yeah...

Ah, I really owe you one. If it wasn't for you guys, I don't know what would've happened. What you did... It was a real tight spot I was in, and you fought so hard to get me out. I don't care what happens. I'll never forget everything you've done for me.
So, you're going to study to become a lawyer too. Am I right or am I right?

CHOICE.Maya: Umm...

CHOICE.Will: It must be real tough. There's all those thick books with hard words you have to read...

CHOICE.Maya: Uh, um... Well...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Oh, yeah. Mr. Powers doesn't know that Maya's a spirit medium... )

CHOICE.Maya: I thought he'd be able to tell by my clothes.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Maybe he thinks that you've got some strange hobby on the side or something.

CHOICE.Maya: ...Hey, wait a sec. What's that's supposed to mean!?

CHOICE.Will: So are you Maya's little sister?

CHOICE.Pearl: I'm sorry, but no.

CHOICE.Will: Oh, then you must be Mr. Wright's little sister!

CHOICE.Pearl: Again, I'm sorry, but...

CHOICE.Will: Then... Whose little sister are you?

CHOICE.Pearl: I'm sorry, but I'm an only child.

CHOICE.Will: Oh, I see... S-Sorry.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Pearl looks so sad... She looks really sorry too... )

CHOICE.Will: Hey, is my face really all that scary? Kids won't come anywhere near me... But when I cover my face, they're all shocked because then they figure out who I am.

CHOICE.Maya: Hmm... Well, I don't think you look scary.

CHOICE.Pearl: Me either. I think your face makes you look like a very kind person!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Aww... Those two are making Mr. Powers tear up... )

CHOICE.Will: S-Sorry. Thanks for taking the time to take it out and show it to me, but I'm really sorry, I don't know a thing about it.

text.Phoenix: Wow, what is with this place? Looks like I've stumbled into Oz or something. Way in the back, there's a sign for the bathroom. Maybe I should visit it while I can before the show starts...
text._info: (Changed from [I bet we have a little time to look around before the show starts...] in the original release)

CHOICE.Phoenix: I can understand flowers in front of the dressing rooms, but what are stuffed bears doing here...? Could it be that there's an action star who has a soft spot for teddy bears...? ...Nah, can't be.

Compared to the flowers on the other side of the hall, these are much more gorgeous. Let's see... Record companies, fan clubs, company workers, family... Carrying all these flowers home would be hard, I think...

There's a piece of paper taped to the door that says, "Juan Corrida's Room". "Juan Corrida"... His name just sounds like a star's name. I've heard it before, but I don't know anything about him at all.

There are toilets in each room in this hotel, but since all sorts of events are held here, there are bathrooms for people who aren't staying here to use as well. Perfect for people like me, who can't afford a stay here in the first place...
"To Mr. Engarde From the Global Studio Staff" Ah, it'd be nice if lawyers got flowers too. Something like, "To Mr. Wright From All Your Grateful Clients".
There's a piece of paper taped to the door that says, "Matt Engarde's Room". "Matt Engarde"... I've heard that name before. Oh, yeah. Maya's always yammering about him like the obsessed fan she is...

text.Will: Sounds like the post-ceremony show is about to start.

text.Maya: Alright! I'm so pumped! I wonder if he's going to show off his special move today? "Nickel Samurai Smelting!"

text.Will: Actually, what I'm interested in most is the press conference.

text.Maya: You mean the "big confession" the Nickel Samurai's going to make after the show? So what is it? Don't you know what it's about, Mr. Powers?

text.Will: Uh, well, I'm not the Steel Samurai anymore, so I don't have any idea.

text.Maya: Bah.

text.Will: S-Sorry. Ah, so I guess you are all going to the press conference then?

text.Maya: Yeah, of course!

text.Will: If that's the case, then here, take these tickets so you can get in.

text.Phoenix: Thank you very much. Well, let's get going to the lobby.

text.Pearl: It looks like it's over this way, Mr. Nick!

text.Maya: OK! For great justice!

CHOICE.Will: They called this so suddenly that something about it just seems off, you know?

CHOICE.Phoenix: You mean the press conference?

CHOICE.Will: Yeah. He said, "There's something I'd like to confess if I win." I heard he faxed his request for a conference in to the office only yesterday.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yesterday... ( Yeah, that is kind of sudden. )

CHOICE.Will: But I guess his manager set everything up somehow, so he was lucky.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Hmm... Nice manager.

text.Phoenix: Hmm... Only a really gaudy hotel would have such a large, gaudy lobby to match.

text.Pearl: Ah, I think they're going to have the post-ceremony show over there.

text.Phoenix: They're using a compact stage, I see.

text.Maya: Ooh... I'm all ready to use my special "Samurai Power".

text.Phoenix: ( Maya looks like she's ready to start a fight... )

text.PA Notice: Your attention please, your attention please. The Nickel Samurai's Post-Ceremony Stage Show will not be held tonight due to unforeseen circumstances.

text.Maya: WHAAAT!? WHYYYYY!?

text.Phoenix: Oww! You didn't have to pinch me! Pinch yourself if you don't believe it!

text.PA Notice: We are asking for everyone's cooperation at this time. So please stay where you are. ...This is a special request from the police .

text.Phoenix: P-Police? Did they just say the police?

text.Will: D-Do you want me to go check out what's going on?

text.Phoenix: Um, wait, I'll come with you...

text.???: Freeze! You two! Didn't you hear the announcement just now!? It just finished telling you not to move!

text.Maya: Th-That voice... I've heard that voice somewhere before...

text.???: Honestly, youth these days can't be bothered to listen to other people when they talk! Just the other day it was the same thing! There was a small footbridge with a sign next to it that said, "Beware, Bridge Out!" And along comes a snot-nosed little punk kid right up to the bridge. I tried to tell the boy the bridge was out and it was dangerous, but would he listen!? No, of course not! He said he'd be careful and only walk on the "in" part of the bridge since the "out" part is what was dangerous! I am not kidding you here! The kid said that and really meant it! WELL! I really let him have it then, and knocked him clear off of that bridge! Honestly, kids these days don't know right from wrong, I tell you!

text.Will: This non-stop chatter...

text.Phoenix: I-It can't be... ...Ms. Oldbag?

text.Oldbag: What is it, you young whipper-snappers!? Do I know you!? ...Wait. YOU! You're Powers, aren't you!?

text.Will: Y-Yeah. Um, about what happened back then...

text.Oldbag: You didn't even get nominated this year, did you? Oh, that's right. You're doing that children's exercise program, trying to play nice.
text._info: (Changed from [You didn't get nominated last year either, did you?] in the original release)

text.Will: Ah, yeah, that's me. Thankfully I still have a job...

text.Oldbag: I love that show, and you're a hoot! You're the "big brother" character, right? Yes, even with your face covered by a mask, I know. You're that giant rabbit! What a work of art, but that's how it is, you know? I mean, if you didn't wear the mask, who knows how many TVs you'd break? Really, and shame on those kids exercising around you. They're getting what they deserve. This is why I thought you shouldn't be anywhere...
text._info: (Changed from [Yes, even with your face covered by a mask, I know. You ended up with a rabbit face.] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: Um... What are you doing here?

text.Oldbag: Look at my uniform and tell me you can't tell I'm a member of security!

text.Maya: But that outfit...

text.Oldbag: Annoying, noisy brats get the blaster!

CHOICE.Maya: Wow, it looks like there's a fancy restaurant on the second floor!

CHOICE.Phoenix: You STILL feel like eating?

CHOICE.Maya: I mean, since we're here, you know?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Don't pull the "since we're here" trick on me... )

CHOICE.Pearl: What a beautiful mansion. Do you live in this wonderful world every day, Mr. Nick?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Oh, no, this is my first time in a place like this.
I'm going to say these cameras were set up to cover the post-ceremony stage show.

CHOICE.Maya: But I wonder where everyone's gone, abandoning their cameras like this...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I guess something big must have happened... )
It's the stage for the post-ceremony stage show.

CHOICE.Will: There was supposed to be a press meeting after the show, but now...

CHOICE.Phoenix: It looks like no one will hear what the Nickel Samurai had to confess after all.

CHOICE.Maya: We're here, so we might as well take some pictures. OK, everyone, sit in a chair!

CHOICE.Phoenix: But we're all out of film...

CHOICE.Maya: Don't worry about it. There's a zillion cameras over there we can borrow.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Hey, hey! You can't just go and "borrow" an expensive professional camera like that!
Ms. Oldbag, what are you doing here? What happened to your position at Global Studios...?

CHOICE.Oldbag: Oh, that old place? Well, since "that" incident, they've been letting people go. When they cut the security team, I got the pink slip.

CHOICE.Maya: What incident? What did you do?

CHOICE.Oldbag: I didn't do anything, you young'un! Don't you remember? That incident a year ago... When this lady got on the witness stand and testified.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Y-Yeah...

CHOICE.Oldbag: And you! Weren't you the one who was bullying me -- this fragile girl at heart!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Um... I plead the fifth.

CHOICE.Oldbag: But you know, I think maybe I rubbed the upper management the wrong way by testifying. ... Yes, that has to be it! Everything is all your fault!

CHOICE.Phoenix: M-Me!?

CHOICE.Oldbag: I thought about being a bodyguard at first, after being handed ol' pinky.

CHOICE.Maya: You? A bodyguard?

CHOICE.Oldbag: For your friend! That fiery, good-looking guy with the red jacket and the ruffles.

CHOICE.Maya: M-Mr. Edgeworth?

CHOICE.Oldbag: But...

CHOICE.Edgeworth: That sort of arrangement would be entirely too troublesome for me.

CHOICE.Oldbag: That's what he said to me. What did I ever do to deserve that!?

CHOICE.Maya: Um... So, did something happen?

CHOICE.Oldbag: I don't have all the details, but, it looks like another one of those "incidents" happened again.

CHOICE.Will: A-An "incident"? Like a "murder" kind of "incident"?

CHOICE.Oldbag: Maybe. You see, I'm a bit of a devilish woman. So wherever I go, showers of blood are sure to follow. Bet you didn't know that!
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [So wherever I go, a rain of blood will come pouring down. Bet you didn't know that!] in the original release)

CHOICE.Phoenix: Um, then shouldn't you quit being a security guard, at least for other people's sake?

CHOICE.Oldbag: Silence, whippersnapper!
These eyes of mine are real pros now!

CHOICE.Phoenix: "Pros"? Pros at doing what?

CHOICE.Oldbag: At doing police work, of course! My eyes are like a hawk! And my professional eyes spot a messy incident! A messy, bloody incident! That's why I don't have time for you meddling kids and your petty little things!

text.Maya: ...Hey, Nick.

text.Phoenix: Wh-What is it? I don't like that devilish smile playing on your lips...

text.Maya: Let's make like we're going to the bathroom, and check things out!

text.Phoenix: N-No way. The police told us not go [sic] anywhere, remember?

text.Maya: Huh!? How B-O-R-I-N-G! You're such a boring guy! You've got no motivation! No spirit!

text.Pearl: Huh? What? What's going on? Are you giving Mystic Maya trouble again, Mr. Nick?

text.Phoenix: ( Not you too, Pearls... Please don't stick your little nose into this one... )

text.Maya: So listen to this, Pearly. This one time at lawyer camp, Nick...

text.Phoenix: O-OK! I get it! Let's go take a look.

text.Maya: Yay! I know you couldn't say no to me, Nick!

text.Pearl: That's right. You'd walk over miles of hot coals for Mystic Maya, wouldn't you Mr. Nick?

text.Phoenix: ( That would be EVERY time we work a case together... )

text.Maya: Well, what are we waiting for? Let's go already! You can come along too, Pearly.

text.Pearl: Goody! I get to come! I get to come!

text.Phoenix: There's nothing really out of the ordinary here...

text.Pearl: Are you looking for the "in-si-dent" that the old lady was talking about?
text._info: (Changed from [Are you looking for the 'something' that the old lady was talking about?] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: Doesn't look like it happened here. Well, we'd better go look somewhere else.

text.Maya: Alright! Then, let's try...
Ack!

text.Bellboy: Are you by chance, Ms. Maya Fey?

text.Maya: Um, yeah... That's me.

text.Bellboy: You have a phone call waiting for you at the front desk.

text.Maya: A call? I wonder if it's someone from Kurain Village...

text.Pearl: What's wrong, Mystic Maya?

text.Maya: Oh, nothing. You guys go on ahead and I'll be right there, OK?
text._info: (Changed from [Oh, nothing. I'll just go on ahead to check it out, OK?] in the original release)

text.Pearl: OK.
Let's go look somewhere else now, Mr. Nick.

text.Phoenix: Yeah, OK.

text.Pearl: This is a little exciting... And a little scary...

CHOICE.Phoenix: There's a grand set of doors over there. It's the doors Maya followed the bellboy out of.

CHOICE.Pearl: So, that's called a "shan-deh leer", right?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yup.

CHOICE.Pearl: What is that for? What does it do?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Well, it's for lighting up a room, Pearls.

CHOICE.Pearl: Um, Mr. Nick? Can I look down now? My neck hurts...

CHOICE.Phoenix: They haven't cleaned up all the food yet. There's a sad feeling hanging in the air now that the party is over...
The awards ceremony was just held on that stage. It was really fabulous.

CHOICE.Pearl: You just reminded me of the circus for a second. I wonder if everyone is alright.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I heard that Berry Big Circus just recently started holding performances again... ) I'm sure they're all fine, Pearls.

CHOICE.Pearl: It's a feast fit for a king!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah.

CHOICE.Pearl: It was the first time I ate that food. What was it called again? I think it started with "key". Key... Wee?

CHOICE.Phoenix: That's right, a "kiwi".

CHOICE.Pearl: I don't know what to say. It's a sweet but sour fruit all in one.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Poor Pearls, having eaten only vegetables all her life. She's been missing out... )
A lobby with a grand staircase always feels enormous. But right now, the only thing filling this enormous room is anxiety about the murder. ...I really hope nothing else bad happens here...
These cameras must belong to the press that came to cover the conference. They're all basically doing the same thing: staring at the empty stage.
Seats for the spectators of the post-ceremony show and the press conference. But it's too bad neither event is going to be held now.
Ms. Oldbag, what are you doing here? What happened to your position at Global Studios...?

CHOICE.Oldbag: Oh, that old place? Well, since "that" incident, they've been letting people go. When they cut the security team, I got the pink slip.

CHOICE.Pearl: Um, I guess you must have done something... um... "deh-plor-ible"...

CHOICE.Oldbag: "Deplorable!?" I would never do such a thing! Don't you remember? That incident a year ago... When this lady got on the witness stand and testified.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Y-Yeah...

CHOICE.Oldbag: And you! Weren't you the one who was bullying me -- this fragile girl at heart!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Um... I plead the fifth.

CHOICE.Oldbag: But you know, I think maybe I rubbed the upper management the wrong way by testifying. ... Yes, that has to be it! Everything is all your fault!

CHOICE.Phoenix: M-Me!?

CHOICE.Oldbag: I thought about being a bodyguard at first, after being handed ol' pinky.

CHOICE.Pearl: "Body...guard?"

CHOICE.Oldbag: For your friend! That fiery, good-looking guy with the red jacket and the ruffles.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( She's not talking about Edgeworth, is she...? )

CHOICE.Oldbag: But...

CHOICE.Edgeworth: That sort of arrangement would be entirely too troublesome for me.

CHOICE.Oldbag: That's what he said to me. What did I ever do to deserve that!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: I'm sorry, but what in the world just happened?

CHOICE.Oldbag: I don't have all the details, but, it looks like another one of those "incidents" happened again.

CHOICE.Will: A-An "incident"? Like a "murder" kind of "incident"?

CHOICE.Oldbag: Maybe. You see, I'm a bit of a devilish woman. So wherever I go, showers of blood are sure to follow. Bet you didn't know that!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Um, then shouldn't you quit being a security guard, at least for other people's sake?

CHOICE.Oldbag: Silence, whippersnapper!

text.Pearl: Those two sound pretty serious...

text.Phoenix: ( That southern accent can only mean... )
H-Hey... Lotta...

text.Lotta: Come on, do a gal a favor and tell this cop I'm just doin' my job and I've got rights...

text.Gumshoe: Ah, YOU!

text.Phoenix: Ah... Detective Gumshoe...

text.Gumshoe: Hey pal, help a guy out! Tell her that only the police are allowed here! This is the scene of a murder, so she should leave this to us pros...

text.Pearl: A... A murder!?

text.Gumshoe: Aw, shoot! Me and my big mouth!

text.Lotta: See! I knew it! My gut instinct told me so! I always trust my gut! A murder, it said! And that's what it is! A genuine murder!

text.Gumshoe: H-Hey, wait...
Oh, man... I'm in trouble now...

CHOICE.Phoenix: So... Detective Gumshoe... A murder...?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Ah, no, that's not it. I got my facts mixed up for a second there, pal.

CHOICE.Pearl: U-Um... Mr. Nick? Is the dead person the Nickel Samurai...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Huh? Why do you ask?

CHOICE.Pearl: Well, Mystic Maya was rooting for him, so...

CHOICE.Gumshoe: It wasn't the Nickel Samurai that got bumped. Actually, the Nickel Samurai is the one under suspicion of doing the bumping off ...

CHOICE.Phoenix: What?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: The guy that died was this hero named the Jammin' Ninja , pal.

CHOICE.Phoenix: The Jammin' Ninja...

CHOICE.Pearl: Um, that woman with the big puffy hair that looks like cotton candy...

CHOICE.Phoenix: You mean Lotta?

CHOICE.Pearl: That woman... She was there that time too, right?

CHOICE.Phoenix: That time?

CHOICE.Pearl: ...When Mystic Maya did that channeling...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Oh, that time... Well, Lotta's a journalist, so that's why she was there.

CHOICE.Pearl: Jer-nal-ist...

CHOICE.Gumshoe: It looks like she was hanging around here before the murder happened.

CHOICE.Phoenix: "Hanging around"...?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Yeah, hiding in wait in front of the Jammin' Ninja's door , pal.

CHOICE.Phoenix: B-But why would she...?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: She wouldn't tell me, pal. Just said something about "Gettin' my big scoop"...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Scoop ? What sort of news could she be after...? )
So the victim was the Jammin' Ninja?

CHOICE.Pearl: Mr. Jammin' Ninja...?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: He was on a really popular rival TV show to "The Nickel Samurai".

CHOICE.Pearl: Oh...

CHOICE.Gumshoe: The victim was the action star, Juan Corrida. He got a huge push and rode the express train to stardom. I mean, even I know who he is!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Yeah, even I recognize his face... )

CHOICE.Gumshoe: But I heard lately that Matt Engarde's been taking the wind out of his sail. I'm telling you, pal, as far as who's popular, those two are hogging all the limelight.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I guess there's no space for Mr. Powers at all, huh... Poor guy... )

CHOICE.Pearl: Mr. Engarde... Um... That's the Nickel Samurai, right...?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Yup. I mean, no! You've got to say it with more umph! "The Nickel Samurai!"

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...Anyway, so now that Juan Corrida's gone, that means Mr. Engarde has the whole stage to himself, wouldn't you say?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: I wouldn't bet on it, pal. We can't have that happen, you know?

CHOICE.Phoenix: "Can't have that happen"? ( What's that supposed to mean, I wonder... )
Wh-Why was Mr. Engarde arrested?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Sorry, pal, but that's not something I can tell you. We just started the investigation, so we don't want any leaks.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Looks like yet another "Steel Samurai" hero is in hot water... )

CHOICE.Pearl: Um... Mr. Nick... If Mystic Maya knew about this...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah, I know. She'd make me take this case... I know...

CHOICE.Gumshoe: I was really shocked by what happened to her in that one case. I didn't know she had such an awesome power!

CHOICE.Pearl: Awesome power...?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: I thought maybe I should do some self-improvement and take up a hobby. So I went out and bought some Morning Glory seeds and planted them, pal.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...That's a good way to improve yourself.

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Ho ho ho. Well, it's nothing really...
That girl is number three on my "People I've Seen A Lot Of Lately" list.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Oh? Then who's number one...?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: As if you need to ask. It's YOU, pal!

CHOICE.Phoenix: A-Ah... So who's number two?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Maya Fey. ...But it looks like she's not around this time.

CHOICE.Pearl: It must be nice to be such good friends with each other, isn't it Mr. Nick?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Somehow, I don't think that's the real meaning of Detective Gumshoe's list... )

CHOICE.Gumshoe: I look good! I think I've lost some weight, pal!

CHOICE.Phoenix: It's only wishful thinking.

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Wishful thinking, huh? ... In that case, I wishfully think I've lost some weight!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I wishfully think he might face the facts one day... )

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Lately, I've been on the instant noodles only diet, pal!
I'm not a real fan of action shows or anything... But I know who Juan Corrida and Matt Engarde are.

CHOICE.Phoenix: You can't talk about one without talking about the other, I guess.

CHOICE.Gumshoe: They even debuted around the same time. So they have this real fiery rivalry with each other. Kinda like you and me, pal!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I never knew he thought of me as a rival... )

CHOICE.Gumshoe: The Nickel Samurai! He really took the Grand Prix tonight!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Maya's a big fan of his.

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Really? ...Oh, I'm sorry then.

CHOICE.Pearl: Why are you sorry?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Matt Engarde was just arrested, pal. ... On suspicion of murdering Juan Corrida .

CHOICE.Pearl: What!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Would you take a look at this for me?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Listen, pal... I'm not leaking any info about the evidence to you this time. If I do, my salary's really gonna get it... And then I won't even be able to get those instant noodles down at the discount market!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Do you know this person?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: You meet a lot of people as a detective, pal. So we make extra sure to not forget people because that's our job. ...Now, having said that, I don't remember ever seeing this person before.

CHOICE.Pearl: Which means that you're kind of forgetful, aren't you Mr. Detective?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: That's not what it means... Not exactly anyway...

text.ACTION: After clearing "The victim" and "Arrested?" Talk options in Gatewater Hotel - Hallway:

text.Will: Hey! So what's going on, Mr. Wright?

text.Phoenix: It looks like Juan Corrida has been killed.

text.Will: Wh-Wh-What!? Juan is... He's...!?

text.Phoenix: It looks like he was murdered... And a suspect was arrested. That suspect is Mr. Matt Engarde.

text.Will: Y-You're joking, right!?

text.Phoenix: Nope. They arrested the Nickel Samurai on suspicion of murdering the Jammin' Ninja.

text.Will: Ooogh... Not again... I feel sick.

text.Pearl: "Again"...?

text.Phoenix: ...About a year ago, something just like this happened, Pearls.

text.Will: I still can't believe... No way... No way Matt would...

text.Phoenix: ( ...? What's Mr. Powers got in his hand...? )

text.Will: ...Oh, before I forget... This... This is for you, Mr. Wright. I got this from the bellboy that came by earlier.

text.Phoenix: ...For me...? But why?

text.Will: I don't know. All he said was it was for Mr. Phoenix Wright, the attorney.

CHOICE.Will: Matt is the most energetic and active actor out there right now. The Nickel Samurai really sealed his place as a pop idol, but... he kept adding fuel to the fire of his rivalry with Juan anyway.

CHOICE.Pearl: Mr. Juan... He's the Jammin' Ninja, right?

CHOICE.Will: Those two would butt heads over everything they could think of. But I'd say that Matt was the one who almost always came out on top.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I guess some people only know how to relate to others by butting heads like a ram... )

CHOICE.Will: Juan said that he'd take Matt on this time too, so he joined a rival TV show.

CHOICE.Pearl: And that was "The Jammin' Ninja"...?

CHOICE.Will: The stylish Nickel Samurai and the burning Jammin' Ninja... Well, things turned messy real fast with those two using their shows for their "war". And the final tally... Look around... It's pretty obvious how things ended up.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Matt even won the Grand Prix this year... The final win over his rival, I guess... )
Mr. Engarde was going to hold a press conference, wasn't he?

CHOICE.Will: That's what I heard. Though if you wanted to get technical about it, it was the Nickel Samurai's conference.

CHOICE.Phoenix: The Nickel Samurai's...?

CHOICE.Will: Yeah. He was supposed to wear his costume and give the press conference that way.

CHOICE.Phoenix: He was going to be in costume...? But why?
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [So he was supposed to be in-costume...? But why?] in the original release)

CHOICE.Will: I'm not sure... They don't keep me in the loop anymore.
It was almost right after you guys left. An old man who's a bellboy at this hotel showed up.

CHOICE.Phoenix: And that's when he told you to give this to me...?

CHOICE.Will: Yeah...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Why... Why give me this transceiver...? )

CHOICE.Will: Hey, where did Maya go off to?

CHOICE.Phoenix: She got a phone call.

CHOICE.Will: Oh yeah, that's right. She was heading for the front desk just now. She sure stands out in a crowd, doesn't she?
Hey, is my face really all that scary? Kids won't come anywhere near me... But when I cover my face, then they're all shocked because they figure out who I am...

CHOICE.Pearl: I think your face makes you look like a very kind person!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Aww... Mr. Powers is getting teary eyed. )

CHOICE.Will: He debuted around the same time as Matt in everything, you know.

CHOICE.Pearl: Really?

CHOICE.Will: Yeah, it started out small... First it was singing contests, then swimming competitions... Then it was bowling tournaments, and then it was who could throw the best New Year's parties... Juan was always trying to one-up Matt. But lately, those two were escalating to more and more dangerous things... I thought that no good would come of it all, so I began to worry.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Too bad Juan's story ended so soon... )

CHOICE.Will: Matt's younger than me, but you can practically see his star potential.

CHOICE.Pearl: His star po-ten-shial...?

CHOICE.Will: I got his autograph the other day.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...Feels kind of wrong now, doesn't it?

CHOICE.Will: I don't care what people say! Matt didn't kill Juan! I know he didn't!
Umm... I'm honored you're asking me, But I have no idea who this person is. Umm... Sorry...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ah, it's OK. You don't have to apologize so much.

CHOICE.Will: S-Sorry.

text.Pearl: Um... I was just wondering... Where's Mystic Maya? She's been gone a long time.

text.Phoenix: ( Now that she mentions it, she was only going to answer a phone call... )

text.Pearl: Maybe she got lost. I'll take a quick look around for her.

text.Phoenix: Ack!

text.Pearl: Wh-What is it, Mr. Nick!?

text.Phoenix: Huh? I... I'm not sure... ( It's coming from this transceiver... )
text._info: (Changed from [Did this transceiver just...?] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: Y-Yes, hello? Wright here...

text.???: Is this Mr. Phoenix Wright, the attorney?

text.Phoenix: And you are...!?

text.???: You don't need to know who I am. I think you have other things to be concerning yourself with... Such as...

text.Maya: Heeelp! Niiiiick!

text.Pearl: M-Mystic Maya!

text.Phoenix: Maya...?

text.???: So, Mr. Wright. Wouldn't you agree that the more important issue is the fate of the girl?

text.Phoenix: ( Her fate? Does he mean what I think he means...? ) Maya! Where are you!? Are you hurt!?

text.???: Come now. Don't fall apart on me yet.

text.Phoenix: ( Th-This... No! This can't be! )

text.???: Now that I have your attention, Mr. Attorney, I have a modest proposal for you. If you do what I require, then I will return to you your valuable " item " unharmed. ...What is this called again in your fancy lawyer terms?

text.Phoenix: ..."Kidnapping for ransom"...

text.???: Yes, that's it. This is a kidnapping .

text.Pearl: Aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaah! Mystic Maya! Mystic Mayaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa!!

text.Phoenix: ( M-My sight... Everything's fading away... Maya... Maya... Maya's been kidnapped ! )

text.???: ...--re you there? Mr. Attorney, are you there?
text._info: (Changed from [You there? Mr. Wright, are you there?] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: H-How much!? How much do you want!?

text.???: Very good, Mr. Attorney. I'm glad you have such a good grasp of the situation.

text.Phoenix: Hurry up and state your condition! And then return Maya--

text.???: Money is not what I seek.

text.Phoenix: ...What?

text.???: What I want is a certain verdict . I would like a complete acquittal .

text.Phoenix: Complete acquittal!? Wh-What in the world have you done to need...!?

text.???: I am not the person you will be representing.

text.Phoenix: What...?

text.???: You are currently at the Gatewater Hotel, are you not? And I know that a murder has just taken place there.

text.Phoenix: Juan Corrida was killed, and the suspect is Matt Engarde...

text.???: You are, as expected, quite on top of things, Mr. Attorney. Now then. What I want is very simple. I want you to obtain a complete acquittal for Matt Engarde.

text.Phoenix: M-Matt Engarde? But why?

text.???: He did not kill anyone. I can attest to that. However...

text.Phoenix: H-However!? However what!?

text.???: However, someone is framing him for the murder. A very smart someone who is setting him up to take the fall...

text.Phoenix: ... ( If I agree and do what he wants, can I believe he'll keep his end of the bargain!? )

text.???: You are, of course, at liberty to take me at my word or not. However, there is one thing you can take as fact. Right now, your very precious " item " is with me, in my possession.
text._info: (Changed from [You are, of course, at liberty to believe me or not.] in the original release)

text.Maya: Mmngnhhh... Heeelp!... Nngmph... NIIIICK!

text.Phoenix: Maya!

text.???: You have two days. Of course, tonight, he will be in questioning with the police. But the trial is in two days. At that trial, you will win a not guilty verdict. Remember, you only have one chance . One chance, Mr. Attorney.
text._info: (Changed from [Remember, you only have one chance. One chance, Mr. Wright.] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: O-One...!? Y-You expect me to get a not guilty in one trial day!?

text.???: Yes, exactly. I don't believe I was wrong in choosing you, so don't let me down.

text.Phoenix: Aagh!

text.???: Oh, yes, that's right. Now that I am playing the role of the kidnapper, I can't pass up this chance to say, "And don't even think about callin' the cops!" ...Hmm, not great, but you get the idea.

text.Phoenix: D-Dammit! Who... Who the hell are you!?

text.???: Alright, I'll tell you that much. My name is... ...De Killer.

text.Pearl: M-Mr. Nick! Wh-Where is Mystic Maya!?

text.Phoenix: ...She's been kidnapped.

text.Pearl: N-No... ... It's all my fault! If only I had gone with Mystic Maya...!

text.Phoenix: It's not your fault, Pearls.

text.Pearl: But it is! It is! Mystic Mayaaaaaaaaaa! Waaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaah!

text.Will: Mr. Wright... I think we... I think we should tell the police what it's [sic] going on...!

text.Phoenix: ( No! We can't do that! If we do, who knows what will happen to Maya... )

text.Pearl: Mr. Nick! What about the detective we saw earlier...?

text.Phoenix: ( ...Detective Gumshoe! ) Yes, that's it! Wait here, and I'll be right back!

text.Will: Alright! I'll take care of Pearl while you're away!

text.Gumshoe: WHAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAT!? RAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAANSOM!?

text.Phoenix: Shhh! Not so loud! ...The ransom is complete acquittal for Matt Engarde.

text.Gumshoe: Wait, the deal is "complete acquittal" in exchange for Maya, you mean...? Then this means Matt Engarde is obviously the killer , pal! No doubt about it!

text.Phoenix: But the guy said that Mr. Engarde is innocent...

text.Gumshoe: You really believe what a KIDNAPPER tells you, pal!?

text.Phoenix: ( I guess he has a point... If Engarde is really innocent, then why the kidnapping? )

text.Gumshoe: And on top of everything else, there's all this evidence we keep finding.

text.Phoenix: Huh?

text.Gumshoe: The forensics team's having a field day back there.
text._info: (Changed from [The guys with the eagle eyes are really lapping it up like they just caught a huge fish.] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: Umm...

text.Gumshoe: But it's strange. There's so much evidence that it feels like something's wrong.

text.Phoenix: There's too much evidence? Is that possible? ( Actually, didn't the kidnapper say something about Engarde being " set-up "...? )

text.Gumshoe: Anyway, looks like you won't be leaving here tonight, pal. Just sit tight and cooperate with the investigation. Tomorrow you can start yours.

text.Phoenix: ...A-Alright... ( Isn't there another way...? )

text.Gumshoe: We've also got to be careful about pushing the kidnapper the wrong way.

text.Phoenix: You're right...

text.Maya: Nnngh... Oww, my head... ( Wh-Where... Where am I!? I wonder if I'm still in that hotel... Wh-What happened to me...? ) Nick... Pearly! ... ( Come on, you guys. This isn't funny anymore... )

text.???: I see you have awoken.

text.Maya: Aaaaaaaaaaaaaah! Wh-Wh-Wh-Who are you!?

text.???: Me? ...I am known as "De Killer".

text.Maya: "D-De Killer"!? You mean like an "ASSASSIN"!? ( I... I'm too young to die! )

text.???: Don't worry. You are not my target. ...For now anyway.

text.Maya: A-Aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaah! Nick! Nick! Where are you!? ...Help me...

text.???: Yes, that's right. Only one person can save you now, and that is Mr. Phoenix Wright.

text.Maya: ...Huh? Wh-What? Nick... Nick's going to save me...?

text.???: Calm down and be a good girl. Think of this as a business transaction .

text.Maya: A... A business transaction?

text.???: I am going to contact him now. I hope you'll cooperate and play your assigned role well.

text.Maya: ...Nick... What's going to happen to me? Nick... Pearly... ...Sis...
text._info: (Changed from [What's going to happen to me? Nick... Pearls...] in the original release)

text.???: ... Is this Mr. Phoenix Wright, the attorney? ... You don't need to know who I am. I think you have other things to be concerning yourself with... Such as...

text.ACTION: March 21, 8:11 AM Wright & Co. Law Offices

text.Pearl: Good morning!

text.Phoenix: Ah, morning, Pearls.

text.Pearl: Mr. Nick! Mr. Nick! Come on! Let's hurry and go see Mr. Engarde!

text.Phoenix: We have to wait a bit, Pearls. Visiting hours don't start until 9 AM, so...

text.Pearl: Oh, I see. Ah, Mystic Maya! If only... If only I had gone with you...
text._info: (Changed from [Ah, Mystic Maya! If only... If only I went with you that time...] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: ( Poor Pearls... She's been like this since last night... We managed to get home somehow, yesterday evening... Thanks to Detective Gumshoe gently holding her by the hand and leading her here... But by the looks of it, I don't think Pearls got any sleep at all last night. )

text.Pearl: Mr. Nick! Mystic Maya... She's alright, right!?

text.Phoenix: Yeah, she's alright. Either way, I'm going to save her. You can trust me on that.

text.Pearl: Please... Please... Help her...

text.Phoenix: ( I'm only able to stay this calm and collected... Because Pearls is doing the crying for the both of us... )

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...No matter where I look in this familiar space I call my office... No, I can't let my mind wander now! I don't have the time! I've got to get going on this case!

CHOICE.Pearl: Um... I have a thought...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Huh?

CHOICE.Pearl: You're going to represent Mr. Engarde... aren't you?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah. I don't really seem to have a choice.

CHOICE.Pearl: Um, but what if... What if he... ...is the real murderer ? What would you do then, Mr. Nick...?
Would you fight to get a not guilty for a murderer to save Mystic Maya...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Pearls... Let's talk to Mr. Engarde first, OK? ...We can think all the bad things we want, but it doesn't change a thing.

CHOICE.Pearl: Y-Yeah, you're right... I'm sorry. I... I can't stop thinking about it...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Pearls... You're really worried about Maya, aren't you?

CHOICE.Pearl: I... I don't have anyone else left in this world.

CHOICE.Phoenix: What do you mean...?

CHOICE.Pearl: My family's all gone...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( ...Her family... )

CHOICE.Pearl: My father... He left my mother and the village behind and went away.

CHOICE.Phoenix: I'm sorry...

CHOICE.Pearl: And... my mother... She did that thing... all for me...
Mystic Maya... She's like a sister to me... ... She is all I have left in this world...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Pearls...?
( She looks out of it... Maybe I should leave her alone... )

text.ACTION: March 21, 8:57 AM Detention Center Visitor's Room

text.Phoenix: ( We couldn't wait for visiting hours to start, so Pearls and I came down here early... To visit one Nickel Samurai, charged with the murder of the Jammin' Ninja... )
G-Good morning. How are you today?
I know this situation might be a little tough for you...
Um... We're...

text.Engarde: Oh, sorry dude...
I already signed up...

text.Phoenix: E-Excuse me...?

text.Engarde: I already have life insurance. I signed up a long time ago cause my job is, you know...

text.Phoenix: ... Oh! No no no... We're not insurance salespeople!

text.Engarde: Really...? Dude, I really don't need that right now either.
Fire extinguishers. I mean, this building isn't my house, so...

text.Phoenix: ... No no no... We're not here to sell you fire extinguishers either! I'm a lawyer. My name is Phoenix Wright.

text.Engarde: A lawyer...? ... Hold on a sec. I'm gonna ask my manager, OK? ... ...

text.Pearl: The Nickel Samurai sure is a strange person, isn't he?

text.Phoenix: ( I think "strange" is an understatement. )

text.Engarde: Sorry about that. You're just in time.

text.Phoenix: Huh!?

text.Engarde: You're a lawyer dude, right? My manager's looking for a good one right now, so how about it?

text.Pearl: M-Mr. Nick! This is our chance!

text.Phoenix: ( I have to make him let me take his case! I have to! )

CHOICE.Phoenix: Smile, you're on candid camera. Mr. Engarde keeps sneaking glances up at the security camera on the wall... I wonder if he is still trying to be a star?

This guard monitors the visitor's room. He's so quiet, you could forget he was even there... If he wasn't watching everything. He's pushed up against the wall... Kinda like a magnet on a refrigerator.
Sorry to intrude, but I would like to ask you a few personal questions.

CHOICE.Engarde: Um, that's OK, but dude, my autobiography's coming out soon, so... If I say stuff without the publisher's approval, then I'm gonna be in real hot water... Hold on a sec. I'm gonna ask my publisher, OK? ... ...

CHOICE.Pearl: Mr. Engarde is so lucky! He has so many people he can talk to.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Umm... I don't know if he actually has anyone he can really talk to... )

CHOICE.Engarde: Sorry about that. Like I thought, the publisher said it'd be "real bad" if I said anything, dude.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Does he have a mind of his own!? )
Mr. Engarde, I would like to ask you about the murder...

CHOICE.Engarde: Oh, are you covering this for a tabloid as a side job, dude? Um, um... Well, if you want my statement on this, you should ask through my staff...

CHOICE.Phoenix: No no no... I'm not asking on behalf of a tabloid...

CHOICE.Engarde: Hold on a sec. I'm gonna ask the president of the studio, OK? ... ...

CHOICE.Pearl: Is he alright, Mr. Nick...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( If we're talking about Mr. Engarde's brain here, I wouldn't put my money on it. )

CHOICE.Engarde: Sorry about that. The studio president said, "Even Neo Mt. Fuji itself knows that I'm not the murderer!"

CHOICE.Pearl: Um, Mr. Nick? What's "Neo Mt. Fuji"...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: It's a mountain in the city of Neo Olde Tokyo; the city the Nickel Samurai protects.
Mr. Engarde, this is an attorney's badge.

CHOICE.Engarde: Dude, I'm sorry, but I don't have the free time to be looking at things like that.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...Huh?

CHOICE.Engarde: I'm much too busy with Nickel Samurai stuff right now.
I don't have the time to take a lawyer's correspondence course...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Why does he believe I'm a salesman!? Insurance, then extinguishers... Now this!! )

CHOICE.Engarde: ...? What's that?

CHOICE.Phoenix: It's a ticket for the press conference. You were going to give one after winning the Grand Prix, right?

CHOICE.Engarde: Huh? Me?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yes. While you were in costume, no less.
CHOICE._info: ([in costume] hyphenated in the original release)

CHOICE.Engarde: Um, I never heard anything like that, dude. I only heard about the stage show. I always leave that kind of stuff to my manager.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( He didn't know...? That's odd... )

CHOICE.Pearl: ...Mr. Nick? What are you going to do with that?

CHOICE.Phoenix: I don't know yet, but I figured I could at least show it to him...

CHOICE.Engarde: Is that a transceiver? Hey, it looks like a real nice one, too.

CHOICE.Phoenix: I got it as a "present" from someone.

CHOICE.Engarde: Hmm? Interesting.

CHOICE.Phoenix: I've also been instructed to take your case.

CHOICE.Engarde: Is that what you heard from the transceiver?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yes.

CHOICE.Engarde: Dude, that's terrible! Don't let some disembodied voice boss you around!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( This coming from a man with a cell phone on his wrist... )

CHOICE.Engarde: I've seen him somewhere before... Is he a member of my fan club?

CHOICE.Phoenix: That's Mr. Powers. Isn't he supposed to be kind of like a mentor to you?

CHOICE.Engarde: Powers...? Oh yeah! He's the guy on that kid's exercise program. I gave him an autograph just the other day.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( He doesn't see Mr. Powers as a mentor at all... )

CHOICE.Engarde: Man, it's too bad he's dead...

CHOICE.Phoenix: You killed him... That's the most logical conclusion, don't you agree?

CHOICE.Engarde: Dude, what are you talking about!? You're making a huge mistake.

CHOICE.Phoenix: If that's such a mistake, then why did they issue an arrest warrant for you!?

CHOICE.Engarde: Hold on a sec. I'm gonna ask the guy in charge of this place, OK? ... ...

CHOICE.Pearl: Stars sure know a lot of people, don't they?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I wonder if that phone even really gets reception in here... )

CHOICE.Engarde: ...Um, I guess you're right about the warrant after all.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Ladies and gentlemen, I believe we might be making some progress here! )

CHOICE.Engarde: Yeah... I'm such a handsome devil.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Uh... Um, yeah...

CHOICE.Engarde: And I'm way good at sports! Karate, tennis, judo, soccer, football, hockey, fencing... Dude, it's no wonder I'm so popular.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Uh... Um, yeah... ( You're also good at sitting in a jail cell, Mr. Popular. )

CHOICE.Engarde: Dude, I know I like to throw money around, but it's not like I buy anything and everything.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( That's nice, because it's not up for sale anyway! )

CHOICE.Engarde: Um, dude, this person looks like a member of my fan club. Hold on a sec. I'm gonna ask the fan club president, OK? ... ...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Um, "dude", you know what...? Forget I asked...

text.ACTION: After clearing all Talk options and presenting Press Conference Ticket and Radio Transceiver:

text.Engarde: ... ...Well, dude, I think it's about time for me to get going.

text.Phoenix: Please, wait! ...I really need to take your case!

text.Engarde: There's always other people in need of a lawyer, right? Want me to introduce you to a few?

text.Pearl: Please! Please let Mr. Nick represent you!

text.Engarde: Man, oh man. Lawyers these days. Now you dudes use kids to pull in clients, too?

text.Phoenix: If you don't take me as your lawyer, then De Killer is going to...!

text.Engarde: ... Wait... What did you just say?

text.Phoenix: "De Killer"...

text.Engarde: D-De Killer!?

text.Phoenix: ( ...What's he doing? He looks like he's mulling something over... )

text.Engarde: ... Alright, dude. I accept your terms.

text.Phoenix: Huh?

text.Engarde: I'll let you represent me in court.

text.Pearl: W-We did it! We did it, Mr. Nick!

text.Phoenix: Uh, yeah... ( I don't feel any better for it... And he doesn't look too happy either... )

text.Engarde: Go ahead, ask me anything. I'll help out as much as I can...

CHOICE.Engarde: Man, I thank my lucky stars that people know my name.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Well, you're quite the hero, and you're in the national spotlight.

CHOICE.Pearl: I didn't know who he is... Does that mean I'm not a good citizen...?

CHOICE.Engarde: Ah, it's really great to be the Nickel Samurai. Dude, lately, I just keep on getting more and more popular.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( True enough... "The Nickel Samurai" is very popular among high schoolers and secretaries right now. I guess Mr. Engarde has a way of catching the eyes of women... )

CHOICE.Engarde: Do you know my motto? "Refreshing like a spring breeze." That's what I am.

CHOICE.Pearl: A spring breeze...

CHOICE.Engarde: That's why this kind of scandal is disastrous, dude. I mean, even if I get out of here tomorrow, it's still gonna look bad.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( But everyone loves a good scandal... )
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [Everyone loves a good scandal...] in the original release)

CHOICE.Phoenix: Can you tell me about your activities last night?

CHOICE.Engarde: After I got the award, I took a break and went back to my room. I had that post-ceremony stage show to do. So I was in my Nickel Samurai costume.

CHOICE.Phoenix: And you were alone the entire time?

CHOICE.Engarde: My manager was running around being busy, so yeah.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Because of the press conference you were supposed to have after the show?

CHOICE.Engarde: I told you, dude. I have no idea about any press conference, alright?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( That's strange... I thought the Nickel Samurai was going to confess something... )

CHOICE.Engarde: Anyway, when I was leaving my room, that's when I noticed it was kinda noisy...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Mr. Corrida was already dead at that time...?

CHOICE.Engarde: Yeah, that's what I gathered anyway from my manager.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I'm beginning to gather that this guy can't do a thing on his own... )
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [With the way he's always talking about his manager, it's as if she runs his life.] in the original release)

CHOICE.Engarde: And that's when the detective in the green coat showed up. He searched me... And then, out of the blue, the dude arrested me.

CHOICE.Phoenix: About you and the victim, Mr. Juan Corrida, what sort of...

CHOICE.Engarde: That's got nothing to do with anything, dude. Man, with that face of his, you can't even tell he's the same age as me. And he wanted to try making a "Jammin' Ninja" movie, even though we all know it'd fail.

CHOICE.Phoenix: The Nickel Samurai still won in the end, right?

CHOICE.Engarde: Yeah. I took the Grand Prix by storm. So why would I, the winner, have any reason to kill the guy anyway? Dude, you'd think it'd be the other way around, you know?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Um... Do you know why you were arrested?

CHOICE.Engarde: I guess maybe my full body search went badly.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Did they find something on you?

CHOICE.Engarde: They found a button from the Jammin' Ninja's costume.

CHOICE.Phoenix: A button ...?

CHOICE.Engarde: I don't get it either. It was caught in the pleats of my samurai pants, or "hakama".

CHOICE.Pearl: Aaah!

CHOICE.Engarde: Dude, I really think someone planted it there though. I'm serious.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I wonder if that's what really happened...? )

text.Phoenix: ... ( ...I guess this is about all I'm going to get out of him... )

text.Pearl: Mr. Nick?

text.Phoenix: Yeah?

text.Pearl: Let's ask one last thing. Let's test Mr. Engarde to see if he really is innocent or not ...

text.Phoenix: W-We can do that...?

text.Pearl: Yes. If you use this...

text.Phoenix: ( Maya's Magatama! )

text.Pearl: He won't be able to hide any secrets from you, Mr. Nick. I'm sure of it.

text.Phoenix: ( I get it...! ) ...Mr. Engarde, I'd like to ask you one more question. Please answer me honestly.

text.Engarde: What is it, dude?

text.Phoenix: Did you kill Mr. Juan Corrida?
Please put the phone away and answer this question yourself.

text.Engarde: Alright. Just so we're clear, dude, I didn't kill anyone, and that includes Juan Corrida, OK?

text.Pearl: Well, Mr. Nick?

text.Phoenix: Nothing. Not a chain or lock in sight.

text.Pearl: Which means... I think it is alright to trust him.

text.Phoenix: ( Yeah, it does appear that way. Well, at least I can breathe a sigh of relief knowing my client is innocent. )

text.Engarde: Um... The trial's tomorrow, right? I'm counting on you, dude.

text.ACTION: March 21, 11:34 AM Wright & Co. Law Offices

text.Phoenix: Well, at least we were able to get Mr. Matt Engarde as our client. And we know that he didn't do it... Which is very important...

text.Pearl: So! So now what should we do!?

text.Phoenix: Well, the trial is tomorrow. And we only get this one chance. There's only one way to prove Mr. Engarde's innocence. We have to find the real killer.

text.Pearl: OK! Then let's start looking!

CHOICE.Phoenix: There is a giant building just outside the window. It's the Gatewater Hotel, a high-class, luxury hotel. Actually, the crime happened at the recently completed hotel in the center of town, the Gatewater Imperial Hotel. ...Just how far are they going to expand their empire...?

CHOICE.Pearl: Oh! I'll water it!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ah, it's OK... I already did that...

CHOICE.Pearl: ...The watering can... Where are you, Mr. Watering Can...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Pearls gets too wound up if she's not doing something to distract herself... I hope Charley can withstand Typhoon Pearls... )

CHOICE.Pearl: This is the Nickel Samurai... right?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Y-Yeah, that's right.

CHOICE.Pearl: Mr. Nick! Please take care of Mystic Maya, and be her "Nickel Samurai", alright!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Difficult-looking legal books stand in a formidable row. They mock me.
