CHOICE.Phoenix: I-It's OK, Pearls. Really.
My desk. Since I don't have time to sit, it's unusually clean...

CHOICE.Pearl: Oh! I cleaned it up some more for you last night! ...Because I couldn't sleep...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Since there were no Psyche-Locks, then that means we can trust Mr. Engarde to be innocent.

CHOICE.Pearl: I really feel much better knowing that. Ever since last night, I was so worried that I kept wondering... "What if he is the real killer...? What then...?"

CHOICE.Phoenix: Hey, I have something I want to ask you, Pearls.

CHOICE.Pearl: OK, what is it?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Why are you so interested in how Maya and I get along? I mean, she and I don't have anything special go--

CHOICE.Pearl: Huh!? Wh-What do you mean!? B-But I thought... I thought you and Mystic Maya were... I-I've been mistaken all this time!? No way...!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Aaaah! She really wasn't kidding! Pearls actually believes Maya and I are... ...Maybe I should've just left it alone... )

CHOICE.Pearl: Mr. Nick! Stop it! Don't hide your true feelings from me!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Ow! She slapped me!! )

CHOICE.Pearl: That's a lawyer's Sacred Treasure, isn't it?

CHOICE.Phoenix: I guess?

CHOICE.Pearl: I feel like it has a mysterious power, just like my Magatama...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Hmm, well, I guess I can let her think what she wants on this one... )

CHOICE.Pearl: Oh, Mystic Maya... I wonder if you're alright...

CHOICE.Phoenix: I'm sure she's OK. We have to be patient for just one more day. I'm sure we can save her. Trust me.

CHOICE.Pearl: If there's anything I can do, please tell me, OK!?
To tell you the truth, I really want to grow my hair out, just like Mystic Maya. But my mother wouldn't let me.

CHOICE.Phoenix: I think your hair now suits you perfectly.

CHOICE.Pearl: R-Really? Th-Thank you! * fidget, fidget *

CHOICE.Phoenix: * fidget, fidget *

CHOICE.Pearl: I'm sure that Mr. Detective would be our ally if we asked!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah, I think so too. ( Looking back, we've known each other for a while now... He's always been trustworthy... A bit "off", but still trustworthy. What a paradox. )

CHOICE.Pearl: He's a really kind and nice old man, isn't he?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Pearls is really perceptive when it comes to people... But what does she mean by "old man"...? ) Hey, Pearls? What about me...?

CHOICE.Pearl: What about you, Mr. Nick?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( On second thought, I don't think I want to hear this... )

CHOICE.Pearl: Um, there are still so many things in this world that I don't understand yet. ...Honestly, I still don't have enough training.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ah, no, it's OK. I don't have any ideas myself...

CHOICE.Pearl: I'm sorry. I'm really sorry!

text.Engarde: Ah, the lawyer dude. So what did you find out?

text.Phoenix: Um, well... I'm still in the middle of investigating...

text.Engarde: I see. ...But I've already told you everything I know, dude.

CHOICE.Engarde: Dude, like I told you, I don't know anything about that press conference. I leave that kind of stuff to my manager.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( ...This is harder than pulling bass from a river... )

CHOICE.Engarde: So, why are you carrying around that transceiver...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: I wanted to ask you about it.

CHOICE.Engarde: And why do you do everything it tells you to do? You know, the messages it sends you, dude.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( On second thought, he probably doesn't have anything to do with Maya's kidnapping. ) ...That's a secret.

CHOICE.Engarde: OK, whatever, dude.
Look, dude, I didn't kill him. I mean, the Nickel Samurai kicked the Jammin' Ninja's butt, right? So it's not like I felt threatened by the likes of him.

CHOICE.Pearl: Being rivals sounds like a sad way to relate to another person...

text.Oldbag: Hey! What do you think you're doing!? You can't come in without...

text.Pearl: Good morning.

text.Oldbag: Hold on, it's YOU! What is going on around here!?

text.Phoenix: U-Uh... Um...

text.Oldbag: I heard poor Juan was killed. Is that true!? It's a bad rerun is what this is. Another "Steel Samurai" doing the most evil of deeds.

text.Phoenix: Um, you know... That's not entirely...

text.Oldbag: I'll have you know that I was a huge fan of Juan's! Why, oh why, do all the stars I'm interested in drop one by one like flies!? It's always been that way! Ever since I was a little girl in elementary school! The class hamster was fine until it was my turn to clean its cage, and then it died! The other kids started calling me the "Queen Reaper". I swear that's what they dubbed me! "Whoever you name in your evil spell dies within three minutes," they would taunt.

text.Phoenix: Um... Actually, I wanted to ask you about the murder and what happened...

text.Oldbag: Hmph! Don't push me, boy!

text.Pearl: Um... Mr. Nick? I... Um... I couldn't hear everything she said... because she was talking too fast...

text.Phoenix: Ms. Oldbag, could you please speak a little slower...?

text.Oldbag: Don't boss me around, you spiky-haired, smarty-pants!

CHOICE.Phoenix: It's the stage they were going to use for the post-ceremony stage show. After the show, there was supposed to be a press conference, but...

CHOICE.Pearl: ...Even Mr. Engarde himself didn't seem to know, huh?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( How does the person who's supposed to give a conference not know about it...? )

CHOICE.Oldbag: My dear Hammer died a year ago in that dreadful murder. And only recently did I finally find a star that makes this heart go * badump * again.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...I don't know what to say...

CHOICE.Oldbag: I ask you, why does every star I cheer for always ends [sic] up kicking the bucket?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Umm...

CHOICE.Oldbag: I'd watch your words! No one's going to get away with saying anything bad about my Juan!

CHOICE.Phoenix: But I haven't said anything...

CHOICE.Oldbag: Well, I don't believe a word that woman says anyway!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Huh? What woman?

CHOICE.Oldbag: That irritating, backwater girl with the afro and the horrible country accent. I mean, what is that manner of speaking supposed to be? And why does she never stop? Honestly, women these days. They don't know the meaning of the word "modesty". When I was a young maiden, I was so beautiful even the flowers of the field blushed. But despite this, I pressed flowers, or read the stars, or wrote beautiful love poems or

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...Pearls? Are you thirsty?

CHOICE.Pearl: Um, a little.

CHOICE.Phoenix: OK. I'll go get you some juice or something.

CHOICE.Pearl: Th-Thank you very much.

CHOICE.Oldbag: Hey! Are you paying attention!? Young'uns today!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( So I'm guessing Ms. Oldbag heard everything from Lotta... )
I want to ask you about what happened around the time of the murder...

CHOICE.Oldbag: Ah, I don't know anything about that. I was here getting ready.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Getting ready? For what...?

CHOICE.Oldbag: The show, of course! ...Well, and the press conference afterwards.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Cue mysterious music for the magical press conference. )

CHOICE.Oldbag: Anyway, I don't know anything about the murder.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ah, I see...

CHOICE.Oldbag: ... But.
But if you're talking about what I saw, that's different. I saw it very clearly!

CHOICE.Pearl: What!?

CHOICE.Oldbag: I saw the most important moment of the night!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Th-The most important moment!? You don't mean...!?

CHOICE.Oldbag: Oh, so now you treat me with respect, you disrespectful child. When you speak to your elders, you should always be polite. Really, kids today.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Please tell me! What did you see!?

CHOICE.Oldbag: The murder last night was gruesome, wasn't it? But then, what murder isn't?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Please don't stray onto another tangent... Please... )

CHOICE.Oldbag: If you want to hear more, then show your respect and bring this lady a present!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Please tell me! What did you see on the night of the murder!?

CHOICE.Pearl: P-Please! Mystic Maya's life is...

CHOICE.Oldbag: Ah, but you haven't given me my present yet. ...Hmm... Let's see... I'll only tell it to you if you can bring me Juan's autograph!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( What an unreasonable request... You might as well have asked for the moon! )

CHOICE.Oldbag: I don't have anything to say to delinquents like you!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Grrr... She's clamming up like the old clam she is... )

CHOICE.Pearl: Please! Anything would be helpful!

CHOICE.Oldbag: Well then, how about I tell you my measurements?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...Um... No, that's okay... Really.

CHOICE.Pearl: She really doesn't like you, does she Mr. Nick?

CHOICE.Phoenix: I know, I know...

text.Phoenix: Looks like the investigation is still in full swing. The hotel staff and the police are running around like a bunch of headless chickens.

text.Pearl: I wonder if we can do any investigating of our own in this kind of atmosphere...

text.Phoenix: ...Well, got to roll up the sleeves and try, I guess.

CHOICE.Phoenix: There's a grand set of doors over there. It's the doors Maya followed the bellboy out of, only to disappear... ...If only we had all gone together...

CHOICE.Pearl: That is such a beautiful sight.

CHOICE.Phoenix: The chandelier?

CHOICE.Pearl: Yes. But I can't believe it... I can't believe that such a terrible murder happened under such beautiful lights... It's shocking.

CHOICE.Phoenix: The awards ceremony was held on that stage just last night. It was really fabulous.

CHOICE.Pearl: You just reminded me of the circus for a second. I wonder if everyone is alright.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I heard that Berry Big Circus just recently started holding performances again... ) I'm sure they're all fine, Pearls.

CHOICE.Pearl: We ate at this table last night, didn't we?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yes.

CHOICE.Pearl: I was really happy then.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I wish I could make you smile again... Even for a second... )

text.Lotta: Hey! Yer here! Been waitin' for ya, Mr. Lawyer!

text.Phoenix: Lotta...

text.Lotta: Hey! Mr. Cop fella! The thief's showed his face!

text.Phoenix: Wh-Wh-What!?

text.Lotta: Arrest him! Put him on trial! Find him guilty! Give him the death penalty!

text.Phoenix: Wh-What's wrong, Lotta!? Are you feeling alright?

text.Lotta: Looked here and there and up and down the mountain, but it ain't here! So why don'tcha just hurry up and give it back to me, ya creep!
text._info: (Changed from [So why don't ya just hurry up and give it back to me, ya creep!] in the original release)

text.Pearl: Um, what are you looking for...?

text.Lotta: My CAMERA! C-A-M-E-R-A! It's my life blood! I'm gonna die without my $700 camera!!

text.Phoenix: Y-Your camera...?

text.Lotta: Look, don't lots of people say the criminal always goes back to the scene of the crime!? And lookie lookie, here ya are!

text.Phoenix: Yep. Here I am... Faced with a Lotta trouble.

text.Pearl: Huh!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: I can understand flowers in front of the dressing rooms, but what are stuffed bears doing here...?

CHOICE.Lotta: I didn't touch them! Wasn't me, I tell ya! I give ya my word!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Why do I get the impression Lotta helped herself to one of them...? )

Compared to the flowers on the other side of the hall, these are much more gorgeous. Let's see... Record companies, fan clubs, company workers, family... Carrying all these flowers home would be hard, I think...

CHOICE.Lotta: Yeah, that's what I thought too, so I was a nice enough gal to lend a helpin' hand! ...Secretly, of course.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I have a feeling one of these days, I'm going to end up defending her in court... )
There's a piece of paper taped to the door that says, "Juan Corrida's Room".

CHOICE.Lotta: So that's the scene of the murder, I reckon. I thought somethin' had gone on that night, but I didn't never think it was murder.

CHOICE.Phoenix: There's a piece of paper taped to the door that says, "Matt Engarde's Room".

CHOICE.Pearl: So Mr. Engarde was here during his break, right?

CHOICE.Phoenix: That's what he claims. ( Hmm... The crime scene... If he had wanted to get to Mr. Corrida's room... He would have had to pass through this hallway. )
So you lost your camera...?

CHOICE.Lotta: It ain't no ordinary camera! Ya buy it in a store and it's $1,600 brand new!

CHOICE.Pearl: Huh? But didn't you just say you bought it for $700?

CHOICE.Lotta: I had a nice long talk with the guy at the store... About five hours, I reckon. I made this itty-bitty scratch on it and the manager got all huffed up in the face... He gave me his talkin' to and was real mean about it too. He done made me cry at that!

CHOICE.Pearl: When did you lose your camera?

CHOICE.Lotta: Last night, after the murder happened. Musta been when I was busy runnin' around lookin' into things! That's when I lost sight of my dear, darlin' expensive sweetie!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Lotta, what did you capture with that expensive camera of yours?

CHOICE.Lotta: I don't rightly know. I snapped a shot of anythin' that caught my eye. So I don't 'member. ...And 'sides, I couldn't get anythin' for my big scoop.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I wonder if Lotta's missing camera is even connected to the murder...? )
So you lost your camera...?

CHOICE.Lotta: It ain't no ordinary camera! Ya buy it in a store and it's $1,600 brand new!

CHOICE.Pearl: Huh? But didn't you just say you bought it for $700?

CHOICE.Lotta: I had a nice long talk with the guy at the store... About five hours, I reckon. I made this itty-bitty scratch on it and the manager got all huffed up in the face... He gave me his talkin' to and was real mean about it too. He done made me cry at that!

CHOICE.Pearl: When did you lose your camera?

CHOICE.Lotta: Last night, after the murder happened. Musta been when I was busy runnin' around lookin' into things! That's when I lost sight of my dear, darlin' expensive sweetie!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Lotta, what did you capture with that expensive camera of yours?

CHOICE.Lotta: I don't rightly know. I snapped a shot of anythin' that caught my eye. So I don't 'member. ...And 'sides, I couldn't get anythin' for my big scoop.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I wonder if Lotta's missing camera is even connected to the murder...? )
Lotta, please tell me what you know about what happened at the time of the murder.

CHOICE.Lotta: Well, from before the ceremony last night, I was hangin' around here in this area. Yeah, actually I was here until around the time Mr. Engarde was arrested.

CHOICE.Phoenix: What were you doing here...?

CHOICE.Lotta: You sure you went to school, City Boy? Wherever Lotta Hart goes, there's a story to be found! A big scoop to be had!

CHOICE.Phoenix: A big scoop...?

CHOICE.Lotta: I told ya before. I'm gonna be the best tabloid photographer the world's ever seen! Reckon course that means I'm always lookin' for the perfect shot!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I wonder what "scoop" she was after this time...? )

CHOICE.Lotta: Although, I was also on the look out for the other stars that were here, so... maybe I wasn't here the entire time...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Lotta... Are you sure you weren't here the entire time? So you could take a picture for your big scoop?

CHOICE.Lotta: Well... Maybe I was. But that's what real journalists do! I got some juicy inside info, so I thought to myself, why not get a picture for proof?

CHOICE.Phoenix: What kind of story was it that you would hang around here...?

CHOICE.Lotta: Oops, sorry, Mr. Lawyer. Can't be tellin' you that. Trade secret, ya know?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Not again... Why does everyone have something to hide...? )

CHOICE.Pearl: We've been stopped, haven't we?

CHOICE.Lotta: Ha ha, yeah! Take that, Mr. Lawyer!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I'm glad someone around here is happy... Ms. Lotta and your "I rule!" smile... )
You were on the hunt for your big scoop last night?

CHOICE.Lotta: It's just a bunch of tabloid photos. They ain't got nothing to do with the murder.

CHOICE.Pearl: It looks like we have no choice but to remove the Psyche-Locks.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah... I guess so.

CHOICE.Lotta: Hey, what's that? ...A press conference ticket? How come I ain't got myself one of them!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: P-Please don't direct your anger at me...

CHOICE.Lotta: Why in tarnations wasn't I invited to that!? How come someone on the bottom of the popularity chart like you got the info, but not me!? Info like that is worth nothin' to ya, am I right or what!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( ...Is that the kind of person she thinks I am...? )

CHOICE.Pearl: Are you going to stand there and take that, Mr. Nick!?

CHOICE.Lotta: Nngh... And I just bought that camera... Who did it!? The thievin' rascal!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Please don't look straight at me while you're saying that...

CHOICE.Lotta: When I find the bugger who went and done this, they're gonna pay with a bullet!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( And if you do that, don't expect me to defend you... )

CHOICE.Lotta: Now that I think about it, she isn't with y'all today, is she...?

CHOICE.Pearl: Um...

CHOICE.Lotta: She's a spunky one! You shouldn't have been lettin' her outta yer sight. Who knows what she's up to now...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Like you're one to talk... )

CHOICE.Lotta: Ah, just wanna say sorry to ya.

CHOICE.Pearl: For...?

CHOICE.Lotta: Well, I really, absolutely thought you were the murderer.

CHOICE.Pearl: ...Huh?

CHOICE.Lotta: You know... Last time, that thing with Maya Fey...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Wh-Wh-What!? But why!?

CHOICE.Lotta: I mean, you were all worked up, ya know?

CHOICE.Pearl: * sniffle * ...Meanie...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Lotta, that was very insensitive of you!

CHOICE.Lotta: This kind of hairstyle is pretty hard to get, ya know. Hard to care for too. Just the other day, I ran my hand through my hair to fix it up, and suddenly, out pops this dollar coin! That's gotta be like hittin' the jackpot!

CHOICE.Pearl: Wow, that's really lucky!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( * sigh * What a deep conversation that was... )

CHOICE.Lotta: I don't really care for 'em "heroes" or whatnot.

CHOICE.Pearl: Oh, I see...

CHOICE.Lotta: And shows they got for kids, those adventures are just plain ol' borin'! Now, adults. We get more caught up in messy, sticky, real situations! ...Even me...

CHOICE.Pearl: O-Oh...

CHOICE.Lotta: Sounds like the tyke's gettin' what I'm goin' with this!

CHOICE.Phoenix: W-Wait a sec here! Don't go around getting her mixed up in things like that!

CHOICE.Lotta: This old granny? Ah, she kept on glarin' at me with those eyes of hers. As if it's my fault. Kept babblin' how she won't forgive people who write "trash" about her Juan... ...Ah, yeah, we sorta got into a little fight, ya know...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( A "little" fight? Knowing those two, it was probably more of a blabbering contest. )
Um... Do you know anything...

CHOICE.Lotta: ... * sigh * ... I've told ya how many times now? I'm a journalist. I've got so much info runnin' laps in my head I forget things here and there!

CHOICE.Pearl: Please don't get so worked up over this...

CHOICE.Lotta: Hah! I don't care if ya beg me! "Be extra tough on kids!" That's this gal's motto on learnin' youngsters.

text.ACTION: March 21 Gatewater Hotel Engarde's Hotel Room

text.Pearl: Um... Where are we?

text.Phoenix: We're in Mr. Matt Engarde's dressing room... This is our client's room.

text.???: May I help you with something?

text.Phoenix: Um, uh... We're...

text.???: You're Mr. Engarde's lawyer, correct? I gathered as much. I also looked for lawyers on my end, but to no avail.

text.Phoenix: Um... How did you know I'm his lawyer...?

text.???: You were just saying that he is your client. In a situation like this, the only person who would use such a word would be his lawyer.

text.Pearl: Wow...

text.???: It's simple deduction, really. The trial is tomorrow, and Mr. Engarde's situation is looking rather grim. So you came here, one stop in your mad dash, to find clues to build his case, correct?

text.Phoenix: Well, you're not totally right, but you're not totally off either.

text.Pearl: It's really not the time to be showing off, Mr. Nick.

text.Andrews: I am Adrian Andrews. I hate to waste time, so let's get down to business.

text.Phoenix: A-Alright... ( She may be of small stature, but appearances can be deceiving... )

CHOICE.Phoenix: It's probably Mr. Engarde's suitcase. For someone who was only going to be here for the award show, this is a lot of stuff. Looks like he has about three days' worth of clothes in here.

CHOICE.Pearl: Stars really are different from us, aren't they...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: That's the bedroom over there.

CHOICE.Pearl: That's a bed...? Wow, they have really big beds here!

CHOICE.Phoenix: There's some samurai-looking clothes on the sofa here.

CHOICE.Pearl: Um, I think that jacket looking thing is called a "happi".

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Whatever it is, I'm sure something like that would make a great souvenir. Maya would be absolutely thrilled... )
Looks like dishes left over from dinner... A dinner for two, at that.

CHOICE.Pearl: I'm sure they're Mr. Engarde and Ms. Andrews' plates.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Looks like they had T-bone steaks... What's with Global Studios and T-bone steaks...?
There's a giant bone sitting on the plate.

CHOICE.Pearl: I... I don't really like meat...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( ...? There's something... weird about this plate... I just wish I could put my finger on what it is... )

CHOICE.Andrews: I assume the first thing you need to know is what everyone was doing that night, correct?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Y-Yes, that is correct.

CHOICE.Andrews: Then I will tell you. Before the award ceremony, I had dinner with Mr. Engarde. In this very room, I might add.

CHOICE.Phoenix: "Dinner"? What did you eat?

CHOICE.Andrews: I told you. I hate to waste time with trifling details. If you took a look at the table yourself, you wouldn't need to ask me.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( ...I bet she's a lot of fun at parties... )

CHOICE.Andrews: When the award show was starting, I headed for Viola Hall.

CHOICE.Phoenix: And after the show ended, you came back to this room...?

CHOICE.Andrews: No, I had some small errands to run. I helped with the preparations in the lobby.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Oh... ( Preparations for the post-ceremony show, I guess... )

CHOICE.Andrews: When it was time for the post-ceremony show, I came back to call for Mr. Engarde. After that, I went to visit Mr. Corrida...

CHOICE.Phoenix: And that's when you found his body, isn't it?

CHOICE.Pearl: You really held strong through everything...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Yeah... She does seem to be mentally tough as nails... )
Um, so... About you and...

CHOICE.Andrews: Stop right there. You aren't seriously about to ask how Mr. Engarde and I are related, are you?
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [Don't expect me to believe you have been talking to me without knowing how we relate.] in the original release)

CHOICE.Phoenix: S-Sorry...

CHOICE.Andrews: I have no idea how he could chose [sic] you as his lawyer.
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [I have no idea why Mr. Engarde chose you as his lawyer.] in the original release)

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Why did she have to go and say something like that...? )

CHOICE.Pearl: Mr. Nick... Calm down and hang in there. I'll give you a shoulder rub to relieve your stress later, alright?

CHOICE.Andrews: I already gave you my name earlier, but I'll add that I'm Mr. Engarde's manager.

CHOICE.Phoenix: His manager... Speaking of managers, did the victim, Mr. Corrida have one?

CHOICE.Andrews: No, he did not.

CHOICE.Phoenix: He didn't?

CHOICE.Andrews: Global Studios has a very different policy from Worldwide Studios in that Worldwide Studios does not assign individual managers to their stars.

CHOICE.Phoenix: I see...

CHOICE.Andrews: This industry is very ruthless and unforgiving. Actually, you look quite ruthless and unforgiving yourself to your poor partner. Dragging a little girl like her to places like this. Honestly.

CHOICE.Pearl: You're wrong! I... I'm doing this to help Mystic Maya...!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Pearls... Calm down and hang in there. I'll buy you a juice later, alright?

CHOICE.Pearl: Nngh...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Do you have any ideas?

CHOICE.Andrews: As to...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: As to why Mr. Corrida was murdered?

CHOICE.Andrews: Why would you ask me about such a thing...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: I'm just doing my job. So, do you have any ideas?
M-Ms. Andrews...?

CHOICE.Andrews: Sorry, but there's nothing more I have to add to this conversation.

CHOICE.Pearl: Is it a Psyche-Lock, Mr. Nick?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yes... There's getting to be more and more of these lately.
You know something, don't you? About why Mr. Corrida was murdered...

CHOICE.Andrews: Why are you asking me? Don't tell me you can see inside my heart.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( No, but I can see the locks you have on your psyche. )

CHOICE.Pearl: If you don't remove her locks...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Yeah, it's worthless to even ask... )
You were the one taking care of the arrangements for this press conference, right?

CHOICE.Andrews: Yes, that's right.

CHOICE.Pearl: But Mr. Engarde said he "didn't know" about it.

CHOICE.Andrews: ... Is that what he said...?

CHOICE.Pearl: Huh...?

CHOICE.Andrews: Actually, I didn't know all the details either. It was a request from the publicity department. All I did was help out and do what I was asked.

CHOICE.Pearl: Oh... I see.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I wonder about that... I wouldn't take her to be the type of person to do something without knowing the details. )

CHOICE.Andrews: That's Mr. Will Powers. He's an actor contracted with Global Studios. He's a very nice man. A man with a good heart. ...But that's all he is and ever will be.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Urk... What a horrible thing to say... )

CHOICE.Andrews: ...Society doesn't care about genuinely nice people, Mr. Wright.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Huh? For a second, her face twisted in pain... )

CHOICE.Pearl: I wonder if something happened to Ms. Andrews...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Did you know the victim, Mr. Corrida?

CHOICE.Andrews: Yes, I knew him. The world is such a small place, after all.

CHOICE.Pearl: Did you know about his rivalry with the Nickel Samurai?

CHOICE.Andrews: Honestly, they were like children when it came to that. Time and time again, those two competed with each other over the most trivial things. ... If either one of them wasn't so stubborn, then maybe no one would have needed to die. ( Changed from [If either one of them weren't so stubborn, then maybe no one would have needed to die.] in the original release )
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [Time and time again, those two competed with each other over the most uninteresting things.] in the original release)

CHOICE.Phoenix: ! ( ...I've got a hunch that this woman knows more than she's letting on... She must know why Juan Corrida was killed! )

CHOICE.Andrews: I asked to become Mr. Engarde's manager. He's a pleasure to manage with his nice disposition.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Hmm... Mr. Engarde does seem like a rather weak-willed man; always doing as he's told... )

CHOICE.Pearl: He's always saying, "my manager," right Mr. Nick?

CHOICE.Andrews: I hate talking about myself. It's a trifling matter, that's why.

CHOICE.Phoenix: S-Sorry... ( Take away that layer of sarcasm and she really does seem to hate herself... )
Um, I'd like to ask you about this...

CHOICE.Andrews: I told you. I hate trifling matters. It's a waste of time to show me things that are of no relevance to me.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Wow... This is the first time I've been shut down this badly... )

text.ACTION: March 21 Gatewater Hotel Corrida's Hotel Room

text.Pearl: Mr. Nick... Where are we...?

text.Phoenix: We're in Mr. Juan Corrida's room, Pearls.

text.Pearl: Mr. Corrida...?

text.Phoenix: The victim... Which makes this the crime scene, too.

text.Gumshoe: Oh! It's you! So!? What's happened!? The kidnapper! Has he contacted you again!?

text.Phoenix: Not yet. He probably won't until we win Mr. Engarde's acquittal.

text.Gumshoe: Umm... You doing OK, pal? Hanging in there?

text.Phoenix: ( I just want Maya to be alright... )

text.Gumshoe: We don't have a lot of time left, but I'm going to help you as much as I can, pal.

text.Phoenix: Can you do that? Even if we want to look around the crime scene...?

text.Gumshoe: Just this once... "Special circumstances" right, pal? I'll even tell you everything I know. But you've gotta keep quiet. It's my neck on the line here.

text.Phoenix: Thank you.

text.Gumshoe: Oh, that's right. I got you guys a map of the hotel, pal. Here you go, little missy.

text.Pearl: Wow, you're giving it to me!? Thank you!

text.Gumshoe: Ha ha. Wouldn't want you to get lost in a hotel too big for its own good.

text.Pearl: Mr. Nick! I got a map!

text.Phoenix: That's great, Pearls!

text.Pearl: ... Um... But Mr. Nick, I can't read what it says...

CHOICE.Phoenix: There are all sorts of things in this refrigerator...

CHOICE.Pearl: The carrot juice bottle and the tomato juice bottle are both empty...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Empty...? ( It's too much of a hassle to throw them away, I guess. ) They're all vegetable juices. I guess he must've been a real health nut.

CHOICE.Pearl: ...Oh! There's a beet, some ketchup, and a bottle of strawberry jam too!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Maybe red was his favorite color...?

CHOICE.Pearl: Wow, there are a lot of bears!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Alarm clock ones, collector's editions, stuffed teddies, plastic models... It's pretty overwhelming... Is there a kind of bear he doesn't have...? )

CHOICE.Pearl: There's even a few in the trash can...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah... I get the feeling maybe the guy didn't really like bears.

CHOICE.Pearl: Poor teddies...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ... ( I don't think I want to "bear" with the trauma the last case caused me... )

CHOICE.Pearl: What's wrong, Mr. Nick?
Hmph! It's so messy here!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Pearls really likes things neat and tidy, I take it... )

CHOICE.Pearl: There are a lot of electronic things in here that I've never seen before. Hey, Mr. Nick! Tell me what they are, pretty please?

CHOICE.Phoenix: OK. That over there is a "watch". You wear it on your wrist.

CHOICE.Pearl: ... I know what a watch is...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Oops. For a second there, I forgot I was talking with Pearls, not Maya... )
It's a suitcase. There are so many things in it that I bet it barely closes. There's his clothes, a dryer, an electric shaver, a calculator...

CHOICE.Pearl: Do all stars pack too much stuff like Mr. Corrida?

CHOICE.Phoenix: It looks like Mr. Corrida had dinner last night.

CHOICE.Pearl: This bottle... It's tomato juice.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( We had a lot of food at the award show last night... But I wonder if the stars had gone onstage after only eating a meager meal like this... )

CHOICE.Pearl: So that's a bed, right?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yup. It's big, but it's a bed.

CHOICE.Pearl: Aaah! Mr. Nick! It's sooooo soft!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Big beds must be a rarity for her... )
Bottles of cosmetics are scattered all over the floor. This is probably where Mr. Corrida fought his assailant.

CHOICE.Pearl: What's this glass fragment from...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: A flower vase maybe? There are flowers on the floor, but I don't know what they are.

CHOICE.Pearl: You don't know much about flowers, do you Mr. Nick?

CHOICE.Phoenix: This is... a guitar case, I guess. A little beat up, but still useable.

CHOICE.Pearl: That's strange. The guitar is not here...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Maybe he forgot to bring it to the show?

CHOICE.Pearl: But Mystic Maya... She said the bright red guitar was the Jammin' Ninja's signature item...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( That's true... ) Huh? This guitar case is wet. But it's only wet on the top of the lid...

CHOICE.Pearl: Yeah... There's no water inside the case... This is water, isn't it...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Stabbed with a knife after a struggle... A clue is sleeping in this photo somewhere... I know it. )

CHOICE.Gumshoe: I'm sorry.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...For what?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: I really want to help you look for her, pal.

CHOICE.Pearl: OK. What is it?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...Because I'm in the number one spot?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Huh? Really? Then who's in first...?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Ms. von Karma's miles and miles ahead of you in this race.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ... I think that's probably best kept to yourself, if you know what I mean...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah, she does give that sort of impression, like she's got it all together.

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Compared to her, you can easily tell I'm a "can't do anything right" kind of guy. That's why I get all nervous and start messing up.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I feel sort of bad for him... )
What do you know about this?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Um... There's nothing special I can tell you about this, pal. Look pal, we don't have a lot of time. Why don't you show me something more important? If Ms. von Karma saw me here like this... I'd have to switch sides real fast...

text.Pearl: Wh-What's that beeping noise, Mr. Nick...?

text.Phoenix: ( Hmm... I've heard this sound somewhere before... )

text.Gumshoe: It's Ms. von Karma...

text.Pearl: Huh?

text.Gumshoe: For some reason, whenever I hear that sound, she pops out of nowhere and whips me!

text._info: (Changed from [Come to think of it, that did happen the last time...] in the original release)

text.Gumshoe: S-Sorry! I've gotta make myself scarce! Later, pal! Eowww!

text.Franziska: At last, you reveal your true nature... Mr. Phoenix Wright!

text.Phoenix: ( * gulp * Would it be too much to ask for you to be nice to me for a change...? )

text.Franziska: So you're the type to steal information from pitifully hopeless detectives! That's very dishonorable of you!

text.Phoenix: ( Owww! )

text.Franziska: Hey! Don't you dare run away, Scruffy McTrenchcoat!

text.Gumshoe: Ah!

text.Gumshoe: Uwaah!

text.Phoenix: ( He was so scared, he just froze up on the spot... )

text.Franziska: Mr. Phoenix Wright! You... You have soiled my perfect prosecution record. I'll never forget that. This time... Victory is mine!

text.Franziska: Wh-What...!?
... H-Hmph! Come, Scruff-face! The investigation briefing is about to begin.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Huh...?

CHOICE.Oldbag: I tell you, I saw him that night. I saw him coming out of Juan's room.

CHOICE.Phoenix: You're kidding!

CHOICE.Pearl: Oh no!

CHOICE.Oldbag: It was about ten minutes before Juan's body was discovered. It was just a coincidence. I was on my way to the toilet, minding my own business.

CHOICE.Phoenix: And...? Did you tell that to the police?

CHOICE.Oldbag: Well, of course! I thought I could get a gift certificate or two out of it, maybe more.

CHOICE.Pearl: Gift certificate...?

CHOICE.Oldbag: I've been recruited again for that part at the trial. You know, the trial tomorrow? This time, you're gonna get it! I'm gonna work hard to get your client pronounced guilty!

CHOICE.Pearl: But Mr. Engarde hasn't done anything bad...

CHOICE.Oldbag: I don't care about details like that! I know he did my dear poor Juan in! I just do! That yellow-bellied chicken!

CHOICE.Pearl: A yellow-bellied chicken...? I wonder what that would look like...

CHOICE.Oldbag: I trust my senses. I know when someone did something bad, and I say he did it!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( What did Mr. Engarde ever do to her to deserve this...? )
What did Mr. Engarde do to you to make you so...

CHOICE.Oldbag: You don't know!? That guy! He framed my Juan! He created that scandal that plagued poor Juan!

CHOICE.Pearl: Mr. Nick!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Wh-What is it?

CHOICE.Pearl: What's a "skan-dal"?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Oh... Um, I'll tell you about that after we get home, OK?

CHOICE.Oldbag: Poor Juan, led astray by the wiles of that vile temptress...

CHOICE.Pearl: Mr. Nick... What do "viles" and "wile temptress" mean...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ack! Um, how about we just listen to what Ms. Oldbag has to say for now, OK Pearls? So, Ms. Oldbag. Who is this "woman" you're talking about...?

CHOICE.Oldbag: ... Adrian Andrews , of course! Who else!? That guy, he shoved the girl onto Juan on purpose!

CHOICE.Phoenix: His own manager? But why...?

CHOICE.Oldbag: I thought lawyers were smart! It was to create a scandal to make Juan lose face! That girl drove Juan into a scandal that dragged his reputation through the mud!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Sounds like a pretty standard definition of a scandal to me... ) Why do you know about that anyway, Ms. Oldbag?

CHOICE.Oldbag: I'm one of Juan's biggest fans! I'm always out there gathering information! There's nothing I don't know!

CHOICE.Phoenix: And do you have proof that Mr. Engarde did what you say he did...?

CHOICE.Oldbag: Next week's issue of a certain magazine says so!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Ugh... Of course. A tabloid... )

CHOICE.Pearl: Next week... Doesn't that mean it's something people don't know about yet...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Why would Ms. Oldbag have information like that...? And where did she get it...? )

CHOICE.Oldbag: Hee hee hee...
Alright, I'll be honest with you for now.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Then, please! Tell us what you saw!

CHOICE.Oldbag: But, aww, what a waste. And here I have a perfectly good chance to have a little fun at you young'un's expense. I AM a little devil, after all.
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [Because I am a little devil, after all.] in the original release)

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Um... Doesn't that imply you aren't a good person...? ) Alright, I'll give you what you want...

CHOICE.Oldbag: You're Engarde's lawyer, aren't you?

CHOICE.Phoenix: W-Well, yes... but...

CHOICE.Oldbag: Then forget it! There is no way I'm telling you!

CHOICE.Phoenix: B-But why!?

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads back to "I AM a little devil, after all."

CHOICE.Oldbag: Th-Th-That's! That's Juan's autograph!!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yes, it is.

CHOICE.Oldbag: And... And it even says, "To my dearest Wendy" on it! Th-That's me, right!? Right!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Um...

CHOICE.Oldbag: My name is Wendy Oldbag, so that "Wendy" has to be me, right!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Well, it may say "Wendy"... But somehow, I don't think Juan had THIS "Wendy" in mind when he signed it... )

CHOICE.Oldbag: Oh, please, give it to me! Let me have it! Please!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Uh, un. I can't let you have it, just like that.

CHOICE.Oldbag: Yes, yes, I know. Then how about an exchange!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Wow, she must really want this autograph... )

CHOICE.Oldbag: My offer isn't good enough for you!? Fine, Mr. Wright. You win. Wendy Oldbag, ready to open up her heart! All for my dearest Juan!
You're Engarde's lawyer, aren't you?

CHOICE.Phoenix: W-Well, yes... but...

CHOICE.Oldbag: Then forget it! There is no way I'm telling you!

CHOICE.Phoenix: B-But why!?

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads back to "I AM a little devil, after all."

March 21 Police Station Criminal Affairs Dept.

text.Pearl: Hmm, it doesn't look like Mr. Scruffy Detective is here...

text.Phoenix: ( Great, now even Pearls is calling him "Scruffy"... Thanks, Franziska. ) They said something about an investigation briefing earlier, right? Why don't we come back and try again later when they're done...

text.Pearl: OK... I guess that's all we can do, right Mr. Nick?

CHOICE.Phoenix: That must be one of the detectives. He's mumbling something to himself.

CHOICE.Detective: "...a break and spit it out, you lowlife scumbag... ...a turkey sandwich? Don'tcha eat ham every day? Get sick of it or something?"

CHOICE.Phoenix: ... He must be doing image training for interrogations.
These are the detectives' desks. There are computers and files on each one. Funny, they're a lot tidier than I expected. I guess the detectives don't spend a lot of time at their desks.
This must be the chief of the detectives here. He's glued to his computer screen.

CHOICE.Chief: WHAT!? The Hero of Heroes award ceremony... The grand prize got away from the Jammin' Ninja again!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Shouldn't you be reading something more important...? )
A poster of a female police officer... Wait, no. That's the latest "Babes in Uniform" calendar. My bad.

CHOICE.Pearl: Aww, it's kind of cute. Mr. Nick, what is this stuffed animal's name...?

CHOICE.Chief: That's the "Blue Badger"! It was my idea! I made it! It's this precinct's mascot, you know.

CHOICE.Pearl: Oh, wow...

CHOICE.Chief: I'll get him assigned mascot of every police station, if it's the last thing I do!

CHOICE.Pearl: I hope you succeed in your mission, sir!

CHOICE.Phoenix: You were looking into Mr. Corrida and Ms. Andrews' affair, weren't you?

CHOICE.Lotta: You got it! I was gonna get myself a scoop by catchin' 'em in a secret meetin'!

CHOICE.Phoenix: But there's already an article about it in one of the weekly tabloid magazines... It's no longer breaking news.

CHOICE.Lotta: Whatcha just say!? Her initials are "A. A." What kind of vague thing is that!? That ain't no proof of nothin'! People are gonna wanna see real proof! Well, at least I do. So that's what I was doin'! Getting photos!

CHOICE.Pearl: Oh...

CHOICE.Lotta: I'm gonna whip up the reader's interest with some gossip and a little misleadin'. Then spice it up a little and have myself an exclusive story!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Wow, Lotta, nice journalistic integrity you got there... )

CHOICE.Lotta: I already finished writin' up my spicy article, ya know. But...
The paper I wrote it on, my note to myself, it's gone.

CHOICE.Pearl: Your note to yourself?

CHOICE.Lotta: It was inside the case of my $1,600 camera. They done run off together. I came here for my big story! Didn't come 'ere to have my treasure disappear on me!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Y-Yeah, I understand...

CHOICE.Lotta: It's enough to make a gal go bonkers, I tell ya! What's with people now, anyway!? I never thought I'd see the day when someone done steal somethin' from me.

CHOICE.Phoenix: You really want that note back, huh...? ( I've got no idea why though. The story on that note is probably a bold faced lie... )

CHOICE.Lotta: Th-That's not somethin' I can tell ya. I mean, that there's my bread and butter...

CHOICE.Lotta: Mmph!

CHOICE.Phoenix: The Nickel Samurai's manager, caught secretly meeting with his rival, the Jammin' Ninja. It would be the hottest story of the season, wouldn't it?

text.ACTION: After clearing "Enguarde's past" Talk option in Gatewater Hotel - Hotel Lobby and clearing "Big scoop" Talk option upon breaking Psyche-Locks in Gatewater Hotel - Hallway:
March 21 Police Station Criminal Affairs Dept.

text.Phoenix: Detective Gumshoe said they had an investigation briefing...

text.Pearl: Yeah... Oh! He's back!

text.Gumshoe: Hey, so you came, pal.

text.Phoenix: Why the blunt greeting?

text.Gumshoe: Um, because there's nothing to be friendly or happy about.

text.Phoenix: What do you mean by that?

text.Gumshoe: Well, things look perfect this time around. The evidence and testimony are airtight...

text.Phoenix: But... But... We can't just roll over and die! We have to stay positive!

CHOICE.Phoenix: That must be one of the detectives. He's mumbling something to himself.

CHOICE.Detective: "Freeze! Police! Everyone against the wall, hands where I can see 'em! Hey, what are you doing, Gumshoe!? Their hands, not yours!"

CHOICE.Phoenix: ... He must be doing image training for arrests.
So what do you mean the evidence is airtight...?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: I can't give you all the details, pal, but there's two big pieces.

CHOICE.Pearl: T-Two!?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: And both of them are in this photo. The first is the button that's missing from the victim's chest.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Hmm... That's the button that you found during your body search of Mr. Engarde...

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Yup. I found it in the folds of the Nickel Samurai's special pants .

CHOICE.Phoenix: Um... Uh... And the second one is...?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: The knife in his chest, pal. The fingerprints on the knife in his chest, to be exact.

CHOICE.Pearl: Fingerprints...? Um... Whose are they?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: You didn't even have to ask, little missy. It's obvious. They're Matt Engarde's.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ... ( Tomorrow's trial... Talk about being stuck between a rock and a hard place... )
So what about this "airtight testimony"...?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: It's that old security lady, Ms. Oldbag.

CHOICE.Phoenix: I thought so...

CHOICE.Gumshoe: What do you mean, you thought so? Did she tell you something, pal?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Um, well...

CHOICE.Gumshoe: And I even told her not to open that mouth of hers and blab to anyone...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Her blab knob is stuck on ten, and there's no turning it down... Trust me. )

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Yeah, well... Ms. Oldbag saw it all, pal. She saw Mr. Engarde come out of the victim's room around the estimated time of death.

CHOICE.Pearl: N-No way!

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "She was the victim's manager and was also Ms. Adrian Andrews' mentor."

CHOICE.Phoenix: What can you tell me about this guitar case...?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Oh, that. This is just what I heard, pal, but that's the Jammin' Ninja's signature item.

CHOICE.Pearl: But... The guitar wasn't in his hotel room...

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Yeah, we looked for it too. It's not normal for a person to forget to bring their most famous item to an award show.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( It's starting to sound like that red guitar is related to this case after all... )

CHOICE.Gumshoe: The stuff in that glass is tomato juice, pal.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Tomato juice...

CHOICE.Gumshoe: I heard the victim really loved that stuff. Favorite drink in the world.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...It was his favorite drink? ( First time I've heard that... )

CHOICE.Gumshoe: We're pretty interested in this bit of gossip ourselves.

CHOICE.Phoenix: The scandal with Mr. Corrida? But why?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Well, two years ago... A woman committed suicide .

CHOICE.Pearl: Suicide...

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Her name was Celeste Inpax. And she was Juan Corrida's manager .

CHOICE.Phoenix: The victim's manager...?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: But that's not all, pal. Ms. Inpax was Ms. Adrian Andrews' mentor... She taught Ms. Andrews everything she knew about the business from square one.

CHOICE.Pearl: Her mentor...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( A woman who was both Mr. Corrida's manager and Ms. Andrews' mentor... Could her suicide have something to do with this case...? )

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Do you want to know more about her, pal?
I'm not a real fan of action shows or anything... But I know who Juan Corrida and Matt Engarde are. Juan Corrida, though, he was always desperately trying to be better than Matt Engarde.
There's something interesting about this woman, pal.

CHOICE.Phoenix: And what is that?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: You don't know? Haven't you heard the gossip about her?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Gossip, huh... I wonder if he knows anything about that article ... )

CHOICE.Gumshoe: If I'm caught leaking info to you here in the precinct, my neck's gonna be in a ringer, pal.

CHOICE.Pearl: Y-Your neck!? No!

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Ah, I mean my "neck" as a joke... But yeah, ask me about things that have to do with the case only, alright pal?

text.Gumshoe: She was the victim's manager and was also Ms. Adrian Andrews' mentor. It's been two years since her suicide, and now those two are linked again by another death. Or maybe it's just a coincidence...? But... Waaah!

text.Franziska: I'm getting sick of dealing with one foolish idiot after another...

text.Gumshoe: M-M-Ms. von Karma!

text.Franziska: You can't seem to stop allying yourself with the enemy, can you? I don't need a traitor in my midst.

text.Gumshoe: Y-Y-You don't... You don't mean...

text.Franziska: I do. Scruffy. You have thirty minutes to get out of here. You are no longer needed. Good bye.

text.Pearl: Th-That's...

text.Gumshoe: W-Wait... Please wait, sir! If I don't get this month's pay, I'll star--

text.Franziska: Quiet! If it weren't for traitors like you...

text.???: "I would've won." Is that what you want to say?

text.Franziska: ...! Wh-Who!?

text.Phoenix: That voice... E-Edgeworth!!

text.Edgeworth: It's been a long time... Wright.

text.Pearl: Th-This person... This is Mr. Edgeworth?

text.Edgeworth: What am I going to do with you...? Still blaming others when things go wrong? You haven't changed a bit, Franziska.

text.Franziska: ... ... ... Y... You... How dare you show your face to me without a shred of shame upon it!? You've soiled the Von Karma name, dragged it through the mud... You even ran away with your tail between your legs like the ill-bred dog you are! ( Changed from [Run away with your tail between your legs like the ill-bred dog you are!] in the original release )
text._info: (Changed from [You've soiled the Von Karma name and dragged it through the mud.] in the original release)

text.Edgeworth: Are you talking about the Von Karma family creed? "To be perfect in every way..." Then let's hear it, Franziska. How are things going? I hear you are having a rough time maintaining perfection in this country.

text.Franziska: Y-You!

text.Edgeworth: You seem to be getting crushed under the weight of it all. That's why I came back.

text.Franziska: Keep your assumptions to yourself! I... I haven't given in yet! I won't lose! This case is mine! I'll never hand it over to you! Never! Mr. Phoenix Wright! I will see you tomorrow... In court. It will be a clinical lesson on the meaning of "total victory"!

text.Edgeworth: Hmph. Still the same wild mare she always was.

CHOICE.Phoenix: That must be one of the detectives. He's mumbling something to himself.

CHOICE.Detective: "Hang in there! You'll be OK, buddy! You're not injured that badly! A hang nail isn't... ...H-Hey. Gumshoe! GUMSHOE! GUMSHOOOOOOOOOE!!"

CHOICE.Phoenix: ... He must be doing image training for when a fellow officer is injured.
I thought you, the Prosecutor Miles Edgeworth, had gone and died!

CHOICE.Pearl: Mr. Nick!

CHOICE.Phoenix: I... I never wanted to see you again!

CHOICE.Edgeworth: I think that's enough of a "warm welcome" for someone you haven't seen in a year...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Are you going to run tomorrow's trial...?

CHOICE.Edgeworth: ...You heard her, right? That wild mare hasn't given in yet, it seems. So, no, I don't think I'll be making an appearance.
Your hatred for me is quite unhealthy. Not to mention one-sided. But I will say one thing...
You can't win on your own at the trial tomorrow.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( What is that supposed to mean...? )

CHOICE.Edgeworth: I have something definitive that you lack. And working together is the definition of teamwork. It's the power to find the truth.
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [And that's the definition of teamwork. It's the power to find the truth.] in the original release)

CHOICE.Phoenix: "The truth"...?

CHOICE.Edgeworth: In order to understand this case, you have to understand a certain "truth". ...Well, if you ever feel the need for my assistance, it is available to you. I'm not in charge of this case, so I can be a bit more generous with information.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Just what is going on inside his head...? )

CHOICE.Edgeworth: A lot of things may have happened, however Manfred von Karma was still my mentor. And a "perfect win record" is proof of a Von Karma.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...One year ago, you could not establish guilt in a few cases... Are those losses the reason you suddenly disappeared from the Prosecutor's Office? Did you leave because you had lost your "perfect win record"...?
To think your motivation for prosecuting trials was so selfish... It'd been better for everyone if you never came back from the dead, Edgeworth!

CHOICE.Edgeworth: ... I see. Then let me ask you something. Why do YOU stand in the courtroom? What is your reason?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Well, with Franziska, she almost always says,
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [Well, if it was Franziska, she would almost definitely say,] in the original release)

CHOICE.Franziska: "I will defeat you this time!" the instant she sees me.
CHOICE._info: (Changed from ['I will defeat you this time!' the instant she saw me.] in the original release)

CHOICE.Phoenix: But... The courtroom is not a personal battlefield for prosecutors and lawyers. I stand in the courtroom to defend my client. ...To save their lives.

CHOICE.Edgeworth: To save your client, you say?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Those who think only of their own ego-driven goals... Those kind of prosecutors are reprehensible to me. Even if you're a "prodigy"... Or someone like you, Edgeworth...

CHOICE.Edgeworth: ... It looks like there is still a lot you have yet to learn.

CHOICE.Phoenix: "A lot I have yet to learn"? Me...?

CHOICE.Edgeworth: ...Hmph. Well, that's enough for now. The time when you will see is coming soon enough...
Ms. Inpax's death was most certainly a suicide. Of that there is no mistake. However, we could not find her suicide note. That's when the police began to suspect that someone had hidden it.

CHOICE.Phoenix: The suicide note? But how do you know Ms. Inpax had even written such a note?

CHOICE.Edgeworth: There was no solid evidence, however... We did find traces of ink on her right index finger. Which makes the likelihood of a suicide note very high.

CHOICE.Phoenix: But who would hide such a thing...?

CHOICE.Edgeworth: The police think it was Mr. Juan Corrida himself.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Th-The victim...?

CHOICE.Edgeworth: He was the one who found her body. Which makes him the only person who had a chance to hide her suicide note.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Mr. Corrida hid his own manager's suicide note...? But why...? )

CHOICE.Edgeworth: As long as her note is missing, any speculation beyond this is meaningless... For now, I think you should look this over. This is the suicide report... Part one anyway...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Part one...? )

What's this about Ms. Andrews having a "dependent nature"?
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [So, how are 'Adrian Andrews' and 'co-dependency' related?] in the original release)

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Adrian Andrews' attempt at suicide... was a few days after the death of Celeste Inpax.

CHOICE.Phoenix: And...?

text.Andrews: It's true. I am a woman who can only live in insecurity. I'm physically small, and I don't really have a lot of self-confidence. I've pushed against all that, though... I've tried to live strongly. I never wanted anyone to find out the truth...

text.Pearl: Ms. Andrews...

text.Andrews: This one thing... It's the one thing I wanted to take with me to the grave... It was my secret. Mine and mine alone.

text.Phoenix: I... I'm sorry.

text.Andrews: You probably think I'm a worthless human being right now, don't you?

text.Phoenix: Please, Ms. Andrews. All I want to know is the truth.

text.Andrews: After Celeste passed away, I heard that someone had hidden her suicide note... And that someone was Juan Corrida. Celeste... Without her... Without her, I became scared. Everything... Everyone seemed like they were out to get me.

text.Phoenix: So you got close to Mr. Corrida to recover her suicide note, correct?

text.Andrews: ... Looks like that tabloid reported the truth after all. Ironic, isn't it?

text.Phoenix: Well, like they say, where there's smoke, there's fire.

text.Andrews: And if they purposely add fuel to the fire, they keep the celebrity world burning.
But as for the suicide note? I didn't and wouldn't kill anyone for it. It just doesn't suit me, that's all.
... Well, that's enough for now. I still have work to do, so...

text.Phoenix: I understand.

text.Andrews: Oh, I have one small favor to ask. My... attempted suicide... I'd like for you to keep it a secret.

text.Pearl: Ms. Andrews...

text.Andrews: If... If people found out about my weakness... I... I would sooner choose to die than live.

text.Phoenix: A-A-Alright! I understand! We'll keep it a secret! ( Ms. Andrews... I guess she's the overthinking type... She probably never says anything without carefully thinking it through first. ( Changed from [She never says anything carelessly, it seems...] in the original release ) )
text._info: (Changed from [Ms. Andrews... I guess she's the 'always thinking' type...] in the original release)

text.Andrews: Thank you for your discretion.
text._info: (Changed from [Thank you very much.] in the original release)

text.Pearl: Mr. Nick... Can I ask you something...?

text.Phoenix: What is it?

text.Pearl: Ms. Andrews has been playing with that card in her hand since a little while back...

text.Phoenix: ( That card...? Yeah, I guess she has... ) Ms. Andrews, what is that card you're holding...?

text.Andrews: Huh? O-Oh, this? I don't quite know. It just suddenly appeared in my handbag...

text.Phoenix: What is it? It looks like... A seashell?

text.Andrews: That's what it looks like, doesn't it? I honestly don't remember owning this card... I wonder where I picked it up from...?

text.Phoenix: ( Her not remembering something clearly? Sounds like it would be a rare occurence. )

text.Andrews: Well, I must be off. I leave Mr. Engarde in your "capable" hands.

text.Phoenix: Well, I think we've gathered about all we can...

text.Pearl: Wh-What about Mystic Maya? Is she alright...?

text.Phoenix: ( Oh, Pearls... She looks so worn out by all this... She hasn't slept at all, and has been walking all over the place with me today... )

text.Pearl: What's wrong, Mr. Nick?

text.Phoenix: Let's go back to the office for a little while. You're really tired, right?

text.Pearl: Oh, no! I'm OK. Really! ... I'm fine. I really am.

text.Phoenix: ( You don't look fine to me... )

text.ACTION: March 21 Police Station Criminal Affairs Dept.

text.Pearl: There's no one here. Everyone's gone. I wonder if the three of them went to eat together!

text.Phoenix: ...I don't think they'd ever do that. They're probably in yet another meeting.

CHOICE.Phoenix: That must be one of the detectives. He's mumbling something to himself.

CHOICE.Detective: "Can't dig through the cereal box... Can't dig for the prize... Will lose sight of the target and ruin the cereal..."

CHOICE.Phoenix: ... He must be doing image training for a stake-out.

text.Pearl: So! What now?

text.Phoenix: Well, we did find one thing out for sure. Ms. Andrews has a motive.

text.Pearl: You mean Ms. Inpax's suicide note...?

text.Phoenix: That's right. She was also the one to discover the victim's body. Clever...

text.Pearl: Ah! Mr. Nick! The transceiver!

text.Phoenix: Hello!? Wright & Co. Law Offices!

text.Pearl: Phew...

text.???: ...Which is why, I suppose, she is absolutely famished.

text.Phoenix: Wh-What!?

text.???: So I suggest you win a quick acquittal, my friend. At any cost. Wouldn't you agree?

text.Phoenix: Wait! Maya! Let me hear her!

text.???: ...Very well.

text.Maya: ...Ask my...!

text.Phoenix: Maya! Is that you!?

text.Maya: ...Sis... Ask my sis!
