text.Phoenix: "Sis"...? What does she mean by that...?
Um, s-sorry... ...Ack!! Mia!

text.Mia: I have a message from Maya, so come, ask me anything you want about her.

CHOICE.Phoenix: What's going on with Maya is the most important thing right now! I should talk with Mia...
How's Maya!?

CHOICE.Mia: She's safe... for now. That kidnapper is one to keep his word, it seems.

CHOICE.Phoenix: I'm glad to hear she's safe... But Mia, how did you know...?

CHOICE.Mia: As soon as she was locked up, Maya called for me. I read the note she left... Then I gathered as much information about her surroundings as I could.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I didn't know you could use spirit channeling like that... Pretty smart of her... )
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [I didn't know you could use spirit channeling like this... Pretty smart of her...] in the original release)

CHOICE.Phoenix: The kidnapper! What's he like!?

CHOICE.Mia: I don't know... Apparently, Maya went to answer a phone call at the hotel and was drugged there...

CHOICE.Phoenix: And!?

CHOICE.Mia: She didn't see the face of her attacker.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Argh...

CHOICE.Mia: Sorry, but I don't have time to answer your questions.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Yeah... And we should be worrying about Maya right now... )

text.Mia: Maya is locked up in a very dark place right now. I'll tell you everything I heard when I was with her.

text.Phoenix: When you were with her...

text.Maya: Nnngh... I'm starving... I could really go for some apple pie... I mean, at a time like this, sweets are the only way to go! I have to stay positive! He promised he wasn't going to kill me! I'm not going to die! ( Sis... I wonder if you're with Nick right now... )

CHOICE.Maya: What's this...? It feels like there are a lot of glass bottles here. And these... They feel like barrels. I'll pass... Too bad I'm really hungry, and not really thirsty.
There's all sorts of things piled up here... But it's too dark to see.

Drat, it's locked. ( Hmm, but this door's lock seems easy enough to open... ) On TV, the hero always uses a plastic card or a stiff piece of cardboard... ...Then "click", they magically open the door. ( I wonder if there's a card like that around here I could use... )
Huh? Someone dropped a card here... It kinda looks like... a business card... But there's no name on it. Hmm... It's a picture of a seashell, I think... What a strange card.
If I don't do something to the door first, I don't think I'll be "moving" anywhere...

text.Maya: Ah! That's it! This shell card! If I use this, maybe I can get the door open! This might be my key out of here! I had a feeling this card might be useful... I'm such a genius! Alright. Now if you'll excuse me, Mr. Kidnapper...
( I did it! ) OK... Now I'm getting the heck out of here! ( I shouldn't keep Nick waiting... Or worried. )

text.ACTION: March 22, 9:47 AM District Court Defendant Lobby No. 3

text.Engarde: Adrian did it...?

text.Phoenix: ...That's what it looks like.

text.Engarde: Dude, no way! That woman couldn't do anything like that.

text.Phoenix: In court today, there will be a mountain of evidence that will implicate you.

text.Engarde: A mountain of evidence...?

text.Phoenix: I'm certain there is someone out there trying very hard to pin this whole thing on you.

text.Engarde: Please, Mr. Lawyer! Dude, like I said yesterday... I'm "refreshing like a spring breeze", alright? I can't let any sort of scandal ruin that.

text.Phoenix: I understand...

text.???: Well, it's almost time.

text.Phoenix: Mia...

text.Mia: We must get a complete acquittal today.

text.Phoenix: I know... But I can't focus on Maya's situation right now. ...Or Pearls' either. No matter what, I have to focus on winning this case by the end of the day!
text._info: (Changed from [I can't focus on Maya's situation right now.] in the original release)

text.Mia: Indeed. Well, let's get going!

text.Phoenix: ( It's him! )
This is Wright!

text.???: Good morning. This is it, Mr. Attorney; the day of the trial.

text.Phoenix: Maya... She's unharmed, right!?

text.???: Well... When I checked on her earlier this morning, she seemed a bit, how shall we say, tired.
Don't worry. People don't die that easily. Besides, what you really should be concentrating on, is winning today's trial.

text.Phoenix: G...Grrrr...

text.???: For my sake, as well as yours, you must win today's trial. Which is why... I sent you a little present this morning.
text._info: (Changed from [For myself, you must win today's trial.] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: Present? What in the world would you want to give me!?

text.???: You'll figure it out once the trial starts... And even if you don't "like" my gift... I expect you to graciously accept it, and win the day's contest... If you please.
text._info: (Changed from [You'll figure it out once the trial opens... even if you don't 'like' my gift...] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: Wait!
( The kidnapper sent me a "present"...? )

text.Engarde: Mr. Lawyer dude? Who was that...?

text.Phoenix: Ah, um... No one. It has nothing to do with you, so forget you heard anything!

text.Engarde: ...Dude, did your nose just get longer?

text.ACTION: March 22, 10:00 AM District Court Courtroom No. 3

text.Judge: Court is now in session for the trial of Matt Engarde. Are the prosecution and defense ready?

text.Phoenix: The defense is ready, Your Honor.

text.Judge: ... I say! Mr. Wright! What happened to Ms. von Karma!?

text.Phoenix: I-I don't know, Your Honor! ( Why are you getting mad at me!? )

text.Judge: Please be quiet, bailiff. Court is in session. If you must tell me something, please keep it brief. Now then, what is it?

text.Bailiff: Prosecutor... Prosecutor von Karma has... This morning, Ms. von Karma was shot by an unknown gunman!

text.Judge: ... WWWWWWWHAT!?

text.Phoenix: Sh-Shot!?

text.Mia: Somehow... I think this is the "present" that man was talking about.

text.Phoenix: His "present"...!

text.Mia: Ms. von Karma is one of the top prosecutors in the country at the moment. If she were to disappear... it would be to your " advantage ". ( Changed from [This would be to your 'advantage'.] in the original release )
text._info: (Changed from [If she disappeared...] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: ( Th-This... This is totally insane! ) M-Ms. von Karma! Is she alright!?

text.Judge: I don't have that answer! ...

text.???: She's alive and in stable condition.

text.Judge: That's good... Phew. ... ...! Y-Y-You're...

text.Phoenix: ( I thought he'd show up... )

text.Edgeworth: ...Your Honor... Due to the circumstances, Ms. Franziska von Karma can not appear in court today. I, Miles Edgeworth, will be taking her place. The prosecution is ready... naturally.

Ms. von Karma was shot in her right shoulder, and is currently undergoing surgery. Luckily, I have looked this case over and am familiar with the details. The prosecution seeks to prove the guilt of Mr. Matt Engarde.

text.Judge: Th-The court acknowledges the prosecution.

text.Edgeworth: ...Wright. I finally found the answer I was struggling for on my long journey this past year. By the time this case comes to an end, you too, will know the answer.
Now then, the prosecution would like to call its first witness... Please bring Detective Gumshoe to the witness stand!
Witness, your name and occupation.

text.Gumshoe: My name's Dick Gumshoe, sir. I'm a detective down at the precinct... for now.

text.Judge: "For now"...?

text.Gumshoe: After this trial's over... I'm supposed to turn in my badge, sir.

text.Phoenix: ( D-Detective Gumshoe... )

text.Edgeworth: The prosecution has no need for a depressed witness. Lift your head up and face forward like a proud officer, Detective Dick Gumshoe!

text.Gumshoe: Y-Yes, sir!

text.Edgeworth: Now, let's have your testimony. If we want to explore the various facets of this case, we must start with that.

text.Mia: Get ready, Phoenix. This is going to be one very rough fight.

text.Phoenix: Yeah... It would have to be with Edgeworth as my opponent. ( The answer he was "struggling" for... Interesting... Show me this "answer" you finally found, Edgeworth... )

text.Gumshoe:
This murder happened after the Hero of Heroes award ceremony, sir. 
The victim, Juan Corrida, was found dead in his hotel room. 
After looking into the cause of death, we believe he was definitely murdered, sir. 
At first, we thought there was something suspicious about the empty guitar case. 
However, we later found out that the guitar case had nothing to do with the murder.

text.Judge: Hmm... After the award ceremony ended, the victim was alone in his room...?

text.Gumshoe: Yes, sir! Both the victim and defendant went alone to their rooms, sir.

text.Judge: I see. Mr. Wright, you may begin your cross-examination.

text.Gumshoe: This murder happened after the Hero of Heroes award ceremony, sir.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
Would you please give us a brief timeline of what happened after the ceremony?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: OK, pal. The ceremony started at 6 PM. It ended around 8 PM... and then there was a short break. A special post-ceremony show was supposed to start in the lobby 30 minutes later.

CHOICE.Phoenix: And that's when the victim's body was found, correct?

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Which is to say, the murder occurred during that thirty minute break period.

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm... Please continue with your testimony, Detective.

text.Gumshoe: The victim, Juan Corrida, was found dead in his hotel room.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
The person who discovered the victim's body was Adrian Andrews, correct?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: ...Yeah.

CHOICE.Judge: Who is this "Adrian Andrews" you're talking about?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: She's the defendant, Matt Engarde's, manager. She's a really pretty lady... sir.

CHOICE.Judge: Ah, so she's a pretty lady... I wonder if she will grace us with her presence...

CHOICE.Gumshoe: When the post-ceremony show was about to start, she went to get Mr. Engarde. After visiting his room, she next went to the victim's room to get him for the show, sir.

CHOICE.Judge: I see... And that's when she found the victim's body...

text.Gumshoe: After looking into the cause of death, we believe he was definitely murdered, sir.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
The cause of death... Wasn't that because Mr. Corrida was stabbed in the chest...?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Only a careless amateur would believe something so brainless as that, pal. Take a good, hard look at the crime photo. Now, a real pro's attention would be drawn here, to this bandana.

CHOICE.Judge: Mmm... "Banana"...

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Um, his "bandana", sir... That's the thing wrapped tightly around his neck, sir.

CHOICE.Judge: Ah, yes, yes. I see. His banana-scented bandana.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Then, what about the knife...?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: It seems to have been stuck in the victim's chest on purpose after his death.

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm... We have a crafty murderer on our hands here.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
The cause of death... Wasn't that because Mr. Corrida was stabbed in the chest...?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Only a careless amateur would believe something so brainless as that, pal. Take a good, hard look at the crime photo. Now, a real pro's attention would be drawn here, to this bandana.

CHOICE.Judge: Mmm... "Banana"...

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Um, his "bandana", sir... That's the thing wrapped tightly around his neck, sir.

CHOICE.Judge: Ah, yes, yes. I see. His banana-scented bandana.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Then, what about the knife...?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: It seems to have been stuck in the victim's chest on purpose after his death.

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm... We have a crafty murderer on our hands here.

text.Gumshoe: At first, we thought there was something suspicious about the empty guitar case.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
And why did you think that?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Because it was empty, pal. The Jammin' Ninja doesn't go anywhere without his bright red guitar. And we couldn't find it anywhere at the scene of the crime.

CHOICE.Judge: Oh! Then how about this theory! A fan really wanted the guitar and did the crime to get it! How's that!?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Um, we thought of that too... But...

CHOICE.Phoenix: But...?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: The only fingerprints on the guitar case were the victim's.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Only the victim's, huh...?

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm... I see. Ah, so much for my theory then...

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
And why did you think that?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Because it was empty, pal. The Jammin' Ninja doesn't go anywhere without his bright red guitar. And we couldn't find it anywhere at the scene of the crime.

CHOICE.Judge: Oh! Then how about this theory! A fan really wanted the guitar and did the crime to get it! How's that!?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Um, we thought of that too... But...

CHOICE.Phoenix: But...?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: The only fingerprints on the guitar case were the victim's.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Only the victim's, huh...?

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm... I see. Ah, so much for my theory then...

text.Gumshoe: However, we later found out that the guitar case had nothing to do with the murder.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
What convinced you it had nothing to do with the case?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: The guitar wasn't at the Gatewater Hotel that night.

CHOICE.Judge: Well then, where was it?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: The bright red guitar was eventually found at the TV studio. The victim, Juan Corrida, had apparently only taken the case with him, sir.

CHOICE.Judge: So you mean he forgot to put the guitar inside the case...?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Yes, sir. Even when he was onstage for the ceremony, he didn't have his guitar.

CHOICE.Phoenix: So that guitar case was empty even before he got to the hotel...

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Yeah, that's right. So it really had nothing to do with the case after all.

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm...

text.Mia: Our first order of business should be to gather more info from his testimony.

text.Phoenix: But there might be a trap set up for us somewhere...

text.Mia: Maybe. However, setting off traps is a part of a lawyer's job too.

text.Phoenix: If you say so...

text.Mia: Of course, we're supposed to escape from them too, wouldn't you say?

text.ACTION: After pressing third, fourth, and fifth statements:

text.Edgeworth: I believe that is enough. First, the victim was choked to death with his bandana. Then, after the victim was dead, the killer deliberately stabbed him with a knife.

text.Judge: Hmm...

text.Edgeworth: Which brings me to my next point. Why then, did the police arrest Matt Engarde...? Because there was reason enough to suspect him.

text.Phoenix: ( Here it comes... Looks like Edgeworth's back in full swing... )

text.Judge: Very well. Detective Gumshoe, please testify about this matter.

text.Gumshoe: Yes, sir!

Matt Engarde and Juan Corrida were huge rivals with each other. 
They each thought the other guy was "in his way". That's motive enough in my book. 
As for evidence... There's the Jammin' Ninja's button. 
It was ripped off of the ninja costume and was found in Mr. Engarde's "hakama". 
The defendant's fingerprints were also all over the knife. 
The defendant bought the knife for the crime... Which makes this a premeditated murder!

text.Judge: Hmm... So the defendant's fingerprints were found on the knife used in the stabbing.

text.Gumshoe: It was sort of sticky on the handle, so the fingerprints came out pretty clearly, sir.
...And there's this button.

text.Judge: That was found in the defendant's clothes, was it? Hmm... And is this button also covered in blood...?

text.Gumshoe: Yes, and we know that the blood on it is the victim's blood, sir.

text.Phoenix: What!?

text.Judge: All of this points very clearly to the defendant, doesn't it?

text.Edgeworth: Yes, it most certainly does, Your Honor. Ready to give in yet, Wright?

text.Phoenix: Hmph! I'll find the hole in your argument somehow!

text.Edgeworth: You can press as hard as you'd like. Just hurry up with your usual pointless questions.

text.Phoenix: Grrrrrrrrr...

text.Gumshoe: Matt Engarde and Juan Corrida were huge rivals with each other.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
But in terms of popularity, Mr. Engarde won, did he not?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: ...Yeah. But you know what's ironic, pal? Juan Corrida was always one step behind Mr. Engarde in everything. This year it seemed like he'd finally caught up, ready for the big, final showdown.

CHOICE.Phoenix: But Mr. Corrida lost the Grand Prix in the end...

CHOICE.Judge: That is too bad... He must have been pretty downhearted after losing.

text.Gumshoe: They each thought the other guy was "in his way". That's motive enough in my book.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
Wait just one second here! Mr. Engarde was beating Mr. Corrida in the popularity polls!

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Well, yeah, I guess, but...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Which means that in the defendant's eyes, the victim was not a rival at all! Which means he had no motive to kill at all!

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm... Yes, I quite agree. Well, Detective?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Um, it's not... Well... I guess if you put it that way, then yeah, the defendant would've had no motive...

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Objection!
Detective. I'm beginning to see why you were fired.

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Eh!? N-No! Not you too, Mr. Edgeworth, sir! That's...

CHOICE.Edgeworth: I look forward to your pension negotiations.

CHOICE.Gumshoe: N-N-N-NOOOOOOOOOOO!

CHOICE.Judge: Now, now, Detective. Let's continue with the testimony.

CHOICE.Gumshoe: * sniffle * Noooo... Not my poor pension too...

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Detective! If you value your money, I suggest you proceed!

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Y-Yes, sir! We can talk about my pension later, sir!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Um, what about what I was saying...? Hello? Anyone...? )

text.Gumshoe: As for evidence... There's the Jammin' Ninja's button.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
Do you have any proof that button belonged to the victim?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Huh? What do you mean, pal?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Oh. Umm, let me put it this way... I'm asking you if you have any evidence to back up your claim that, "this button was ripped off of the Jammin' Ninja's costume".

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Huh? But can't you tell by just looking at it?
A-And the victim's blood is on it.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Anyone could have smeared that blood on there afterward.

CHOICE.Gumshoe: ... M-M-Mr. Edgeworth... Help me... sir!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Alright! I knew it had to be this piece of evidence. Now to reel this one in... )

CHOICE.Edgeworth: ...Thread.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Huh?

CHOICE.Edgeworth: The button was attached to the costume by thread, obviously. And that thread snapped when the button was torn off. If you match up the ends of the thread on the costume with the thread on the button... it's a perfect match.

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Yeah, that's it! They're a perfect match, pal!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Urk.

CHOICE.Mia: That's Edgeworth for you. Never misses a beat.

text.Gumshoe: It was ripped off of the ninja costume and was found in Mr. Engarde's "hakama".

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
When was this button found?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Pretty soon after the body was found, we rounded up everyone who knew Mr. Corrida. And then we did a search on them all. That's when we found the button.

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm... So it was almost immediately after the murder...

CHOICE.Edgeworth: The police didn't have the free time to lollygag and play tricks, unlike some people...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Hey! What is he trying to say about me here? )

text.Gumshoe: The defendant's fingerprints were also all over the knife.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
How were the fingerprints arranged on the knife?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Huh? What do you mean, pal?

CHOICE.Phoenix: By examining the fingerprints, you can determine how the defendant held the knife. For example, did he hold it normally, or overhand...?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Oh! Is that what you meant!? Well, we didn't actually think of that...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I can't believe the bumbling of this department... )

CHOICE.Edgeworth: ...Hopeless. Were you paying attention to the testimony, Wright? The defendant's fingerprints were "all over" the knife. There is no way to determine how the knife was held at the moment of the murder.

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm... So is the defendant the owner of this knife, then?

text.Gumshoe: The defendant bought the knife for the crime... Which makes this a premeditated murder!

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
There is no way this was a premeditated murder, even if he bought the knife!

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Sorry, pal. This isn't just some pocket knife. It's not really useful for anything, and you can't just walk around with it either.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Argh. Well, this is not good... If the prosecution can prove it was a premeditated murder , we're done for... )

CHOICE.Mia: ...Phoenix.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Y-Yes?

CHOICE.Mia: There's something very interesting about what the detective said just now. Think carefully, before it's too late.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Objection!

text.Phoenix: ( A button covered in the victim's blood... And a knife with Engarde's fingerprints! )

text.Mia: Be grateful. If the judge were more rash, he would've already pounded his gavel in closing.

text.Phoenix: We're still in a world of trouble...

text.Mia: Well, before any battle, you must find your enemy's weakness. So let's find the weakness in this testimony, no matter how small it may be, OK Phoenix?

text.Phoenix: Wait a second!

text.Gumshoe: Wh-What?

text.Phoenix: So the basis of your argument that this was a premeditated murder is simply that my client "bought a knife beforehand"?

text.Gumshoe: That's right, pal. The defendant...

text.Phoenix: ...Did not buy this knife.

text.Gumshoe: H-Huh!?

text.Phoenix: Take a good look at the handle of this knife, and you'll know what I'm talking about.

text.Gumshoe: ...Huh?

text.Judge: It has a " Gatewater " seal set into the handle...

text.Gumshoe: "Gatewater"...? I think I've heard that name somewhere before.

text.Phoenix: That's the name of the hotel. The Gatewater Hotel.

text.Gumshoe: ... Uh oh.

text.Phoenix: The murder knife was actually property of the hotel! Which means this murder was not premeditated!

text.Judge: Yes, that is very true! This is a very big...

text.Edgeworth: Heh heh heh...

text.Judge: Wh-What is it, Mr. Edgeworth?

text.Edgeworth: I'm sorry, but the defense is simply too careless.

text.Phoenix: What!?

text.Edgeworth: I think whether the crime was premeditated or not... has already been determined.

text.Phoenix: H-How so!?

text.Edgeworth: I admit this knife is hotel property. There is no one currently on the police force that is dumb enough not to realize this.

text.Gumshoe: ...But I didn't kn... Oh... * whimper *

text.Edgeworth: The question is... Where did this knife come from?

text.Judge: Wh-Why that's obvious! It came from the victim, Mr. Corrida's room...

text.Edgeworth: Sorry, Your Honor, but that is incorrect. The victim ate a last meal before he was murdered. With that being the case... I would like to draw the court's attention to what is on top of the table.

text.Judge: There is a knife and a fork on the table! Then... Where in the world did this knife come from!?

text.Edgeworth: If it pleases the court... I would like for us to recall the room of the defendant, Mr. Matt Engarde. Especially what was on top of his table... There is something missing... Perhaps, it is a single knife? We investigated the leftover dishes for fingerprints, and while we were investigating, we came to the conclusion that Mr. Matt Engarde's knife was missing.

text.Phoenix: Urk...

text.Edgeworth: Mr. Engarde had gone to the victim's room with the knife he had used during dinner. Why would he carry a knife on a visit? To kill, of course. And with that, I believe the prosecution has proven... This was a premeditated murder.

text.Judge: Amazing, Mr. Edgeworth. Absolutely brilliant. A brilliantly clear deduction.

text.Mia: It seems like Edgeworth had this planned from the very beginning...

text.Phoenix: ( This must be one of those "traps", and I just walked headlong into it! )

text.Judge: A murder weapon with fingerprints, and a button from the victim's costume. There is quite a sizable amount of evidence here.

text.Edgeworth: I can safely say that any further deliberation is a waste of Your Honor's time. Although... I wouldn't mind if the defense were to present evidence not yet shown to the court.

text.Phoenix: ( Evidence not yet shown...? )

text.Mia: He means evidence that the court hasn't seen yet. In other words, new evidence.

text.Judge: What does the defense have to say about this, Mr. Wright?

text.Phoenix: Um, well...

text.Mia: Phoenix. The judge is favoring the prosecution right now. If we answer with something wrong here...

text.Phoenix: ( That gavel of his will be ringing out to the sound of our defeat! )

text.Judge: Mr. Wright, do you have something important and necessary to present to this court?

CHOICE.ACTION: USER SELECTS No, not right now.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( This has to be another trap! Better if I don't say anything than risk throwing out a bad piece of evidence. )

CHOICE.Judge: Looks like the defense isn't saying a peep on this one.

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Which means this court is adjourned.

CHOICE.Mia: Phoenix! We will lose this case if you give up here! So you had better show the judge something! Quick!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Slow down! We all know I have a tendency to be wrong more than... I can't even say it! )
HOLD IT!

text.Phoenix: There's one...
One piece of evidence that catches my attention. Something that this court has yet to see!

text.Judge: Mr. Wright. I will say this one more time. I do not feel this trial needs to continue at all. ... However, I am giving you one chance... and only one.

text.Edgeworth: What the judge is saying, Wright, is don't try pulling one of your usual bluffs here.

text.Phoenix: ( If I mess this up, it's curtains for all of us! )

text.Judge: You may now present one, and only one piece of evidence. Now then, what is this important evidence that you must show to the court?

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "This... is a wine glass, is it not?"

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Sorry, Wright, but this time, your bluffing steered you wrong.

CHOICE.Judge: I can see nothing strange about this piece of evidence.

CHOICE.Phoenix: W-Wait!

CHOICE.Judge: I am a man of my word, Mr. Wright!

text.Judge: This... is a wine glass, is it not?

text.Phoenix: Please look at the photo of the crime scene one more time! The scene is a mess because of the victim's struggle against his assailant. The vase was broken, his makeup is all over the floor... These were all things that were at one point, sitting on top of the dresser.

text.Judge: Hmm... Well, yes, I see your point.

text.Phoenix: However! This glass, that is sitting on top of the dresser, is mysteriously untouched. The only thing that had not fallen over along with everything else is this wine glass! This piece of evidence is more than strange enough to warrant further consideration!
W-Well? What do you all have to say...?

text.Judge: Ah, well, yes, it is a little peculiar...

text.Phoenix: Y-Yes, isn't it!? I thought it was!

text.Judge: You can stop looking at me with those puppy dog eyes of yours now. Mr. Edgeworth?

text.Edgeworth: What is it, Your Honor?

text.Judge: Your opinion...

text.Edgeworth: ...You don't need my opinion. Because there is no special meaning to that glass.

text.Phoenix: ...What!?

text.Edgeworth: It's safe to say that the glass was set there after the crime took place. By the person who discovered the body, Adrian Andrews, for example. She could have easily been so shocked that she set the glass down without thinking.

text.Judge: Hmm... That does sound very plausible. Mr. Wright?

text.Phoenix: ( Could Ms. Andrews really have set that glass down without thinking...? )

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( It's possible that is what happened. There's nothing that points to Ms. Andrews not being the one who set the cup down. And if I raise an objection here, that would only make the judge slam his gavel down... )

CHOICE.Mia: You can't think like that, Phoenix.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Mia...

CHOICE.Mia: Right now, you're hanging on by a very thin thread. Anything else you can grab onto right now is better than nothing!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( So in other words, push as far as we can go... )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "The defense would like to challenge the prosecution's theory."

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( If I appear weak here, the trial is over. I can look for my proof later! For now, I should trust my instinct and point with certainty! )

CHOICE.Mia: They just might fall for it, if you're thought-provoking enough!

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "The defense would like to challenge the prosecution's theory."

text.Phoenix: The defense would like to challenge the prosecution's theory. We would like to see something that proves it was Ms. Andrews who set the cup on the table!

text.Judge: Hmm... You've turned the situation on its head yet again, as usual. Mr. Edgeworth. Do you have any proof to back up your claim?

text.Phoenix: ( There's no way he has any. He's just bluffing! )

text.Edgeworth: Unlike Mr. Wright, I never say anything unless I have the evidence to support it.

text.Phoenix: Wh-What!?

text.Edgeworth: You're not thinking hard enough today, Wright. Did you think this wine glass escaped my notice?

text.Phoenix: Th-Then...

text.Edgeworth: Of course it has been thoroughly inspected... for fingerprints.

text.Phoenix: Fingerprints...

text.Edgeworth: There were only one set of fingerprints left on this wine glass.

text.Judge: Only one? Well, whose were they!?

text.Edgeworth: They were not the victim's nor the defendant's. Rather, they were of one Adrian Andrews.

text.Phoenix: WHAT!?

text.Edgeworth: That is why I said that the person who had discovered the body had left it there. Are we done here, Mr. Wright?

text.Phoenix: ( Grrr! I can't believe I fell into another trap! )

text.Edgeworth: Ms. Andrews was probably holding the glass when she went to see Mr. Corrida. But upon seeing his dead body, she was stunned, and set the glass down on the dresser.

text.Judge: Hmm... What you just said makes a lot of sense.

text.Edgeworth: Tsk tsk tsk... Now do you see, Wright? You can't change any part of my scenario as it explains everything all too well.

text.Phoenix: Grrr!

text.Edgeworth: I've thought long and hard this past year about what it means to be a "prosecutor". And from here on out, I will show you the answer I have come to discover!

text.Judge: W-Wait a second... Mr. Edgeworth! I think the prosecution has provided enough evidence for me to enter my verdict...

text.Edgeworth: Unfortunately, I can not allow you to pass judgment yet. The prosecution has yet another witness we would like the court to hear from.

text.Phoenix: "Another witness"...?

text.Edgeworth: Yes. Bailiff! Please bring in the next witness!

text.Mia: What in the world is Mr. Edgeworth thinking?

text.Edgeworth: Now then, witness, please state your name and occupation...
... Witness! Your name and occupation, please!
Uurrngh!

text.Oldbag: ...Heh. G.O.T.C.H.A!

text.Edgeworth: Grrrrrrrrr...

text.Phoenix: ( I wonder what happened to that calm composure he had earlier... )

text.Oldbag: Oh, Edgey-boy! It's been what, a year since we last met, hasn't it? You should be more happy to see me!

text.Edgeworth: I saw the report with her testimony, but who knew that under that helmet... it was the wicked witch of the witness stand!?

text.Oldbag: I tell you, this time I know what I'm supposed to do! So today, I'm going to tell you anything and everything! Even things that don't have to do with that terrible crime.

text.Judge: Ms... Witness... "That terrible crime" is all this court needs to know.
Oof!

text.Oldbag: Shush! I'm talking to my dear Edgey-Wedgey right now! Don't interrupt us, gramps!

text.Judge: Yes, madam.

text.Edgeworth: No no no, please, by all means interrupt her! Please! * ahem * Anyway, witness, your testimony please.

text.Oldbag: It's true what they say, that youth are hotheaded nowadays. Not that I mind at all, Edgey. Now then, what should I start with...?

text.Edgeworth: The witness was on security detail at the hotel on the night of the murder. Is this correct, Ms. Oldbag?

text.Oldbag: It was a great job being able to see my dearie Juan! It was almost too much for my little heart to handle!

text.Judge: You mean... You were a fan of the victim?

text.Oldbag: Look, everyone is crazy over that Engarde, saying he's cute in a fresh way, or something. But not me! I wouldn't say anything so silly. After all, I have no interest in a little child like him. I'm only interested in a real man: Juan Corrida!

text.Phoenix: ( Um... But those two were the same age... )

text.Oldbag: Anyway, as I was saying, I was pacing in front of his room that night.

text.Edgeworth: Very well. Please tell the court what you witnessed the night of the murder.

text.Oldbag: Leave it to me, Edgey-poo!

Anyway, after the ceremony, I went to pace around in the hallway in front of his room. 
There was something I was interested in finding out, you know... 
Well, since I was on the job, I made sure to keep a good eye out the whole time. 
That's when someone showed up! It was a man coming out of poor Juan's room. 
It was Engarde. Matt Engarde. He was trying to sneak his way out of Juan's room!

text.Judge: Hmm... So Mr. Engarde came out from the victim's room...

text.Oldbag: See! It has to be him! He's the murderer!

text.Judge: I see. Well, Mr. Wright. You may begin your cross-examination.

text.Oldbag: Anyway, after the ceremony, I went to pace around in the hallway in front of his room.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
Ms. Oldbag, what was your post on that night?

CHOICE.Oldbag: The lobby. I was supposed to help set up the stage for that trifling show. But I refused to help, I'll have you know. It was for that Lead-headed Samurai's show. Heh, I even took out a few of the nails.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Maybe it was a good thing the show didn't go on... )

CHOICE.Oldbag: Besides, that manager with the glasses seemed to be working hard at it without me. So I thought I'd take a break and spread my wings a little.

CHOICE.Phoenix: And that's when you went to hang around the victim's door?

text.Oldbag: There was something I was interested in finding out, you know...

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
Something you were "interested" in? And just what was that?

CHOICE.Oldbag: It's not some little thing I can just go around telling everyone, you know. It's top secret, between me and Juan. Ah, and Edgey, of course.

CHOICE.Judge: Mr. Edgeworth. What is this thing she was "interested" in...?

CHOICE.Edgeworth: I have no idea. I despise gossip, Your Honor.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( "Gossip"...? )

CHOICE.Edgeworth: If this has something to do with the case, then you can append it to your testimony.

CHOICE.Judge: ...Yes, well, that would explain why your age was not recorded in the report.

CHOICE.Edgeworth: In any case... The witness then saw someone, correct?

CHOICE.Oldbag: ... Ah! I'm too scared! I can't say his name out loud!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Oh, what I wouldn't give to have Franziska's whip right about now... )

CHOICE.Oldbag: Well, I guess I can tell you, since he was such a bad boy anyway.

CHOICE.Oldbag: You don't need me to tell you about his face! That soft, gentle look in his eyes and his effeminate lips! His right eye covered by his silky hair! His sparkling, shining teeth!

CHOICE.Phoenix: His teeth were... shining?

CHOICE.Oldbag: Well, he's shining all around in this week's pin-up poster, dearie.

CHOICE.Oldbag: What? Engarde's face is the same no matter where it is, right, you whippersnapper!?

I guess it really wasn't that important after all.

CHOICE.Judge: * sigh * Mr. Wright, do you know why we say time is valuable? If not, I suggest you learn.

Then perhaps you would like to point out what part of that testimony was important!

CHOICE.Judge: Mr. Wright. There is something much more valuable than a person's pride. And that is "time". Please don't waste this court's precious time with worthless questions!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Y-Yes, Your Honor... ( I think I just wasted his good favor... )
What was the man you saw carrying?

CHOICE.Oldbag: In which hand? His right or his left?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Um...

CHOICE.Oldbag: Ah, now this is a real mess. I mean, I can't be expected to answer such a vague question!

CHOICE.Oldbag: Empty.

text.Mia: She may not remember things or be mistaken here and there, but I don't think she's lying.

text.Mia: But, that's how the human mind is. It also has the tendency to jump off-topic. She's strayed onto a few interesting side-topics this time too, hasn't she? But that's what makes her a sweet old lady, right?

Ms. Oldbag...

text.Oldbag: What!? Don't say my name for no reason!

text.Phoenix: Do you know what this is?

text.Oldbag: Aaaah! It's button number 2 on the Jammin' Ninja's costume!

text.Phoenix: ( Now I KNOW she's an obsessed fan... She identified it in a single glance! )

text.Oldbag: Give it here! Give it here! If you don't give it to me, I'll punish you with this!

text.Phoenix: ( Wow... She really is a die-hard fan to want a button covered in blood... ) This button was discovered on Mr. Engarde's body during a full body search.

text.Oldbag: See! See! This button proves beyond a shadow of a doubt it was that rascal Engarde!

text.Phoenix: It was caught up in the pleats of his Nickel Samurai hakama pants.

text.Oldbag: See! See! And Engarde is the Nickel Samurai!

text.Phoenix: ...Witness! Now, it may just be me, and I do have an active imagination, but just now, didn't you say that the defendant... Matt Engarde was wearing his "usual racing jacket "!?

text.Oldbag: ... ... ... Ah... I'm so sorry. Sorry that you judge people based on what they wear! If I wore the trendiest dress, then maybe you'd think I was the most gorgeous woman ever! But instead, I have to put up with wearing this ridiculous-looking outfit. You'd agree this outfit is hideous, right? I've got a tape recorder stuck on my chest! Lemme tell you, it's HEAVY! So heavy, I wish we would have switched to CDs ages ago! But I'm keeping that dream alive for all those kids out there, I work hard with a smile on my face, don't you understand!? Now, take a look in the mirror. Your clothes are about as interesting as a documentary on curling! You should take a tip or ten from Edgey-poo. Now HE'S got style!

text.Judge: Now hold your tongue still there for one second! So what you saw in actuality, was not Mr. Engarde, the man... but Mr. Engarde, the Nickel Samurai!?

text.Oldbag: But when you think about it... They're really one and the same anyway...

text.Phoenix: Ms. Oldbag! This is a very important point we're talking about!

text.Oldbag: Edgey-poo! Do you think so too?

text.Edgeworth: Well, it might be something worth considering.

text.Phoenix: Just say, "It's important" and agree with me for a change!

text.Judge: Witness! Think carefully and try to remember as much as you can before you testify!

text.Oldbag: * sigh * Alright, if you insist.

text.Phoenix: ( I should be the one sighing, not you! )

text.Oldbag:
Engarde... Engarde... Yes, now I remember! 
The Nickel Samurai, that's right, it was the Nickel Samurai that I saw! 
Yes, it would have been convenient for him to wear his costume during the murder. 
He had to go to that post-ceremony stage show right after the crime, you know. 
So he must've worn that Nickel Samurai costume when he was stabbing poor Juan.

text.Phoenix: But... But the possibility does exist!

text.Oldbag: Ah, young'uns today. I told you, there is no way it was anyone else.

text.Judge: H-How do you know that?

text.Oldbag: Because... I said so. And what I say is the truth.

text.Phoenix: ( At least she's just as delightful a witness as she was a year ago... )

CHOICE.Phoenix: Uh, what?

CHOICE.Oldbag: "A striking figure by the sea, standing all alone is he. He's the Nickel Samurai!"

CHOICE.Oldbag: OKAAAAAAAY! ... You promise, right!?

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Wright. I'll be sending the bill for the chewing gum to your office at a later date.

He probably took his gloves off before he began the stabbing!

text.Judge: Hmm... But the murder still did take place...

text._info: (Changed from [Looks like I've made your life a tiny bit more difficult, huh Edgey...?] in the original release)

text.Edgeworth: Gnnnnngh...

text.Judge: Witness, did you or did you not really see the Nickel Samurai?

text.Oldbag: Well, I guess at first I might have forgotten, but...

text.Phoenix: Are you saying you mixed up Mr. Engarde with the Nickel Samurai, his character on TV!?

text.Oldbag: But I mean, I can't really do anything about that now! Look, I was waiting around in front of their doors because, well... Well, I wasn't waiting around for the Nickel Samurai, that's for sure!
text._info: (Changed from [But I mean, I can't really do anything about that!] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: ...! ( She wasn't waiting for the " Nickel Samurai "...? ) Alright then... Who were you waiting around for then?

text.Oldbag: ... Hmph! That's top secret to anyone outside of security!

text.Judge: I have a feeling that you were waiting for Mr. Juan Corrida. Am I correct, witness?

text.Oldbag: Ha ha ha. The way you think, you are a sad amateur with a terrible case of near-sightedness.

text.Judge: Amateur...? Me...? What am I an amateur of...?

text.Phoenix: ( So Oldbag was waiting around in front of the victim's room... But it doesn't sound like she was waiting to catch a glimpse of Mr. Corrida... )

text.Mia: Maybe... Phoenix! Maybe the old bag was waiting around for "that" person!

text.Phoenix: ( Hmm, if it's who I think Mia's hinting at... It's certainly possible... ) Ms. Oldbag. You were waiting for this person to come out of the victim's room, weren't you?

CHOICE.ACTION: USER SELECTS Present Adrian Andrews profile

CHOICE.Mia: What are you talking about, Phoenix!? She could've waited until the next century and this would never have appeared!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Ouch... Busted... Guess there's no fooling her. )

CHOICE.Judge: You two! What do you think you're doing flirting in my courtroom!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: We weren't doing anything like that... Honest... ( Well, back to the drawing board on this one... Oldbag was waiting around in front of the victim's room... )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads back to "But it doesn't sound like she was waiting to catch a glimpse of Mr. Corrida..."

text.Judge: Who is this person...?

text.Phoenix: This is Adrian Andrews, Mr. Engarde's manager.

text.Judge: B-But why would the defendant's manager be in the victim's room...?

text.Edgeworth: It seems that this is the latest rumor in circulation, Your Honor.

text.Judge: ...Hmm... Oh... This is... Well, this is... Hmm, hmm... Hah, I see...

text.Phoenix: ( The judge seems to be really into the "article"... If it can be called such a thing... )

text.Judge: Then this manager with the initials A. A. ... Are you saying it's...?

text.Edgeworth: Adrian Andrews . Without a doubt, the witness thought so as well.

text.Oldbag: ... Hmph. Looks like you found me out. Well, that's fine. I can throw away this whole "sworn to confidentiality stuff" then.
text._info: (Changed from [Well, that's fine. I can throw away this whole sworn to confidentiality stuff.] in the original release)

text.Judge: W-Witness...? What in the world are you...

text.Mia: Watch out, Phoenix. I've got a bad feeling about this... A very bad feeling.

text.Oldbag: I got some information... Some very secret information from a certain source. So that's why I was doing my own little investigation... In secret, of course.

text.Judge: B-But what for...?

text.Oldbag: Oh, just for myself... Personal reasons and all that.

text.Judge: ... Well, Mr. Edgeworth. How will you proceed from here?

text.Edgeworth: I really don't want to do this, however I cannot simply let this point slide.

text.Judge: I see. Very well then. Witness, please testify about this "secret information".

text.Oldbag: Get ready! This is going to take the wind out of you young'uns!

text.Phoenix: ( I'm sure we're all capable of handling this... Really, it's not like we're ten years old. )

text.Oldbag:
That Engarde is one evil, evil man! 
He thought he could ruin poor Juan by causing a huge scandal! 
So to do that, he sent his own manager to get in close with Juan! 
I cannot condone such dirty tricks! So I took action! 
...Oh, and this is top secret, you got that!? Nobody else but you and me know yet, OK?

text.Judge: The defendant sent his manager...? What a distasteful topic for this court!

text.Oldbag: What!? Nobody's above gossip! And isn't there a saying!? "The truth is never pleasant."

text.Phoenix: ( Never heard that one before... )

text.Judge: Mr. Edgeworth. What about this Adrian Andrews person...?

text.Edgeworth: We have looked into this matter, and found that the "truth" the article proposes is, in fact, baseless gossip.

text.Judge: Hmm... But should this be true... Then this proves that the defendant did bear ill-will towards the victim.

text.Phoenix: ( ...So this means I have to smash this rumor once and for all. )

text.Judge: Now then, Mr. Wright. You may cross-examine the witness.

text.Mia: Be careful. The old bag seems rather excited right now.

text.Oldbag: That's right! Engarde is nothing but your average foul-blooded youth!

text.Phoenix: ( Well, as the old saying goes... You've gotta burn old bags with fire! Time to fire up the afterburners and hit the highway to the danger zone! )

text.Oldbag: That Engarde is one evil, evil man!

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
You can't say something like that without proof! That's just slander!

CHOICE.Oldbag: But it's true! That woman was getting intimate with poor Juan! Look! It says so right here, doesn't it!? "Manager to the stars, Ms. A. A.!"

CHOICE.Phoenix: But the name of the magazine this came from is "Gossip Land"...

CHOICE.Oldbag: What? Are you saying that "gossip" is all just a pack of lies? Hmph, what do you know? I suppose next you'll swear to me that the "news" is 100% truth!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Um...

CHOICE.Oldbag: Honestly, sonny. You can't discriminate between the news and gossip!

CHOICE.Judge: Yes, discrimination is bad, Mr. Wright.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Discriminate? When did I do anything like that? )

CHOICE.Oldbag: Anyway, Engarde will never get me to say "touch√©"!

text.Oldbag: He thought he could ruin poor Juan by causing a huge scandal!

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
A scandal...? What do you mean by that?

CHOICE.Oldbag: You're a dimwitted one, aren't you? I can't believe you don't know what a "scandal" is! Honestly, what are they teaching kids in middle school these days...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ah, no no! I wasn't asking what the word "scandal" means! Even I know that much!

CHOICE.Oldbag: Well! That Engarde thought he could own a monopoly on popularity!

text.Oldbag: So to do that, he sent his own manager to get in close with Juan!

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
You don't have any proof that Mr. Engarde did any such thing!

CHOICE.Oldbag: You must be suffering from shock; the shock of hearing the truth. And now, since you're in so much shock, you can't do anything right!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( You're right, I can't do anything, but boy do I wish I could do something about you. )

CHOICE.Oldbag: Alright then, sonny, show me what you've got! Can you show me proof that Engarde didn't bear any ill-will towards Juan!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: I'm not going to let you push me around that easily!

CHOICE.Oldbag: Heh. There's many a man who've said those exact words and paid dearly for them.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Maybe you should brace yourself this time! Here is my proof that Mr. Engarde did not hold any ill-will towards the victim!

CHOICE.Oldbag: ...Is that it? You can take it from here, Edgey-poo!

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Ngrk! Wh-What are you handing it over to me for!?
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [EH!? Wh-What are you handing it over to me for!?] in the original release)

CHOICE.Oldbag: I want you to give that jagged-headed baboon-boy a message for me! Please? Tell him that no matter what he does, the only thing he's good at is failing.

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Um... What she said, Wright! Or should I say... Baboon-boy!

CHOICE.Judge: Yes, I agree this isn't much of a piece of evidence... Baboon-boy.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Did I just gain a new nickname here...? )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "And you were lecturing me about saying things without proof!"
USER SELECTS Decline the offer to present

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...I don't have anything to offer.

CHOICE.Oldbag: Seeeeeee! Just as I thought.

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "And you were lecturing me about saying things without proof!"

CHOICE.Oldbag: And you were lecturing me about saying things without proof! You've just given me a free pass to say whatever I want whenever I want, silly boy!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Me and my big mouth... )

CHOICE.Oldbag: That's the way the cookie crumbles. For you, anyway.

CHOICE.Phoenix: I'm not going to let you push me around that easily!

CHOICE.Oldbag: Heh. There's many a man who've said those exact words and paid dearly for them.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Maybe you should brace yourself this time! Here is my proof that Mr. Engarde did not hold any ill-will towards the victim!

CHOICE.Oldbag: ...Is that it? You can take it from here, Edgey-poo!

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Ngrk! Wh-What are you handing it over to me for!?

CHOICE.Oldbag: I want you to give that jagged-headed baboon-boy a message for me! Please? Tell him that no matter what he does, the only thing he's good at is failing.

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Um... What she said, Wright! Or should I say... Baboon-boy!

CHOICE.Judge: Yes, I agree this isn't much of a piece of evidence... Baboon-boy.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Did I just gain a new nickname here...? )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "And you were lecturing me about saying things without proof!"

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...I don't have anything to offer.

CHOICE.Oldbag: Seeeeeee! Just as I thought.

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "And you were lecturing me about saying things without proof!"

text.Oldbag: I cannot condone such dirty tricks! So I took action!

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
So, what do you mean by "I took action"...?

CHOICE.Oldbag: Like I already told you, I was lying in wait close to the crime scene! Once that slimy woman came out of Juan's room... I was going to capture her, and teach her a good lesson. Something you young'uns need!

CHOICE.Judge: You were going to "teach her a good lesson"...?

CHOICE.Oldbag: I was going to make her eat the damaging beams of my ray gun! Like this!

CHOICE.Judge: N-No, stop!

CHOICE.Oldbag: Well, it was too bad that woman didn't come through the door that night.

text.Oldbag: ...Oh, and this is top secret, you got that!? Nobody else but you and me know yet, OK?

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
Wait!

CHOICE.Oldbag: What!? I'm a busy woman! Tea time with the kids is over!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Secret information that no one else knows yet... If that's true, then how do you know this "secret information"!?

CHOICE.Oldbag: Huh!? Well... That's... because I'm a pro... Yes, that's it...
I-It's a secret! Even if you drill a hole into my brain, you'll never find out!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( How in the world did that old bat get such a "secret" piece of information...? )
If you don't be a good girl and tell me where you got this secret information... You won't get to go home today!

CHOICE.Oldbag: Umm... Edgey-boy! What are you doing!? Help me!

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Eh!? What do I have to do with this!?

CHOICE.Oldbag: Just do this for me... You'll get your reward.

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Hmph. I don't want your reward, but you don't leave me much of a choice...
Objection!
The witness could have gotten her information from anywhere! It's even possible that it was spontaneously made up inside the witness's head!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( And he lectures ME on "reckless blabbering"!? )

CHOICE.Judge: As long as we don't know where this information came from, it's quite a waste of time to focus on this line of questioning.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Where did Oldbag get her inside information...? There has to be something I can use to figure it out! )
So no one else is supposed to know this "secret information", correct? If that's true, then why do you know it, Ms. Oldbag...?

CHOICE.Oldbag: Wh-Wh-Why are you looking at me like that...? Stop that!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Witness! I hate to say it, but this is how you came to acquire your secret info, isn't it!?
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [I'm sad to say it, but this is how you found out this secret, isn't it!?] in the original release)

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Objection!
You call that "proof"!? It looks more like proof of spite towards the witness! If you have nothing to back up your claims, then they are no more valid than "gossip"!

CHOICE.Judge: Objection sustained. Witness, please feel free to ignore the defense's gesture of ill-will and continue.

CHOICE.Oldbag: Okie-dokie! See, nothing can get me down!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Great... That did nothing but set me back a few minutes of my life... )
( I should probably think a bit more about this... I don't want to do anything rash... For now, maybe I should sit back and watch how things play out... )

text.Mia: Sounds like just another tidbit of gossip, doesn't it? But you can't just ignore it either. It makes your client look bad either way.

text.Phoenix: ( Well, I don't think I heard anything really out of the ordinary just now... )

text.Mia: There has to be something we can catch her on...

text.Phoenix: ( Yeah... And when I find it, I'm going to press the heck out of it... )
The "investigative photographer", Lotta Hart...

text.Judge: Oh yes... I remember that mischievous girl.

text.Phoenix: She reported that she had lost a certain note she had written to herself.

text.Judge: She reported such a thing...?

text.Phoenix: On that piece of paper, she had written down some of her outrageo... er, impressions about the relationship between the victim and Ms. Andrews.

text.Oldbag: Wh-What!? Outrageous ideas, you say!?

text.Phoenix: No no no, I said impressions .

text.Oldbag: Then... Then...! Then everything written on this piece of paper is completely meaningless!?

text.Phoenix: Ah! That's it! That's the note!

text.Oldbag: Ah! AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHH! Noooo! You see, this is something completely different! This is my top secret list of groceries to buyyyyyyy!!

text.Judge: Hmm, then you are the one who took Ms. Hart's note?

text.Oldbag: I'm a huuuuuuuge fan of Juan's, that's why! That infamous, puffy-haired whippersnapper... She's working with that evil Engarde! She said so herself! "En garde! I'm his sidekick!" She was so happy, smiling like a silly duck. I was only checking what she had written!
... Edgey-poo! You believe me, don't you!?

text.Edgeworth: Nngh...

text.Oldbag: I was only trying to help out like the angel I am! It's only one little piece of paper! I've never taken anything else before!

text.Edgeworth: You really should come with a supply of cheese to match your vintage whine.

text.Judge: Well, it was only a piece of paper. I suppose we can overlook this just this once.

text.Phoenix: ( She looks like she's really sorry... Should I forgive her? )

CHOICE.ACTION: USER SELECTS Pile on more pressure.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( If I let up on her now, she'll get away... I have to find some way to inflict a deafening blow to the prosecution! )
I guess we should forgive her.

CHOICE.Oldbag: Hmph! Who the heck are you to decide who should be forgiven, you delinquent!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Grr... ( Number of endearing qualities: ZERO. )

CHOICE.Mia: Phoenix. You can't go easy on her. She's no frail old lady.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Y-Yeah...

CHOICE.Mia: You should be pressing her until she gives in!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Mia is really scary today... * gulp * )

text.Phoenix: Witness! You said that the only thing you stole was that note. Is this correct?

text.Oldbag: S-S-Stole!? Why don't you listen more carefully, you annoying brat!? I saved this piece of paper from the terrible, lonely trash can! That's all!

text.Phoenix: You're lying, dammit! And I can prove it!!

text.Oldbag: Are you putting my credibility under scrutiny again!?

text.Phoenix: Ms. Oldbag! I don't believe that the note is the only thing you stole that night!

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Hmph. More than the witness' credibility, perhaps you should be worrying about your legal standing, or should I say, falling?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Um...

CHOICE.Judge: I'm setting the volume down to low so I won't have to waste my time with your objections!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Hmm... I never knew the judge had hearing aids... Argh! Now's not the time to be wondering about health conditions! OK, one more try! )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads back to "You're lying, dammit! And I can prove it!!"

text.Phoenix: Ms. Oldbag! That note was with a camera, inside its case, wasn't it?

text.Judge: A camera...?

text.Phoenix: Yesterday, Lotta Hart was raising a huge stink over her camera. She kept saying something like, "My sweetie $1,600 camera disappeared on me!"

text.Judge: Why... Why... Witness!!

text.Oldbag: What is it, gramps?

text.Phoenix: If you have the note, then it is only logical that you have the camera too!

text.Oldbag: Grr... Looks like you found me out again, sonny... Is this the camera you're looking for?

text.Phoenix: Ah, that's...!

text.Oldbag: What!? Even though I look like this, I'm still a person, you know! I still eat meals like you, I fall in love... and "borrow" things from people!

text.Judge: Um... I think your definition of "borrow" is a little off...

text.Oldbag: I saw that woman's business card and that's when I noticed it said, "Slimebag Celebrity Photographer Extraordinaire"! Well, when I saw that, I had to know what sort of pictures she had taken! I'm a professional security guard! It's my business to know these things!

text.Judge: Bailiff! Check this camera's photos. Hurry! We must examine them at once!
Well, Mr. Edgeworth... What do we have?

text.Edgeworth: There is only one photo that seems to be relevant to this case.

text.Judge: Please present it to the court! Th-This is... This is the Nickel Samurai!

text.Oldbag: See, I told you! That's the guy I saw!

text.Judge: This proves that the witness was not lying earlier about this matter.
Wh-What does all this mean, Mr. Edgeworth!?

text.Edgeworth: This photo by itself does not prove that the person in it is the defendant. However! In his own confession, Mr. Engarde clearly stated that... At the time of the murder, he was still in his Nickel Samurai costume !

text.Judge: If that is the case, then... this Nickel Samurai is...

text.Edgeworth: The defendant.

text.Judge: How did it come to this...? I think this brings us to the end. We have examined every piece of evidence thoroughly. Final comments, Mr. Wright? The court will consider them before we close. Do you agree that this photo is decisive evidence against your client?

text.Phoenix: ( If this photo really is decisive, then we're done for! But if I raise an objection here and blow it, then I would put Maya's life in jeopardy. I can't make a mistake here! There is only one road out of this mess! ) This photo that Lotta took... There's...

CHOICE.ACTION: USER SELECTS nothing strange with it.

CHOICE.Phoenix: There is nothing strange with this photo.

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Hmph. I have done nothing to alter this picture either, in case you're wondering, Wright.

CHOICE.Judge: I see... And it seems the defense will rest on this matter. In that case, there is no reason to further prolong this trial.

CHOICE.Mia: Is this really alright with you, Phoenix!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: W-Well... There's nothing wrong with this photo that I can poi--

CHOICE.Mia: Try again! Take another good look at it! And if you still don't see anything... Do something... anything to prolong the trial!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Y-Yes, Chief! W-Wait, Your Honor!

CHOICE.Judge: What is it, Mr. Wright? I'm about to enter my verdict. Please address me with your comment afterwards.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Um, no, I'm sorry, but this can't wait...

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Oh? Let me guess. You are going to point out some peculiarity with this photo?

CHOICE.Judge: Wh-What? Why didn't you say so earlier!?

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "There's... There's something strange with this photo!"
USER SELECTS something strange with it.
Leads to "There's... There's something strange with this photo!"

text.Phoenix: There's... There's something strange with this photo!

text.Edgeworth: I knew this was coming, Wright.

text.Judge: Your thoughts, Mr. Edgeworth?

text.Edgeworth: I think we can all agree there is nothing strange with this photo. There is no way for the defense to debunk this photo, even with a bunker buster.

text.Judge: "Debunk with a bunker buster"!? Is that what you're planning to do, Mr. Wright!?

text.Phoenix: ... Um, anyway, please look at the photo one more time!

text.Judge: If you really believe you can honestly find something wrong with this photo, then you should only need one chance , correct...?

text.Phoenix: Um... Well... ( I have to find something wrong with this photo! I can't let this chance go by! Where in the heck did she take this photo from anyway...? It's all out of focus! Why can't she take a good shot, especially when it counts!? )

text.Judge: Now then, let's hear your objection. What about this photo is "strange"...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: It's this person here, of course!

CHOICE.Judge: You mean the "Nickel Samurai"? And what is wrong with that?

CHOICE.Phoenix: At the time of the murder, Mr. Engarde was in his own room! Which means this Nickel Samurai is a fa--

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Objection!
If you think that's all it takes, you should reconsider your choice of occupation.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Urk.

CHOICE.Edgeworth: I think it's about time you retired!

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm, it looks like there was no problem with this photo after all.

CHOICE.Edgeworth: The problem was with the brain of that lawyer, Your Honor.

CHOICE.Phoenix: W-Wait!

CHOICE.Judge: You are the one who let your last chance fly away from you, Mr. Wright!

CHOICE.Judge: "Around here"...?

CHOICE.Mia: "I think"...?

text.Phoenix: The costumed person in this photo could not have been Mr. Engarde!
text._info: (Changed from [The 'Nickel Samurai' in this photo could not have been Mr. Engarde!] in the original release)

text.Judge: What is the meaning of this!?

text.Edgeworth: Objection!
I wonder if you would care to elaborate... With actual facts, that is.

text.Phoenix: Let's take a look at the Nickel Samurai's poster. Please pay particular attention to the area around the bottom of the hakama.

text.Judge: His... His socks... You can see his socks...

text.Phoenix: Exactly! However, in this photo... The Nickel Samurai is clearly holding his hakama up just to walk!
There is only one explanation for this! The person inside this costume is clearly much shorter than the defendant! ( Alright. I think I've turned things around for myself this time! )

text.Mia: That's curious...

text.Phoenix: Huh? What is?

text.Mia: Edgeworth is unusually calm today...

text.Phoenix: That's true...

text.Mia: He's just letting the trial run itself -- as if he's only along for the ride.

text.Phoenix: "Along for the ride"...? What do you mean by that?

text.Mia: I can only think that perhaps he doesn't feel under attack at all...

text.Phoenix: ( He doesn't feel under attack!? Then, I haven't damaged his case at all!? )
text._info: (Changed from [He doesn't feel under attack!? Then, he's not taking any damage!?] in the original release)

text.Judge: Mr. Edgeworth! Where does this leave us!?
If the person in this photo is not Matt Engarde... Then everything the prosecution has tried to prove has become meaningless!

text.Edgeworth: ... Hmm... I thought it would come to this.

text.Phoenix: WHAT!?

text.Edgeworth: Wright. I have something I want to ask you. I think you have proven that the person inside this costume is not Matt Engarde. In that case... Who IS this a photo of...?

text.Phoenix: ( Who is the person wearing the Nickel Samurai costume? )

text.Mia: Don't stress out over this, Phoenix. It's very simple. What you should be focused on is Edgeworth's attitude, don't you think?

text.Phoenix: ( Yeah... Why is he so calm...? )

text.Judge: Mr. Wright. Let's hear your thoughts. Who is the person in this photograph...?

CHOICE.Judge: Are you saying this is who you think was in the costume...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Uh... Um... Well, I know there isn't a lot to back me up here, but...

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Objection!
Sometimes I wonder about you. Do you just pick the first piece of evidence you see?

CHOICE.Mia: I can't believe it. I didn't think you would mess up here of all places...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Argh... And I really thought I had it! )

CHOICE.Judge: Now then, would you care to try one more time?

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads back to "Mr. Wright. Let's hear your thoughts."

text.Judge: A-Adrian Andrews...?

text.Phoenix: If you want to know who that Nickel Samurai is, it is none other than this woman!

text.Edgeworth: And why would you say it must be Ms. Andrews!? What in the world points you to her?
text._info: (Changed from [And why would you say it would be Ms. Andrews!? What in the world points you to her?] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: For starters, she's short. And, she can freely move in and out of Mr. Engarde's room. Finally, she had dinner with Mr. Engarde that night.

text.Judge: And how does that all add up?

text.Phoenix: It means that it makes it very easy for her to get a certain item. ...A certain knife with Mr. Engarde's fingerprints all over it!

text.Judge: The knife that was used as a murder weapon!

text.Edgeworth: Why don't you just say what it is you want, Wright?

text.Phoenix: ( I have to do this now! This is my last chance to turn things around! ) The defense motions to indict Ms. Adrian Andrews in the murder of Juan Corrida! It was Ms. Andrews who tried to frame the defendant for the crime!

text.Judge: Order! Order!! ORDER!! It looks like this trial has hit a most unexpected development! Mr. Edgeworth!

text.Edgeworth: Yes, Your Honor?

text.Judge: This court is issuing a subpoena for Ms. Adrian Andrews! A verdict cannot be passed without first hearing her testimony!

text.Phoenix: ( Alright! This is it... )

text.Mia: This... is kind of bad for us.

text.Phoenix: Huh? What do you mean?

text.Mia: If Adrian Andrews is summoned to court as a witness... It means that the trial will go on for another day.

text.Phoenix: One more day...? Ack!! ( If I don't get a verdict TODAY, then Maya...! )

text.Judge: Now then, we shall set Ms. Andrews' testimony for tomorrow...

text.Phoenix: ( Wh-What am I supposed to do!? The judge is about to adjourn the court! )

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I have to do something... The trial must go on! But I don't have anything left... No evidence, no nothing! )

CHOICE.Judge: Now then, court will adjourn for tod--

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "I abhor wasting such valuable time..."

CHOICE.Judge: Now then...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Objection!
Please, Your Honor! Continue the trial! You must pass a verdict today!

CHOICE.Judge: I can't do that. We cannot hear Ms. Andrews' testimony if she is not--

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "I abhor wasting such valuable time..."

text.Edgeworth: I abhor wasting such valuable time...

text.Phoenix: E-Edgeworth?

text.Edgeworth: Your Honor. I request that you please continue with today's trial.

text.Judge: B-But... We cannot continue due to this unexpected development!

text.Edgeworth: Tsk, tsk. "Unexpected" development? I think you underestimate me, Your Honor.

text.Judge: And what do you mean by that...?

text.Edgeworth: That Mr. Phoenix Wright would slave his way to subpoenaing Ms. Adrian Andrews is all happening according to plan... Even if Wright was a bit slow to catch on...

text.Phoenix: Wh-Wh-Wh... WHAAAAAAAAAAAAT!?

text.Judge: What is the meaning of your statement, Mr. Edgeworth!?

text.Edgeworth: Ms. Adrian Andrews is currently waiting in the prosecution lobby... She is the next witness.

text.Phoenix: ...! ( Everything... Everything was planned out in advance by that man...? )

text.Mia: Somehow, I knew there was no way Edgeworth would overlook Ms. Andrews... Looks like this battle is far from over.

text.Edgeworth: Exactly.

text.Judge: Very well. We will call the next witness. However... Before we proceed, we shall take a 10 minute recess. Please prepare your witness in that time, Mr. Edgeworth.
The court will now take a 10 minute recess.

text.ACTION: March 22, 2:14 PM District Court Defendant Lobby No. 3

text.Engarde: Dude! I can't believe that Adrian... No way! Not cool and collected Adrian Andrews!

text.Phoenix: She is your manager. It would have been very easy for her to pull this off. The only person who had easy access to the knife you used at dinner was, well... her.

text.Engarde: So after the ceremony, during the break, huh...? I was sleeping like a log the entire time...

text.Phoenix: See, she could have also easily planted that blood-covered button in your hakama.

text.Engarde: Hmm... Because she was the one that came to wake me up? ... Then... Dude, you're saying it really was her...?

text.Phoenix: Yes. She is the real killer ... She was the one who murdered Juan Corrida.

text.Engarde: But... Why!? I thought she was buds with Juan...!

text.Phoenix: She has her own agenda.

text.Engarde: H-Her own agenda!? Wh-What are you talking about?

text.Phoenix: I'm sure you'll see by the time this trial's over. It'll be alright. I'll get you acquitted by the end of today.

text.Engarde: Get me a verdict that's refreshing like a spring breeze, OK Mr. Lawyer dude?

text.Mia: Phoenix... You think her motive is related to Celeste Inpax's missing suicide note , right?

text.Phoenix: ...Yes. Ms. Andrews depended on Ms. Inpax for her strength and reason to live. But then Ms. Inpax suddenly killed herself. It sounds like she left a suicide note, and the person thought to have hidden it...
text._info: (Changed from [Ms. Andrews depended on Ms. Inpax for her strength and will to live.] in the original release)

text.Mia: ...Is Juan Corrida, the victim of this murder.

text.Phoenix: And that's why I think that Ms. Andrews got close to Mr. Corrida... All to get the suicide note back!

text.Mia: That sounds plausible... But one thing bothers me.

text.Phoenix: Um, what...?

text.Mia: Who was it that first told us about their relationship? Better stated, Mr. Andrews' dependency issues with regards to Ms. Inpax...?
text._info: (Changed from [Better stated, Mr. Andrews' co-dependency with regards to Ms. Inpax...?] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: ... It was Edgeworth...

text.Mia: It looks like he's still the one in command of this ship. Don't let your guard down yet.

text.ACTION: March 22, 2:25 PM District Court Courtroom No. 3

text.Judge: Court will now reconvene. Now then, Mr. Edgeworth, if you please.

text.Edgeworth: The prosecution calls the witness subpoenaed by this court. Ms. Adrian Andrews, the person who discovered the crime in Mr. Juan Corrida's room!
What is your occupation?

text.Andrews: I am the manager of the defendant in this case, Mr. Matt Engarde.

text.Judge: I see. Now then...

text.Andrews: Before we begin, Your Honor, I have one request.

text.Judge: Uh, yes, sure. What is it?

text.Andrews: I'm sure everyone in this room is wondering the same thing, and would love to find out more about my relationship with the victim. After all, it was the topic of a certain weekly "magazine" recently...

text.Judge: Ah, no, I have no idea what you mean. I've never even heard of "Gossip Land"...

text.Phoenix: ( If the judge was ever a prosecution witness, he'd do all my work for me... )

text.Edgeworth: Anyway, I was wondering if you could please tell us about your relation to the victim.

text.Andrews: Yes, I was seeing Mr. Corrida. I was also aware of the rivalry that existed between Matt and Juan... But this was a private matter between Juan and myself.

text.Judge: Hmm, so it was a "fry 'n bait" matter... or was that "bait 'n fry"? Reminds me of fishing...

text.Andrews: But I... But I didn't kill him.

text.Edgeworth: No one has accused you of that.

text.Andrews: I think there's someone who would beg to differ.
text._info: (Changed from [I've got a feeling someone will soon...] in the original release)

text.Judge: I think we all understand your relationship with the victim now, Ms. Andrews.

text.Edgeworth: Very well then. Witness, please testify to the court about what happened when you discovered the murder that had taken place.

text.Andrews:
It was time for the show to start, so I went to get Matt from his room. 
After that, I went to Juan's room. 
And there was his dead body. I... I was in shock... 
What I saw was, naturally, the exact same scene as in the crime scene photo. 
I felt as though I was about to faint, so I poured myself a glass of juice.

text.Judge: You poured yourself a glass of juice...?

text.Andrews: Yes. Sadly, I didn't remember not to touch things at the scene of a crime... And I disturbed the crime scene by moving this one thing...

text.Edgeworth: And that is when the fingerprints on the wine glass were made, Your Honor.

text.Judge: I see. Well, Mr. Wright, you may cross-examine the witness.

text.Mia: Phoenix. She is one cool and collected customer, and she has the brains to match.

text.Phoenix: Yes... I know.

text.Mia: In order to catch a person like her, you have to avoid head-on confrontations. You should disrupt her pacing.
text._info: (Changed from [You should disrupt her pace.] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: Disrupt her pacing...?
text._info: (Changed from [Disrupt her pace...?] in the original release)

text.Mia: She's the type of woman who is easily thrown off by things inconsistent with her thinking so you have to attack when she least expects it. The instant you let up on your offense is the instant this trial is over. Understand?

text.Andrews: It was time for the show to start, so I went to get Matt from his room.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
And what was Mr. Engarde doing at the time...?

CHOICE.Andrews: He was taking a nap. He was worn out from his mini performance as the Nickel Samurai during the ceremony...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Hmm, Mr. Engarde did say he was taking a nap... ) Then I guess you could say it could not have been taken out of his room, yes?

CHOICE.Andrews: Excuse me? "It"...? What are you...?

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Objection!

Wright. I thought years of school would have taught you how to construct a sentence. If you can't make a sensible sentence with a subject, then I'll make one for you. Watch. Did you, Ms. Andrews, remove Mr. Engarde's knife from his room?

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm...

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Subject, verb, object Wright. Did you skip basic grammar? The witness may continue.

text.Andrews: After that, I went to Juan's room.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
And why did you do that...?

CHOICE.Andrews: As a friendly gesture, Juan was to make an appearance with the other Heroes.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( So the show was supposed to be a "show" of friendship, huh? )
Is that the only reason?

CHOICE.Andrews: I beg your pardon? What are you implying...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: You had a certain goal in mind when you started to get close to him, correct...? So perhaps you had a more personal matter to discuss with the victim...?

CHOICE.Andrews: ... Sorry, but I didn't have any such intentions in mind at that time.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I can't get her to talk without a strong piece of evidence, I guess... )
( I should back off... As long as I don't have any proof, she's not going to talk. )

CHOICE.Edgeworth: May we continue now...? Witness, what did you see when you got to his room?

You were "in shock"...?

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Anyone randomly stumbling upon a dead body would be in shock. And you can't seriously expect that a young beauty like her would not be shocked.

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm... I see...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( That's odd. I thought she was always in total control of herself...? )

CHOICE.Mia: That's what she would like people to think. Always be mindful of the gap between the perception and reality.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Objection!

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "You testified that you knocked the flower vase over. Is this correct?"

text.Phoenix: ( It doesn't sound like there's any glaring contradictions in her testimony just now... )

text.Mia: I warned you earlier that she would not crack so easily. The only way to make her is to...

text.Phoenix: ...Keep on the offensive and not let up.

text.Mia: The only way you're going to catch her is with some very strong, decisive evidence...

text.Phoenix: ( I have to find something! I just have to! ...For Maya's sake... )
You testified that you knocked the flower vase over. Is this correct?

text.Andrews: Yes.

text.Phoenix: And are you sure it fell onto the guitar case?

text.Andrews: I-Is there some problem with what I said...?

text.Phoenix: It's not "some" problem, it's a "major" problem. It's true that the top of the guitar case was wet with water. However, that's exactly what is so strange! Ms. Andrews! You testified that the vase fell onto the guitar case! However! If that was true, the case should have gotten wet on the inside , not the outside!

text.Judge: Th-That's very true!

text.Phoenix: Furthermore, there is one other strange thing about this guitar case.

text.Judge: And wh-what is that?

text.Phoenix: Let's take another look at the crime scene photo. The remains of the vase are scattered on the floor.

text.Judge: And what is wrong with that?

text.Phoenix: If the guitar case was open when the vase fell... The glass shards should be INSIDE, not outside the case!

text.Andrews: Ah!

text.Edgeworth: Objection!
What is your point, Wright!? That the case was closed at the time the vase was knocked over? Is that all!?

text.Phoenix: Objection!
No. Think back to what Ms. Andrews testified to! She said that other than the vase, she didn't touch anything else!

text.Edgeworth: Nngh...

text.Judge: Yes, that's right... She did implicitly say she didn't touch the guitar case !

text.Edgeworth: Objection!
But... But this whole matter with the guitar case is a dead end! The bright red guitar was found at the studio! It has no bearing on this case at all!

text.Phoenix: ... That may very well be, however... ( Argh, the empty guitar case does seem to have no relation to this case, doesn't it... )

text.Judge: Hmm... It seems that there is no deeper meaning to the guitar case. Well, Mr. Wright? Do you think we need to hear more details about the guitar case?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Well, the case was empty, and I think that's all we really need to know...

CHOICE.Judge: I see.

CHOICE.Mia: Wait! Phoenix! Don't you remember what I told you earlier? What's important here is that you disrupt her pacing. You have to attack her when she's not expecting it!

CHOICE.Judge: Now then, let's move on to a different matter...

Actually, Your Honor, I've changed my mind. I would like her to testify about the case.
