text.Phoenix: ( I can't believe I'm doing this either... )

text.Judge: Alright. I'll follow along... For now. Ms. Andrews, please testify to the court about the guitar case.

text.Andrews: Yes, Your Honor.

I don't remember too clearly because I was a bit dazed. 
I suppose I must have opened the guitar case... after I knocked the vase over. 
It's not a big deal though, right? The case was empty after all. 
As for why I opened the case... Even I don't know.

text.Judge: Hmm... It looks like this really wasn't a very important point.

text.Edgeworth: This wastefulness is such a familiar feeling by now that it's almost... comforting.

text.Phoenix: Um, anyway, I'll just go ahead and start the cross-examination...

text.Edgeworth: Hmph. Using "anyway" to change the topic -- a convenient escape for a weak man.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I'm not going to get anywhere if I continue pressing her like this... The only way to make her talk is with evidence... I guess I should give it a try... )
Objection!
There is no way you were the one who opened the guitar case.

CHOICE.Andrews: Why would you say that!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: It's elementary, my dear. Because the only fingerprints on this guitar case are those of the victim !

CHOICE.Andrews: Ah!

CHOICE.Judge: What is it, Ms. Andrews?

CHOICE.Andrews: ... You shouldn't assume that I must have left prints just because I touched the case.

CHOICE.Phoenix: What do you mean?

CHOICE.Andrews: What if I were to tell you that I was wearing gloves at the time?

CHOICE.Judge: Gloves...? But why would you be wearing gloves at the time?

CHOICE.Andrews: It was the night of the award ceremony. So of course I dressed up for the occasion. Yes, now I remember... I'm almost sure I was wearing a pair of thin gloves.

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm... I see... Well, Mr. Wright. It seems the witness was wearing gloves at the scene of the crime.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Hmm, I guess so... And I guess that makes sense.

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Hmph. You're the epitome of a half-baked idea.

CHOICE.Andrews: A brain is to be used, not to look pretty for med students carving cadavers.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Looks like I need to bake my thoughts just a little longer... )

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Now, if the defense has no further objections, let's return to the testimony.

CHOICE.Phoenix: You were wearing gloves...? Isn't that a little strange?

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "I have your proof right here. This wine glass."

I think it's time for you to go home now, Wright... Before you hurt yourself, that is.

text.Phoenix: I have your proof right here. This wine glass.

text.Andrews: Ah...

text.Judge: Order! Order! Order!!

text.Mia: Looks like you hit the nail on the head this time.

text.Mia: I believe that guitar case plays a very important role here.

text.Mia: Phoenix, drop all of your presumptions. What was in the guitar case was not the bright red guitar.

text.Phoenix: ( You don't mean... it was a bright WHITE guitar!? Wait, that's not right either... )

text.Judge: Hmm, I admit it would be unnatural for someone to do that. So the witness was not wearing gloves, despite the fact that on the case...

text.Edgeworth: Objection!
Your Honor, this is obviously the defense's usual misdirection tactic at work. Steer the court towards an unrelated topic, and lull us all into his misguided...

text.Phoenix: Objection!

No, Your Honor! Please recall that Ms. Andrews had testified that the vase "fell onto the guitar case"! Which means that the case was closed when the crime took place! However, it is wide open in this photo of the crime scene! I am sure this guitar case has some relation to the murder!

text.Edgeworth: Objection!
If you are so sure, Wright, then I'm sure you can somehow substantiate your outrageous claim, correct!? Please, enlighten us as to why that guitar case has anything at all to do with this murder!

text.Phoenix: Uh...

text.Judge: Can you do that, Mr. Wright!?

text.Phoenix: Um, well... Let's suppose for a second... That the bright red guitar was not the only thing that could have been in the case...

text.Judge: The bright red guitar not being the only thing...? Y-You don't mean to suggest that a bright BLACK guitar was inside the--

text.Edgeworth: Objection!
So, you intend to push your theory that the case was not empty!? Is that it, Wright!?

text.Phoenix: I wouldn't say something I didn't intend to prove!

text.Edgeworth: Deflate that head of yours! You haven't proven anything yet! Now then, let's have it. What was inside this case at the time of the murder!?

Leads to "Th-This is... This is a photograph...!"

CHOICE.Edgeworth: And why would something like that be inside a guitar case, let alone this one?

CHOICE.Judge: Why, Mr. Wright, why?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Well... I just thought it might have been possible...?

CHOICE.Edgeworth: I have a suggestion. Why don't you put that in the void where your brain is supposed to be!

CHOICE.Judge: Yes, and never bring it out again!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Can't a foolishly foolish fool get some love...? )

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Do you still think you can prove your theory? Can you prove that the guitar case was not empty at the time of the murder?

text.Phoenix: Yes, but what is important is what is in that picture, Your Honor.

text.Phoenix: It doesn't take a genius to see what I mean! What I am proposing is... Inside the guitar case was the Nickel Samurai! The hero's very own costume!

text.Edgeworth: Wh-What!?

text.Judge: M-Mr. Wright! Explain yourself!

text.Edgeworth: Wright! Are you saying that the witness opened the guitar case to take out a costume !? What insane point would there be to doing something like that!?

text.Phoenix: That insane point would be to wear the costume, of course. Ms. Andrews put it on to hide her identity so she could make her escape. After all, you couldn't let anyone see you leave, could you, Ms. Andrews?

text.Edgeworth: I-I refuse to accept your theory! Do you have anything to support such a preposterous idea!?

text.Phoenix: Just outside the door was an investigative photographer who was starving for a big scoop. And in the end, she managed to get this shot, correct?

text.Judge: You... You mean this photo!? Order! Ordeeeer! It looks like we've wandered into quite another mess again, haven't we...?

text.Mia: Nice job, Phoenix.

text.Phoenix: Well, you know my strategy. Speak first, think later!

text.Judge: Hmm... So the real murderer was hiding inside a costume...

text.Edgeworth: Objection!

W-Wait one second, Your Honor! The Nickel Samurai's costume would have been Mr. Matt Engarde's! Why would something of the defendant's be in the victim's room!? And inside the guitar case, of all places!?

text.Judge: Hmm, true... That is a little baffling... Mr. Wright, the court would like to hear your thoughts. What was this Nickel Samurai costume doing inside the guitar case...?

Maybe YOU should be stripped naked and run out for making a mockery of this court!

text.Judge: But... But why!? The victim, Mr. Corrida, was the Jammin' Ninja . Why would he secretly bring the Nickel Samurai's spare costume with him...? What could be the reason behind such a peculiar act?

text.Phoenix: ... And therein lies the sticking point...

Wh-What are you mumbling to yourself about now!? Have you just been rambling all this time without any sense of inner monologue!?

text.Judge: Mr. Wright, please explain yourself! Why do you think the victim had the Nickel Samurai's spare costume!?

text.Judge: What is this...?

text.Phoenix: On the night of the murder, after the stage show, the Nickel Samurai was going to hold a special press conference .

text.Phoenix: Yes, the Nickel Samurai was supposed to confess something at this conference.

text.Edgeworth: I heard about this as well. For once, you're not making something up, Wright.

text.Phoenix: But what struck me as strange was that Mr. Engarde himself said he had no idea he was supposed to be holding a press conference that night.

text.Judge: But how can that be!?

text.Phoenix: The way I see it, that can mean only one thing: The conference was set up by none other than the victim, Mr. Juan Corrida himself!

text.Judge: Th-The victim?

text.Phoenix: Yes. The spare Nickel Samurai costume was prepared for that very conference! Mr. Corrida was going to hold the press conference as the " Nickel Samurai "!

text.Judge: He was going to dress up as the Nickel Samurai and hold a conference!? But why would the victim do such a thing!?

text.Phoenix: That's something I don't quite know yet, however... What I am concerned with right now is what he intended to reveal at that conference.

text.Edgeworth: The Nickel Samurai was going to " confess " something. And by "confess", I'd wager he was going to reveal something about " himself ".

text.Phoenix: Which means that Juan Corrida, posing as the Nickel Samurai, was going to speak about Matt Engarde !

text.Judge: Yes, I guess that is what it would mean...

text.Edgeworth: But, if that's the case... that's not a "confession"! That's " public disclosure "!

text.Judge: M-Ms. Andrews...?

text.Judge: Pardon me?

text.Andrews: Yes, just as you say, the press conference was set up by Juan.

text.Judge: Ms. Andrews! Please offer us an explanation for this!

text.Andrews: I was the one he asked to help set it up. And the person who prepared the second costume for him... That was also me.
Juan had bet everything on the Jammin' Ninja this year. And if he lost the Grand Prix... He was going to make sure Matt was going down with him . That's what he thought anyway.

text.Judge: He was going to ruin him, huh...?

text.Andrews: It looked like somehow, Juan had in his hands a secret so powerful ... that it would destroy Matt's acting career had it been revealed!

text.Phoenix: What!?

text.Judge: And do you know what this "secret" of Mr. Engarde's is, Ms. Andrews...?

text.Andrews: ... That's something only Juan knew. I... I don't know what it is.

text.Judge: Ah... I see.

text.Andrews: I... I've probably been coming off quite suspicious to everyone, but that's to be expected. I've been trying to protect Matt, after all...

text.Phoenix: P-Protect Mr. Engarde!?

text.Judge: And yet again another strange bit of truth comes to light it seems... Ms. Andrews, if you could, please tell us the truth about your behavior!

text.Andrews: Yes, Your Honor. I understand.

From the moment I saw the crime scene, I had a feeling that Matt was the murderer. 
Matt had to kill Juan no matter what. 
And he didn't have an alibi for what he was doing at the time of the murder. 
My thoughts were confirmed by the evidence, of course; the button and the knife... 
But I'm Matt's manager... So I felt that I had to protect him...

text.Judge: Hmm... This does account for everything...

text.Andrews: Well... I am the logical type.

text.Mia: We're finally seeing her true self. She is more nervous than a scared rabbit.

text.Judge: If the defense can find no fault with this testimony, I am ready to make a ruling. Please keep that in mind as you cross-examine, Mr. Wright. ( Changed from [Now then, Mr. Wright, if you please.] in the original release )

And that person is... you, Ms. Adrian Andrews!

text.Andrews: P-Please... Stop...

text.Phoenix: Well, how about it, Ms. Andrews!?

text.Andrews: Um...

text.Phoenix: ( I've got her this time! )

text.Judge: Ms. Andrews...?

text.Andrews: ... I... I... I refuse... to testify.

text.Phoenix: What was that...?

text.Andrews: Th-There's a law... It says I can't be forced to testify about something... if it can incriminate me!

text.Judge: Well, yes... You are absolutely correct, Ms. Andrews. The law does provide us with a way to avoid self-incrimination ... by allowing a witness to not testify if the testimony can cause damage to themselves.

text.Phoenix: WHAT!? ( " Pleading the fifth " is not something most people would think to do on the spot! Actually... Thinking back to yesterday in Mr. Engarde's room... )

text.Franziska: Adrian Andrews!

text.Andrews: Y-Yes...?

text.Franziska: Think hard about what we just discussed. Understood!?

text.Andrews: A-Alright... ...

text.Phoenix: ( That's it. That's when Franziska planted this idea into her head... She must have told Ms. Andrews to not testify if things looked bad. )

text.Mia: You did a good job proving everything up to this point, Phoenix. But there is still one thing you haven't done.

text.Phoenix: Something I haven't done...?

text.Edgeworth: Heh heh heh. What's wrong, Wright? Are you finished already? Run out of evidence?

text.Judge: What is so humorous, Mr. Edgeworth!?

text.Edgeworth: I'm sure you realize this as well, Your Honor... But, everything the good lawyer here has proven up to this point is meaningless.

text.Phoenix: Wh-What!?

text.Edgeworth: Everything you have proven is circumstantial.

text.Phoenix: Circumstantial ...?

text.Edgeworth: Yes, circumstantial. You have yet to provide a single piece of definitive proof . Proof that Ms. Andrews, did in fact, harbor a wish to murder Mr. Corrida!

text.Judge: M-Ms. Andrews! You... Did you want to kill Mr. Corrida...?

text.Andrews: I believe this may lead to me incriminating myself, so I will abstain from answering.

text.Judge: But Ms. Andrews... If you do that, it would be the same as admitting your guilt, don't you think...?

text.Andrews: Maybe so, or maybe not. There is nothing to prove it either way. Besides, you don't even know what crime I would be "guilty" of due to my silence.

text.Phoenix: ( NO!! She's taking that defiant attitude again! ) M-Mia! What should we do...?

text.Mia: Somehow, we've landed in the worst possible situation.

text.Judge: I think we have reached a certain conclusion at this point in time. Ms. Adrian Andrews has refused to testify. And the defense's theory that she is the actual murderer... has not been fully substantiated with solid, definitive proof .

text.Phoenix: But! That's not true!

text.Judge: In this situation, there is only one thing this court can do. And that is to declare a recess.

text.Phoenix: R-Recess...!?

text.Judge: I request that both the prosecution and the defense look further into this matter. And at tomorrow's trial...

text.Phoenix: ( T-Tomorrow ...!? We don't have a "tomorrow"! If we don't get a not guilty verdict today, then... )
HOLD IT!
Please wait, Your Honor! Th...That's not necessary! The trial... Please continue the trial!

text.Edgeworth: What are you sweating for...? Your client is getting one more day to live, isn't he?

text.Phoenix: That... That's not it! This isn't about that. Edgeworth! I know you know who the real killer is! Please... Let the trial continue! If I don't get the verdict... then Maya...

text.Judge: But it's impossible to continue as long as the witness refuses to testify. Now then, this court is...

text.Edgeworth: Objection!
It is not impossible for this trial to continue.

text.Judge: Mr. Edgeworth! Wh-What are you...

text.Edgeworth: It's true Ms. Andrews holds the right against self-incrimination; however, if the topic of conversation were something unrelated to whatever she may be guilty of, then she has no right to withhold testimony!

text.Judge: Y-Yes, that is very true, but...

text.Edgeworth: Actually, there is one little thing that I'm curious about. Ms. Andrews.
When you found the victim's dead body, you poured yourself a glass of juice.

text.Andrews: Y-Yes... And...?

text.Edgeworth: I can't help but think how unnatural that is. Usually when one finds a body, they are shaken up, not stirring a glass of juice.

text.Andrews: So my actions were "unusual"? But I've already...

text.Edgeworth: Before you speak, I want to state that if you have a reason behind your actions, I would like you to testify to that effect.

text.Andrews: Testify...!?

text.Edgeworth: Your Honor! I would like to request that the witness testify again as to what happened when she first discovered the victim's body! Whatever we find out in this testimony should in no way implicate the witness.

text.Judge: Hmm...

text.Mia: I don't know what it is about Edgeworth today, but I can't get a good read off of him. Is he friend or foe? I just don't know...

text.Judge: The court acknowledges the prosecution's request. Ms. Andrews, if you please.

text.Andrews:
That glass of juice... I didn't really pour it for myself. 
I was surprised when I walked into the room and saw it in that messy state. 
And Juan... He was sitting slumped over and tired-looking in the corner. 
When I saw him sitting like that, the thought that he was dead didn't cross my mind. 
To be honest, I thought he had just fainted or something. So I went to pour him some juice. 
When I realized that he was dead... That's when I knocked the flower vase over.

text.Judge: Hmm... So you poured that glass of juice for the victim. Why didn't you say so in your earlier testimony?

text.Andrews: ...I didn't think I needed to include something so trivial.

text.Mia: Phoenix. Please be careful here. If you can't find anything wrong with this testimony, then there's nothing left...

text.Phoenix: I know. ( Edgeworth... What the heck is going on in that brain of yours...? )

text.Judge: Now then, Mr. Wright. You may begin your cross-examination.

text.Andrews: That glass of juice... I didn't really pour it for myself.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
But... There wasn't anyone else in the room, right?

CHOICE.Andrews: Of course not.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Then... who did you pour it for?

CHOICE.Andrews: Mr. Wright. There is a rhyme and reason for everything. Can you wait just a little longer for it to be revealed to you?

CHOICE.Edgeworth: In other words, Wright, "Be quiet and listen."

CHOICE.Andrews: Precisely! I couldn't have said it better myself.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Unnngh...

text.Andrews: I was surprised when I walked into the room and saw it in that messy state.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
So, it was a "mess"? Are you sure it wasn't messy because of your fight with Mr. Corrida...?

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Objection!
I understand your frustrations at not being able to prove your theory. However... Before you go accusing people of crimes, go find yourself some evidence!
And then, what did you see next, witness?

text.Andrews: And Juan... He was sitting slumped over and tired-looking in the corner.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
Slumped over?

CHOICE.Andrews: Yes, he was just sitting there with his head tilted forward, eyes closed. He really looked like he was sleeping.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( ...Is it just me or did that right there sound a little... odd? )

text.Andrews: When I saw him sitting like that, the thought that he was dead didn't cross my mind.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
Then what did cross your mind?

CHOICE.Andrews: I thought maybe he had smashed everything up in anger because he lost the Grand Prix. And then felt tired after his rampage, so he decided to take a nap... Anyways, that's what I thought...

CHOICE.Judge: I see. So you didn't think he was dead at all.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Objection!

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "So you honestly didn't think he was dead when you found him?"

text.Andrews: To be honest, I thought he had just fainted or something. So I went to pour him some juice.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
You thought he fainted...?

CHOICE.Andrews: I thought he was asleep at first. But then, the room was in such a messy state... I thought maybe he had gotten into a fight with someone...

CHOICE.Edgeworth: And that's when you went to pour the glass of juice?

CHOICE.Andrews: Yes. He always has a hard time waking up. So Juan always has a glass of tomato juice to drink.

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm... I see. And after that, what happened next?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Objection!

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "So you honestly didn't think he was dead when you found him?"

text.Andrews: When I realized that he was dead... That's when I knocked the flower vase over.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
And how did you come to realize that he was, in fact, dead?

CHOICE.Andrews: I shook him over and over, but I never got a response... So I set the glass down on the dresser and tried to take his pulse. I... I was shocked... and staggered backward...

CHOICE.Edgeworth: And knocked the flower vase over. So that's what happened.

CHOICE.Andrews: ...Yes.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Objection!

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "So you honestly didn't think he was dead when you found him?"

text.Mia: ... This is what it all comes down to.

text.Phoenix: Huh?

text.Mia: This is the absolute end for both sides... And Adrian is letting her guard down. Phoenix, now is our best chance yet to kill the prosecution's case!

text.Phoenix: ( Isn't that a bit harsh...? Ms. Andrews... Will you tell us the truth this time...? )
So you honestly didn't think he was dead when you found him?

text.Andrews: No, not at all...

text.Phoenix: Even though this is what you saw when you discovered the body?

text.Judge: Wh-What is the meaning of this!?

text.Phoenix: Isn't it obvious, Your Honor? There is a knife sticking straight out of Mr. Corrida's chest! Anyone who saw this scene would have immediately thought that here was a dead man!

text.Andrews: Ah... Um... That's... Well, you see...

text.Phoenix: I doubt a single person in the world would mistake this for someone who fainted, and then so nonchalantly go pour something to drink!

text.Judge: Y-Your point is...?

text.Phoenix: Ms. Andrews! Your testimony just now... It was all one giant lie!

text.Andrews: Ungh!

text.Phoenix: And your lie has proven one thing very clearly. That you are the real killer!

text.Andrews: ... NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOoooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo!

text.Judge: It looks like the defense has somehow brought the ugly truth to light. The defendant, Mr. Matt Engarde, is not guilty after all...

text.Andrews: That... But that's impossible! You're wrong...

text.Judge: M-Ms. Andrews! Try to have some composure!

text.Andrews: It... It wasn't me... It wasn't me, I tell you! It was Matt! I swear it! He's the one who killed Juan!

text.Phoenix: But you were the one who refused to testify! And your reason for not doing so was that you "might" end up incriminating yourself!

text.Andrews: Th-That's because...

text.Judge: Ms. Andrews, I will give you one last chance. What exactly are you hiding that may "incriminate" you?

text.Andrews: ... I... I... I refuse... to testify.

text.Judge: Then there is no need for this court to continue any further. Mr. Matt Engarde's innocence has been clearly demonstrated.

text.Phoenix: ( Is... Is it... over...? Have we... Have we found the truth at last...? )

text.Mia: What's wrong, Phoenix?

text.Phoenix: Usually... Well, usually, the real killer confesses his or her guilt. And now that I think about it, this is the first time someone hasn't.

text.Judge: Now then, I would like to hand down my verdict for Mr. Matt Engarde.

text.Edgeworth: Objection!
Your Honor. The prosecution feels that it would be premature to pass down a verdict at this time.

text.Judge: Wh-What...?

text.Edgeworth: The reason is quite simple. This witness has yet to speak the absolute, real truth.

text.Judge: The "absolute, real truth"...? What are you...?

text.Edgeworth: Witness... Don't you understand yet?

text.Andrews: ...Huh?

text.Edgeworth: I don't know who planted this silly idea in your head, but as long as you "protect" yourself through your silence, Matt Engarde will go free. And in his place... YOU will become the guilty party !

text.Andrews: ...Th-That's... That's a lie! I... I don't believe you!

text.Edgeworth: What...?

text.Andrews: I... I was told... If I spoke... If I spoke, then it would be all over... And Matt would never be declared guilty...

text.Phoenix: ( Wh-What in the world is she talking about!? Has she lost it!? )

text.Andrews: I... I can't speak about it... I'm too scared...

text.Mia: It's Franziska von Karma...

text.Phoenix: Huh...?

text.Mia: Don't you rememeber, Phoenix? Ms. Andrews lives by gripping tightly onto the words of another. Because she doesn't have the strength to believe in herself.

text.Phoenix: Th...Then, right now... Ms. Andrews is...

text.Mia: Yesterday, she was tossed a life-saver by Ms. von Karma . "Don't say a word, no matter what happens. If you do, Matt Engarde will be acquitted." Ms. Andrews undyingly believes in those words right now, and is clinging onto them...

text.Phoenix: ( Th-Then what should we do!? This... This is the first time I've ever come across anything like this! But Ms. Andrews has to be the killer, right!? All we have to do now is... is get our not guilty... That is my only priority! )

text.Andrews: It wasn't me! I'm begging you, please believe me! I didn't kill Juan! Help... Please... Someone... Help me...!

text.Judge: Mr. Wright.

text.Phoenix: Y-Yes, Your Honor!

text.Judge: The court can't continue on like this, therefore I'd like to hear what you intend to do.

text.Phoenix: ( What I intend to do...!? Wh-What am I supposed to do!? What am I supposed to say!? )

text.Edgeworth: Wright! I suggest you think very carefully about this! Think about what this witness did, and what she did NOT do! And think about who is the real mastermind behind this crime!

text.Phoenix: ( Who's the real mastermind? Isn't that obvious!? There's no one else it could be except the woman crying over there! ...Right? )

text.Edgeworth: Come now! What will you do!? What kind of man are you, Mr. Phoenix Wright!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( No matter what she says... Ms. Andrews is the only person it could be! Not to mention... I don't have a choice. I have to win a complete acquittal today! ) Y-Your Honor! The defense believes there is enough evidence to substantiate our claim! Therefore, we motion that this court passes a verdict of "not guilty" as soon as possible!

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm...

CHOICE.Edgeworth: I'm disappointed in you, Wright! What have you learned in this past year!?

CHOICE.ACTION: USER SELECTS Force Andrews to testify

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I have to win a complete acquittal today... There's no way around that! But... I can't bring myself to do it like this! Not when she's making a face like that... ) Ms. Andrews! I would like to know what you are really hiding!

CHOICE.Judge: M-Mr. Wright! Are you sure you know what you're doing!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Sure, Mr. Engarde would get an acquittal, but in his place, you would be found guilty! Is this... Is this how you really want this trial to end!?

CHOICE.Andrews: B-Be quiet... How dare you!? You... You're trying to trick me!

text.Judge: That's enough! I commend you for trying, Mr. Edgeworth. However, it's clear that the defense's theory is the truth.

text.Andrews: ...Y...You're wrong...

text.Edgeworth: ... What a shame...
text._info: (Changed from [Such a shame...] in the original release)

text.Edgeworth: I had hoped things wouldn't come to this, however...

text.Judge: Wh-What is it, Mr. Edgeworth?

text.Edgeworth: Ms. Andrews. Since you absolutely refuse to testify... It falls on my shoulders to disclose this to the court.

text.Judge: M-Mr. Edgeworth!?

text.Edgeworth: This witness... How should I put this... She has an illness.

text.Andrews: What!?

text.Edgeworth: And because of this illness, she has tried to commit suicide in the past.

text.Andrews: S-Stop... Please stop...!

text.Edgeworth: No matter how much you want to hide it, it's no use. I have the evidence right here.

text.Andrews: Ah! Th-That's...!

text.Phoenix: ( That's the second part of the suicide report -- the attempted suicide report ! )

text.Edgeworth: What will you do now, witness? You know what I am about to do, don't you? I will now reveal to the court, the true nature of the pitiful woman known as Adrian Andrews!

text.Phoenix: ( The secret of her dependent nature ... Having other people know about it scares her more than anything else in the world... )
text._info: (Changed from [The secret of her co-dependant [sic] nature...] in the original release)

text.Andrews: Please! Please STOP!! I beg you!! If people find out... If people find out... I... I'll...

text.Edgeworth: If you're going to say you would "choose death", that is of no concern to me.

text.Phoenix: ( Edgeworth... How can you be so cold...!? )

text.Edgeworth: However, before you die... I will pull the truth from your still-breathing lips! ... No matter what I have to do.
text._info: (Changed from [I will pull the truth from your breathing lips!] in the original release)

text.Edgeworth: So, will you tell the court yourself, or shall I!? Either is fine with me.

text.Andrews: ... ... ...I... I'll talk. But please... Help me... N-Nothing matters anymore...

When I first saw him... I really thought he had fainted. Honest. 
When I realized he was dead... That was when I formulated my plan. 
Once I made sure there was no one in the hallway, I made a dash back to Matt's room. 
And then... I stabbed Juan's dead body with the knife, and ripped off the button. 
Just when I finished and was returning to Matt's room... I had a bit of an inconvenience. 
And that's why... That's why I ended up using the Nickel Samurai costume.

text.Judge: S-Stabbed the body!? With the knife!? But why would you do that!?

text.Andrews: Isn't it obvious? To pin the blame on a certain person... A certain cowardly man!

text.Judge: Wh... What do you mean by all of this...?

text.Edgeworth: It might take this court a little while to understand, but... This is the truth.

text.Andrews: The real killer is Matt! That scumbag of a man! I'll never forgive him! He's trying to escape his guilt again! Just like last time!

text.Phoenix: ( "Last time"...? )

text.Edgeworth: So, Ms. Andrews stabbed the victim, Juan Corrida, in the chest with the knife. However, she didn't do it with murder in mind. She did it with the intent of framing Matt Engarde for the murder... And this! This is her "crime"!

text.Phoenix: ( Wh-WHAT!? How is this possible!? I mean... Wasn't Ms. Andrews supposed to be the real murderer!? )

text.Judge: Mr. Wright. Please get over your shock and commence the cross-examination.

text.Andrews: When I first saw him... I really thought he had fainted. Honest.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
But you could tell from the state the room was in, that there must have been a fight! Are you telling the truth when you say that you did not know he was dead?

CHOICE.Andrews: He... had a scarf tied around his neck... But that scarf is a part of the Jammin' Ninja's costume... So... So I didn't think anything about it was strange... His head was also... tilted down a bit, so I couldn't see his face that well... That's why I thought I'd wake him up... and went to pour the juice...

text.Andrews: When I realized he was dead... That was when I formulated my plan.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
What is this "plan" you had?

CHOICE.Andrews: ... I knew right away the murderer was Matt. I knew because Juan... He was going to expose Matt's weakest weakpoint to the world. So Matt did this to stop Juan, and silence him for good. That's when I thought, "I should forge some evidence and pin this crime on Matt."

CHOICE.Edgeworth: So the forged pieces of evidence were the knife and the button...

CHOICE.Andrews: The first thing that came to mind was to plant the knife.

text.Andrews: Once I made sure there was no one in the hallway, I made a dash back to Matt's room.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
That was so you could get the knife, correct?

CHOICE.Andrews: The knife Matt used at dinner had his fingerprints all over it. I thought if I used that, then the police would certainly turn their eyes towards him. Matt was napping with his costume on at the time. I slipped in, took the knife, and returned to the scene of the crime.

text.Andrews: And then... I stabbed Juan's dead body with the knife, and ripped off the button.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
So you were the one to stab the victim with that knife.

CHOICE.Andrews: It gives me goosebumps to think about it now... What a horrible thing I did... But... At the time, I couldn't control my own body. It moved on its own. Then, when I stabbed Juan's dead body... I suddenly realized something. If I used the button somehow, I could make Matt look even more suspect.

CHOICE.Edgeworth: So you thought to rip one of the buttons off and then plant it in Mr. Engarde's hakama.

CHOICE.Andrews: Yes... That's what I had planned to do. ...But things never go that smoothly, do they?

text.Andrews: Just when I finished and was returning to Matt's room... I had a bit of an inconvenience.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
An "inconvenience"...?

CHOICE.Andrews: There was a woman with a camera at the ready, loitering in the hallway.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I'm willing to bet my spikes it was Lotta... )

CHOICE.Andrews: There was also a woman with a ray gun at the ready pacing back and forth...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( That's Ms. Oldbag for you... )

CHOICE.Andrews: I had already been caught and made into a big scoop for a certain weekly tabloid once, so I couldn't very well go out looking like myself and get caught again.

text.Andrews: And that's why... That's why I ended up using the Nickel Samurai costume.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
You were the one who prepared that costume, weren't you?

CHOICE.Andrews: Yes. I took it from Global Studios... I also put it into Juan's guitar case the day before the award ceremony.

CHOICE.Edgeworth: You did this in preparation for the press conference, correct?

CHOICE.Andrews: Yes, Juan wanted to wear that costume and hold a press conference in it. He was going to disclose Matt's big secret there.

CHOICE.Judge: And what is this "secret"...?

CHOICE.Andrews: ... ...That, I don't know. Anyway, I thought that if I were to leave Juan's room in the Nickel Samurai costume... then people would think that Matt was the "real" murderer. I was very careful not to leave any fingerprints when I opened the guitar case. I absolutely did not want anyone to know about the costume.

text.Phoenix: ( I don't want to concede, but this testimony... it rings of the truth ... )

text.Mia: I'm sorry, Phoenix...

text.Phoenix: N-No, please, don't apologize to me. We were both taken by surprise.

text.Mia: Still, I'm sorry...

text.Judge: I think we've heard enough! So, after that, you went back to Mr. Engarde's room and planted the button?

text.Andrews: ...Into Matt's hakama? Yes. After that, I folded up the costume I was wearing and put it into a bag. Then I snuck it out of the hotel and got rid of it.

text.Judge: M-My word... What does all this mean...?

text.Andrews: ...Mr. Edgeworth, is it?
The real criminal... is Matt Engarde!! Yesterday... That woman prosecutor sat me down for a talk...

text.Phoenix: ( Franziska, huh... )

text.Andrews: She said that I should, under no circumstances, confess to what I had done. That if I just kept quiet, then Matt would be found guilty for sure... I... I had no choice but to believe in her words...

text.Judge: What this witness has done is clearly unlawful. However... As long as her testimony stands, we can be certain she is not the real killer!

text.Phoenix: W-Wait, Your Honor! The defense still...

text.Edgeworth: Objection!
Wright.
It's pointless. At this point in time, it is not possible to indict Ms. Andrews on anything.

text.Judge: Yes, exactly. There isn't a single piece of evidence that points to her as the murderer. The cross-examination of this witness is over. And so is today's trial. You couldn't establish that the witness was the culprit. Please let it go, Mr. Wright!

text.Phoenix: B-But!

text.Judge: Mr. Edgeworth, please place Ms. Andrews under arrest for further questioning.

text.Edgeworth: Understood, Your Honor. The prosecution will arrange for her detention immediately.

text.Judge: That's all. Court is adjourned for today!

text.Phoenix: ( Today's... Today's trial... It's over...! And I didn't win an acquittal! )

text.Edgeworth: Witness... Would you mind if I asked you something?

text.Phoenix: ...! ( Edgeworth...? )

text.Andrews: What is it...?

text.Edgeworth: Before you leave court today, I wondered if I might look at one thing. The card in your hand. It's had my interest for quite some time now. What exactly is it...?

text.Andrews: Oh, this...? Mr. Wright also asked about this. Although I didn't remember at the time you asked me about it, Mr. Wright, I remembered just now. I found this in the room on that day.

text.Phoenix: "The room"...?

text.Edgeworth: "That day"...?

text.Andrews: Yes. I found this card when I discovered Juan's body. It was lying there right next to him...

text.Phoenix: You found that card... next to the victim's body?

text.Andrews: I suppose I must have unconsciously slipped it into my pocket... ...But it's not as if this card has any relevance to Juan's murder, right?

text.Phoenix: ( Yeah, I guess not. But it's still a strange card, if you ask me... But as far as a clue to this case...? I don't see why... )

text.???: HOLD IT!

text.Edgeworth: Witness! That card... Give it to me! Hurry!

text.Phoenix: E-Edgeworth...?

text.Edgeworth: Do you have any idea what you have stupidly, yet inadvertently done!? This... I can't believe you hid this from me all this time!

text.Andrews: I... I didn't mean to...

text.Mia: Wh-What is this all about...?

text.Phoenix: ( I've never seen Edgeworth so emotional before... That card... What in the world is it? And what does it mean...!? )
text._info: (Changed from [I've never seen such an emotional Edgeworth in my entire life...] in the original release)

text.ACTION: March 22, 5:24 PM Wright & Co. Law Offices

text.Pearl: Mystic Maya... M-Mystic Mayaaa... * sniffle, sniffle *

text.Phoenix: There, there, Pearls...

text.Pearl: I... I can't take it... anymore... ...Waaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa...

text.Phoenix: L-Look! It'll be alright! Everything may still work out.

The condition was that we had to get a "not guilty" verdict. And so far, the kidnapper has kept his word and hasn't hurt Maya. And he won't because Mr. Engarde hasn't been given a "guilty" sentence yet!

text.Pearl: Unngg... Nnmff... * sniffle, sniffle *

text.Phoenix: Cheer up! We don't have time to stand around crying! We have to get going!

text.Pearl: ... Y-You're right... Mystic Maya is in much more pain than I am!

text.Phoenix: Yes, that's right. So...

text.???: Hey! You guys! Glad I caught you, pal!

text.Pearl: M-Mr. Scruffy Detective...

text.Phoenix: ( ...Oh boy. Looks like Detective Gumshoe... has been dubbed "Mr. Scruffy Detective" in Pearls's book now... )

text.Gumshoe: It's just plain ol' "Mr. Dick Gumshoe" now, and I came to talk to you, pal!

text.Phoenix: ( But we're kind of busy right now... )

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Hey, it's wilting a little!

CHOICE.Pearl: I'll... I'll give it some delicious water, pal!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ah, it's OK... I already did that...

CHOICE.Gumshoe: ...The watering can... Where are you, Mr. Watering Can...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Did he just call the watering can, "Mr."? )

CHOICE.Pearl: This is the... uh... Nickel Samurai, right?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Y-Yeah, that's right.

CHOICE.Pearl: Mr. Nick! Please take care of Mystic Maya, and be her "Nickel Samurai", alright!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Difficult-looking legal books stand in a formidable row. They mock me.

CHOICE.Pearl: Oh! Do you need to look something up in one of these law books, Mr. Nick!? Wh-Which book is it!? Which book do you need!? ... Umm... I can't read those hard books, and... um... I can't reach them either...

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "I noticed something at the trial today."

... Phooey. It's busted. I would so die a happy Samurai fan... if I ever got to see the Nickel Samurai on a TV like this. ... Ack! I can't believe I just made a joke about dying, all things considered...

...That's weird. What's a figurine doing on a sofa in a place like this...? I think it's... a bear. Aww, how cute! But it's got a lot of cuts and slits on it... I wonder if it's some kind of puzzle or something...
It's so dark in here that I can barely see, but... these kinda feel like... video tapes... All of them... Just what kind of room is this...?

Unngh... Locked. Of course. And it doesn't look like I can use the card to open this door. There's a little hole at the bottom of the door. If only I was a little skinnier. Then maybe I'd be able to crawl through there...

text.Phoenix: Hm? O-Oh yes, Pearls? ( Got caught up in my thoughts about Maya's situation... )

text.Pearl: Mr. Edgeworth has left, you know.

text.Phoenix: ( I guess for now, I have no choice but to believe in Mr. Engarde. But I think I should listen to his story one more time... ) Alright! Let's get going, too.

text.Pearl: OK!

text.Jailer: I'm sorry, but visiting hours are over for today.

text.Pearl: Aw...

text.Phoenix: ( Argh... I have too many questions I need to ask... ) I-I'm sorry, but I'm Phoenix Wright, a lawyer for one of the...

text.Jailer: You're Mr. Wright, you say? Oh, yeah, there's a message here for you.

text.Phoenix: A message...?

text.Jailer: It's from Matt Engarde. ...Ah, here you are.

text.Pearl: What did he write!? Is it something really important...?

text.Phoenix: I don't know. Well, let's see what it has to say... "To Mr. Lawyer dude, I've got something really important to tell you." ( Why do I feel uneasy all of a sudden...? )
text._info: (Changed from ['To the lawyer dude. I've got something really important to tell you.'] in the original release)

text.Engarde: ... ... Oh, Mr. Wright. So actually... I have a favor to ask of you. I have this cat named Shoe. I didn't put out a lot of food when I left the house, so he's probably pretty hungry. You think you could drop by my house and feed Shoe for me, dude? My house is just a little ways down from the hotel, alright?

text.Pearl: Th-This is terrible! Let's hurry! We have to feed his cat! I'm sure poor Shoe's stomach is growling by now!

text.Phoenix: Y-Yeah, I guess...
( A client's request is a request... Guess I should go check up on his cat. )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "Hmm... Maybe if I show her this letter I got from Edgeworth..."

text.Phoenix: ( Hmm... Maybe if I show her this letter I got from Edgeworth... ) Um... Ms. Oldbag... If you would look at...

text.Oldbag: What!? You want me to look at this worthless piece of... .................. ...Edgey-pooooo...

text.Phoenix: ( Ugh... Is that her perfume, Ph√©romone d'Amour, I smell...? * shudder * )

text.Oldbag: Let's see here... "Would you please allow this unsophisticated young person to conduct his investigation? Yours truly, Miles Edgeworth"

text.Phoenix: "Y-Yours truly"!?

text.Oldbag: Hmph, that man's good at flattery. Fine. But only because Edgey-poo said so, you understand!?
I just thought of something I have to do. Remember, no messing around! You do anything bad and I won't let you off the hook!

text.Pearl: It looks like she has strong feelings for Mr. Edgeworth.

text.Phoenix: That may be, but you know nothing's going to come of it.

text.Pearl: That's so mean, Mr. Nick! Feelings are meant to be told and shared!

text.Phoenix: Owww... ( Every time we talk about love, I always end up with a handprint on my face somehow. ) Um, so anyway, let's continue our investigation.

text.Pearl: OK!

text.Phoenix: Ack! What!? What now!?

text.Oldbag: One little thing, before I forget. You can't go into Engarde's room today.

text.Pearl: Why?

text.Oldbag: The police's main investigation team is going to be in there all day, you hear?

text.Phoenix: ( I wonder if they're the team in charge of investigating "De Killer"...? )

text.Oldbag: So don't go in there! Set one foot in there and you'll face the wrath of Wendy Oldbag!

CHOICE.Phoenix: It's the stage they were going to use for the post-ceremony stage show. After the show, there was supposed to be a press conference, but...

CHOICE.Pearl: But that press conference...

CHOICE.Phoenix: It was really the victim, Juan Corrida, trying to disclose something about Mr. Engarde.

CHOICE.Pearl: But they're both heroes... Why would they do something so un-heroic?

CHOICE.Phoenix: They may look like heroes on the outside, but on the inside, they're only human.

text.ACTION: After clearing "Maya's situation" Talk option in Hotti Clinic - Reception, then visiting Detention Center:

text.Phoenix: ( Hmm, sure is dark... )

text.Pearl: I'll go turn on a light!

text.Phoenix: Wow... So this is what a star's house looks like. Must be nice to be rich.

text.Pearl: Come on, Mr. Nick! Let's find Shoe, the kitty-cat! Shoooooe!

text.Phoenix: So I guess this is Shoe.

text.Pearl: Ah, what a lovely cat. ...Hello, Shoe.
...Tee hee.

text.Phoenix: ( The cat seems to like Pearls. )

text.???: Pardon me...
May I help you with something, Mister...

text.Phoenix: Oh, uh, we're lawyers. Actually, I'm Mr. Engarde's lawyer.

text.???: The master's... Then, you must be Mr. Wright.

text.Phoenix: Y-Yes.

text.???: Ah, it's a pleasure to meet your wonderful self.

text.de Killer: I am the family butler, John Doe.

text.Phoenix: Nice to meet you.

CHOICE.Pearl: Oh! There's a giant cooking hearth here.

CHOICE.Phoenix: That's actually a fireplace.

CHOICE.Pearl: How are they different, Mr. Nick?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ... ( You know, I've never actually seen a hearth before, come to think of it... )

CHOICE.Pearl: You should come and visit Fey Manor, then. I'll show you one when you do.
A... A giant bicycle is flying through the air!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ... That bicycle, Pearls, is one where you don't have to pedal, and it moves on its own.

CHOICE.Pearl: Really!? Wow!

CHOICE.Phoenix: But sorry to disappoint you, it can't fly.

CHOICE.Pearl: ...Oh. That's too bad.

CHOICE.Phoenix: It's a very comfortable and spacious lounge set. I wonder if famous stars drop by and sit around and have a good time. ...In any case, I don't really belong here, do I? ... Argh. What is with me and feeling inferior today...?

CHOICE.Pearl: Ah! There are masks here!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah. That one in the middle is the Steel Samurai. The ones next to that are the Pink Princess and the Evil Magistrate. They fought many battles against the backdrop of Neo Olde Tokyo.

CHOICE.Pearl: Wow, you really know a lot about the Steel Samurai, Mr. Nick.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ... ( I don't know whether to laugh or cry that I know more about that show than a kid... )
There's another door over there.

CHOICE.Pearl: You shouldn't go wandering off over there, Mr. Nick.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...Yes, Pearls. ( Now I know how Maya feels when I tell her to stop playing around... )

CHOICE.Pearl: There's a small door at the bottom of this bigger door, Mr. Nick.

CHOICE.Phoenix: I bet it's for Mr. Engarde's cat to use.

CHOICE.Pearl: Oh, you mean Shoe.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( The door... It's locked tight. Well, I guess that's to keep nosey people like me from entering it. )
You must know all sorts of things about Mr. Engarde, right?

CHOICE.de Killer: Honestly, sir... I don't believe my master is capable of such a foul deed as murder.

CHOICE.Phoenix: And, uh, anything else?

CHOICE.de Killer: No, not especially. It is not appropriate for a lowly servant to speak of the master or his affairs.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Hmm... How typically "butler-like", as it were... )
Mr. Doe, how long have you served at this residence...?

CHOICE.de Killer: Well, sir, I would have to say... maybe about one year?

CHOICE.Phoenix: And, uh, anything else?

CHOICE.de Killer: No, not especially. It is not appropriate for a lowly servant to speak of himself and his affairs.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( You know, I would've thought Mr. Engarde the kind to have a maid over a butler... )
CHOICE._info: ([maid] in quotation marks in the original release)

CHOICE.Phoenix: That's a very cute cat you've got here.

CHOICE.de Killer: It is my duty to take care of him. The master rather fancies Shoe.

CHOICE.Phoenix: And, uh, anything else?

CHOICE.de Killer: No, not especially. It is not appropriate for a lowly servant to speak of the family cat.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( ...Well then. I guess I don't need this piece of scrap paper anymore. )
That's a very cute cat you've got here.

CHOICE.de Killer: It is my duty to take care of him. The master rather fancies Shoe.

CHOICE.Phoenix: And, uh, anything else?

CHOICE.de Killer: No, not especially. It is not appropriate for a lowly servant to speak of the family cat.

CHOICE.Phoenix: You must know all sorts of things about Mr. Engarde, right?

CHOICE.de Killer: Honestly, sir... I don't believe my master is capable of such a foul deed as murder.

CHOICE.Phoenix: And, uh, anything else?

CHOICE.de Killer: No, not especially. It is not appropriate for a lowly servant to speak of the master or his affairs.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Hmm... How typically "butler-like", as it were... )
I was wondering if you wouldn't mind taking a look at this.

CHOICE.de Killer: I'm afraid I cannot offer up anything special about it. It is not appropriate for a lowly servant to speak of evidence for a trial.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Polite yet snotty with a touch of rude. He's the stereotypical butler alright. )
Would you happen to know who this person is...?

CHOICE.de Killer: No, I would not. It is not appropriate for a lowly servant to speak of the master's acquaintances.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Then what in the world CAN I talk to you about!? )

CHOICE.Pearl: M-Mr. Nick! Being angry is bad!

text.de Killer: ...Well, I'm afraid I must take my leave of you now.

text.Phoenix: Oh, we should probably get going ourselves.

text.de Killer: Ah, so young and yet already so accomplished. A master of law...

text.Phoenix: But there is also a lot to be proud of in being a butler, in charge of the house and all.

text.de Killer: Thank you for the compliment, sir. ...People are not always who they appear to be. ...Now if you'll excuse me.

text.Phoenix: Looks like we're the only ones here.

text.Pearl: And yet... the hotel seems so busy somehow...

text.Phoenix: ( Probably because the police team is scouring for clues about "De Killer"... )

CHOICE.Pearl: I want to eat a meal with Mystic Maya again...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah, me too...

CHOICE.Pearl: Whenever I watch Mystic Maya eat like she does... It makes me happy about eating, and then I can eat a lot.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Well, then... How about after we wrap up this case, we all go out for a huge twenty-course feast!

CHOICE.Pearl: OK! Let's work really hard, then!

text.Lotta: Hey, City Boy!

text.Phoenix: L-Lotta... You're still here...

text.Lotta: Reckon course! An investigative photographer eats or starves on her ability to snap up the scoop, yeah!? And this hotel just has that "aura of mystery". Ya know, like something's always about to happen.

text.Pearl: But... Do you have a camera?

text.Lotta: Reckgiven! A photographer's gotta have cameras out the ear like corn to be a real pro, ya know!? So I'm hangin' around here... ... ... Speaking of cameras and feedin' the mouth, do ya have mine, ya bread-thief!?

text.Phoenix: ( Why can't you drop that "thief" thing already? )

CHOICE.Pearl: Aww, how lovely! The teddy bear looks happy to be surrounded by so many beautiful flowers.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Pearls really seems to like teddy bears a lot. )
Ah... I wonder if... Lotta also...

CHOICE.Lotta: I didn't touch them! Wasn't me, I tell ya! I give ya my word!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Why do I get the impression Lotta helped herself to one of them...? )
Compared to the flowers on the other side of the hall, these are much more gorgeous. Although, other than sunflowers and tulips, I have no idea what any of them are.

CHOICE.Pearl: Um, Mr. Nick? What's this flower called?

CHOICE.Phoenix: It's a sunflower... I think.

CHOICE.Pearl: This flower over here is pretty too.

CHOICE.Phoenix: That's a tulip, I guess.

CHOICE.Lotta: Callin' everythin' a sunflower or a tulip; don't reckon even little kids'll fall for that!

CHOICE.Phoenix: There's a piece of paper taped to the door that says, "Matt Engarde's Room".

CHOICE.Pearl: The old lady told us about this, didn't she? That we can't go in this room tonight.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I wonder if an investigation briefing is going on right now inside... Without Detective Gumshoe... )
I want to ask you about the night of the murder.

CHOICE.Lotta: What? Ya really gonna shell out the bucks for the info I got!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Lotta, you were loitering in this hallway the night of the murder, were you not?

CHOICE.Lotta: Well, kinda... But...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Brace yourself, Phoenix. Here it comes... )
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [Brace yourself, Wright. Here it comes...] in the original release)

CHOICE.Lotta: I didn't exactly hang around here the entire time, ya know. Followed a few stars around... got a few autographs, shook a few hands, had a soda-pop with a few of 'em too.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Looks like she wasn't here the entire time that night... )

CHOICE.Pearl: The security lady also wasn't in this hallway the whole time either.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I guess this means there's no one who can tell us who came and went that night... )
So, about the note that was inside your camera case.

CHOICE.Lotta: Oh, that ditty I wrote?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah... Can I believe what you've written?

CHOICE.Lotta: Ya mean the stuff about Engarde shovin' his manager lady onto Corrida?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah...

CHOICE.Lotta: Ah, well, I reckon ya best not be believin' that.

CHOICE.Phoenix: What?

CHOICE.Lotta: Look, I sorta wrote that on a whim, ya know? Writin' whatever came to mind.

CHOICE.Pearl: "Whatever came to mind"...?

CHOICE.Lotta: Yeah, when ya get down to it, it's just a lotta random bull dooders.
Hey, what's with ya!? Why ya starin' at me like my grandpa used to!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Hmph.

CHOICE.Lotta: Hey, and why do you look like you suddenly got older too!? Or am I just shrinkin' here!?

CHOICE.Pearl: Umm...

CHOICE.Lotta: Ah! My baby! My $1,600 baby! What's with that red-coated prosecutor anyhow!? The guy told me it was "evidence" and refused to give it back to me!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Well, that's kind of how it is...

CHOICE.Lotta: Hey, hey. Yer that red-coat's friend, ain't ya? So put in a few good words for me and git me back my camera.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Y-You want me to do what!?

CHOICE.Lotta: Listen, nag the guy real good fer 'bout five hours and I guarantee he'll give it back.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Why don't you do your own dirty work...?
Um, would you please take a look at this?

CHOICE.Lotta: Nope. Sorry. No can do. Only thing I wanna see is a steamin' hand towel.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Um, what? A steaming hand towel...?

CHOICE.Lotta: Need one for my eyes. Today just ain't a good day for my eyes to be lookin' at stuff.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( How convenient! Maybe I'll have to use that one next time you show me something! )

text.Lotta: ... Well, I reckon it's time for me to get going. A tabloid photographer without a camera is just a "tabloid", huh.

text.Phoenix: Umm... Yeah, I guess so.

text.Lotta: Keep yerself together out there, ya hear!? I'm comin' to see ya in court tomorrow.

text.Phoenix: O-OK, I'll see you then...

text.Lotta: And you too there, little 'un. Keep up the good work, OK?

text.Pearl: OK!

text.Lotta: Don't be picky about yer food, now.

text.Pearl: OK!

text.Lotta: And make sure ya do all yer homework, ya hear?

text.Pearl: OK!

text.Lotta: And if you happen to find yerself a camera, make sure ya bring it right to me, ya--

text.Phoenix: Would you please just leave already!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: There's a piece of paper taped to the door that says, "Juan Corrida's Room". ( I wonder what EXACTLY happened in the room behind this door...? Even now, no one really has any idea... )

text.ACTION: March 22 Gatewater Hotel Corrida's Hotel Room

text.???: ... Ooongh... Oooonnngh... Ooongh... Oooonnngh...

text.Pearl: M-M-Mr. Nick!

text.Phoenix: Wh-What is that otherworldly, ghastly moaning...!?

text.???: ... Ooonnnn... Oooo... Nnnghff... Ghfff...

text.Pearl: I... I hate evil ghosts... Waaaaaaaaaaaaah...

text.Phoenix: I don't think it's a ghost... Maybe it's a demon!?

text.???: E-Excuse me!? Watch who you're calling a demon, brat!

text.Pearl: Aaaah!

text.Phoenix: Zoinks! It's the alien!!

text.Oldbag: Who are you calling an alien!?

text.Phoenix: Oh, it's just you, Ms. Oldbag. What are you doing here?

text.Oldbag: What is wrong with young'uns today!? I came down here to pay my respects to my poor Juan, and you're disturbing me!

CHOICE.Pearl: So that's a bed...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yup. It's big, but it's a bed.

CHOICE.Pearl: Aaah! Mr. Nick! It's sooooo soft!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( How easily children are entertained. )
Bottles of cosmetics are scattered all over the floor. This is probably where Mr. Corrida fought his assailant.

CHOICE.Pearl: These glass shards...

CHOICE.Phoenix: They're probably from the glass vase Ms. Andrews knocked over.

CHOICE.Pearl: So, the Nickel Samurai's costume was in here?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah.

CHOICE.Pearl: I can't believe Mr. Corrida went so far, just to say bad things about Mr. Engarde...

CHOICE.Phoenix: W-Well, it was a "press conference", so he had to go in costume.

CHOICE.Pearl: But weren't Mr. Engarde and Mr. Corrida friends?

CHOICE.Phoenix: They weren't friends. They couldn't be friends because they were rivals.

CHOICE.Pearl: So, a "rival" is someone who is a "strong enemy"!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Pearls is really fired up over this... And I don't have an answer for her. )
It's a beautiful wine glass, and there's... tomato juice in it.

CHOICE.Pearl: Ewww. Tomato juice. I don't really like it much.

CHOICE.Phoenix: There's a bottle of it on the table over there. That's probably where this came from.
Please talk to me about the night of the murder just one more time.

CHOICE.Oldbag: I talked about it plenty at the trial! I was fooled, tricked... DECEIVED by that fraud of a photographer and her note! She was loitering around here with that imbecilic look on her face!

CHOICE.Pearl: "With that imbecilic look on her face"... OK, got it.

CHOICE.Oldbag: N-Now hold on a second there you little pipsqueak! If you're going to take notes, at least make me sound better than that!

CHOICE.Pearl: Oh, alright.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Now I've seen everything... )

CHOICE.Oldbag: But you know, I was working that night too, doing my job, minding my own business. So it's not like I had time to waste standing around here the whole night.

CHOICE.Phoenix: I was wondering if you could tell me a bit more about Mr. Corrida.

CHOICE.Oldbag: He was the most popular star, you know... Especially where it counts -- in my book!

CHOICE.Phoenix: But I heard that he was lagging behind in the polls against Mr. Engarde...

CHOICE.Oldbag: Um, w-well, that's just a recent thing. Bad luck and all that, you know. But! He was going to become an even bigger star than he used to be! Look! Just look at this mountain of presents! It's a show of the mountain of feelings all his fans had for him!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah, the mountain is pretty big, and certainly nothing to shake a stick at.

CHOICE.Pearl: ...Mr. Nick?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Hm? What is it, Pearls?

CHOICE.Pearl: The presents. They're all bears... right?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( She's got a point... There isn't a single thing here that isn't a bear... )
All of Mr. Corrida's presents from his fans seem to be... bears...

CHOICE.Oldbag: Oh, that's because you can't think of Juan without thinking about bears !

CHOICE.Pearl: Bears...? Why bears?

CHOICE.Oldbag: You don't know!? When my dear Juan was training, he fought barehanded with a bear. He refused to give in and let the bear win, but after the fight, they became friends.

CHOICE.Pearl: Wow... What a heartwarming story.

CHOICE.Oldbag: Look, it's just like in those young people's dramas. I can see those two tuckered out, down by a river going, "Heh... You... You sure can fight..." "You too, bub. You too."

CHOICE.Phoenix: D-Did all that really happen?

CHOICE.Oldbag: It's in his biography, bub.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( What a load of crock! )

CHOICE.Oldbag: So ever since then, fans have been giving him bears as presents.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah... Nice... Bears...

text.ACTION: After clearing all Talk options and visiting Living Room:

text.Phoenix: Wh-Wh-What is that infernal racket!?

text.Oldbag: It's one of the presents going off. Sounds like it's already 8 PM. Way past your bedtime!

text.Phoenix: Urk... That startled me! I thought I was going to die for a second...

text.Pearl: Eight PM... That's the time when the award ceremony ended that night, remember?

text.Phoenix: ( Time sure flies... Hard to believe it's been two days since the ceremony... )
( The transceiver! )
Hello!? Hello!?

text.???: ...This is not a phone.

text.Phoenix: Maya! How is Maya!? You haven't hurt her, have you!?

text.???: ...It seems you were not able to fulfill your end of the bargain, Mr. Attorney.
text._info: (Changed from [...It seems you were not able to fulfill your end of the bargain, Mr. Wright.] in the original release)

text.???: I have heard the news. So it would seem my present did you no good...

text.Pearl: N-Noooo! Mystic Maya! Mystic Mayaaaaaaaa!

text.Phoenix: One more day! Please! All I ask is for one more day! I... I'll get a not guilty verdict for sure this time! Please...

text.???: ... I suppose if I must. I need that acquittal more than anything else, after all.

text.Phoenix: ...Please... Please let Maya say something! I want to hear she's alright!

text.???: Alright... hissssss... then... hisssssss... ssssssssss... ssss... a little... sssssss...

text.Phoenix: ( What is with this static all of a sudden...! ) Hello!? Hello!?

text.???: It seems... ssssss... hisss... sssss... bad... sssssss... hisssssssssss... ssssssssss... connect...sssssssssssss...

text.Phoenix: ( Dammit! Did the transceiver just suddenly break...!? )

text.???: ssssssssss... 'll excuse me... hisssssssssssssssss...

text.Pearl: Wh-What happened...?

text.Phoenix: I don't know. All of a sudden, it became nothing but static.

text.Pearl: Aaaah... Mystic Maya! Mystic Maya!

text.Phoenix: ( Why did the transceiver suddenly break like that...? I should probably have an electronics expert look at it... The sooner the better! )

text.Gumshoe: Hey! Welcome back, pal! I thought I'd make you a little something for dinner.

text.Phoenix: Th...That's nice... Thanks.

text.Gumshoe: A rich-man's luxurious full course meal... out of a can, that is...
text._info: (Changed from [It's a rich-man's luxurious full course meal... out of a can, that is...] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: I'm sorry you went through all the trouble to cook, but I don't have the time to eat.

text.Gumshoe: Oops... Looks like you don't have a can opener, pal.
text._info: (Changed from [Oh, hey... You don't have a can opener here, pal.] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: ( You've got to be kidding... And here I thought he had already whipped something up. )

text.Gumshoe: Oh, I know! There is one way I know how to be helpful! Ask me about anything you want, pal! Go ahead!

text.Phoenix: ( Well, since he's here and offering... I wonder what I should try asking him about? )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "Um... So what is "electromagnetic interference"...?"

CHOICE.Gumshoe: The transceiver...?

CHOICE.Pearl: Oh, Mr. Nick! You should ask Mr. Scruffy Detective about that thing.

CHOICE.Gumshoe: What thing?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Oh yeah! This thing just up and broke all of a sudden!

CHOICE.Gumshoe: It... It broke, pal?

CHOICE.Phoenix: When I was talking to the kidnapper, it just suddenly broke into static... Look, it sounded like this.

CHOICE.Gumshoe: I don't hear any static, pal.

CHOICE.Phoenix: H-Huh??

CHOICE.Pearl: Maybe it fixed itself?

CHOICE.Phoenix: That's strange... I'm sure it was making a loud static noise.

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Hmm... Maybe...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Maybe what?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Maybe it was " electromagnetic interference ", pal.

CHOICE.Phoenix: "Electromagnetic interference"?
Oh yeah! Do you know about this card?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Card?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Edgeworth, for some reason, went pale the instant he saw this card.

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Hey, I know what this is, pal!

CHOICE.Phoenix: You do?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: No matter what way you look at it, I'd say it's a picture of a shell .

CHOICE.Phoenix: Um, that's it?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Oh yeah! That's right! Mr. Edgeworth really likes those cooked snail things. Um, what are they called again...? "Escargot" or something like that...?

CHOICE.Pearl: Mr. Nick! I think we just solved the mystery of why Mr. Edgeworth's face turned pale, right!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( As I suspected, Gumshoe has no clue... )

text.Phoenix: Um... So what is "electromagnetic interference"...?

text.Gumshoe: It's something that happens when a radio wave gets mixed up with another signal, pal.

text.Phoenix: Oh, when you put it that way...

text.Pearl: I don't understand what you're talking about...

text.Gumshoe: Like for example, when a cell phone goes off next to a computer screen, the stuff on the screen gets kinda fuzzy and starts acting funny, right?

text.Pearl: Huh? ..."Kom-pu-ter"?

text.Gumshoe: ... Um, it's like when you use the dryer next to the TV, and the screen starts looking weird.

text.Pearl: O-Oh, yes, the TV does do that! Hmm... Oh, so that's what you're talking about!

text.Phoenix: ( She seems amazingly happy at being able to understand this... )

text.Gumshoe: So the room you were in when that interference to the transceiver happened... There's gotta be something there that's sending out very strong radio waves , pal! Something like... Hmm... Like a listening device or something.

text.Phoenix: Ah!

text.Gumshoe: Hey, speaking of that! Where were you when it happened?

text.Pearl: We were in Mr. Corrida's room... The scene of the murder !

text.Gumshoe: What!? That's it! I'm going to sneak into the precinct and get a bug sweeper ! I'll meet you at the crime scene later, alright pal!?

text.Phoenix: Ah, wait! Gumshoe!

text.Gumshoe: Oh yeah, baby! It's investigating time! I'm on fire, pal! My fingers are itching to go! Yeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeah!

text.Pearl: We should be going too, Mr. Nick!

text.Phoenix: Alright, let's go!

CHOICE.Phoenix: My desk. Since I don't have time to sit, it's unusually clean...

CHOICE.Pearl: Oh! I cleaned it up even more for you last night!

text.ACTION: After clearing "Electromagnetic interference" Talk option in Wright & Co. Law Offices:
March 22 Gatewater Hotel Corrida's Hotel Room

text.Gumshoe: Hey! You're finally here, pal!

text.Phoenix: S-Sorry to keep you waiting.

text.Pearl: Do you have the... um... "bug sweeper"?

text.Gumshoe: Um, well, you see... I got busted trying to sneak in, pal. Then suddenly, I'm staring at the precinct doors. ...From the outside, I mean. So yeah... I couldn't get one of the police bug sweepers...

text.Phoenix: ... What do you mean you couldn't get it!? We need that item!

text.Gumshoe: Hey, hey, calm down, pal. I didn't say I didn't get one, just not the police's.

text.Pearl: Wow... So this is a "bug sweeper"...

text.Phoenix: It looks a little... broken.

text.Gumshoe: Hey, this was made when I was in elementary school, pal.

text.Phoenix: Oh? By who?

text.Gumshoe: Me, of course! Ah, seeing this sure brings back memories...
Hey, don't look down on it, pal! Sure, it looks a little beat up... But I put my heart and soul into building this puppy here!
text._info: (Changed from [Hey, don't look down on it, pal! Sure, it looks a little run down...] in the original release)

text.Pearl: Your heart and soul...?

text.Gumshoe: It'll work! Trust me, pal, it'll do the job! But...

text.Phoenix: But...?

text.Gumshoe: But you can't set the sensitivity... So it's going to beep at anything that gives off electromagnetic waves.

text.Pearl: But isn't it better that way?

text.Gumshoe: Oh ho ho ho ho ho ho ho ho ho ho ho ho ho ho ho ho ho ho ho ho ho ho ho! Well, anyway, since I brought it all this way, might as well give it a whirl, right pal?

text.Phoenix: ( I'm getting that sinking feeling again... )

text.Gumshoe: OK, now I'll tell you how to use this baby! There's a listening device or some other sort of bug hidden in this room, pal.

text.Pearl: So we're going to find it, right?

text.Gumshoe: Right. Now, first, let's turn the sweeper on. Next, move the sweeper around to give the room a real thorough lookie-see, pal. The sweeper'll let you know how strong of a signal it's picking up, so keep an eye on it, OK? ( Changed from [You can see how strong the radio waves are in an area by looking at the CHECK gauge.] in the original release ) Once you find something that's giving off a lot of radio waves... ( Changed from [Once you find something that's giving off strong waves, the gauge will change...] in the original release ) ...press [the A Button / Enter] to lock on to it. ( Changed from [And when that happens, touch the gauge to really give the thing a long hard stare.] in the original release ) There's a lot of things here that's going to give off radio waves, so let's take a good look at anything and everything that seems suspicious, OK pal!? Alright! I'm going to go stand outside and keep an eye out. Give me a yell if you find the bug. Got it, pal!?
text._info: (Changed from [Next, touch the sweeper and take a real good look around the room with it, pal.] in the original release)

CHOICE.Phoenix: It's a plain old calculator.

CHOICE.Pearl: It says "50" on it. Maybe he was calculating his allowance?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( A whole 50 cents?? Um, maybe if he was a spirit medium... )
And here we have a dryer... Nothing unusual here, I think.

CHOICE.Pearl: A dryer...? Oh! if you use it next to a TV, it'll make the screen look all weird right?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...Y-Yeah.

CHOICE.Pearl: And when that happens, it's called "electromagnetic interference", right!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Hey, good memory Pearls!

CHOICE.Pearl: I will never forget it for the rest of my life!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Well, it certainly looks like an alarm clock.

CHOICE.Pearl: What's wrong? Why do you look troubled?

CHOICE.Phoenix: I just can't imagine the listening device being inside this alarm clock. It just, um, sort of reminded me of something that happened a long time ago...

CHOICE.Pearl: Oh...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Well, anyway, it looks like the listening device isn't in here.

CHOICE.Pearl: Wow, there's a really delicious loaf of bread in here!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Looks like it's been on "keep warm" all this time since the murder.

CHOICE.Pearl: Well, Mr. Scruffy Detective always says, "Got to keep the trail and crime scene warm."

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I think the "keep warm" in that case is a little more metaphorical... )

CHOICE.Pearl: What's this?

CHOICE.Phoenix: It's a small video camera. ...No listening device in this gizmo.

CHOICE.Phoenix: That's what it seems like.

CHOICE.Pearl: But! I want to grow bigger and bigger!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Well, eating only vegetables isn't going to help you there. You have to eat meat too... )
It's the TV's remote control. But it doesn't look like the listening device is in here.

CHOICE.Pearl: Um, so I was thinking... I wonder if a TV remote works on other things... Like... Could I make you change your expressions like TV channels? Zap!

CHOICE.Phoenix: H-Hey! ( Hmm, but if I could... Ooh, the people I would give the ol' mute button to! ) Well, I don't think it's going to work on me... Why don't we try it on Maya tomorrow, OK?
There's no listening device in that notebook computer, huh.

CHOICE.Pearl: Umm... What's a "notebook computer"...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ... Do you know what a "notebook" is?

CHOICE.Pearl: Yes! It's a small book with paper that you can write on! ...So?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Well, that thing is like a notebook in a way. It's basically a small laptop.

CHOICE.Pearl: Umm... Mr. Nick... What's a "laptop"...?
This is a... a refrigerator, right?

CHOICE.Phoenix: I really don't think the listening device is in something like this.

CHOICE.Pearl: Because it's filled with nothing but healty vegetable juices, right!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Uh, yeah, sure. ( What does that have to do with listening devices? )

CHOICE.Phoenix: Oh, well, it's kind of like a hot water pot, I guess. But instead of hot water, coffee comes out.

CHOICE.Pearl: Really!? Th-This pot can do that!? ... Um, is there a pot that orange juice comes out of...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: I don't think there's anything like that, Pearls. Sorry.

CHOICE.Pearl: Oh, the water in this hot water pot has run out! I'll go get more water for it!

CHOICE.Phoenix: O-OK. Sounds good. ( Looks like she's forgotten all about looking for the listening device... )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "This is... This is just a giant stuffed teddy bear, right?"

CHOICE.Phoenix: Well, the listening device isn't in the air conditioner.

CHOICE.Pearl: Aah! Yuck! This air filter is covered in dust and dirt...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Y-Yeah...

CHOICE.Pearl: ... Come on, Mr. Nick! Let's wash it!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I wonder if being a neat freak makes even the tiniest dust bunny look colossal...? )

CHOICE.Pearl: ...What?

CHOICE.Phoenix: O-Oh, nothing.
I don't really think the listening device is in the TV of all places.

CHOICE.Pearl: Looks like the TV was left on, and it's now showing an old samurai movie.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah. This channel plays all sorts of international movies, as well as domestic ones.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...Um, yeah.

CHOICE.Pearl: When I grow up, I want to study Japanese!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I should probably keep my mouth shut here, and not destroy her dream... )
Lamp, check. Listening device... nope.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah.

CHOICE.Pearl: And they're all on. You shouldn't do that, Mr. Nick. Don't you know that's wasteful?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...Ah, yeah... I'll be more conscientious from now on. Sorry.
A cell phone... Nope, no bugs in here.

CHOICE.Pearl: A "cell phone"...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Wh-What!? Don't tell me you don't know what a cell phone is!

CHOICE.Pearl: ...I'm sorry. I've never seen one before...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Now that she mentions it, my cell phone couldn't get any reception while I was staying in Kurain Village... And Pearls has never lived outside of that village, so... Well, I guess I can't say it's impossible to live without one... )
Well, the phone is the most common place for a "listening device", I'd say. But, let's take the receiver apart first before we get ahead of ourselves here.

CHOICE.Pearl: Wow, you know a lot about electronics, don't you Mr. Nick?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah, I know tons. Especially when it comes to taking them apart. It's my specialty. ( I'll leave the fixing part up to Gumshoe... )

CHOICE.Pearl: So...? Is there a "listening device" in there?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...No. ( And I really thought it had to be in the phone too... )

CHOICE.Pearl: Ah, what a lovely bear...
AAAAAAAAAAAAAH!!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ah, this must be one of those fancy bear-shaped toy robots.

CHOICE.Pearl: I-It's a robot!? It's a REAL robot!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Y-Yeah, it's a real one.

CHOICE.Pearl: Mr. Nick!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Y-Yes?

CHOICE.Pearl: H-How many horse-powers is it? How many horsies!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Horsies...? ...
Um... Well, look, it's a bear, so... uh...

CHOICE.Pearl: Um...
The radio is on and playing something. Oh! It's "Kids' Question Corner"!
... Yes, why is it, Mr. Nick?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ... Why don't you listen to the radio program a little more, Pearls?

text.Pearl: No, not yet. But this bear's eye is...

text.Gumshoe: Oomph! * rip! *

text.Pearl: Noooooooooo!

text.Phoenix: Th-That's!

CHOICE.Pearl: So... It's sort of like a TV broadcast, isn't it?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Wh-What!?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: And if you think about the angle the bear is at... It's bound to have had a clear shot of the whole crime , pal!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Is there really no way to find out...? )
