CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah.

CHOICE.Gumshoe: And because he's "Shelly", that's why he leaves a "shell" card?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yes.

CHOICE.Gumshoe: ... Ho ho ho ho! Oh, that's great. But you know, no matter how strange I may seem, at least my jokes don't make you cringe. Right, pal?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Umm... Yeah, you keep on thinking that... )

CHOICE.Pearl: It's a really tiiiiny camera.

CHOICE.Gumshoe: A camera this size lasts about 3 hours with a fresh battery pack, pal.

CHOICE.Phoenix: But what would something like this be doing in...?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Well, I'd say taking a secret video of the murder.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Which means... Someone knew there was going to be a murder here! )

CHOICE.Gumshoe: This device looks like it was made by the criminal themselves. If it's only sending images, then I'd say it'd last about 80 hours, pal.

CHOICE.Pearl: You know a lot about these things, don't you Mr. Detective? Is spying on people a hobby of yours...?

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Well, no... I mean... You're making me embarrassed, putting me on the spot like this.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Why should he be embarrassed? Is there something I'm not getting here...? )

CHOICE.Pearl: The bear is really lovely, isn't it? It's so soft and fuzzy, and the face is really well-made...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Well, I guess when you compare it to all the other presents, it is well-made. )

CHOICE.Gumshoe: Yeah, but I don't think the bear itself is a clue to this case at all.

text.Gumshoe: ... ...I got it!

text.Phoenix: Wh-What!?

text.Gumshoe: Hey, pal. Let me borrow this mini camera for a bit!

text.Phoenix: Wh-What are you going to do?

text.Gumshoe: I'm going to go around to the electronic shops and see if I can find out who bought this!

text.Phoenix: B-But that's impossible! I mean, it's already 9 PM!

text.Gumshoe: Leave it to me! Even if I have to search all night, I'll find your man, pal!
Oh yeah, baby! It's investigating time! I'm on fire, pal! My fingers are itching to go! Yeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeah!

text.Pearl: ...He's gone.

text.Phoenix: ...Yeah.

text.Pearl: But Mr. Scruffy Detective sure is a nice man. He's pushing himself so hard, all for Mystic Maya's sake...

text.???: It's a mystery how you always manage to do things in the most inefficient ways, Wright.
text._info: (Changed from [...You always manage to do things in the most ineffective ways.] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: ( Ack! )

text.Edgeworth: You'll have to excuse me. I heard your conversation just now.

text.Phoenix: E-Edgeworth! What are you doing here!?

text.Edgeworth: A rescue team has been created and deployed. I can't say I'm optimistic... but we have to move forward, one step at a time.

text.Phoenix: I-I see... Thanks.

text.Edgeworth: Don't thank me yet. We still have to find her.
Hmm... So, there was a spy camera hidden inside this stuffed animal, huh? You are one lucky man, Wright.
Do you know this stuffed bear, little girl?

text.Pearl: Um... I have no idea!

text.Edgeworth: Hmph... Of course not. The maker of this bear is a very expensive, luxury brand from overseas. It's completely hand-made, and only a small number of these are exported here.
text._info: (Changed from [It's completely hand-made and there are very few that are exported here.] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: Wh-What?

text.Edgeworth: The camera and transmitter that scatterbrained detective took with him are dead ends. Things like those can be bought anywhere... However, this bear is different. By tracking how it got into this country, this bear can tell us who the buyer is.

text.Pearl: C-Can you really do that!? Mr. Nick, can he really?

text.Phoenix: W-Well, I guess so...

text.Edgeworth: Hmm... It's 9 PM. I think I can still make it in time.
I'll be taking this for now. I'm sure you have other things you have to do.
See you soon, Wright.

text.Phoenix: W-Wait!

text.Edgeworth: What?

text.Phoenix: Why are you doing this...?

text.Edgeworth: ... I have no interest in explaining myself to someone who cannot comprehend. But besides that, Wright. Until court reconvenes tomorrow, you should concern yourself with this question: "Who was the person that murdered Juan Corrida?"

text.Phoenix: The " real killer "...

text.Edgeworth: Do you really still think it was Adrian Andrews?

text.Phoenix: To be honest... I don't know anymore.

text.Edgeworth: ... You still have a little time left... Find the truth, Wright. Everything begins with the truth.

text.Phoenix: ( Juan Corrida's real killer... Ms. Andrews' past... The kidnapper whose sole condition is an acquittal for Mr. Engarde... And... this card. Shelly de Killer... ) ...Maya. The only way I can save you now, is to find all the answers to this case tonight! I don't understand what your real intentions are, Edgeworth... but as you said, all I can do for now is find the truth!

text.ACTION: March 22, 9:14 PM Gatewater Hotel Corrida's Hotel Room

text.Pearl: It's past 9:00 PM already, isn't it? I wonder... I wonder if Mr. Edgeworth has already found Mystic Maya...?

text.Phoenix: ( These things take time. I'd say probably not... ) The police are professionals, Pearls. They'll find her, so don't you worry. And if we can win a not guilty verdict tomorrow... then everything will be OK.

text.Pearl: Y-You're right... ...

CHOICE.Phoenix: So the real person who killed Mr. Corrida was...

CHOICE.Pearl: That assassin... Mr. Shelly de Killer, right?

CHOICE.Phoenix: And the card Ms. Andrews found at the crime scene seems to be proof of that. But if that's the case, then a new question comes to mind. Who was the one that hired De Killer to begin with? Who is his client ?

CHOICE.Pearl: You mean... Who asked for the murder...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: That person didn't want to dirty their own hands in blood, but whoever this client is, they're still a killer .

CHOICE.Pearl: Who... Who could have hired the assassin? Do you think it was Ms. Andrews...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I wonder... But if she was the client... then why go through the effort to stab the knife into the corpse herself...? )

CHOICE.Pearl: But if Ms. Andrews wasn't the client... Then... No, it can't be...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( ...Matt Engarde himself...? )

CHOICE.Pearl: If Mr. Engarde really did hire the assassin...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Then he is not innocent at all. Far from it, he would be guilty of the crime.

CHOICE.Pearl: B-But it can't be Mr. Engarde, right!? I mean, when we first talked with him...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...Mr. Engarde, I'd like to ask you one more question. Did you kill Mr. Juan Corrida?

CHOICE.Engarde: ... Alright. Just so we're clear, dude, I didn't kill anyone, and that includes Juan Corrida, OK?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I didn't see any Psyche-Locks at that time... Actually... That reminds me... )

CHOICE.Pearl: Did you remember something, Mr. Nick?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah, something Ms. Andrews said at the trial today. She said something interesting.

CHOICE.Pearl: Um... So what is this "interesting thing"?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Oh, that's right. You didn't hear it, did you Pearls?

CHOICE.Andrews: Juan had bet everything on the Jammin' Ninja this year. And if he lost the Grand Prix... He was going to make sure Matt was going down with him . That's what he thought anyway.
It looked like somehow, Juan had in his hands a secret so powerful ... that it would destroy Matt's acting career had it been revealed!

CHOICE.Pearl: Mr. Engarde's "secret"...!? Wh-What is this secret...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: I don't know yet. But for now, let's think about it this way. Mr. Corrida was going to reveal this "secret". That means... Mr. Engarde had plenty of motive to have Mr. Corrida silenced. ... ( Which means we have to meet with Mr. Engarde. There's no way around it now. )

CHOICE.Pearl: I... I believe in your lawyer powers, Mr. Nick. I know you can bring us a miracle.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I'm guessing by "miracle", she means a not guilty verdict... And she wouldn't be wrong either. It will take a miracle to pull this one off. )

CHOICE.Pearl: Why... Why did the kidnapper have to take Mystic Maya...? Why couldn't he have taken me instead!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Stop it, Pearls! Don't say things like that! If that had happened, then Maya would be hurting, I'm sure of it. Just like how you are hurting now, Pearls.

CHOICE.Pearl: Y-You're right...
One more day...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah... If we can bring the trial to its end, she'll be back. Don't worry.

CHOICE.Pearl: I decided I won't cry anymore, Mr. Nick. You're so brave and holding strong for Mystic Maya, so I have to do the same.
If only I had studied harder during my training... I could be a bigger help to you, Mr. Nick.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ah, don't worry about it. Really. Pearls, you're doing a great job...

CHOICE.Pearl: Mr. Nick! Is there a waterfall around here!? I feel that I must be made new under the rushing spring waters!

CHOICE.Pearl: Oh... Thanks anyway...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Something tells me Gumshoe isn't eating them because he genuinely likes them, but... )

CHOICE.Pearl: He's working so hard, all for Mystic Maya's sake... I'm going to get him lots and lots of instant noodles as a thank your present!
Um... Is it really that important to be the Master of all the Stars? So important that you try to find your friends' weaknesses, and then expose them...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: I... I wouldn't know...

text.Phoenix: Yeah. It's past 9:00 PM already. But we still have some things to prepare for tomorrow's trial. ( There's still the matter of this " secret " Mr. Corrida held about Mr. Engarde... And Ms. Andrews' real intentions. These are two things I must know tonight! )

text.Pearl: But aren't visiting hours over at the detention center?

text.Phoenix: Hmm... I'm sure we'll think of something, Pearls. Don't you worry.
Hey! Wait!

text.Oldbag: What is it, whippersnapper!? All I know is nothing that has anything to do with you is ever good! Like just now. I was handed this strange device for who knows what reason. And I was told to use it to search the whole hotel.

text.Phoenix: That's... the bug sweeper, isn't it? ( The one Gumshoe made... )

text.Oldbag: I don't know and frankly, I don't care. But the request came from Edgey-poo, so...

text.Phoenix: Edgeworth...?

text.Oldbag: And he said,

text.Edgeworth: "If you feel angry, direct your anger at that unsophisticated lawyer."

text.Oldbag: So, I'm going to feel free to direct all my anger towards you!

text.Phoenix: ( Ugh... Gee, thanks a bundle, Edgeworth! What a pal you are! )

CHOICE.Phoenix: They haven't cleaned up all the food yet.

CHOICE.Oldbag: Don't you touch it without permission! I brought a lunch box today, so I could pack it.

CHOICE.Pearl: Um... But... Hasn't the food been out for two days already?

CHOICE.Oldbag: When it's in your stomach, it's all the same!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Wow, the digestive powers of an alien are wondrous... )

CHOICE.Pearl: I want to eat a meal with Mystic Maya again...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah, me too...

CHOICE.Pearl: Whenever I watch Mystic Maya eat like she does... It makes me happy about eating, and then I can eat a lot.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Well, then... How about after we wrap up this case, we all go out for a huge twenty-course feast!

CHOICE.Oldbag: My mind's like a steel trap, so I'm going to hold you to that!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I was NOT talking to you! )

CHOICE.Oldbag: This is absolutely top secret, so you had better keep it to yourselves! I heard they found a spy camera hidden in one of the presents!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Hmm, very interesting.

CHOICE.Oldbag: I'm sure it was... you know... It was to catch poor Juan in the middle of a scandalous "meeting" !

CHOICE.Pearl: "Scandalous"...? What's that?

CHOICE.Oldbag: It means... Well, you know, that gossip that's been going around about my dear Juan.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Oh... You mean that thing about Ms. Andrews. ( But I'm sure she must've had some reason for getting close to Mr. Corrida... )

CHOICE.Oldbag: I'll let you in on another secret, young'un. I know who planted that spy camera! It was that obnoxious, puffy-haired photographer girl! The nerve of some people! Spying on people by herself! As if I wouldn't want to see it for myself too!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Wow! The alien actually admitted her true intentions for a change! )

CHOICE.Oldbag: I don't know what you're thinking exactly, but I can bet that it's nothing good!!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( But I didn't say anything... )

CHOICE.Oldbag: So you want to know about Juan and that manager, right? Actually, as I hear it, they were something of a refreshing pair, those two.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Oh?

CHOICE.Oldbag: I tell you, Juan really welcomed that manager with open arms, I heard.

CHOICE.Pearl: That "manager"...? Who are you talking about?

CHOICE.Oldbag: You don't know? That manager woman Juan had. It's a shame she killed herself, though...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Oh, you're talking about Ms. Celeste Inpax... Ms. Andrews' mentor, right?

CHOICE.Oldbag: Yes, yes, that's the one! That Celeste girl. She was supposed to get married , you know.

CHOICE.Phoenix: M-Married? You mean... to Mr. Corrida ?

CHOICE.Oldbag: * sigh * Really, you young kids today don't know anything, do you? That girl Celeste killed herself three days after their marriage announcement!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Three days after their marriage announcement!? What in the...!? )

CHOICE.Pearl: Why would Ms. Inpax want to kill herself!? She was going to get married!

CHOICE.Oldbag: Well, that's because... she was thrown away, you see, by Juan.

CHOICE.Phoenix: What!?

CHOICE.Pearl: B-But... They were going to get married, right? They promised each other, right?

CHOICE.Oldbag: They held a grand announcement session... But... Three days later... Juan suddenly cancelled their marriage.

CHOICE.Phoenix: I-Is that true?

CHOICE.Oldbag: It was in the weekly magazines.

CHOICE.Pearl: B-But why!? Why did he do that!?

CHOICE.Oldbag: That was not in the magazines, unfortunately.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...I see.

CHOICE.Oldbag: That night after Juan called off the wedding, that manager, Celeste, killed herself.

CHOICE.Phoenix: How terrible...

CHOICE.Pearl: I wonder what happened between those two...?

text.Phoenix: On that night, there must've been at least a few hundred people here. Hmm... I guess the police are done with their questioning and investigating. It looks like things here in the lobby have finally calmed down.

CHOICE.Phoenix: A lobby with a grand staircase always feels enormous. When the murder happened, it was abuzz with people running back and forth... But now since things have quieted down, it actually feels more eerie than before.

text.Phoenix: It looks like no one is around...

text.Pearl: Um, what happened to that person with the stuffed teddy face...?

text.Phoenix: ( Oh, she must mean that butler with the stitches in his face. )

text.Pearl: Shoooooe!
Oh, there you are. I guess you're still awake, huh Shoe?
Hee hee, come on, let's play.

text.Phoenix: ( I wonder if that butler, Mr. Doe, is already asleep or not... )

text.Pearl: It doesn't look like Mr. Scruffy Detective is here.

text.Phoenix: Well, he's out there with that camera asking around at all the electronic stores.

text.Pearl: Then, I'll make some salad for him for dinner.

text.Phoenix: ( It looks like Pearls really appreciates what Gumshoe is doing for us... )

text.Pearl: ...Um, Mr. Nick?

text.Phoenix: Hm? Yes?

text.Pearl: Where is the lettuce?

text.Phoenix: ...I don't think I've ever bought lettuce before.

text.Pearl: ... Aww, I guess I have to give up on making a salad, then.

text.Phoenix: ( Guess the lack of lettuce is kind of a problem. )

CHOICE.Pearl: Oh! I'll water it!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ah, it's OK... Gumshoe already gave it more than plenty earlier...

CHOICE.Pearl: ...The watering can... Where are you, Mr. Watering Can...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Pearls gets too wound up if she's not doing something to distract herself... I hope Charley can withstand Typhoon Pearls... )
My desk. Since I don't have time to sit, it's unusually clean...

CHOICE.Pearl: Oh, I'll wipe it some more and make it super shiny! ...The wiping cloth... Where are you, Mr. wiping cloth...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: It's fine. Really. If you wipe it any more, it'll be so shiny I'll be using it as a mirror.

text.Phoenix: Visiting hours ended a few hours ago. Looks like we're not going to get a chance to talk with Mr. Engarde tonight...

text.Pearl: B-But... Isn't what we have to ask very important?

text.Phoenix: ( Yeah, but I don't think that matters to the guard... )

CHOICE.Phoenix: Visiting hours ended hours ago, so what's the camera watching over now?

CHOICE.Pearl: Maybe it's watching the Mr. Policeman who's standing over there.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Somehow, I don't think that's it... )
Visiting hours ended hours ago, so what's he watching over now?

CHOICE.Pearl: Maybe he did something bad and he's standing there as punishment.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Somehow, I don't think that's it... )

text.ACTION: March 22 Police Station Criminal Affairs Dept.

text.Pearl: It feels sort of tense in here, doesn't it Mr. Nick?

text.Phoenix: ( Yeah, it does. I wonder if something happened...? )
Ah, yes sir.

text.Chief: Well, we've finally found just the person we've been looking for. A real decisive witness .

text.Phoenix: A "decisive witness"? You mean for Mr. Engarde's case?

text.Chief: We're taking the witness's statement right now. Gotta hand it to Mr. Edgeworth.

text.Phoenix: ( What's Edgeworth up to now...? )

text.Pearl: Wh-Who is this witness?

text.Chief: I think you know this person quite well, Mr. Lawyer.

text.Pearl: M-Mr. Nick...?

text.Phoenix: ( Between the kidnapper's demand and now this... I can't see any way to win here! )

text.Chief: Oh, yeah... Mr. Edgeworth wanted me to tell you something.

text.Phoenix: He did?

text.Chief: Even though visiting hours are long over at the detention center, he wanted me to grant you special permission, so there you go.

text.Pearl: What!?
text._info: (Changed from [Eh!?] in the original release)

text.Chief: I've already called them so they know. Go on, go talk to your heart's content.

text.Phoenix: Thank you very much.

text.Pearl: This is such good news, Mr. Nick!

text.Phoenix: ( "Go talk to your heart's content"? It sounds like the police are pretty sure they have tomorrow's trial in the bag. )

CHOICE.Phoenix: That must be one of the detectives. He's mumbling something to himself.

CHOICE.Detective: "It seems as though my true face has been revealed... I was an elite businessman who made deals with the entire world! I was the young successor and CEO of a colossal corporate conglomeration! But my real self is that of a regular everyday policeman!"

CHOICE.Phoenix: ... Stop doing image training, and get yourself out there in the field!!
This must be the chief of the detectives here. He's glued to his computer screen.

CHOICE.Chief: Whaaat!? "The real killer in the Corrida murder is an assassin..."!? This must be someone's idea of a joke. I can't believe this garbage!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Have a little more faith in your own subordinates! )

CHOICE.Chief: This mascot here is the "Blue Badger". I made him, you know. I'm finally gonna show him off to the Chief of Police tomorrow.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Wow, that's really something.

CHOICE.Chief: You have no idea how much time and effort I invested into him to get this far... But my hopes for this little guy go far beyond just this precinct, yessiree. I'll get him deployed to every precinct in the nation. Just you wait.

CHOICE.Pearl: I wish you luck, sir.

text.ACTION: After clearing "Something interesting" Talk option in Gatewater Hotel - Corrida's Hotel Room, clearing "Celeste's suicide" Talk option in Gatewater Hotel - Hotel Lobby, and visiting Criminal Affairs Dept.:

text.Phoenix: ( I'm sure they must have transferred Ms. Andrews here by now... So that means that both Mr. Engarde and Ms. Andrews are in this detention center. Now then, whose story do I want to hear? )

CHOICE.Engarde: Dude! It's Mr. Wright! I hope you can get me off the hook tomorrow. I'm counting on you!

CHOICE.Phoenix: I... hope so too... ( Edgeworth just dropped a bombshell on me by saying... that Juan Corrida was killed by an assassin, and that the assassin's client is... ( Changed from [that Juan Corrida was killed by an assassin, and that assassin's client is...] in the original release ) this man... Matt Engarde... )
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [Edgeworth just dropped a bombshell on me and said...] in the original release)

CHOICE.Engarde: What's wrong?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...Mr. Engarde. There is something I must know with one hundred percent certainty.

CHOICE.Engarde: Hmm, you seem kinda different. You're totally not like your usual lawyer dude self.

CHOICE.Phoenix: This guard monitor's the visitor's room. He's sleeping standing up. The night's pretty long, and he probably got tired. Hmm... I hope he doesn't fall over...
Um, about the "press conference"...

CHOICE.Engarde: You mean the one where Juan was gonna dress up as the Nickel Samurai?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah. I heard a little more about it from Ms. Andrews.

CHOICE.Andrews: It looked like somehow, Juan had in his hands a secret so powerful... that it would destroy Matt's acting career had it been revealed!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Could you please fill me in on what this " secret " is? Please?
( I knew this was coming... )

CHOICE.Pearl: Mr. Nick? D-Don't tell me...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Psyche-Locks... )
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [A Psyche-Lock...] in the original release)

CHOICE.Engarde: You said a "secret", right? But I don't have any idea what it is. Do you dude...?
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [You said a 'secret', right? But you don't have any idea what it is, do you dude...?] in the original release)

CHOICE.Phoenix: This is a very important matter! Please! You must tell me! What is this "secret"!?

CHOICE.Engarde: Hmm... Well... Hold on a sec. I'm gonna consult my lawyer, OK?

CHOICE.Phoenix: H-Hello? This is Phoenix Wright.

CHOICE.Engarde: Oh, hey Mr. Lawyer dude. Sorry, but you know dude, you totally don't have any idea. And I really didn't care at all about what Juan was up to, OK?
So, it's like that.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ... ( Looks like I have no choice but to remove those Psyche-Locks... )
Did you know about Mr. Corrida and Ms. Andrews' relationship...?

CHOICE.Engarde: Well, it's all over the tabloids, dude. Ah, but I don't know any of the details, if that's what you mean. Look, how many times do I have to tell you? I don't care what Juan did with his life.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ms. Andrews... She had a purpose in mind when she started seeing Mr. Corrida. Her mentor was Mr. Corrida's manager... and Ms. Andrews was going to get Ms. Celeste Inpax's suicide note from him.

CHOICE.Engarde: Celeste...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Does that jog any memories...?

CHOICE.Engarde: ... Dude, I suddenly just got totally hungry. You up for a pizza? My treat.

CHOICE.Pearl: Um... Mr. Nick? What's a "pea-za"? Is it a kind of pea, like green peas?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Let's go eat one later, OK?

CHOICE.Engarde: ...Argh, I got cut off by the pizza dude at the shop.

CHOICE.Phoenix: That's too bad...

CHOICE.Engarde: Well, how about we get our minds off of this topic and talk about something else, OK?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Mr. Engarde... Are you connected to Ms. Inpax's suicide in some way...? )

CHOICE.Engarde: That Juan... Posing as someone else and trying to hold a press conference...! And the person who set it all up was Adrian, wasn't it?

CHOICE.Phoenix: That's what I heard.

CHOICE.Engarde: Argh... I can't believe... Why would she do such a thing, dude!?
That's a very nice transceiver, dude. I'm kind of an expert in gadgety things...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Why does what he just said give me a sinking feeling? )

CHOICE.Engarde: His signature item was a guitar. Hah! I mean, dude, what kind of ninja carries a guitar!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Um, I'm not someone who would know...

CHOICE.Engarde: Dude, it's such a kid thing to do. I mean, just my opinion and all.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Isn't your show a kid's show too? )

CHOICE.Engarde: He was a bit of a talentless hack when he was alive... But who knew he could play dead so well? Wouldn't you agree?

CHOICE.Phoenix: W-Well, that's because he really IS dead!

CHOICE.Engarde: And quite pitifully indeed, yes?
That Adrian... I never thought she'd go this far to frame me for the crime... I mean, what does she have against me? Dude, I don't get it.

CHOICE.Phoenix: That's something I would like to know too. Do you have any ideas at all? Even the slightest clue?

CHOICE.Engarde: Huh!? What!? Me!? D-Don't be silly, Mr. Lawyer dude! How am I supposed to know something like that?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...Mr. Engarde?

CHOICE.Engarde: Dude, I know I asked you to be my lawyer and all... But I don't think I have to tell you anything and everything.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Um... What do you mean by that?

CHOICE.Engarde: It just means I don't have to tell you anything and everything, dude.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Um, about this...

CHOICE.Pearl: M-Mr. Nick! You can't!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Huh?

CHOICE.Pearl: Ms. Andrews said she doesn't want anyone to know about that, remember?

CHOICE.Engarde: What's that?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Oh, this? Um... Nothing. It's nothing, really.
( ... I'm kind of scared to show him this card... )

CHOICE.Engarde: What's wrong, dude?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Oh, um... So about this picture card... Have you ever seen this before?

CHOICE.Engarde: ...? Nope, never saw it before in my life, dude.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I don't think he's lying... Or is he...? Then again, he looked like he gasped just now... Maybe I'm seeing things...? )

CHOICE.Engarde: It's true we debuted at the same time... so that's why people were always comparing us. But I totally didn't care what people were saying because he wasn't even close, dude. I mean, I won every contest we ever had, hands down!
I don't get it... Why would she want to frame me...? I mean, I've never done anything to her, dude...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Mr. Engarde sounds pretty sincere and he seems trustworthy... So I have to find out what Ms. Andrews' real intentions are! )
About this person...

CHOICE.Pearl: He is your butler, Mr. Doe, right? We met him at your mansion.

CHOICE.Engarde: Oh... Yes, that's right. He's a pretty cool dude who can do lots of things. He takes real good care of me.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Could you please take a look at this...? I know it may not seem important to you...

CHOICE.Engarde: Well, if it's not important, then I'd rather be in bed. If I don't get my 12 hours of beauty sleep, my skin's gonna wrinkle up like a prune, dude.

CHOICE.Pearl: You know, he's right Mr. Nick. Your skin's kind of drying up here and there.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I swear... After this case is over, I'm going to get lots and lots of sleep... )

CHOICE.Andrews: ..Oh, it's you.

CHOICE.Phoenix: I'm sorry to be visiting at such a late hour. But there are a few questions I absolutely have to ask you tonight.

CHOICE.Andrews: Me? I thought your client was Matt.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I'm sure Ms. Andrews knows something... She can't be clueless about this "secret" Mr. Corrida had on Mr. Engarde... )
I'd like to ask you about Matt Engarde, if you don't mind...

CHOICE.Andrews: Mr. Wright... You still don't know, do you? The real him, I mean...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ... You seem to bear a lot of resentment towards Mr. Engarde. If that's the case, then why did you become his manager? And why would you become intimate with his rival?

CHOICE.Andrews: ... That... has nothing to do with this case. Nothing.

CHOICE.Phoenix: About Ms. Celeste Inpax...

CHOICE.Andrews: I had finally put her death behind me... And now, thanks to you, it's all come back to the surface.

CHOICE.Phoenix: I... I'm sorry.

CHOICE.Andrews: Yes, I was shocked by her suicide. And it's true that when I heard the rumor that Juan was the one who had hidden her suicide note, I began to draw close to him. I wanted to get her suicide note back... and to burn it.

CHOICE.Phoenix: You wanted to " burn it "? But why?

CHOICE.Andrews: I didn't want it to spread like just another piece of gossip. But... I never held any murderous intent towards Juan. I would never do something so stupid.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( The suicide note, huh...? I wonder what it said? )
Why did you try to frame Mr. Engarde?

CHOICE.Andrews: That's simple. Because he's the killer, that's why. Isn't it the duty of every good citizen to inform the police?

CHOICE.Pearl: B-But... there had to be another way.

CHOICE.Phoenix: The police are excellent at doing their job, so they'd figure it out, right?

CHOICE.Andrews: Yes, they're so good that they couldn't figure out the real truth behind Celeste's death.

CHOICE.Pearl: Ms. Andrews...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Well, um, I know you're not the type of person to do something without a reason, so please, tell me why you did what you did...

CHOICE.Andrews: ...Revenge.

CHOICE.Pearl: Huh...? Did you say something just now...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( A Psyche-Lock, huh... )

CHOICE.Andrews: Don't you understand yet? You're not my lawyer. To be honest, you're more like my enemy.

CHOICE.Pearl: But...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I'm sure I just heard Ms. Andrews say, " Revenge ". )
Why did you frame Mr. Engarde...?

CHOICE.Andrews: Hmm, I wonder why...? I don't really know myself. When I realized what I was doing, I had already stabbed the knife into the body.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I'm almost sure that just now... Ms. Andrews muttered, " Revenge " to herself. )

CHOICE.Andrews: I was the one who organized the whole press conference. Juan wanted to deal the most damage possible to Matt's career. And that's why he was killed. It's quite simply a story of cause and effect, yes?
It appears to me that rumor was started by Juan himself.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Mr. Corrida...? But...

CHOICE.Andrews: I'm Matt's manager, remember. I think he wanted to embarrass Matt through his relationship with me.

CHOICE.Pearl: But... But didn't Mr. Corrida like you...!?

CHOICE.Andrews: There weren't any feelings of love between us. For me, it was about getting Celeste's suicide note... For him, it was about wounding Matt's pride. That's all it was.

CHOICE.Pearl: That's... That's...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Poor Pearls is in shock. She sees just how cruel the world can really be. )
So there was a Nickel Samurai costume inside of this case, correct?

CHOICE.Andrews: Yes, there was. I even personally carried it here from the studio. I always thought it was such a childish thing to dress up and wear a costume like that, but I never thought that I would wind up using it myself that night.
When I was pouring that glass of juice... I honestly had no idea that Juan was dead...

CHOICE.Pearl: I see...

CHOICE.Andrews: I really am a terrible woman, aren't I? One moment, I'm thinking of looking after him, and the next, I'm stabbing him in the chest with a knife.

CHOICE.Phoenix: About this photo...

CHOICE.Andrews: The person who stabbed the body and opened the guitar case was me.

CHOICE.Phoenix: And that was so you could get the Nickel Samurai's costume out so you could wear it...?

CHOICE.Andrews: I thought I had executed that part quite well. But you showed me differently. You are a formidable lawyer, Mr. Wright.
You know... There was only one thought running through my head at that time. "With this, I can finally expose Matt's true nature to the world."

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( His "true nature"...? I wonder why she's saying that, but not telling me what his true nature is? If it were me, I think I'd be happy to finally get that kind of thing off my chest. )

CHOICE.Andrews: I don't care what the reason was... It's unforgivable that he hid Celeste's suicide note.

CHOICE.Phoenix: But you don't have any proof that she left a suicide note behind, right?

CHOICE.Andrews: Celeste... She always believed there was a right way and a wrong way to do anything. She would have left a note. I... I wholly believe that.
S-Stop it! I don't want to remember the hopelessness and the despair I felt back then!

CHOICE.Pearl: Hurry up and put that away, Mr. Nick!

CHOICE.Phoenix: I-I'm so sorry!

CHOICE.Andrews: It was near Juan's dead body. I... I noticed it when I went to fill the glass. And then when I realized that Juan was dead... I completely panicked. That's when I must have unconsciously picked this card up and put it into my pocket. As for why...? I simply don't know.
That's Mr. Will Powers. He's an actor contracted with Global Studios. He's a very nice man. A man with a good heart. ...But that's all he is and ever will be.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Urk... What a horrible thing to say... )

CHOICE.Andrews: ...Society doesn't care about genuinely nice people, Mr. Wright.
He is a very prideful man... Or rather, was. He absolutely had to compete with Matt in everything, no matter what it was. He really was such an idiot.

CHOICE.Pearl: Ms. Andrews...?

CHOICE.Andrews: Well, I guess maybe all stars are like that. Never giving any thought to other people's feelings.

CHOICE.Pearl: Ms. Andrews...?

CHOICE.Andrews: That things have come to this... I have nothing left to say about that man. Not one word.
I hate talking about myself. It's a trifling matter, that's why.

CHOICE.Phoenix: S-Sorry...

CHOICE.Andrews: Celeste... was my mentor. She was a strong woman... She wouldn't kill herself over any old trifling matter...

CHOICE.Pearl: S-So... You have some ideas of why she killed herself...?

CHOICE.Andrews: Yes, I suppose...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Um, I'd like to ask you about this...

CHOICE.Andrews: I told you. I hate trifling matters. It's a waste of time to show me things that are of no relevance to me.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Wow... This is the first time I've been shut down this badly... )

text.Phoenix: ( Now then, whose story do I want to hear? )

text.ACTION: After clearing "Something interesting" Talk option in Gatewater Hotel - Corrida's Hotel Room, clearing "Celeste's suicide" Talk option in Gatewater Hotel - Hotel Lobby, and visiting Criminal Affairs Dept.:
March 22 Police Station Criminal Affairs Dept.

text.???: Oh! Mr. Wright! Please, you have to help me!

text.Phoenix: ( Uh oh... ) M-Mr. Powers!

text.Pearl: What happened? Why are you here?

text.Will: I-I... Uh, you see, I got roped into this somehow...

text.Pearl: What??

text.Will: And now I'm going to testify at tomorrow's trial.

text.Phoenix: ( So the decisive witness ... is Mr. Powers? )

text.Will: I was talking with a detective until a little while ago, and I was on my way home... When all of a sudden, "You there! You're under arrest!" And I was brought back here.

text.Phoenix: O-Oh.

text.Will: They said my face and whole self in general looked "suspicious" or something.

text.Phoenix: ( Hmm... Well, I guess I can see how they thought you looked suspicious... )

text.Will: * sigh * I'm just a normal guy on an exercise show for kids... Is that a crime??

CHOICE.Phoenix: That must be one of the detectives. He's mumbling something to himself.

CHOICE.Detective: "...I... I'm sorry, everyone. I've lied to you all... I... I'm not a detective. I'm really... I'm really... I'm really Global Hero Onyankopon!"

CHOICE.Phoenix: ... I think he's lost his grip on what's real and what isn't...
So, about this "testimony" you're giving. What are you going to talk about?

CHOICE.Will: Ah, I really don't know yet... But it sounds like I saw something pretty important from what they tell me.

CHOICE.Phoenix: You saw something important? What was it?

CHOICE.Will: Ah, well, the detective told me not to talk about it. "You can't tell anyone, and especially not that lawyer," he said.

CHOICE.Pearl: Who do you think is "that lawyer" the detective was talking about...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: I'm going to take a wild guess and say it's me.

CHOICE.Will: ...Y-Yeah, you got it.

CHOICE.Pearl: Mr. Nick! Mystic Maya and myself are your only two allies in this whole world, but it's alright!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Ouch... I don't really have a lot of friends, do I...? )

CHOICE.Will: This is going to do a lot of damage to Matt, you know. Because he's got that "refreshing like a spring breeze" image going.

CHOICE.Phoenix: But what is he really like?

CHOICE.Will: Well, let's see. Matt's always been kind of a "player" with women... He would never really turn a pretty face away, if you know what I mean... He'd always say, "It's just a game" to justify himself.

CHOICE.Pearl: What!? H-How horrible! That's unforgivable!

CHOICE.Will: Oww. S-Sorry. Didn't mean to offend you. But you know, he said once that, "There's only one person in the world who won't swoon over me."

CHOICE.Phoenix: One person who wouldn't swoon over him?

CHOICE.Will: His manager, you know. Ms. Adrian Andrews.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Why is Mr. Powers suddenly looking kind of... energetic? )

CHOICE.Will: Ah, you see, I'm actually a sucker for gossip. I mean, celebrities and their world have this dazzling sort of image, right?

CHOICE.Phoenix: A dazzling sort of image? But aren't you a part of that dazzle, Mr. Powers?

CHOICE.Will: No, I'm more of a hairy, sweaty, smelly, brutish kind of guy, you see. But it's OK, really. I get to hear plenty of gossip about a lot of the other stars around me as things happen.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Well, that's true.

CHOICE.Will: Oh, hey! So did you hear about this yet? About Ms. Andrews' mentor and her suicide...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: You mean Ms. Inpax?

CHOICE.Pearl: We heard something about how her wedding was cancelled...

CHOICE.Will: Yeah, that's what I'm talking about! I thought about it a little the other day! About that mysterious death! Hey, Mr. Wright! Why don't you ask me about that!? Go on, go ahead!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Mr. Powers is so charged up his skin is practically glowing with electricity... )

CHOICE.Will: Hey, so have you heard this? Celeste left a suicide note! And they say that Juan went and hid it...

CHOICE.Phoenix: We heard about that in court today. ( But there wasn't any actual proof that she had left a note... )

CHOICE.Will: Well, this is what I think. I think that something bad was written on that note. Something bad for Juan, that is.

CHOICE.Pearl: Something bad for Mr. Corrida?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Why do you figure so?

CHOICE.Will: Well, before she died, Celeste talked with a few of her friends. And she said, "It looks like I got caught up with a truly insidious man..."
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [And she said, 'It looks like I may have been caught by an insidious man...'] in the original release)

CHOICE.Phoenix: A "truly insidious man"...? Did she mean Mr. Corrida by that?
CHOICE._info: (Changed from [An 'insidious man'...? Did she mean Mr. Corrida by that?] in the original release)

CHOICE.Will: Well, there's no one else that fits the bill, right? And that would be reason enough for him to hide the suicide note!

CHOICE.Phoenix: I see... Well, that's some good info. Thank you.

CHOICE.Will: Y-You're welcome!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Mr. Engarde and Ms. Andrews; they're both at the detention center right now. There are still things I don't understand or know about, I'm sure... I have to get the two of them to tell me everything! )

CHOICE.Will: Um... That kidnapper... Has he said anything since then...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Well... He tried, but there was a lot of interference.

CHOICE.Will: I see...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( That radio interference... Who would've thought it was caused by a spy camera? )

CHOICE.Will: Hey! That article! Is that from "Gossip Land"?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Y-Yeah, I guess so.

CHOICE.Will: Ah, you too? I absolutely love this magazine!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Um... "You too"...?

CHOICE.Will: Oh, they wrote a little something about me once! "Steel Samurai's Midnight Dine and Dash".

CHOICE.Pearl: Dine and dash...?

CHOICE.Will: I bought ten copies of that issue, you know.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Do you think we could somehow get back to THIS article...? )

CHOICE.Will: The Jammin' Ninja made me want a bright red guitar, you know. I wanted to be cool like him, so I went out and bought one.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Oh... That's nice...

CHOICE.Will: Ah, but you don't understand. I can't get a single sound to come out of it. Because I sort of tripped on it and crushed it... the day after I bought it.
I can't believe Ms. Andrews tried to frame Matt... Those two have such a strange relationship with each other, don't they?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Looks like Mr. Powers is just as in the dark about things as I am. I guess I don't have a choice other than to go talk to the two of them myself. )

CHOICE.Will: Hey, that's Ms. Andrews! She's Matt's manager. Actually, I was interested in her for a little bit. Just a little...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Hmm... So Mr. Powers likes this type of woman... ) What do you know about Ms. Andrews...?

CHOICE.Will: Well, see... Here's the thing. I don't really KNOW her know her... you know? Ah! If you're interested, I can give you a little bit of the details!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( He's so happy, he looks like a lion that's just found his next meal... )

CHOICE.Will: Well, there's no one left around who knows the details, you know. Only rumors are left now.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ah, it's OK. You don't have to apologize so much.

CHOICE.Will: S-Sorry.

text.ACTION: After breaking Matt Enguarde's Psyche-Locks, then clearing all Talk options:

text.Engarde: What's wrong, Mister Lawyer? You've grown awfully quiet...

text.Phoenix: H-How could I have been so deceived by you all this time? When we first met, I asked if you had killed Juan Corrida... And you answered very clearly that you hadn't killed anyone.

text.Engarde: Hey now. I never told you any lies. The person who did the killing was that De Killer guy, right? All I'm guilty of is taking a catnap in my room.

text.Phoenix: You... You... You killed Mr. Corrida!

text.Engarde: Hahaha. I dare you to say that in court tomorrow.

text.Phoenix: Grr...

text.Engarde: Aww, but too bad. You can't. You're my lawyer, after all. Aren't you?
You could always drop my case and refuse to represent me. How does that sound? Aww, but you can't, can you? That would be the one thing you absolutely can't do.

text.Pearl: M-Mystic Maya...!

text.Engarde: You wouldn't want to test De Killer. He's a man of his word, or so I hear. You could end up getting a certain friend of yours rubbed out if you lose.

text.Phoenix: ...Y...You... scoundrel...

text.Engarde: So if I were you, Mr. Wright, esquire, I think I would give it my all tomorrow. Remember, everyone likes a happy win-win resolution.

text.Phoenix: I... I'll get you for this!

text.Engarde: That's such a clich√© phrase. Juan said something just like that, if memory serves. Of course... Well, we all know how well things turned out for him, don't we? Good night, Mister Lawyer.

text.Phoenix: ( Maya... Maya, what am I supposed to do!? )

text.???: ... And now... Now you've finally found it.

text.Edgeworth: The starting line of this case.

text.Phoenix: Edgeworth...

text.Edgeworth: I don't care for the horrid atmosphere here. Let's return to the precinct.

text.ACTION: March 22 Police Station Criminal Affairs Dept.

text.Edgeworth: Well, Wright? What are you going to do? If you plan on changing your defense...

text.Pearl: N...No! We can't do that...

text.Edgeworth: That's right... He's holding Maya hostage...

text.Phoenix: ... What... What should I do...?

text.Edgeworth: ... That's not something I can answer for you.

text.Pearl: M-Mr. Edgeworth...

text.Edgeworth: Wright... Only you can decide where to go from here. One year ago... At that time, I didn't truly understand what a " prosecutor " was. And that is why... I had to leave the Prosecutor's Office. I felt that I couldn't stand in a court of law until I knew what a prosecutor really was. And now, Wright... It's your turn.

text.Phoenix: My... turn?

text.Edgeworth: What is this thing called a " lawyer "? What can you do as one? You must find the answer... And you must find it on your own.

CHOICE.Phoenix: I'm a lawyer... But to fight for someone who is clearly a killer... Matt Engarde ... That man is really... Argh!

CHOICE.Edgeworth: It doesn't matter who, every person deserves a proper defense and a fair trial . Isn't that the basis of our judicial system?

CHOICE.Phoenix: " Proper defense "? But what exactly is that? Is it where a lawyer forcibly and blindly gets an acquittal through shouting and trickery?

CHOICE.Edgeworth: ... * sigh * Ironic that you of all people should say such a thing. Isn't that exactly how you have fought for your clients up until now?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Uh... W-Well, that may be true, but... But that's... That's because I've believed my clients to be innocent from the bottom of my heart! But if I were to get Engarde an acquittal... That... That isn't a proper defense at all!
I became a lawyer because I thought... I thought I could save people who were suffering and in pain...
But... When I look at this mess we're in... I can't even protect the person closest to me. Even if I win the case, I still lose in the end... I just don't know what to do!

CHOICE.Edgeworth: ... Wright. Would you get a hold of yourself? You have it all wrong.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Huh?

CHOICE.Edgeworth: We aren't some sort of heroes. We're only human, you and I. You want to "save someone"? That's something easier said than done, wouldn't you say?

CHOICE.Pearl: Th-That's...

CHOICE.Edgeworth: You are a defense lawyer. You can't run away from that. You can only fight. That's all you can do.

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "People like you and Franziska von Karma are always using all you have to pin me down."

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Now's not the time to talk about evidence... )

text.Phoenix: People like you and Franziska von Karma are always using all you have to pin me down. You fight to the very end, even when you know the truth is not with you. But I'm not like you. I can't fight for a false verdict -- for a man I clearly know to be guilty!

text.Edgeworth: ... Franziska... She fights for herself. The only thing she fights for is her perfect win record. That's all.

text.Phoenix: And!? Isn't that the same as you!? Isn't that why you ran away a year ago? Because your precious win record was destroyed!? You are so petty!

text.Edgeworth: ... I see... Now I understand why you despise me so. However, you are mistaken.

text.Phoenix: What do you...?

text.Edgeworth: Thanks to you, when you sealed off my path to a perfect win record... I began to realize the error of my ways. I realized that things such as a perfect record were meaningless.

text.Pearl: What!?
text._info: (Changed from [Eh!?] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: I don't believe you. Are you saying that is why you left the Prosecutor's Office? But then, why? Why are you here now?

text.Edgeworth: The answer to that... is something you will find out on your own. I have faith you will see it before the verdict is read tomorrow. But if you can't, then you will be powerless to change the ending of this story.

text.Pearl: M-Mr. Nick! The transceiver!

text.???: I'm sorry for what happened earlier. Well then, Mr. Attorney. Do you wager you can obtain an acquittal tomorrow?
My, my. What is the matter, Mr. Attorney? I don't sense your usual anger this time.

text.Phoenix: ...Tell me. Please. Why are you holding Maya hostage for Mr. Engarde's sake? Why are you... Why are you doing this for that cold-blooded killer!?

text.Edgeworth: Wright...

text.???: ... Please don't misunderstand things. He is my client.

text.Phoenix: Don't toy with me! A man who hires an assassin is just as much of a killer himself!

text.???: ... ...I believe you were asking me for a reason as to why I am doing what I am...

text.Phoenix: ...Y-Yeah.

text.???: This is what I like to call my " aftercare ".

text.Phoenix: Wh-What the heck is "aftercare"?

text.???: My name carries a certain amount of honor and dignity, Mr. Attorney. I take great care to insure that no suspicion falls upon my clients for my handiwork. That is what is called " client relations " and it is a part of an assassin's duty.

text.Phoenix: An assassin's... "duty"...?

text.???: We were unlucky this time and my client was arrested as a suspect. As a result, I did what I had to do to enlist your expert help, Mr. Attorney. And to ensure that you would do everything in your power to the very end.

text.Phoenix: Wh-What is your name!?

text.???: I believe I told you once before, however...

text.Phoenix: You did... But...

text.???: My name is... De Killer . Shelly de Killer.

text.Edgeworth: Y-You're Shelly de Killer!?

text.de Killer: Please keep in mind you do not have much space to maneuver with me. As a De Killer, I always finish what I set out to do. If you fail to keep up your end of the bargain...

text.Phoenix: M-Maya!

text.de Killer: It would be my duty as an assassin to see to it she receives a nice long nap.

text.Pearl: Aaaaaaaaaaah! Noooooooooooo!

text.de Killer: Now then, if you'll excuse me. If someone were to trace this signal back to me, it would be quite troublesome.

text.Pearl: Mystic Maya! Mystic Mayaaaaa!

text.Edgeworth: I... I don't know what to say...

text.Phoenix: ...Edgeworth!

text.Edgeworth: Hm?

text.Phoenix: Did you hear that? At the end of that transmission...

text.Edgeworth: Huh? Oh, that... It sounded like a cat.

text.Pearl: ...A cat?

text.Phoenix: ( It can't be... that cat... Can it...? )

text.Pearl: What is it...?

text.Phoenix: I think... I know where Shelly de Killer is holding Maya hostage! Edgeworth! Have all police units head for Engarde Mansion immediately!

text.Edgeworth: ...! Alright. You hurry over as well, then!

text.Phoenix: Don't lose hope yet, Pearls! The fight has only just begun!

text.Pearl: Y-Yeah!

text.Phoenix: ( Now then, whose story do I want to hear? )

CHOICE.Jailer: I'm really sorry, but... Matt Engarde is refusing to meet with you.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...I see.
( Well, I guess I don't really have anything left to talk to him about anyway... )

CHOICE.Pearl: Shall we listen to what Ms. Andrews has to say...?

text.Phoenix: Maya!

text.Pearl: Please answer us! Mystic Mayaaaa!

text.Edgeworth: We have this area completely surrounded. There is no way for him to escape. Assuming he's still in the area...

text.Phoenix: I can't believe it... That butler... All this time, he was De Killer...

text.Edgeworth: He and Engarde were working together all this time. I'm sure they had worked out a contingency plan ahead of time.

CHOICE.Phoenix: This is the first time I've seen such a large fireplace.

CHOICE.Edgeworth: I don't particularly care for large fireplaces. They remind me of my youth.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I wonder, if memory serves, if it's because of that rich aunt he had? ) Don't tell me you're still stuck on that incident...?

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Don't take this personally, but I really do not wish to remember anything from that time in my life.
It seems that Engarde was quite famous, even as a motorcycle racer.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Generally when a star like him tries to do something like that, they fail, but...

CHOICE.Edgeworth: It seems Engarde is no ordinary man.
That Engarde... This is probably where he conducted business with De Killer.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah...

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Shelly de Killer values his client relations more than anything else. So I'm sure he must meet with his clients in person to talk about any transactions.
It's Engarde's personal collection. I'd say it's a hobby of his to collect prop masks of shows related to his own.

CHOICE.Phoenix: You seem to know all sorts of details about Matt Engarde... Almost too many details...

CHOICE.Edgeworth: He's the defendant in this case. Of course I would know about him.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Y-Yeah... I guess that makes sense...
It looks like there's another room in the back.

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Leave that to us. I'm sure the investigation team is already doing its job in there.

CHOICE.Pearl: There's a small door at the bottom of this bigger door, Mr. Nick.

CHOICE.Phoenix: I bet it's for the cat to use.

CHOICE.Pearl: Oh, you mean Shoe.

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "Oh, it's a figurine of a bear!"

text.Pearl: Oh, it's a figurine of a bear! But there are a lot of cuts in it for some reason...

text.Phoenix: A bear...? Isn't that more of a thing for Mr. Corrida? Why would something like this be here...?

text.Edgeworth: Wright, look down. There's a little pet door installed here.

text.Pearl: Ah, I'm sure that's for Shoe...

text.Phoenix: Do you think that this... came through that little door...?

text.Edgeworth: Umph! This door... It's locked!

text.Phoenix: Well, I'm pretty used to breaking doors down by now. Let's go, Edgeworth!
Argh! There's no one here!

text.Edgeworth: From the looks of this room, I would say this is Engarde's private lounge. ...Look at this, Wright!

text.Phoenix: An antennae for sending and receiving radio signals and a VCR ... Check inside the deck! If there's a tape, it would be an important piece of evidence! ( If we're lucky, it'll have the moment the crime was committed recorded on it! )

text.Edgeworth: ... I'm sorry, but... The tape deck is empty. There's no tape to be found.

text.Pearl: No...

text.Edgeworth: But there's no mistake that someone used this to record something. It looks like someone took the tape we're looking for, and escaped with it...

CHOICE.Phoenix: A huge television and speakers loom largely here. I'm sure if Maya saw this, she'd say,

CHOICE.Maya: "I would die a happy Samurai fan if I could see the Nickel Samurai on a TV like this!"

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yeah, that's what she'd say... ... Ack! I can't believe I just made a joke about Maya, all things considered...
It's a VCR and an antennae. The footage that the spy camera took at the scene of the crime... was beamed here and recorded on tape.

CHOICE.Pearl: If only we had that tape, it would have been really helpful...

CHOICE.Phoenix: It's Engarde's computer. Maya... Why couldn't you have used this to get help?

CHOICE.Pearl: M-Mr. Nick! Where's... Where's the power switch!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ... ( Oh, I get it... So that's what happened. She couldn't find the power switch... )
It's a very small table. I bet we could barely squeeze 3 Pearls on there.

CHOICE.Pearl: But I wouldn't sit on a table to begin with, Mr. Nick...

CHOICE.Phoenix: What a spacious sofa. I bet 10 Pearls would fit on here.

CHOICE.Pearl: Um, I don't think 10 of me would fit, Mr. Nick...

CHOICE.Phoenix: I can't read all the labels, but this is a very large collection of video tapes. Looks like Engarde taped all of his own shows...

CHOICE.Pearl: There's a little door for Shoe in this big door.

CHOICE.Phoenix: I'm sure Maya used this door to shove this out there... I'm sure it was her! ( Every time you give me some piece of evidence, it's always the most crucial piece. This time too, I'm sure... )

text.Phoenix: ... ( We've searched all over, but it looks like he got away... )

text.Edgeworth: I'm sorry. It looks like he slipped out of our grasp this time.

text.Phoenix: And now... we've lost our only lead.

text.Edgeworth: Don't give up yet. That little girl is looking to you to be her pillar.

text.Phoenix: ...Yeah, you're right.

text.Edgeworth: We're close, I can tell. We've already set up checkpoints along every route leading out of this district. Leave the rest to us.

text.Phoenix: ( Maya... )

CHOICE.Pearl: Wow... I've never seen so many bottles all in one place before.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Well, I guess when you're a star, you have so much money you can buy anything you want.
The light doesn't filter in all the way, so it's hard to see. It looks like there are crates and cardboard boxes tied up with wire here.

CHOICE.Pearl: It's a pretty heavy door, isn't it? I can't open it by myself. Please don't shut me in here by accident, OK Mr. Nick?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( If I were locked in a place like this... I'd be plenty scared too. Trust me. )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "This looks like a picture of Ms. Inpax..."

text.Phoenix: This looks like a picture of Ms. Inpax... ( "With love... Celeste" )

text.Pearl: Ms. Inpax? You mean...?

text.Phoenix: Yes, Mr. Corrida's former manager.

text.Pearl: Why would a picture of Ms. Inpax be here in Mr. Engarde's mansion?

text.Phoenix: ( And why does it say, "With love"...? Hmm, this might be a clue... )

text.Pearl: Ah!

text.Phoenix: What's wrong, Pearls?

text.Pearl: P-Please let me see that picture frame!

text.Phoenix: ( Huh? What's so special about the frame? )

text.Pearl: On the back... There's something written on the back of the frame! ..." Maya " It's Mystic Maya! She left us a message!

text.Phoenix: Wh-What!?

text.Maya: I thought you'd come. I knew you would. Now listen up! You'd better get Engarde a guilty sentence, OK!? If you get that creepy slimebag a not guilty, I'll never forgive you, ever! I'm fine, so you don't need to worry. ...There's so much I want to write, but I don't think I have a lot of time left. Pearly, you're there too, right? Make sure you help Nick, OK? Someone's gotta watch out for the helpless lunk. ... Um... That's it for now, Nick. I guess I'll talk to you guys later.

text.Pearl: ...That's... I... Nooooooooo! Mystic Mayaaaaaaa... * sob *

text.Edgeworth: Wright!
What's wrong? Why the blank stare?

text.Phoenix: Oh, um, nothing.

text.Edgeworth: We've searched the house, and this is the last room. It looks like he eluded us.

text.Phoenix: ...Edgeworth.

text.Edgeworth: Yes?

text.Phoenix: As far as clues go, I think this is about all I'm going to get.
But I'm still short one last thing...

text.Edgeworth: And what is that?

text.Phoenix: ( Ms. Andrews' Psyche-Lock... If I could just find out what secret she's holding... Then I think I stand a chance in court tomorrow... To blow this case wide open and expose the truth. )

text.Edgeworth: I think I know what you're thinking. I'll contact the detention center.

text.Phoenix: Um... Thanks, Edgeworth. Well, let's go Pearls. It's time to open that last lock.

text.Andrews: Good evening, Mr. Wright. ... What's wrong? You look ill...

text.Phoenix: Ms. Andrews. I have come to remove your Psyche-Lock.

text.Andrews: Psyche-Lock...?

text.Phoenix: I want to know, and you will tell me... ...your secret.

text.Andrews: Fine, go ahead. Try to break me, if you can.

CHOICE.Andrews: Celeste... She was supposed to get married to Juan.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Yes... But I heard that it didn't work out.

CHOICE.Pearl: Because Mr. Corrida didn't want to get married to her anymore, right...?

CHOICE.Andrews: Yes... Because of Matt .

CHOICE.Pearl: B-Because of Mr. Engarde? What do you mean?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I think I can see where this is going. )

CHOICE.Andrews: Celeste... She was Matt's manager a long time ago. She was the happiest woman in the world at that time. I was working part-time back then, and I often saw the two of them together.

CHOICE.Phoenix: So that's why... "With love... Celeste" is written on the frame of that picture.

CHOICE.Pearl: They were a couple, weren't they?

CHOICE.Andrews: It wasn't anything as splendid as that. Celeste was being used; toyed with until she was... thrown away.

CHOICE.Pearl: That's so horrible...

CHOICE.Andrews: Matt's entire image is built around how nice and wonderful of a man he is. A scandal would have destroyed that. Which is why Celeste, in her kindness, moved over to Worldwide Studios. And that is where she met Juan. She seemed really happy with him; even happier than when she was with Matt. Celeste and Juan were such a good match that they were even planning to get married. And then it was suddenly called off. On the night Juan called their marriage off, Celeste... She killed herself. And that's why I framed Matt. It was revenge for Celeste and for myself.

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "I'm sure even you can guess why Juan called the wedding off, right?"

CHOICE.Andrews: I've already told you countless times. It's because I thought Matt was the killer.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( No, that's not it! I know you have a personal reason to dislike Mr. Engarde. ) Ms. Andrews. You may think I didn't hear it, but I know you said something earlier. You said, " Revenge ."

CHOICE.Andrews: So you are saying I was taking my revenge out on Matt, and that's why? Wh-What an absurd idea. I... I don't have anything I want to take revenge for.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Ms. Andrews... A woman who lives by being dependent on other people... ) ( There is something or someone in her past that would make her take revenge ... )

text.Andrews: I'm sure even you can guess why Juan called the wedding off, right? Matt "confessed" to Juan... about his relationship with Celeste.

text.Phoenix: I see... So that's what happened.

text.Pearl: But... Then why did Mr. Corrida have to call off the wedding!? I don't understand at all...

text.Andrews: It was probably because of his worthless male pride. Juan and Matt were always fierce rivals. Matt waited for the wedding announcement and then unleashed the truth on Juan. He was aiming for when it would hurt Juan the most.

text.Pearl: Poor Ms. Inpax!

text.Andrews: ...That wasn't the end of it. That day, I'm almost certain that Celeste left a suicide note behind. And in that note, she left a detailed account of Matt's various misdeeds, and... So that she would never again be hurt by Matt, she chose... to die. Then, when Juan discovered her body, he hid her note.

text.Pearl: B-But why would he do that!?

text.Andrews: It's simple. Juan realized that note was a powerful weapon against Matt. And it would be especially damaging to his "refreshing like a spring breeze" image. In any case... With his pride hurt, Juan sought revenge.

text.Phoenix: Revenge... There's that word again.

text.Andrews: Juan wanted to publicly disclose the contents of that suicide note. At a time that would cause Matt the most damage, of course.

text.Phoenix: And that was at the press conference after the stage show...

text.Andrews: I know all about it, because I heard it all from Juan. It was so I could find out about all this that I drew close to Juan to begin with. They're quite a pair of hideous monsters, aren't they? Even Celeste's death was something for them to use in their game. That night, when I found Juan's body, it was only natural that I thought the murderer was Matt. Those two were always spying on one another, after all. As for me, I was frantically searching for Celeste's suicide note. I wanted to destroy it before it ever went public. I was going to burn it. I had even brought a lighter. But... I couldn't find the suicide note... And that's when revenge crossed my mind. Yes, I was going to bring to them my own kind of cruel revenge. Celeste was killed by those two monsters. So when I stabbed Juan's body with that knife... I didn't feel a single shred of guilt.
... And that's all I have to say.
Well, Mr. Wright? Even knowing all this, are you still going to help that... "man"?

text.Phoenix: ... I... I'm a lawyer...

text.Andrews: I see. What a foul profession.

text.Phoenix: ... Thank you very much for your time and for talking with me.

text.Andrews: It was no big deal. I couldn't sleep anyway.

text.Phoenix: ( I can't sleep either... Not with Maya's situation... or with what I know now... )
... * huff * ... * huff * ... Grr!! How did I get into this mess...?

text.ACTION: That's far enough! You can't run forever, Mr. Phoenix Wright!

text.Phoenix: Wha...!? What have I done wrong!?

text.ACTION: I cannot allow you to go on like this!

text.Phoenix: ...? B-But I'm just a simple defense attorney!

text.ACTION: Silence! You are no longer worthy of your title.
March 23, 9:43 AM District Court Defendant Lobby No. 3

text.Phoenix: Hello, this is Phoenix Wright.

text.Engarde: You don't look so well, dude. You're gonna prove me not guilty today, right?
Hahaha... If you please, Mister Lawyer. Remember, it's not just me. Your precious friend's life is riding on today's verdict too.

text.Phoenix: Grr...!

text.Maya: Now listen up! You'd better get Engarde a guilty sentence, OK!? If you get that creepy slimebag a not guilty, I'll never forgive you, ever!

text.???: Phoenix... Phoenix!

text.Phoenix: M-Mia! Maya! How's Maya!?

text.Mia: ...I don't know.

text.Phoenix: You don't know...?

text.Mia: She hasn't tried to channel me since yesterday.

text.Phoenix: Mia... What... What am I supposed to do...?

text.Mia: ... Well, like I said. For a lawyer, the worst of times are when you have to force your biggest smiles.

text.Phoenix: B-But!

text.Mia: You can't give up! There's still some hope left.

text.Phoenix: Stop it, please! There's nothing left... Not here, not anywhere...
( Argh! It's that accursed Engarde again... )
WILL YOU LEAVE ME ALONE!? Look, don't call me anymore! I mean it!

text.Gumshoe: ......You're really mean, pal.

text.Phoenix: Aaah! Gumshoe! I'm really, really sorry! Where are you?

text.Gumshoe: They let me join the investigation team and we're chasing after De Killer, pal!

text.Phoenix: ...! Then, you have some sort of lead...!?

text.Gumshoe: Sorry, but right now we've got zero leads on the guy... But we're not going to give up!

text.Phoenix: Gumshoe...

text.Gumshoe: Until the trial is over... until the verdict is handed down, we're going to do everything we can and find De Killer! If we can get Maya out, then you can get Engarde the guilty verdict he deserves, pal!

text.Phoenix: ( That's true, I could do that if they found Maya first... )

text.Gumshoe: You got that!? So you have to do whatever you can to make the trial last longer!

text.Phoenix: I have to make the trial last longer ?

text.Gumshoe: If you go at Mr. Edgeworth with everything you've got, then you two can draw it out!

text.Phoenix: ( Oh, now I get it... )

text.Gumshoe: I believe in you, pal! You and Mr. Edgeworth can do it! So! Believe in us! We're going to give it all we've got, just like you!

text.Phoenix: Got it! Thanks Gumshoe!

text.Mia: ...Hey, Phoenix. You understand now, don't you? You have something money will never be able to buy. Friendship. It's the strongest weapon in the world and you have it in abundance.

text.Phoenix: ...Yeah! ( Looks like we're coming to the end... I have to make the trial last as long as I can! Gumshoe will come through, I know it! )

text.ACTION: March 23, 10:00 AM District Court Courtroom No. 3

text.Judge: Court is now in session for the trial of Matt Engarde.

text.Phoenix: The defense is ready, Your Honor.

text.Edgeworth: The prosecution has been ready for a while, Your Honor.

text.Judge: Now, as I recall, we concluded yesterday's session with a big mystery on our hands. The mystery being what exactly was Ms. Adrian Andrews' role in this murder? That is to say, is she really connected to the crime itself? Mr. Edgeworth, if you would please inform the court of today's proceedings.

text.Edgeworth: Adrian Andrews. She forged evidence that threw suspicion onto Mr. Engarde, and then proceeded to escape the crime scene by wearing a Nickel Samurai costume. The guilt of these actions are those from which she cannot escape.

text.Judge: Hmm, then you're saying that she is guilty after all...?

text.Edgeworth: I'm not finished, Your Honor. Ms. Andrews has nothing to do with committing the actual murder.
I would like to direct the court's attention to this card.

text.Judge: What is that...? It looks like a shell...

text.Edgeworth: This is the calling card of a certain assassin.

text.Judge: A-Assassin , you say!?

text.Edgeworth: Yes, Juan Corrida was killed by a professional assassin! And the person who hired the assassin, his client so to speak, is Matt Engarde!

text.Judge: Wh-What a surprising turn of events!

text.Edgeworth: I would think it's become commonplace by now, Your Honor.

text.Phoenix: ( I know what's going on this time... So I know that everything Edgeworth has said is true... )

text.Mia: But we still have to hold out as long as we can. At least, until Maya's safe and sound.

text.Phoenix: I wonder how the trial will turn out today...?

text.Judge: Now then, please call your first witness, Mr. Edgeworth.

text.Edgeworth: The prosecution calls the defendant's "mentor", Mr. Will Powers to the stand.
Now then, witness. Your name and occupation, please.

text.Will: O-OK. I'm... Uh... Will Powers. I'm a poor, underpaid action star...

text.Edgeworth: And what is your relation to the defendant?

text.Will: Well, that's... I guess I'm sort of a lousy mentor to him in a way. Yeah.

text.Judge: Um, Mr. Powers. Please... You don't need to put yourself down so much.

text.Will: Oh, uh, sorry. Well, but I'm just kind of a nothing sort of guy.

text.Edgeworth: On the night of the murder, you visited the defendant's room. Is this correct?

text.Will: Y-Yes.

text.Phoenix: ...! ( I... I didn't know that... )

text.Will: Um, but you know... I didn't actually get to see Matt when I went...

text.Edgeworth: All you need to do is answer what you're asked. Now then, I would like you to please testify about when you went to Mr. Engarde's room.

text.Will: O-OK... Sure...

After the award ceremony, I went by myself to Matt's room. 
Matt was standing there in front of his room, still in his Nickel Samurai costume. 
He was talking with someone. At first, I thought it was the bellboy. 
I watched the two of them for a while, but then I gave up and went back. 
I had guests with me that night, and I couldn't make them wait for me.

text.Judge: Hmm... Nothing sounds out of place in Mr. Powers' testimony.

text.Phoenix: ( And talking with the bellboy is no big deal... )

text.Edgeworth: If one assumes that the person Mr. Engarde was speaking with was an ordinary bellboy...

text.Judge: Wh-What are you implying?

text.Edgeworth: Well, Mr. Wright. Let's have your cross-examination, shall we?

text.Phoenix: Huh?

text.Mia: A trap. Can't you smell it, Phoenix? But for us to find out more, we're just going to have to charge in head first, right?

text.Phoenix: I don't remember that happening at all. Maya was making such a racket in her hyper state... I ended up focusing on her.

text.Mia: ...I see. In any case, from his story, he probably wasn't gone for very long.

text.Edgeworth: Yes, he was the assassin.

text.Judge: Mr. Powers! Please testify! Tell us what you saw!

This time, I was in that hallway because I had to go to the bathroom!

Of course, when I say "room", I mean Juan Corrida's room! 
Now that I think about it, that bellboy did seem kinda out of place! 
Yeah! So he had to be the assassin! I'm sure of it! 
I mean...

text.Edgeworth: That would be correct, Your Honor. Well, Mr. Wright. I believe it's your turn... to entertain and make us laugh.

text.Phoenix: Ha. Ha. Ha. Ha.

text._info: (Changed from [Who do you say is the real client of De Killer, and therefore, the real murderer?] in the original release)

CHOICE.ACTION: USER SELECTS Present Adrian Andrews profile

CHOICE.Edgeworth: You've let me down, Mr. Wright.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Huh?

CHOICE.Edgeworth: I know you are aware of the truth. And you are free to turn your eyes from it... But at least try to make some sense while you are doing so.

CHOICE.Judge: I'll give you another chance. Don't squander it.

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads back to "Now then, Mr. Wright."

text.Judge: Adrian Andrews...!?

text.Phoenix: Yes. We already know that she tried to frame Matt Engarde for the crime... By wearing a spare Nickel Samurai costume!

text.Will: Ah! Then... Then the " Nickel Samurai's arm " that I saw...

text.Phoenix: That could have very well been Ms. Andrews !

text.Judge: But what about Mr. Engarde?

text.Phoenix: If you would please recall yesterday's testimony, the defendant was taking a nap during the break period.

text.Judge: That's right... Then... finding this figure at Mr. Engarde's mansion...?

text.Phoenix: It was a well-laid trap set by Ms. Andrews.

text.Judge: Mr. Edgeworth... What is your opinion on this?

text.Edgeworth: ... I can't even begin to count the flaws in the defense's logic. Besides which, there is no evidence to support it. However... I can't fully discount its possibility either.

text.Judge: Hmm...

text.Phoenix: ( This is to save Maya... This is to save Maya... Even if the whole world turns against me, this is one fight I can't give up on! )

text.Judge: Order! Order! Order! All disruptive parties will be forced to leave the courtroom!

text.Edgeworth: Your Honor. ... For the benefit of the defense, I'm willing to play along with his "what if" game.

text.Judge: His "what if" game, Mr. Edgeworth?

text.Edgeworth: The prosecution is prepared to challenge the defense's theory.
Mr. Wright. Even you must have thought it strange and wondered, "Why would the criminal want this little wooden bear...?"

text.Phoenix: ( He's right... De Killer did specially bring that bear to Engarde right away... ) Why do you ask? Is there something special about it?

text.Edgeworth: Absolutely. And I'm sure that once the court knows its significance, the true killer's identity will become crystal clear. Your Honor! The prosecution calls upon a witness who will clear all doubts against Ms. Andrews.

text.Judge: And who would that be!?

text.Edgeworth: It's quite simple, Your Honor. Ms. Adrian Andrews herself.

text.Judge: I see... Well then, the court will take a short 10 minute recess. The prosecution will prepare its witness in that time.

text.Edgeworth: Yes, Your Honor.

text.ACTION: March 23, 11:54 AM District Court Defendant Lobby No. 3

text.Engarde: Hahaha... Oh, I knew it was a good idea to hold her hostage. Don't you agree, Mister Lawyer...? But I never thought in your desperation, you'd try to pin the guilt onto Adrian!

text.Phoenix: ... ( Aaaargh! I swear this demon will pay... )

text.Pearl: Mr. Nick!

text.Phoenix: P-Pearls? Where's Mia?

text.Pearl: I... don't know... A really strong power suddenly called her away...

text.Phoenix: ( A really strong power...? )

text.Pearl: Oh, Mr. Nick! Your phone is...

text.Phoenix: ( It's from Gumshoe! )

text.Gumshoe: How is it going!? Have you been hanging in there, pal!?

text.Phoenix: Y-Yeah, sort of... We just barely found something to latch onto.

text.Gumshoe: Phew. That's good, pal.

text.Phoenix: And what about you!? Anything yet!? Have you figured out where De Killer and Maya are!?

text.Gumshoe: Um, uh... We still don't have any leads, but...

text.Phoenix: WHAT!? We don't have any more time!

text.Gumshoe: If we just had one! Even a single clue would be really helpful...

text.Phoenix: ( I was only able to come this far because I kept thinking to myself... I've got to keep the trial going until Maya's been rescued... But have I just run out of luck this time...? Is all our hope for naught...? )
( Huh? A tent!? )
M-Mia!

text.Mia: It looks like Maya was unconscious until just a few minutes ago. As soon as she woke up, she called for me.

text.Phoenix: So it was Maya that called you away!

text.Mia: She's locked in a dusty little room right now. But I could see a circus tent outside the window about 300 feet away!

text.Phoenix: Gumshoe! Is there a circus in town right now!?

text.Gumshoe: There's only one, pal! The Berry Big Circus!

text.Phoenix: Maya is somewhere within a 300 feet radius of the main tent!

text.Gumshoe: Wh-What!? ... OK, hold on a sec, pal! Hey! Draw a circle on that map! About a 300 feet radius from the main tent! Hurry!

text.Mia: And...

text.Phoenix: And?

text.Mia: I could see a mailbox under the window.

text.Phoenix: Gumshoe! There's also a mailbox!

text.Gumshoe: Hmm... OK! What else?

text.Phoenix: What else, Mia!?

text.Mia: I'm sorry, but it was a very small window. I couldn't see anything else... It felt like I was in an old office building... Maybe the third floor or so...

text.Gumshoe: I heard her! An old office building. Good stuff, pal! OK, just hang in there! Just a little longer, pal! Wish us luck!

text.Phoenix: Good luck!

text.Gumshoe: I'll call you later, so don't let your battery die, OK pal!?

text.Phoenix: Mia! Maya's not hurt, right!?

text.Mia: She's in a pretty bad state, Phoenix. She's being starved.

text.Phoenix: ( Gumshoe! Please hurry!! )

text.Mia: Looks like we're out of time. Are you alright, Phoenix?

text.Phoenix: ( It's only a matter of time before Maya's rescued... I can do this! I just have to make this trial last a little longer! )

text.ACTION: March 23, 12:05 PM District Court Courtroom No. 3

text.Judge: Court will now reconvene.

text.Edgeworth: De Killer, the man who murdered the victim, handed this to his client. From this, one obvious question arises. "Why this particular item?" I believe the answer to that question will provide us with the name of the real culprit. Now then, the prosecution calls the defendant's manager, Adrian Andrews, to the stand!
text._info: (Changed from [I believe the answer to that question will provide us with the name of the real criminal.] in the original release)

text.Edgeworth: Currently, the witness is accused of tampering and obstruction of justice.
However, you have been called to the witness stand today to ascertain... who exactly is guilty of murder.

text.Andrews: I understand.

text.Edgeworth: Very good. Now, have you ever seen this bear before, Ms. Andrews?

text.Andrews: Of course I have.

text.Judge: You have seen it before?

text.Edgeworth: That's right. It's only natural that the witness has. Ms. Andrews. Could you please enlighten the court to this bear's secrets?

text.Andrews: Alright.

text.Phoenix: ( Why... Why does she...?? )

text.Andrews:
Actually, this is an elaborate puzzle. 
If you know the correct order, it can be taken apart one piece at a time. 
At its center is a small cavity, with just enough room to store a small item. 
Because of its complexity, if you don't know the order, you can't open the bear. 
You really can't tell that it's a small "jewelry box" just by looking at it.

text.Judge: So this figurine... it's a container of sorts, is it...?

text.Andrews: Yes. Looks can be deceiving, wouldn't you agree?

text.Judge: Yes. This is superb craftmanship. ...Oh, yes, I nearly forgot. You may begin your cross-examination, Mr. Wright.

text.Mia: It looks like there really was something to that bear after all.

text.Andrews: Actually, this is an elaborate puzzle.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
A puzzle?

CHOICE.Andrews: That's right.

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm... But it looks like an ordinary figurine...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( True enough... To people who don't know, I'm sure they would never guess that this was a puzzle... ) So what kind of puzzle is this exactly?

text.Andrews: If you know the correct order, it can be taken apart one piece at a time.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
So you can "take it apart"? And how would one go about doing that?

CHOICE.Andrews: Well, you first turn its tail to the right and then push it in.

CHOICE.Judge: ...Oh, yes, I see.

CHOICE.Andrews: After that, the arms and legs are free to move and can be removed.

CHOICE.Judge: Ooh... This is most interesting...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( A boy and his new toy... It's like he's 5 all over again... )

CHOICE.Judge: ......... ......... ......... ...Oh, don't mind me. Go ahead and carry on.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I think he's lost it... )

text.Andrews: At its center is a small cavity, with just enough room to store a small item.

CHOICE.Andrews: I know because I was the one who bought it .

CHOICE.Andrews: That's right. It was a puzzle in the shape of a bear, so I thought it would be perfect for Juan.

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Witness, let's continue with your testimony.

text.Andrews: Because of its complexity, if you don't know the order, you can't open the bear.

Who else knows that this bear is actually a small container or "jewelry box"?
