( I think this is about all I'm going to get for now... )

text.Edgeworth: Well, Mr. Wright? I think even you have come to realize...
That there is one very important fact we have uncovered, and that is this: This bear is actually a "jewelry box".

text.Judge: Hmm...

text.Edgeworth: Now that we have agreed to this point, there is only one logical question that can come next. And that is this: What is inside this box?

text.Judge: What's inside!?

text.Edgeworth: That's right. That's what we are going to find out next. Witness.

text.Andrews: Yes?

text.Edgeworth: You are the only one who can open this. Please...

text.Andrews: I've opened it. Is this what you wanted?

text.Judge: Wh-What is that? It looks like a... note...

text.Edgeworth: I don't think we need to guess at what that is... Do we, Mr. Wright?
It's the suicide note.

text.Judge: The suicide note?

text.Edgeworth: The suicide note left by Juan Corrida's former manager, Celeste Inpax. Until now, no one knew of its whereabouts... But just as we suspected, it was hidden. Hidden by the victim, Juan Corrida himself. It seems Celeste Inpax had very beautiful handwriting. And she just as beautifully signed her own name on this document. This is most definitely the note she left right before she committed suicide!

text.Judge: O-ORDER! Witness! Did you know about this...?

text.Andrews: ...Yes, I did. I heard all about it from Juan. When I discovered his body... I looked for the bear. I wanted to destroy the note before it became public. But... I couldn't find it anywhere.

text.Edgeworth: Because it had already been taken by De Killer.

text.Mia: Everything is going at Mr. Edgeworth's pace... So now that the suicide note has been found, what's the next logical question?

text.Phoenix: "What is written on the note...?"

text.Mia: That's right... At least, that's what I would think...

text.Edgeworth: Now then, I believe it is only appropriate the contents of this note be made known.

text.Andrews: I can't stop you, can I...? I went through so much... just to get my hands on it. And I was going to burn it... for her sake.

text.Edgeworth: I'm deeply sorry, but I can't allow you to persuade me to stop. Your Honor. If you could please read the contents of this note aloud.

text.Judge: Very well...

text.Phoenix: The judge's voice rang loud and clear though the dead silent courtroom... In her note, Celeste Inpax left to us a record of all that had happened to her... About being used and then thrown away by Engarde... About being engaged to Corrida, and Engarde's role in destroying that... And about how she decided, in her despair, to end it all.

text.Judge: ... And that's all Ms. Inpax had to say.

text.Edgeworth: There is one thing I would like to say here. The prosecution has no interest in slandering Mr. Engarde.

text.Judge: Then... What...?

text.Edgeworth: Our intention, Your Honor, is to establish a motive for murder . Isn't that correct, witness?

text.Andrews: Yes... On the night of the murder, Juan was going to make the contents of the note public. After the post-ceremony show... he was going to hold a press conference.

text.Judge: My word...

text.Edgeworth: Matt Engarde values, above all else, his "refreshing like a spring breeze" image. Which is why he had to stop this note from being made public... At any cost!

There is no room for doubt here. Mr. de Killer's client's goal was to obtain this suicide note . And the only person who needed this note that badly is the defendant . Let's not forget that the bear with the note inside was found at the defendant's house!
text._info: (Changed from [There is no margin for doubt here.] in the original release)

text.Judge: It seems that we have come to the truth at last. The defendant's motives were entirely selfish. He deserves no sympathy from anyone!

text.Phoenix: ( The suicide note or the figurine!? Which one of these should I pursue?? )

CHOICE.Phoenix: Objection!
Please wait, Your Honor!
I think Your Honor believes that Matt Engarde killed in order to obtain this note.

CHOICE.Judge: Yes, that is correct.

CHOICE.Phoenix: But that seems a little strange. In fact, I think there is a contradiction here!
This note was hidden by Mr. Corrida until the night of the murder. If that is the case... I say that Matt Engarde could not have known what was written on this note!

CHOICE.Judge: Oh! I didn't think of it that way...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Exactly. But I did think of it that way, and I thought it was rather strange. No one in their right mind would kill for a note without first knowing what it said!
Objection!
Please wait, Your Honor!
The assassin took this with him from the crime scene after murdering Mr. Corrida. At the request of his client, of course.

CHOICE.Judge: So, what's your point, Mr. Wright?

CHOICE.Phoenix: I don't think it's possible that Mr. de Killer's client was Matt Engarde. In fact, I think there is a contradiction here!
You can't tell by just looking at it that this bear is really a jewelry box. The chances that Matt Engarde thought the note was inside this bear... Are zero to none!

CHOICE.Judge: Oh! I didn't think of it that way...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Exactly. But I did think of it that way, and I thought it was rather strange. After all, there is no reason why Mr. Engarde would ever want a jewelry box like this!

text.Judge: Order! Order! Order! Y-You make a valid point, Mr. Wright! Mr. Edgeworth! What is your opinion!?

text.Edgeworth: I believe a show of appreciation is in order.

text.Edgeworth: The defense seems to be in love with wishing more despair upon itself.
I would like to direct the court's attention to this.

text.Judge: What is that...?

text.Edgeworth: It is a very small video camera, Your Honor. This type of camera is commonly used as a means of spying .

text.Judge: S-Spying...?

text.Phoenix: ( What the...!? I thought that spy camera was in my possession ... )

text.Edgeworth: Matt Engarde and the victim both thought of the other as their biggest rival. They even went so far as to use this type of item to find each other's weaknesses!

text.Judge: And...?

text.Edgeworth: The victim, Juan Corrida, was being spied on! His personal life was being watched by none other than Matt Engarde!

text.Judge: Order! Oooooorder!! Ahem! Mr. Wright!

text.Judge: You... Don't tell me you knew about your client's spying activities!?

text.Phoenix: Well... sort of...

text.Judge: "Sort of" is not an acceptable answer, Mr. Wright!

text.Edgeworth: I see you are confused, Mr. Wright. You're probably thinking, "But I have the camera that was in the stuffed bear's eye..."
But this camera that I have is not that same one. Last night, I searched the victim's house on a hunch... Using this...

text.Phoenix: ( Gumshoe's bug sweeper... )

text.Edgeworth: By the way, Mr. Wright. The defendant's fingerprints were found on this camera.

text.Judge: Matt Engarde's fingerprints were on there!?

text.Mia: Well, Phoenix... It looks like those cameras were hidden all over the place, huh?

text.Phoenix: ( What am I supposed to say to that evidence...? )

text.Edgeworth: I think this is the end. It's fairly obvious that Mr. Engarde learned of the suicide note through this. He was watching the victim all along.

text.Phoenix: ( He got me good this time! I don't have anything to counter that! )

text.Phoenix: Yes, Chief!?

text.Mia: Have you figured out what you're going to do next yet?

text.Phoenix: What I'm going to do next!? ( Does running away like a frightened child work? )

text.Mia: I know it seems like Mr. Edgeworth is very close to putting the lid on this case. But... In his eagerness to prove his point, he forgot one very important thing .

text.Phoenix: Well, what is it, Mia!?

text.Mia: There is a piece of evidence that he really should investigate .

text.Phoenix: ( Something he should investigate ? )

text.Mia: I would really hate to see the good prosecutor get scolded... For not remembering to look into the item when he had the chance.

text.Phoenix: ( Why are you speaking in riddles all of a sudden...? )

text.Judge: Alright, I think this time we finally understand everything. Well, Mr. Wright? You don't have any further objections, do you?

text.Phoenix: ( What is this piece of evidence that Mia is talking about...? Can I figure out what it is that still needs to be looked at, or should I let it go...? )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "...I have an objection, Your Honor."

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I have no objections to Engarde getting his guilty sentence as he should... But I can't let that happen yet! Mia said there's still something worth examining . If she thinks so, then even if I have to force it, I must find something to bring up! )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "...I have an objection, Your Honor."

text.Phoenix: Objection!
Your Honor! The defense has no intentions of letting this go so easily!

text.Judge: You are beginning to sound desperate...

text.Phoenix: That's just your imagination, Your Honor! Mr. Edgeworth. This is not like you at all.
In your eagerness to prove your point, you've forgotten one very important thing.

text.Mia: Hey... Isn't that what I just said!?

text.Edgeworth: So, you're telling me that I forgot something?

text.Phoenix: You're so close, Mr. Edgeworth... But there's something you really should examine about this piece of evidence!

text.Phoenix: Hmm... Who knows?

I mean, sure, this "suicide note" was found inside this bear. But this bear was in my possession until a few moments ago. Which means... The handwriting on this "suicide note" has yet to be analyzed !

text.Judge: Oh...

text.Phoenix: So! As to whether this pivotal piece of evidence was really written by Ms. Inpax or not... That has yet to be even remotely confirmed!

Your Honor. The defense is indiscriminately accusing the witness again! There is no evidence linking the witness to the suicide note whatsoever!

text.Edgeworth: Imposs... That's impossible!

text.Mia: This isn't good, Phoenix.

text.Phoenix: ( The judge is going to carry this trial over one more day. I don't think Maya will physically be able to make it another day! )

( What is with him!? And what's with that sigh!? ) Where's Maya!? What happened to De Killer!?

text.Phoenix: I'm sorry, Your Honor! But...!

text.Judge: But wouldn't it be better if we adjourned for today and then reconvened tomorrow...?

text.ACTION: March 23, 2:04 PM District Court Defendant Lobby No. 3

text.Edgeworth: Wright! Well!? What's going on with Maya's situation!?

text.Edgeworth: Unnngh...
Report!

text.Edgeworth: What!?

text.Gumshoe: Well... I'm not a detective anymore, so I had to... I'm really sorry, sir, but I've got to put the law on hold for now!

text.Phoenix: ( Sounds bad... I hope he doesn't get in too much trouble over this... )

text.Gumshoe: With my hunk of junk car, I'd say I'll be there in about 20 minutes, sir! Don't worry! I'll be there! Wait for me!

text.Edgeworth: A-Alright... Just get here in one piece.

text.Gumshoe: I'm on a mission and no one can stop me now, sir! No one! I'm pulling out all the stops and running every red light !

text.Phoenix: ( Items left by the murderer , huh... Maybe there's something among them that will be decisive enough to end this! )

text.Edgeworth: Hey! What's wrong!? Detective Gumshoe! Answer me!

text.Gumshoe: ... No one can stop... I'm...

text.Phoenix: Wh-What happened?

text.Edgeworth: It sounded like he had an accident. I'm guessing his cell phone broke as well.

text.Phoenix: Wh-What was he thinking?? We've got to hurry and call for help!

text.Edgeworth: But we have no idea where he is. His cell phone is broken, and he wasn't driving a patrol car, so no radio either. Also... If we don't get to those items before they do, the police will take possessions of them.

text.Phoenix: No! We can't let that happen!

text.Edgeworth: Well, if there is a way we can find out where he is, then we stand a chance...

text.Phoenix: ( Why, oh why did Gumshoe have to get into an accident now!? Is there any way to find out exactly where he is at this moment...!? )

CHOICE.ACTION: USER SELECTS There is a way.

CHOICE.Phoenix: That's right! There is a way!

CHOICE.Edgeworth: What!? How!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: I'm sure we can find out where Detective Gumshoe is through this...!

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Why are you bringing up Franziska at a time like... Oh, I see! I'll try to get in contact with her. The chances are slim, but she's all we have...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Franziska... Will she even want to help us...? )

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Wright, we're not in the middle of a mock trial here!

CHOICE.Phoenix: I guess this won't work, huh...?

CHOICE.Edgeworth: I guess it's up to me. Alright, I will think of something on my end. Don't get your hopes up too high, but I'll try my best.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( ...Did I say something wrong...? )

CHOICE.ACTION: USER SELECTS There is no way.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Argh! It's no use! I can't think of anything!

CHOICE.Edgeworth: I see... Alright, I'll try to think of something on my end. Don't get your hopes up too high, but I'll try my best.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( ...Did I say something wrong...? )

text.Phoenix: Edgeworth...

text.Edgeworth: What is it?

text.Phoenix: I don't have any right to judge anyone ever again...

I know my client is guilty. But what I'm doing now... I'm pinning the guilt onto someone totally innocent, and using the evidence to do so... ... It might be my turn to say, "Defense Attorney Phoenix Wright chooses death"...

text.Edgeworth: Wright. It doesn't suit someone like you to cry useless tears. Whether you did your job well or not... That can only be seen after the verdict has been decided.

text.Phoenix: The verdict...

text.Edgeworth: Yes, bailiff?

text.Bailiff: There's a phone call for you, sir. They said it was extremely urgent.

text.Edgeworth: They're probably finished with the handwriting analysis. I have to go take this call. In the mean time, think hard about what it is you must do.

text.ACTION: March 23, 2:35 PM District Court Courtroom No. 3

text.Judge: Court will now reconvene. I assume both sides are ready?

text.Phoenix: Y-Yes, Your Honor...

text.Edgeworth: Y-Yes, Your Honor...

text.Judge: ...I can understand the defense acting like this, however, why do you also seem distraught, Mr. Edgeworth!?

text.Edgeworth: I... that is... It's nothing, Your Honor.

text.Phoenix: ( What's wrong with Edgeworth...? )

text.Mia: It looks like something unexpected just happened to him.

text.Judge: Now then, Mr. Edgeworth. If you could please tell the court the results of the handwriting analysis on Ms. Inpax's suicide note...

text.Edgeworth: Y...Yes, Your Honor. Unfortunately... We have discovered that this suicide note is a forgery.

text.Phoenix: What!?

text.Judge: What do you mean, Mr. Edgeworth!?

text.Edgeworth: This... This note was not written by Ms. Inpax herself! It is a fake !

text.Judge: Order! Order! Order! Mr. Edgeworth! Would you care to explain what is going on!? If this was not written by Ms. Inpax, then who wrote it!?

text.Edgeworth: We would need more time to do a more detailed analysis, however... It appears that the handwriting matches that of the victim, Mr. Juan Corrida .

text.Phoenix: Mr. C-Corrida...?

text.Mia: Well, well... It looks like Ms. Inpax never left a suicide note after all. She never wrote anything about Engarde...

text.Edgeworth: However! Your Honor. Even though this suicide note is indeed a fake, Mr. Engarde could not have known that, and so that [sic] facts remain unchanged! Acting under the assumption that it was real, he had plotted to possess it!

text.Judge: Hmm... That does sound very plausible.

text.Phoenix: ( This theory that Engarde had no idea that the suicide note was fake... Something seems a little wrong with it... )

CHOICE.Phoenix: The defense believes that the theory the prosecution has stated contradicts testimony! If everything the prosecution has proven up to this point is true... Then it's impossible for Mr. Engarde to not have know it was a fake!

CHOICE.Judge: What is this little item called again...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Um, a video camera, Your Honor. Well, a very small one, but...

CHOICE.Judge: Oh, that's right. A camera. Ah, you kids and your fancy toys nowadays...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Mr. Edgeworth! Earlier, you claimed that Mr. Engarde knew of the existence of this note because he was spying on the victim. Isn't that right?
If that were true... Then this means Mr. Engarde would have known that the victim had forged the note!

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Aaack!

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "So then, the defendant knew this suicide note was a fake."

CHOICE.Judge: Well, Mr. Edgeworth?? Your response?

CHOICE.Edgeworth: I believe that even more important than finding out if this note is real or not, is whether the attorney's badge pinned to that man's chest is real... That is the million dollar question!

CHOICE.Judge: Yes, I agree.

CHOICE.Mia: Me too.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I'm going to take a wild guess and say that I messed up again...? )

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm... Actually, there is something I would like to ask. Mr. Edgeworth. You had stated something earlier to the effect of the defendant had spied on Mr. Corrida's private life...
I believe this would mean that he would have known about the note as well...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Th-That's it! ) Yes, and so naturally... This means Mr. Engarde would have known that the note was a fake!

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Uungh!

CHOICE.Judge: Order! Order! See here, Mr. Wright!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...Um, yes Your Honor?

CHOICE.Judge: I was the one who thought of the spying thing! Jumping in and stealing my thunder like that is simply... I can't even describe it!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ah, yes... Sorry...

CHOICE.Judge: I could've even bragged about embarrassing Mr. Edgeworth to my grandchild had you not... For that, I assign you a penalty, Mr. Wright!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Whaaaaa!? ( If only I had kept my mouth shut... )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "So then, the defendant knew this suicide note was a fake."

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( It's no use... Something feels wrong, but I can't put my finger on what it is... )

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm... Actually, there is something I would like to ask. Mr. Edgeworth. You had stated something earlier to the effect of the defendant had spied on Mr. Corrida's private life...
I believe this would mean that he would have known about the note as well...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Th-That's it! ) Yes, and so naturally... This means Mr. Engarde would have known that the note was a fake!

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Uungh!

CHOICE.Judge: Order! Order! See here, Mr. Wright!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...Um, yes Your Honor?

CHOICE.Judge: I was the one who thought of the spying thing! Jumping in and stealing my thunder like that is simply... I can't even describe it!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ah, yes... Sorry...

CHOICE.Judge: I could've even bragged about embarrassing Mr. Edgeworth to my grandchild had you not... For that, I assign you a penalty, Mr. Wright!

CHOICE.Phoenix: Whaaaaa!? ( If only I had kept my mouth shut... )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "So then, the defendant knew this suicide note was a fake."

text.Judge: So then, the defendant knew this suicide note was a fake. And if that's true, then the situation has suddenly changed in a very dramatic way.

text.Phoenix: Exactly, Your Honor! The prosecution's theory as to what Mr. Engarde's motive for murder was... It has suddenly disappeared into thin air!

text.Edgeworth: But Your Honor! It's not as if Mr. Engarde monitored Mr. Corrida 24 hours a day! Perhaps the victim wrote the note in a place Mr. Engarde didn't know of!

text.Phoenix: Well, right back at you, Mr. Edgeworth! Why don't you show us some proof that the victim made the forgery at an unknown place!?

text.Edgeworth: Gnnngh!

text.Judge: Order! Order! Order! ...Mr. Edgeworth. It looks like this time, it is you who has dug his own grave.

text.Edgeworth: Unnnngh... As I figured...

text.Judge: Huh? ...As you figured...?

text.Edgeworth: As I figured... It came down to this after all...

text.Judge: Mr. Edgeworth, you are not making any sense...

text.Edgeworth: When I heard the results of the handwriting analysis, I thought this might happen. The question is... "What next?"

text.Phoenix: What next...??

text.Edgeworth: If the prosecution can't prove Mr. Engarde's motive through the evidence, then we must prove it from another angle.

text.Judge: Well, I agree with you there...

text.Edgeworth: Your Honor. The prosecution... would like to call a witness to the stand at this time...

text.Judge: Oh. Well, that's fine.

text.Edgeworth: However... this witness... This witness is a little... unusual...

text.Phoenix: ( Edgeworth stuttering...? This is not like him at all. )

text.Judge: Unusual? Well, what sort of witness is this person, Mr. Edgeworth?

text.Edgeworth: This witness is one who is perfectly fit to answer once and for all the question of, "Who was it that hired Shelly de Killer to commit murder?"

text.Phoenix: That's impossible!! Who in the...!? No such person exists who can answer that question with such certainty!

text.Judge: Y-Yes! Mr. Edgeworth! Who is this witness!?

text.Edgeworth: It is... It's... um...

text.Judge: Yes!? Go on! Who is it!?

text.Edgeworth: The man himself... Mr. Shelly de Killer.

text.Judge: Oh, Mr. de Killer. ... W-W-Waaaaait!! Shelly de Killer!? Um, you mean... The killer? Err... I mean the assassin?

text.Edgeworth: Yes... Your Honor.

text.Judge: He's coming here? To the witness stand...?

text.Edgeworth: Well, yes, in a manner of speaking... I recognize that this is a very unusual circumstance, so I ask for your permission.

text.Judge: Hmm... Well, Mr. Wright?

text.Phoenix: Y-Yes?

text.Judge: Is this alright with you?

text.Phoenix: ( Do I have a choice here...? I can't really do much else to drag this trial out... ) The defense has no objections, Your Honor.

text.Judge: I wonder if it really is alright to do this...?

text.Edgeworth: Very well then. The prosecution calls our witness to the stand!

text.Phoenix: ( Edgeworth... Is there no other way left to us...? )

text.Edgeworth: Now then, witness. ...Um, your name... and your, uh... occupation, please.

text.de Killer: Very good, sir. My name is Shelly de Killer, and I am a professional assassin.

text.Judge: I... I say!! Wh-What is going on here!?

text.Edgeworth: Your Honor?

text.Judge: How can you remain so calm? And what is the meaning of this two-way radio...?

text.Edgeworth: Actually, Your Honor, it was delivered to me just now... And it came with a condition. As long as we do not trace its source, Mr. de Killer will testify to this court.

text.Phoenix: ( So this must be what that urgent phone call he got earlier was about... )

text.Judge: Oh no, this will not do. I cannot allow this in my court. First of all, we can't even be sure this is really Mr. de Killer himself!

text.Edgeworth: Witness. Please present some sort of proof that you are in fact Shelly de Killer.

text.de Killer: I understand. Please wait a second.

text.Maya: ... I'm... sooo... hungry...

text.Phoenix: M-M-Maya!

text.Mia: Maya!

text.Judge: A... A voice! Mr. Wright! Can you confirm anything from this!?

text.Phoenix: The defense has no objections to this person! We are satisfied that this man is indeed Shelly de Killer!

text.Judge: It looks like we have run into yet another unexpected turn of events... Well, it doesn't seem like we have too many choices under these circumstances, so...

text.Edgeworth: ...Now then, witness. There is one thing I would like to confirm before we speak of anything else.

text.de Killer: And what would that be?

text.Edgeworth: At the request of a client, you killed Mr. Juan Corrida. Is this correct?

text.de Killer: ... It is as you say. I did indeed kill Mr. Corrida.

text.Judge: * gulp *

text.Edgeworth: Now that we have answered that, let's move on to the name of your client!

text.de Killer: ...Very well.

text.Judge: This is all just a bad dream... Yes, that's it, a bad dream...

text.Phoenix: ( Shelly de Killer... What is he going to say...? )

text.de Killer:
There is something I must first state. 
To an assassin, nothing is more important than the trust between a client and himself. 
And that is the reason I am here today on this witness stand. 
It is my wish that you grasp this concept before I give the name of my client.

text.Judge: Hmm, Mr. de Killer seems to be a very clever man. I'd almost say he seems to be mocking us.

text.Edgeworth: While he may appear to be our enemy, Your Honor, Mr. de Killer is only stating the truth. He is no hypocrite. He has always stood by this one belief.

text.Judge: You mean about this " trust between his clients and himself " thing? Hmm, it seems to be a level of trust beyond what people like me can comprehend. ...Well, Mr. Wright? Are you ready to cross-examine the witness?

text.Phoenix: Yes, Your Honor.

text.Mia: There's no way to know what's coming next, so stay cool and collected, Phoenix.

text.de Killer: There is something I must first state.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
We can hear anything you have to say later. Can you please just tell us your client's...?

CHOICE.de Killer: I don't think you understand your place, Mr. Attorney. I said this is something I must first state. Do you know what the word "first" means?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ... S-Sorry... Go on...

CHOICE.Judge: Well, it appears this is one witness you can't badger, Mr. Wright.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( That's only because you don't know about Maya's situation... )

text.de Killer: To an assassin, nothing is more important than the trust between a client and himself.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
The trust between you and your client...?

CHOICE.de Killer: I provide my services in a fast and efficient manner. In exchange, I trust that my clients are discreet about me and my identity. If too many people knew my face, it would be quite troublesome.

CHOICE.Judge: And that is why you're testifying in this manner?

CHOICE.de Killer: This is the first time one of my clients has ever been accused of murder. I must preserve the De Killer name so my clients can trust me.

CHOICE.Phoenix: But couldn't someone stab you in the back and break your trust?

CHOICE.de Killer: It has never happened before, but if it ever did...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Y-Yes...?

CHOICE.de Killer: That person wouldn't be my client for very long. They would certainly...

CHOICE.Judge: Th-That's enough! Please, no more!

CHOICE.de Killer: Very well. It was only a hypothetical anyway.

CHOICE.ACTION: USER SELECTS Press ( after pressing this statement, then pressing third statement )

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
The trust between you and your client...?

CHOICE.de Killer: I provide my services in a fast and efficient manner. In exchange, I trust that my clients are discreet about me and my identity. These are the roles and duties an assassin and his client are to carry out.

CHOICE.Phoenix: I'm sorry, but I was wondering about something you just said. You said that your client had already "broken the rules"...

CHOICE.de Killer: A person who frames another is the worst kind of human.

CHOICE.Phoenix: And that's why you feel you can betray this person?

CHOICE.de Killer: I have no trust relation with a client who can't understand their assigned role.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Just my luck... An assassin with a conscience. Who would've figured...? )

CHOICE.de Killer: Now then, everyone. Do you think you can understand my logic?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( This case just keeps getting better and better! )

CHOICE.de Killer: If you can't, then I'm afraid we can't proceed...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Everyone understands your point, I think. Really.

CHOICE.de Killer: In that case... I believe I am prepared to disclose the information you seek.

CHOICE.Edgeworth: You have made it crystal clear that you value trust over all else. I believe we are ready.

CHOICE.de Killer: ...Excellent.

text.de Killer: And that is the reason I am here today on this witness stand.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
That seems a little strange to me... I mean, you're about to tell us the name of your client. I would think that this would be very bad for them.

CHOICE.de Killer: It doesn't matter to me. This client has already broken the rules and acted outside of their prescribed role .

CHOICE.Judge: Their role...?

CHOICE.de Killer: This person tried to implicate another of the crime in order to save themselves. And this is a trespass that cannot be forgiven.

CHOICE.Judge: You... Who gave you the right to be so high and mighty...!?

CHOICE.de Killer: To the gentleman who spoke just now... Excuse me, but would you care to die?

CHOICE.Judge: Ah, no! No! I, uh, didn't say anything!

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( The judge had better watch himself... )

text.de Killer: It is my wish that you grasp this concept before I give the name of my client.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
We understand, so please tell us the name of your client!!

CHOICE.de Killer: I'm afraid I cannot do that. I still have a few things to say before I do.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Aaargh! That egomaniacal... )

CHOICE.de Killer: It's not good for your health to be so aggravated. You won't live very long if you let everything bother you...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Somehow, that coming from an assassin makes it less than comforting... )

text.de Killer: Now then, I do believe it's about time I revealed the name of my client, don't you agree?

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!

text.Phoenix: ( I don't really care about all this extra fluff. Just tell us the name already! )

text.Mia: Patience. Try to calm down a little. It's important to try and understand his mindset. He seems very steadfast and closed so you're going to have to work to get him to talk.

text.Phoenix: ( I'm not his therapist, you know... )

text.Judge: What is it?

text.Phoenix: ( Umm... Now I can't bring myself to ask the client's name... )

text.Edgeworth: If you can't ask it, Mr. Wright, then I will. Witness! What is the name of your client who requested the murder of Mr. Juan Corrida!?

text.de Killer: That person's name is...
...Adrian Andrews...

text.Phoenix: Whaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa

text.Edgeworth: aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa

text.Judge: aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaat

text.Edgeworth: Objection!
W-Witness!! That's not who you told me it was earlier!

text.de Killer: Pray tell, what are you talking about, Mr. Prosecutor? I should think I know my own client, and it is Adrian Andrews .

text.Edgeworth: Whaaaaaaaat!?!? Th-This can't be! On the phone earlier...

text.Phoenix: Wh-What's going on here...?

text.Mia: My guess is that Mr. de Killer just stabbed Mr. Edgeworth in the back.

text.Phoenix: Stabbed Edgeworth in the back...?

text.Mia: I'm sure in order to get an audience with this court, Mr. de Killer told him a different name... "Matt Engarde", perhaps...?

text.Phoenix: ( I knew it... )

text.Edgeworth: Objection!
This... This is outrageous! I was deceived! This witness is telling a very serious lie!

text.Judge: B-But you were the one who summoned this witness!

text.Edgeworth: Grk! Grr... Y-You... Shelly de Killer...!

text.de Killer: My testimony is the truth. The defendant at the moment is Matt Engarde, am I correct? All I wish to do is help procure his acquittal .

text.Judge: H... Hmm...

text.Mia: Wow... All of a sudden, it feels like we can actually win this.

text.Phoenix: Yeah...

text.Judge: The prosecution has failed to provide a motive and has instead, provided this suicide note, which is a forgery created by the victim. Furthermore, there is a possibility the defendant himself knew it was a fake. But most definitive of all, we have heard from the assassin himself; the name of his client. Mr. de Killer's client who requested the murder was not the defendant at all!
With all this evidence, it is obvious to me that this means that Mr. Matt Engarde... Is innocent !

text.de Killer: I seem to have caused you all a bit of confusion. Please, continue your discussion, and call me when you have reached a verdict.

text.Judge: Bailiff! Please bring Ms. Adrian Andrews in immediately!

text.Mia: What now? With the way this is going, Engarde will be found innocent. This may be our last chance ... to save Maya...

text.Phoenix: Yeah... But... But Edgeworth is right. De Killer is lying! And Engarde... my client... I know he's guilty! ( Can I live with myself if I win this!? )

text.Judge: Who would've believed that the prosecution's own witness would absolve the defendant!?

text.Edgeworth: Your Honor! The prosecution requests permission to further question the witness! Shelly de Killer is certainly lying under oath!

text.Judge: Hmm...

text.Andrews: It wasn't me! Listen! Everyone! Please! That testimony just now... It was all one big lie!

text.Phoenix: Ms. Andrews...

text.Andrews: The suicide note may have been a fake. But! That man... Matt... He's the reason Celeste died! And Juan's death... It was all because he got pulled into Matt's twisted world! That testimony just now... You have to believe me... It was a horrible, horrible lie...

text.Judge: But... Mr. de Killer himself has testified... He has named you as his client.

text.Andrews: No! That's not true!

text.Judge: Also, there is quite a bit of evidence that points to you. The knife and button, donning the Nickel Samurai costume...
text._info: (Changed from [The knife and button, donning the Nickel Samurai's costume...] in the original release)

text.Andrews: But that's... That's...

text.Judge: You even have a motive. We know that Ms. Celeste Inpax was a large part of your life. You wanted to follow her... And you wanted revenge against the two who hurt her. I would say you have plenty of reasons to want them both dead.

text.Andrews: I... No... Mr. Wright!
You... You know the truth! Tell them! Tell them the real story... Who the real killer is... Tell them! Please... Help me...

text.Phoenix: ( Yes, I know the truth... )

text.Judge: Mr. Wright.

text.Phoenix: Yes, Your Honor?

text.Judge: I believe we have reached the end of this trial. Therefore, I ask the defense for any final words or opinions.

text.Phoenix: ... ( I have to decide... Do I take the not guilty verdict and save Maya... Or do I throw this chance away and wait for Gumshoe's new evidence...? What am I supposed to do!? )

CHOICE.Phoenix: Your Honor! The defense will make a request... ... ... ( It's no use... I can't... It feels like I've lost my voice...! )

CHOICE.ACTION: USER SELECTS Request the trial continue

text.Mia: Phoenix...

text.Phoenix: I can't do it, Mia... I can't accept a not guilty.

text.Mia: You are a lawyer.

text.Phoenix: I know. But... But Matt Engarde is a killer -- a murderer ! I can't... I can't let him get away with this. I can't let someone else take the fall. If I let Ms. Andrews be convicted, then I am no better than Engarde. And even though I don't want to admit it, I have to face the fact that it is because of Edgeworth that I now know the real truth. He could've gotten Engarde convicted so many times over, but he never took a single one of those chances. If I take this verdict right now... I'd be betraying his trust. ( ...His trust ...? I never thought about it until now... I... I trust him...? )

text.Mia: ... Yes, you do.

text.Judge: Mr. Wright. Your opinion, please.

text.Phoenix: The defense requests that we be allowed to further question Mr. de Killer.

text.Judge: A-Am I hearing you correctly, Mr. Wright!?

text.Edgeworth: Wright...

text.Judge: But... But... That witness has cleared your client through his testimony! Your job here is done!

text.Phoenix: I'm not done yet. To see through witnesses' lies and find the truth... THAT is my job, Your Honor!
text._info: (Changed from [I'm not done yet. To see through this witness' lies and find the truth...] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: ( There's still more evidence to look at... And I'm sure that once those pieces arrive here in this very courtroom... a miracle will occur! )

text.Judge: Very well. The trial will continue. Mr. Edgeworth. Please re-establish connection with Mr. de Killer.

text.Edgeworth: Right away, Your Honor!

text.de Killer: ...Has a verdict been reached?

text.Edgeworth: Before that, we would like to talk with you a little more.

text.de Killer: About? All you needed from me was the name of my client. What else could you need me for?

text.Edgeworth: Well... Actually, we would like to hear everything you know about this case. This is how things are... usually done.

text.Phoenix: ( What is he talking about? "Usually done"...?? )

text.Judge: But... What shall we have him testify about now?

text.Edgeworth: Mr. de Killer. If you don't mind, please testify about your client in more detail.

text.de Killer: You legal people and your procedures. Is it any wonder no one likes to go to court?

As I have already stated quite a few times, Adrian Andrews is my client. However. 
One thing I simply cannot overlook is tampering with the scene of the crime. 
My client did it to frame another for the crime. 
While pretending to be the first person to discover the body and enter the scene, 
Adrian Andrews already knew from the very beginning that Juan Corrida was dead! 
But even more appalling is the creation and planting of the "knife" and "button". 
That act is what I was referring to when I said my client had "broken the rules".

text.Judge: Hmm... This is a most unexpected turn of events... For the... um, fifth time now...? However, this time, everything has finally been revealed.

text.Edgeworth: Objection!
Just a second, Your Honor!

text.Judge: Yes, Mr. Edgeworth?

text.Edgeworth: We still have the cross-examination to do...

text.Judge: But you don't need to question testimony like this... Do you, Mr. Wright?

text.Phoenix: ... Your Honor, the defense will question the witness. ( As if I have a choice here! )

text.Judge: Huh!? Why!? What this witness has said is nothing but beneficial to the defense's case! If you scrutinize the testimony, then...

text.Phoenix: ( ...Then I'll expose the lies in that oh-so-"beneficial" testimony, I suppose. )

text.Judge: I don't understand what's going on anymore...

text.Phoenix: ( That makes two of us... )

text.de Killer: As I have already stated quite a few times, Adrian Andrews is my client. However.

CHOICE.Phoenix: HOLD IT!

CHOICE.Judge: What is it, Mr. Wright?

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( If I press him the wrong way, it might raise suspicions on his end... But I have to do something to waste more time... ) Um... Witness. About requesting a hit...

CHOICE.de Killer: Yes?

CHOICE.Phoenix: How much is your fee...?

CHOICE.de Killer: ... I see you are also quite a dark-hearted man, Mr. Attorney...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Huh?

CHOICE.de Killer: If you would like to talk business, we can do so after the trial...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Ack! NONONO! I'm not thinking of hiring--
