CHOICE.Phoenix: Oh, no, it's not like that at all. I just think lies aren't a good thing, you know...?

CHOICE.de Killer: Oh, I know and agree. Lies are not a good thing at all...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Urk.

CHOICE.de Killer: I think we are on the same page now, aren't we Mr. Attorney? Remember. If I feel threatened in any way... I am free to cut contact at any time...

CHOICE.Phoenix: I'm sorry! Please forgive my foolishness!

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm... If only you were this apologetic all the time... Anyway, I do not see a huge contradiction here. Therefore, you may continue, witness.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I think I can pull something out of what he said... But it would be real bad if I did something and made him mad over something trivial! ) There are no problems with the testimony, Your Honor.

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm...

text.Mia: We've pretty much reached the end of our rope here...

text.Phoenix: Huh? Seems like we're still OK to me.

text.Mia: And that's exactly what is so bad. At the rate we're going, we will end up completely destroying De Killer's lie. If we do that... You already know how serious of a situation that will put us in.

text.Phoenix: O-Oh yeah... ( All I can do now is pray that those items reach us in time... )
Shelly de Killer. If you had really given the bear to Ms. Andrews... then this item should not have been inside it.

text.de Killer: "This item"...?

text.Edgeworth: I see where you're going...

text.Phoenix: Yup, that's where I'm going...

text.Judge: Where is everyone going!? Do I need to pack a suitcase?

text.Phoenix: Your Honor. Please think back to Ms. Andrews' testimony.

text.Andrews: And I was going to burn it... for her sake.

text.Phoenix: If even for a single minute, this bear had actually been in Ms. Andrews' hands... I'm sure she would have taken the suicide note out and burned it!

text.Judge: Order! Order! Order! So that's where you two were going!

text.Edgeworth: So by the very fact that this suicide note was still inside the bear... It tells us that your "client" didn't know how to disassemble the puzzle!
text._info: (Changed from [Tells us that your "client" didn't know how to disassemble the puzzle!] in the original release)

text.Judge: Wh-Which means...?

text.Edgeworth: It means, Your Honor, that it is impossible for Adrian Andrews to be the "client"!

text.de Killer: Ohoooooo!

text.Judge: O...Order! Order! ORDER!!

text.de Killer: ... Ungh... Mr...Phoenix Wright...
I... I'm sure I mentioned this before. How I hate traitors above all else!
I think your cross-examination has clearly demonstrated something to me. You... You must wish to break your end of our agreement!

text.Phoenix: No! That's not...

text.de Killer: That's enough! If that is your intention, then there is only one thing for me to do!

text.Phoenix: W-Wait! Please!

text.de Killer: Gentlemen, ladies, please excuse me. I have a matter that I must attend to.

text.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
N...No... Please... Not that... Please wait...

text.de Killer: Mr. Attorney! Bring this trial to a speedy end, and I may stay my hand! Otherwise...

text.Phoenix: Nnnngh... Gnwaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaahhh!!

text.Judge: What in the...? Mr. Wright...? Are you...?
Mr. Edgeworth...?

text.Edgeworth: Yes, Your Honor?

text.Judge: I didn't understand this witness' outburst just now. Do you think there is a need to hear more testimony, or is this enough...?

text.Edgeworth: Well... We should...

text.Phoenix: ( Edgeworth! We can't do this! If we keep this up... Maya... She'll...! )

text.Edgeworth: U...Ungh! The prosecution... I...

text.Judge: Wh-What has come over everyone? Even you are...

text.Edgeworth: The prosecution... rests.

text.Judge: What is going on around here...?

text.Edgeworth: The prosecution has no further questions, Your Honor.

text.Judge: Wh... Whaaaaaaat!?
Well, I never thought I'd see the day. This is a most unusual situation... If the prosecution rests with no further questions... Then... the prosecution has failed to uphold its stance.
If that is the case, then even though I am reluctant, I must believe that Mr. de Killer's testimony is accurate . That would mean that Shelly de Killer's client is... Adrian Andrews !

text.Edgeworth: Nnngh...

text.Judge: Mr. Wright!

text.Phoenix: Y-Yes, Your Honor?

text.Judge: If I end the trial here, right now, then your client, Matt Engarde, would be declared innocent . And in his place, Adrian Andrews would be charged with murder.

text.Phoenix: ( M-Ms. Andrews... would be charged with murder ! )

text.Judge: The prosecution has no further questions, so we will now hear the defense's final remarks. Bailiff! Please bring the defendant, Matt Engarde, to the stand!

text.Mia: The items from De Killer's hideout didn't make it in time... We tried as hard as we could, but it looks like our time has run out...

text.Phoenix: ( I can't believe it... )

text.Mia: The outcome now lies in your hands.

text.Engarde: Dude, did the old guy finally decide?

text.Judge: To be honest, I can't think of you as a truly innocent and good person. You have done enough evil to drive a woman to suicide.
But... At least on the charge of murder, it would appear you are innocent.

text.Engarde: ... Hah...! So, I guess even the old fuddy-duddy figured me out!

text.Judge: M-Mr. Engarde...?

text.Engarde: What an atrocious lawyer I have -- giving his own client up like this! And that "refreshing like a spring breeze" crap; it's just as atrocious, don't you agree?
text._info: (Changed from [You were atrocious as a lawyer, weren't you? Giving your client away like this!] in the original release)

text.Engarde: Anyway, get on with it and pronounce me innocent already. Right, Mister Lawyer!?

text.Phoenix: ... ( Should I side with justice? Or should I save Maya's life? )

text.Maya: You'd better get Engarde a guilty sentence, OK!?

text.Phoenix: ( But... But if I did that... Maya will die! But if I say he's innocent... Then Ms. Andrews will be charged as the murderer ! Do I say he's "guilty"... or "not guilty"...? Either choice I make, someone's life is going to end! It all hinges on what I choose! )
text._info: ([choose] in quotation marks in the original release)

text.Judge: Now then, Mr. Wright. Let's hear the defense's final statements on this matter.
If the person who hired the assassin was Adrian Andrews... Then your client, Mr. Matt Engarde is innocent.

text.Engarde: Hmph... There's no need to ask, old man. After all, my lawyer is going to say what I want... aren't you?

text.Edgeworth: Wright...

text.Phoenix: ( I can't! I can't do this! But I have to decide something! I can't count on the evidence to help me anymore. I have to listen to my heart! ) My client... Matt Engarde is...

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "We are waiting for your answer, Mr. Wright!"
Leads to "We are waiting for your answer, Mr. Wright!"

text.Judge: We are waiting for your answer, Mr. Wright! Matt Engarde, your client deserves an answer!

text.Phoenix: ... ( Maya... I'm sorry... ) Matt Engarde is...

text.Franziska: Objection!

text.Phoenix: F-Franziska von Karma!!

text.Judge: Wh-What are you doing here... OWW!

text.Franziska: You see now, don't you... Mr. Phoenix Wright? This is exactly why you should NEVER take your eyes off of that scruffy fool!

text.Edgeworth: Did you bring them? The final pieces... Do you have them?

text.Franziska: You should know better than to ask that, Mr. Miles Edgeworth. A Von Karma is perfect in every way! The evidence is here in perfect condition! Don't worry about Scruffy. He's fine, and his injuries are minor. All of the items are inside this.

text.Judge: What a filthy, old coat this is...

text.Phoenix: ( That's Gumshoe's... I can spot his tattered rags anywhere... )

text.Franziska: I apologize for its ugliness, but there was nothing else to wrap the items in.

text.Phoenix: ( I've fought long and hard this whole trial... All for what is inside that raggedy coat... I'm sure that inside that coat, lies a crucial piece of evidence! ) Your Honor! Inside that filthy coat... Are the defense's final pieces of evidence !

text.Judge: Your final... evidence!?
... This trial is already over. All that remains is for me to hand down my verdict. I do not believe that any evidence presented now, would change the outcome of this trial.

text.Phoenix: ( Wh-What!? )

text.Edgeworth: Objection!
Your Honor. It is our duty to examine every piece of evidence, down to the last. I request that Ms. von Karma be allowed to present these pieces of evidence!

text.Judge: Hmm... I suppose you are right, Mr. Edgeworth. I grant permission to do so. However, this one obvious rule applies here; If these items do not bring up any new points, then they will not be accepted by this court.
Now, Ms. von Karma. If you please.

text.Franziska: These pieces of evidence are items left by De Killer during his escape from the police.

text.Judge: Hmm... He must have been in quite a rush.

text.Franziska: Yes, Your Honor. De Killer left three pieces of evidence .

text.Phoenix: ( Somewhere among the evidence we're about to see... There will be something that will turn this whole situation around... like a miracle . I'm sure of it! )

text.Mia: That is all we can hope for.

text.Franziska: The first item is a pistol .

text.Phoenix: ( Does De Killer's pistol have anything to do with this case...? )

CHOICE.ACTION: USER SELECTS Question for more details

CHOICE.Phoenix: Does that pistol have any relation to this case?

CHOICE.Franziska: We have yet to perform a ballistics test, so I can't say anything for certain... However, I believe it has something to do with this case... At least, to me.

CHOICE.Edgeworth: That's the pistol that he used to shoot you, isn't it?

CHOICE.Franziska: That's what I believe, yes.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Oh...

CHOICE.Franziska: I kept the bullet they removed from my shoulder as a sort of memento... I'm sure it will be an excellent sample for the test.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( So that's the pistol that was used to shoot Franziska... It's probably not going to help us very much... )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "Pistol added to the Court Record."
USER SELECTS More details are not needed

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I'm pretty sure there was no gun involved in this case. There's no real benefit to hearing about it... ) Please present the next piece of evidence.

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "Pistol added to the Court Record."

text.Franziska: The second piece of evidence is this video tape.

text.Phoenix: ( I bet De Killer took that from Engarde Mansion... )

CHOICE.ACTION: USER SELECTS Question for more details

CHOICE.Phoenix: Have you checked the contents of that tape?

CHOICE.Franziska: Unfortunately, there was no time to.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Oh yeah...

CHOICE.Franziska: But I would speculate that this tape is very important.

CHOICE.Judge: Why would you say that?

CHOICE.Franziska: Because he came back to his hideout for it.

CHOICE.Phoenix: De... De Killer went back for it...?

CHOICE.Franziska: That's right. It looks like he was trying to recover it. He injured three of the officers at the site.

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm...

CHOICE.Franziska: But somehow, it looks like they managed to protect it from De Killer. Shelly de Killer is no ordinary man.

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "Video Tape added to the Court Record."
USER SELECTS More details are not needed

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Right now, we don't need to establish De Killer's role in this case... I should be listening to information about a different piece of evidence. ) That's fine. Please present the next piece of evidence!

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "Video Tape added to the Court Record."

text.Franziska: The last piece of evidence is this bellboy's uniform.

text.Phoenix: ( Is that a uniform from the Gatewater Hotel...? )

CHOICE.ACTION: USER SELECTS Question for more details

CHOICE.Phoenix: Was that used during the crime?

CHOICE.Franziska: I am almost certain it was. There's even a pair of black leather gloves in one of the pockets.

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( There's no doubt about it! De Killer was wearing this on the night of the murder! )

CHOICE.Franziska: There is one thing I found interesting about this uniform.

CHOICE.Edgeworth: And what is that?

CHOICE.Franziska: There is a button missing on this uniform.

CHOICE.Edgeworth: A button...?

CHOICE.Franziska: It's a very unique button. I'm sure if we were to recover it... It would provide us with an interesting clue.

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm...

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "Bellboy's Uniform added to the Court Record."
USER SELECTS More details are not needed

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( I don't think this is going to help us much at all... ) Thank you very much, Ms. von Karma. I think that's enough.

CHOICE.Franziska: ...Hmph.

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to "Bellboy's Uniform added to the Court Record."

text.Franziska: That is all I have to present, Your Honor.

text.Judge: Hmm... It's just as I thought.

text.Phoenix: And... what is that, Your Honor..?

text.Judge: I'm sure, were we under normal circumstances, these items from Shelly de Killer's hideout would be very important clues. However... Our question is not "Who did the killing ?"

text.Edgeworth: It is, "Who is the client ?"...

text.Judge: Yes, that is correct. And these three items do not tell us anything about that! Thank you for your hard work, Ms. von Karma. You may step down now.

text.Phoenix: HOLD IT!
Wait, Your Honor! Please allow me to examine this new evidence!

text.Judge: Overruled. This court already has all the evidence it needs to hand down a verdict!

text.Engarde: Wonderful... Absolutely splendid. This judge is such a brilliant man, isn't he?

text.Phoenix: ( Is this the end...? )

text.Mia: Phoenix.

text.Phoenix: I knew it... There's no such thing as a "miracle" in this world, is there?

text.Mia: I think you're wrong. I think they do exist. But you have to make that "miracle" happen. You've come this far! You can't give up now!

text.Phoenix: But... But... No matter how you think about it... It's... It's...

text.Mia: Try... For my sake. Just think about it for a second. There are two ways out of this situation for us.

text.Phoenix: ( T-Two!? )

text.Mia: The first... Make Engarde wish from the bottom of his soul for a guilty verdict .

text.Phoenix: Huh?

text.Mia: De Killer will always place his client's wishes first. If Engarde himself wished to be convicted, then he will let his hostage go.

text.Phoenix: Th-That may be true, but... That's asking me to do the impossible!

text.Mia: The second way... Force De Killer to end his contract with Engarde. If De Killer were to no longer think of Engarde as his "client"... Then he would let Maya go.

text.Phoenix: Mia! That's even more impossible! He is a man who values his duty towards his clients above all else!

text.Mia: ... I know both of these seem like impossible feats at first. But if you could make either one happen, it would truly be a "miracle".

text.Phoenix: The bigger problem is, the judge has already said he doesn't need any more evidence! The pieces he was just shown -- he's not accepting them!

text.Mia: Phoenix. Think things through from the other side . Isn't that what has always worked for us?

text.Phoenix: ...! ( The "other side"...? Wait, does she mean... ) You mean... to turn things around ?

text.Mia: Phoenix. The judge says he doesn't need the evidence. If that's the case, then who does need it?

text.Phoenix: ( "The person who needs the evidence"... )

text.Mia: The defense, prosecution, and the judge... We have seen all the pieces of evidence. And that is how we have come to know the " truth ". But there is one person who has yet to seen them all. And that person does not know the "truth". ( Changed from [And those people do not know the 'truth'.] in the original release ) That truth... It may be what will bring about the miracle in the end.
text._info: (Changed from [But there are people who have not seen them all.] in the original release)

text.Judge: There are no objections this time, correct? Now then, I will pronounce my verdict!

text.Engarde: Why don't we all respectfully sit back and listen, kids.

text.Phoenix: Objection!

text.Judge: I have already told you, Mr. Wright. This court does not need any more evidence.

text.Phoenix: I am not saying it is us that needs the evidence, Your Honor!

text.Judge: Then... you want to show the evidence to... that person...?

text.Phoenix: Yes, Your Honor.
Please, Your Honor!

text.Judge: Mr. Wright. For you to ask with such passion... I will grant you one chance.

text.Phoenix: ( O...One chance... )

text.Judge: Please show your evidence to who you think is the right person.

text.Edgeworth: Objection!
That's impossible! To turn this situation around in one try...

text.Judge: One try. That is all I will permit.

text.Phoenix: ( I have to try to remember... Everything that has happened up to this point... Think, Phoenix! Think! There must be a way to save Maya while taking Engarde down at the same time! )

text.Judge: Now then, Mr. Wright. Let's not waste any more time.
Who would you like to show evidence to?
I see. And now... Tell this court what one piece of evidence you would like to show this person!

CHOICE.ACTION: USER SELECTS Present Video Tape ( after presenting Shelly de Killer profile )
Leads to "... Well, what do you think, Mr. Edgeworth...?"

CHOICE.Judge: ... Well, what do you think, Mr. Edgeworth...?

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Uh... Um... I... don't have anything to say to this...

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm... How about you, Ms. von Karma?

CHOICE.Franziska: ... Well, I was just shot, so...

CHOICE.Judge: I'm afraid I cannot allow the defense to continue.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Whaaat!?

CHOICE.Judge: No one understands what you are talking about anymore!

CHOICE.Phoenix: W-Wait! Please! One more chance...

CHOICE.Judge: That is enough, Mr. Wright. I will now state my verdict. This court finds the defendant, Matt Engarde...
That is all. This court is adjourned!

text.Judge: ... Well, what do you think, Mr. Edgeworth...?

text.Edgeworth: Uh... Um... I think there is some merit... in showing this evidence to that witness.

text.Judge: ... Bailiff! Please bring in the transceiver from earlier!

text.Phoenix: ( Alright! It looks like I managed to convince him... )
text._info: (Changed from [Alright! It looks like they got a hold of him...] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: Maya... She's OK, right!?

text.de Killer: Didn't I tell you to concern yourself with bringing about a speedy end to this trial? Now, if I understand correctly, you wish to show me one piece of evidence?

text.Phoenix: Yes. One is all I need. I have here a video tape. It was found at your hideout.
I heard you injured three officers in your attempt to get this back.

text.de Killer: That was most regrettable. However, it was an order from my client. I was told to protect that video tape.

text.Phoenix: ( I thought so... )

text.de Killer: I'm afraid I seem to have failed in that regard.

text.Phoenix: Do you know the contents of this tape?

text.de Killer: I was sternly told by my client to not watch it. So I have absolutely no idea.

text.Phoenix: Actually, you are on this tape.

text.de Killer: Me?

text.Phoenix: There was a video camera hidden at the crime scene. Your actions were being recorded .

text.de Killer: Wh-What!?

text.Judge: Is that true!? Mr. Wright!?

text.de Killer: Who... Who was it that planted a camera...!?

text.Phoenix: Well, the only person who could have placed a camera at the scene of the crime... would be your " client " naturally.

text.Judge: Th-That was... Adrian Andrews...

text.Edgeworth: Be quiet and listen... Your Honor.

text.Judge: Yes, sir.

text.Phoenix: Your "client" specified a place and time for you, isn't that right?

text.de Killer: Y-Yes...

text.Phoenix: That was so they could film you.

text.de Killer: ... I had no idea. ... Mr. Wright. Why would my client do such a thing?
I would like to know why...

text.Phoenix: ( Why did Matt Engarde film the crime scene...? The reason "why" he did that is my ticket out of this whole mess! ) There is only one reason why your "client" would secretly film the crime scene. They...

CHOICE.ACTION: USER SELECTS wanted to see Juan get his.

CHOICE.Phoenix: They wanted to witness the moment Juan Corrida died! Your client was going to sit on their fluffy soft sofa... Sip some coffee and pretend they were at a film festival!

CHOICE.de Killer: That... That's... I don't think that sounds like a very enjoyable hobby...

CHOICE.Phoenix: Well, Your Honor!?

CHOICE.Judge: ... Well, what do you think, Mr. Edgeworth...?

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Uh... Um... I... don't have anything to say to this...

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm... How about you, Ms. von Karma?

CHOICE.Franziska: ... Well, I was just shot, so...

CHOICE.Judge: I'm afraid I cannot allow the defense to continue.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Whaaat!?

CHOICE.Judge: No one understands what you are talking about anymore!

CHOICE.Phoenix: W-Wait! Please! One more chance...

CHOICE.Judge: That is enough, Mr. Wright. I will now state my verdict. This court finds the defendant, Matt Engarde...
That is all. This court is adjourned!

CHOICE.ACTION: USER SELECTS wanted blackmail on you.
Leads to "Your "client" once told me something very interesting."
USER SELECTS didn't trust your skills.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Your "client" didn't trust your skills! That's why, in order to monitor your work, they set up a video camera!

CHOICE.de Killer: I-Is that right? I suppose that were I to fail at my job... my client would fall into utter ruin. I can't say I don't understand the want to see how I do my job. And as long as I could cleanly erase the tape... I suppose it can be overlooked.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Oh... Is that how you feel...? W-Well, everyone...? What do you think...? Pretty good, huh...?

CHOICE.Judge: ... Well, what do you think, Mr. Edgeworth...?

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Uh... Um... I... don't have anything to say to this...

CHOICE.Judge: Hmm... How about you, Ms. von Karma?

CHOICE.Franziska: ... Well, I was just shot, so...

CHOICE.Judge: I'm afraid I cannot allow the defense to continue.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Whaaat!?

CHOICE.Judge: No one understands what you are talking about anymore!

CHOICE.Phoenix: W-Wait! Please! One more chance...

CHOICE.Judge: That is enough, Mr. Wright. I will now state my verdict. This court finds the defendant, Matt Engarde...
That is all. This court is adjourned!

text.Phoenix: Your "client" once told me something very interesting. We were talking about you, and this is what they said.

text.Engarde: But I'm no weakling. I don't believe anyone... least of all assassins .
Oh, come now, Mr. Wright. Assassins aren't above blackmail.
Yes, that's where the video comes in. With that, I can keep him at bay, and even blackmail him if I want.

text.Phoenix: Your "client" didn't trust you at all. They were thinking of using this video to blackmail you! What do you have to say to that, Shelly de Killer!?

text.de Killer: Gnnn...nnnngh... Ohoooooo! ... It looks like... It looks like I was being deceived from the very beginning...

text.Phoenix: Yes... By a natural... That is the kind of person they are. Your "client" is a person who only thinks and plots of how to use the people around them to protect themselves from any and all dangers that may arise. That is the true nature of your "client".

text.Edgeworth: I have one question for the witness.

text.de Killer: Yes?

text.Edgeworth: You told us one thing numerous times during your testimony. You said that you detest traitors most of all.

text.de Killer: Yes, that's right.

text.Edgeworth: But what if that traitor was your own client ...? What would you do then!?

text.de Killer: ... That's obvious. I would break our contract in that case. And then... That client would become my next target. For the honor of the De Killer name, even if it takes an eternity... I would follow that person to the ends of the earth to exact my punishment.

text.Edgeworth: I see. That's all I wanted to know.

text.Phoenix: ( So the traitor becomes De Killer's next target... Ah! I get it... This is how we'll turn this case around ! )

text.de Killer: Mr. Wright.

text.Phoenix: Yes...?

text.de Killer: My contract with my client is over as of now. I seem to have a new job on my hands. I will now return to you, your precious item.

text.Maya: ...What the!? I'm not an item!

text.Phoenix: ( Maya... I thought I'd never see you again... Oh thank goodness! )

text.Judge: Um... This trial appears to have come to its conclusion... However... I... Actually, I am sort of... I don't quite know what just happened there with the client and the witness and... Gwaaah! M-Ms. von Karma! Where did that...!?

text.Edgeworth: She always has you in her sights. Now! I do believe it's time to finally hand down a verdict!

text.Phoenix: Mr. Engarde. It looks like somehow, you got what you wanted. You will finally receive the acquittal you wanted so badly. You should be happy.

text.Edgeworth: But before that, I would like to make one final statement. Sometime in the near future, one very betrayed assassin may appear before you.
Needless to say, that man is very good at what he does. I'm sure you would understand what I mean, if you watch this video.

text.Engarde: ...H-- Help me...

text.Edgeworth: Now then, Your Honor! The verdict, if you please.

text.Judge: I-Is this alright with you, Mr. Wright?

text.Mia: We have finally reached the end of a very long battle. Whether he's convicted or acquitted, there is no escape for him now. Go on, Phoenix. Plead whichever way your heart tells you.

text.Phoenix: Right, Chief.

CHOICE.Phoenix: Congratulations, Mr. Matt Engarde.
Please make sure to savor every moment of what little time you have left. Your Honor! As always, the defense pleads not guilty.

CHOICE.Judge: Very well. This court finds the defendant, Matt Engarde...

CHOICE.Engarde: P-Please wait...

CHOICE.Judge: What's the matter?

CHOICE.Engarde: If... If I get a not guilty... I'll... I'll be... killed...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ...Matt Engarde.
Even though I am a lawyer, I cannot make your crime disappear. I think a guilty verdict is appropriate here.

CHOICE.Engarde: M-Me!? My wonderful self...!? G-Guilty!?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Even if you got an acquittal, the instant you set foot outside the detention center, your life would be in danger. No matter which way you look at it... You can't run away from your crime anymore!

text.Engarde: ... Noooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo!Guiltyyyyyyy!!!!!!!!!!!!!!Guuuuuilty!!!GGG--Guuiiillltyyyy!!!GGGUUUILLLTYYY!!GUILTY!!!GuiLTy!!guIIIltYY!!Guil--guilty!guilty!GUilTY!GUILTY!

text.Judge: As always, it looks like we have uncovered the real truth.

text.Phoenix: ( We? I don't remember you helping out much in this... )

text.Judge: Mr. Edgeworth. How is Matt Engarde?

text.Edgeworth: I have left Ms. von Karma in charge of his incarceration. I'm sure he's getting a full-course meal of whip leather right about now.

text.Judge: Very good. That was a close one, wasn't it, witness?

text.Andrews: Yes... I plan to pay my debt to society for my own crime, Your Honor. ... The first time I was called to the witness stand during this trial... all I felt was despair. ( Changed from [I really felt hopeless.] in the original release )
text._info: (Changed from [This trial was the first time I had stood on the witness stand, and when I did...] in the original release)

text.Phoenix: ( She must be talking about the time Edgeworth really went after her... I guess she's trying to forgive him for what he did... )

text.Edgeworth: This witness... How should I put this... She has an illness.
If you're going to say you would "choose death", that is of no concern to me.

text.Andrews: But... after that, when I was alone at the detention center... That's the first time I really saw myself for who I am.
text._info: (Changed from [That's the first time I really saw myself and who I am.] in the original release)

text.Andrews: And today... When the two of you used your combined strength to convict Matt... I... I felt like I had finally been saved.

text.Phoenix: ( Wow, this is the first time I've ever seen her smile. )

text.Andrews: I am really happy that you two were in charge of this case. I really don't know how to express how I feel at this moment... This is... This is the first time I've felt comfortable with myself -- with who I am. Thank you so much, everyone!

text.Judge: It looks like we have resolved everything at last. As for myself, there are still a few things I'm confused about... But everyone seems to be in good spirits, and that is good enough for me. That is all. This court is adjourned!

text.ACTION: March 23, 5:14 PM District Court Defendant Lobby No. 3

text.Mia: You were great out there, Phoenix!

text.Phoenix: What I did out there was right... wasn't it?

text.Mia: ... This is the first time you've not gotten your client off. You got them a "guilty" verdict this time. But... You have to look past all of that, to what's really important. You now realize that there is something more than just getting a "not guilty", right?

text.Phoenix: Yes, I understand now.

text.Mia: Phoenix, think back for a second. Think to the moments before Ms. von Karma arrived with the final pieces of evidence. Think about the incredible decision you had to make...

text.Judge: Now then, Mr. Wright. Let's hear the defense's final statements on this matter.

text.Phoenix: ... ( I can't count on the evidence to help me anymore. I have to listen to my heart! Should I side with justice? Or should I save Maya's life? ) My client... Matt Engarde is...

text.Mia: Is he "guilty"... or is he "not guilty"...? Those were your choices then. And your answer... Your answer spoke to what being a " lawyer " means to you...

text.Edgeworth: Wright!

text.Phoenix: E-Edgeworth...

text.Edgeworth: I have good news. Maya is now safe in police custody!

text.Pearl: Really!?

text.Phoenix: P-Pearls--

text.Pearl: You're telling us the truth, right, Mr. Edgeworth!?

text.Edgeworth: Y-Yes... She's quite safe. She is on her way here as we speak in a patrol car.

text.Pearl: Aaaaaaaaah! Mystic Maya! Mystic Maya's safe!! You did it! You really did it, Mr. Nick!

text.Phoenix: ( Oww... She punches deceptively hard for a kid... )

text.Pearl: I... I believed in you. I kept saying to myself: Mr. Nick will save her... Mr. Nick will save her... Waaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaah!

text.Phoenix: Ah, um... Thanks.

text.Pearl: Oh...

text.Phoenix: What's wrong?

text.Pearl: Ms. von Karma...

text.Phoenix: Um... About earlier... Uh... Thanks... OWW!!

text.Franziska: Why are you still smiling... Mr. Phoenix Wright!? You... You lost!! Your perfect win record has now been crushed! And yet... You are still happy!?

text.Phoenix: ... I don't think you'll ever understand... Ms. von Karma.

text.Franziska: How dare you!?

text.Edgeworth: Don't worry. She may in time. After all, I was like that myself, until a year ago...

text.Phoenix: E-Edgeworth...?

text.Edgeworth: For my own personal victories... and for guilty verdicts... I used every dirty trick in the book. And so my win record remained spotless. But... A man appeared and stood fast against that selfish me. I fought him in my usual manner, and tasted my first defeat. I felt like I had lost everything because of that. And then... It was my turn to sit in the defendant's chair. And I was saved... by that person I called my "enemy"... I couldn't forgive myself for all that had happened. So I left the Prosecutor's Office. And I left that note... "Prosecutor Miles Edgeworth chooses death"...

text.Franziska: Hmph, as well you should have. A prosecutor who has shamed himself with defeat should crawl into a hole and die!

text.Edgeworth: ...But that was not what happened. After I left the Prosecutor's Office, I finally came to realize something. And it was in that moment of clarity that everything began to change.

text.Franziska: Wh-What foolish nonsense...

text.Edgeworth: We prosecutors use anything we can to attack the defendant. But every time we did so...

text.Phoenix: Objection!

text.Edgeworth: No matter how desperate the situation... instead of giving up like most people, that man would hold strong with his undying faith. And then, before I knew it... I began to trust in that man as well.

text.Franziska: Wh-What!? You trusted your enemy!?

text.Edgeworth: It doesn't matter how many underhanded tricks a person uses... The truth will always find a way to make itself known. The only thing we can do is to fight with the knowledge we hold and everything we have. Erasing the paradoxes one by one... It's never easy... We claw and scratch for every inch. But we will always eventually reach that one single truth . This I promise you.

text.Pearl: The "truth"...

text.Edgeworth: Yes. That's the reason why prosecutors and defense lawyers exist. But I'm sure you knew that already, didn't you, Wright?
That's why you couldn't forgive me; this man who went into hiding. Isn't that right? This man who only had his sights set on "victory", who ran away into the night...

text.Pearl: Ah! Is... Is Mr. Edgeworth right, Mr. Nick...!?

text.Phoenix: ( You really let me down... ) When you disappeared, I felt... betrayed. The reason I decided to become a lawyer to begin with... Was because I believed in the things you said to me, all those years ago... And you... You betrayed your own words. That's why... one year ago, I made up my mind. I decided that the Miles Edgeworth I knew had died... ...At least, that's what I told myself.

text.Franziska: You pathetic fool!

text.Pearl: M-Ms. von Karma...

text.Franziska: I don't want to hear the wretched whimpering of a disgraced loser! A Von Karma is someone who is destined to be perfect! Miles Edgeworth... You are no longer worthy! You are no longer worthy of being a Von Karma! And neither am I! It's over... It's all over!

text.Phoenix: ( Franziska threw something on the ground just now... )

text.Edgeworth: This is... an electromagnetic receiver .

text.Phoenix: Isn't that the thing she used to track Detective Gumshoe...?

text.Edgeworth: I'll return this to the precinct later. There's something else...

text.Pearl: Ah! Isn't that Ms. von Karma's whip!?

text.Edgeworth: "I'll never set foot in another courtroom again"... I'm sure that's what she's saying by this action...
You should keep this, Wright.

text.Phoenix: ... Umm... OK.

text.???: Nick!!

text.Pearl: Mystic Maya! Mystic Mayaaaaaaaa!

text.Maya: Oh, Nick! I knew you would come through! You got Engarde convicted, like I knew you would... And on top of that, you even rescued me!

text.Phoenix: Well, of course I did! You know I would never desert you! But we sure pressed our luck this trial... You're really lucky to be standing here!

text.Maya: Whatever, whatever. Look, it's over, OK? Besides, if I did croak, I would just come back and haunt you like a bad ghost through Pearly!

text.Phoenix: ... ( Is it really that easy to do something like that...? )

text.Maya: ... Th-Thanks a lot... Nick.

text.Phoenix: Um... Don't mention it.

text.Edgeworth: Maya...

text.Maya: Oh, Mr. Edgeworth.

text.Edgeworth: Um... I'm relieved you're alright.

text.Maya: Hey... It looks like you've made some real progress, Mr. Edgeworth!

text.Edgeworth: Umm... Well, I suppose I'm a little different from who I was a year ago.

text.Maya: Heh...
Alright! I think it's time we got out of this depressing place!

text.Phoenix: Huh? Where are we going!?

text.Maya: Food, Nick! FOOD! Grub! Chow! I'm starved! I'm so hungry even you look like a nice, juicy burger on a bun to me, Nick!

text.Phoenix: Y-You think I look like a burger...? I'm a Prime Rib at least!

text.Pearl: Come with us, Mr. Edgeworth! Please!!

text.Edgeworth: Uh, um... If you insist...

text.Phoenix: Alright... So how about we hit up our usual burger joint...?

text.Maya: Don't be silly, Nick.

text.Phoenix: Huh?

text.Maya: This case messed up that awesome evening, and got in the way of my gourmet food. So I've decided that we have to make it up by having another feast!

text.Phoenix: A-Another feast...?

text.Maya: C'mon, Nick! FOOOOOOD!

text.ACTION: March 23, 7:38 PM Gatewater Hotel Hotel Lobby

text.Gumshoe: Hey, pal! Sorry to keep you guys waiting!

text.Phoenix: Gumshoe! Are you alright!?

text.Gumshoe: Yeah, but I'm really embarrassed. I didn't think I would hit a telephone pole, of all things.

text.Phoenix: A telephone pole...? ( Then, it wasn't a red light that got him...? )

text.Lotta: Ya did it again, City Boy. I felt like my dear ol' heart was gonna give out on me! And I ain't jokin'!

text.Will: Yeah! It was more exciting than the very last episode of the Steel Samurai!

text.Phoenix: Th-Thanks...

text.Lotta: Now lookie here, mister snooty prosecutor! Don't ya reckon ya bullied Mr. Wright too hard!? If ya don't start bein' a lot nicer to him, he might just kick it... Tonight, even!

text.Edgeworth: Umm... I'll keep that in mind.

text.Lotta: Well, come on now! Everyone gather 'round! Y'all are gonna get yer picture taken by a genuine professional photographer!

text.Phoenix: ( Looks like Lotta bought herself a new camera... )

text.Gumshoe: Well, pal... At least we can put this messy case behind us now. Come on! Tonight's all about eating, so let's go chow down, pal!

text.Maya: Amen to that, pal! Amen!

text.Will: You know, when you think about it, you were the one who saved the day, Detective!

text.Gumshoe: Huh? Me? ...You really think so?

text.Edgeworth: He's right. If it wasn't for the three items you took... I think this trial would have had a very different ending.

text.Gumshoe: Ah, well, you know... It's... Ho ho. Ho ho ho ho. Ho ho ho ho ho. ...Huh? Wait. That's odd... When I ran off with the things from De Killer's hideout... I was sure I took 4 things in total, sir.
text._info: (Changed from [I was sure I took 4 things total, sir.] in the original release)

text.Maya: What?

text.Pearl: Four?

text.Gumshoe: Yeah, I'm sure I put one of the items in my coat pocket...

text.Phoenix: ( There was a fourth item ...? )

text.Lotta: Aw, come on y'all. It's over! But whoo boy, I tell ya! You really are somethin' else! Between getting' accused of murder and getting' kidnapped... Never a dull moment with you, huh?

text.Maya: Hahaha, you think?

text.Phoenix: ( Why does she look so happy about that...? )

text.Pearl: But being shut away for two whole days... Weren't you scared...?

text.Maya: Yeah, it was really scary. I felt so hopeless. So to keep my mind off of things, I drew a picture!

text.Lotta: Sounds like ya had it rough, gal! So where's this picture of yers?

text.Pearl: Yeah! I want to see it! I want to see Mystic Maya's picture!

text.Maya: ... Hmm... You know, I don't know where it went...

text.Pearl: Aww... That's too bad...

text.Maya: W-Well, it's alright! It wasn't anything important anyway.

text.Phoenix: ( Ah... It sure is nice to finally see them both smiling again. )
What is it, Edgeworth?

text.Edgeworth: This thing is picking something up.

text.Gumshoe: Ah! That's! That's Ms. von Karma's receiver! Ugh. Thanks to her, I had the most awful experience of my life, sir! I can't believe she stuck a tracking device on me...

text.Edgeworth: That's odd. Even though you're standing right here... The tracking device seems to be in a different location.

text.Gumshoe: Oh... It's probably busted or something, sir.

text.Edgeworth: ... ...Well, it doesn't matter. I'm afraid it's about time for me to excuse myself. I still have some work to do.

text.Maya: Huh!? But Mr. Edgeworth! You haven't even eaten anything yet!

text.Phoenix: ( And you've eaten way too much, you glutton! )

text.Edgeworth: I had fun tonight. Now, if you'll excuse me...

text.Phoenix: Wait.

text.Edgeworth: What?

text.Phoenix: ... I just want to say... Thanks, Edgeworth. You really saved me out there.

text.Edgeworth: ...Hmph. If anyone should be saying thanks, it should be me, Wright.

text.Phoenix: ( I feel like words alone aren't enough here... I wonder if there's anything I can give him to express how I feel...? )

CHOICE.Edgeworth: What's this...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Thank you... It's all thanks to you two. You... and her...

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to " You don't need to thank me. I was only doing my job."

CHOICE.Edgeworth: ... What's this...?

CHOICE.Phoenix: Um... It's my way of saying thanks...

CHOICE.Edgeworth: ... I... see... Well, it's the thought that counts...

CHOICE.Phoenix: ( Hmm... I guess I'm not very good at this showing my appreciation thing... )

CHOICE.ACTION: Leads to " You don't need to thank me. I was only doing my job."

text.Edgeworth: You don't need to thank me. I was only doing my job.

text.Pearl: It looks like Mr. Edgeworth has left, Mr. Nick. Hey, Mystic Maya?

text.Maya: Hm? Yes, Pearly?

text.Pearl: I guess you two can go back to being lovey-dovey, right? You and Mr. Nick, I mean...

text.Maya: P-Pearly! Would you cut it out already!? You're embarrassing me!

text.Will: Um, anyway... So, who's paying for this lovely dinner party?

text.Maya: As if you need to ask! Everyone say, "Thank you" to Nick!

text.Phoenix: Huh?

text.Gumshoe: Ah, yeah... I'm kinda at the point where I can't even buy instant noodles, pal. So I kinda already put your name on the bill.

text.Phoenix: Huh? Huh?

text.Lotta: Yeah, I got me a situation just like that myself. There's this camera shop in this hotel, see... And I just bought myself this good ol' beauty here! It'd better be anyhow for $3,000!

text.Phoenix: Huh? Huh? Huh?

text.Lotta: Actually, I reckon ya bought it for me since it's on yer tab and all.

text.Phoenix: Huh? Huh? Huh? Huh?

text.Pearl: Isn't this great, Mr. Nick!?

text.Maya: Yeah, Nick!

text.Phoenix: ... ( Why do I suddenly feel like screaming? )

text.Lotta: Aww, ya don't need to hold back now, ya hear?

text.Gumshoe: Yeah, pal! Time to let it all out!

text.Pearl: This is going to be the first time I hear the real you.

text.Maya: Go on! It's been a while since I heard you say it. I've been busy being a hostage and all.

text.Phoenix: ... Alright then... If you say so.
Objection!

text.Maya: You really came through for me, Nick! I had to hide that letter, but I knew you'd find it. I really feel like I've been living on the edge lately. I mean, I've escaped death three times now! Pretty cool, huh? I feel like a pro!

text.Pearl: I'm so happy that you could save Mystic Maya, Mr. Nick! And I'm so happy for the two of you! Speaking of which... I think this hotel is a popular place for honeymooners... So I sort of... made reservations for the two of you... Just in case...
text._info: (Changed from [Speaking of... I think this hotel is a popular place for honeymooners...] in the original release)

text.Gumshoe: Well, pal. It looks like I'm back on the force again. Mr. Edgeworth had a long talk with the Chief, and he got me reinstated for my sake! I heard he said things like, "Letting that one go is bad for all of society." I knew it! Crashing headlong into everything is the only way to live, pal!

text.Byrde: I, Maggey Byrde, am retiring this uniform as of today, sir! I'm going to be a waitress from now on. And bring smiles and joy to the people who come by the restaurant, sir! I hope you'll stop by sometime, Mr. Wright!

text.Hotti: Hmm, yes... Are you here to visit a patient? Hmm... I'm Director Hotti... Hoh, hoh. Recently... Hmm, yes... That girl, you know... I haven't seen her around... Hmm, yes... But I remember... If I even laid so much as an eye on her, it would go, "Crack!". Hmm... ...It didn't matter if I got whipped though... Hmm... Hmm, yes... Hoh, hoh.

text.Max: It's time to begin our quest of world circus domination sweetie!! And to let the world know we are serious, I plan to make a fabulous flight to Zimbabwe!

text.Regina: Hey Max! What do you think Zimbabwe is like? Do you think there are castles made of cake, and bunnies who can talk...?

text.Max: I think if there are any talking bunnies, even they won't laugh at Moe's jokes!

text.Moe: I'm ready! I'm ready! There's no way these jokes are gonna fall on deaf ears. I'm going to be more contemporary with my humor! Moe Curls, R-R-R-Represent!

text.Trilo: We've got our new act all worked out! Prepare for the "Hallelujah Chorus"!
Say something will you! You're supposed to start this off! Get on with it...!!

text.Oldbag: ...What's this!? Drat, it's just an ordinary electric razor recharging on its stand! I can't believe this. Really! How long do they plan on making me do this!? Ah, but it's Edgey-poo's idea, so that means it must have a deep, hidden meaning. But... Why do I get the feeling... They wouldn't forget about me, would they? Ah, it was never like this in the old days! Everyone thought the world of me! They used to call me Queen Wendy, and treat me like royalty, and any man who hasn't heard about this is going to feel the pain of my heel, yes they're going to feel the burn, and speaking of burn, playing with fire is very dangerous and because of that, three of the warehouses where they stored the scenery were burned right down and that caused a huge stink that

text.Andrews: I appreciate everything you and Mr. Edgeworth did for me from the bottom of my heart. Oh, that's right. I received a letter from Ms. von Karma. She said that after I get out, I should feel free to consult her about anything at all. I'm really thankful to have met everyone!

text.de Killer: It has become difficult for me in this country as of late. As such, I will take a short leave of absence. If you would like to request my services, please be sure to visit my homepage. May we both be blessed with longevity.

text.Franziska: ...! How did you know I was here...?

text.Edgeworth: With this.

text.Franziska: That's...

text.Edgeworth: I heard you were planting things on a certain person. Things like tracking devices in his coat , for example.

text.Franziska: Hmph. That's just like you. I only planted it there because he was always wearing it. This... filthy, drab coat of his... I don't know how it ended up in my luggage. But it's going in the trash, I promise you that.

text.Edgeworth: Oh, that's right... Speaking of that man... He told me something very interesting.

text.Gumshoe: When I ran off with the things from De Killer's hideout... I was sure I took 4 things in total, sir.
text._info: (Changed from [I was sure I took 4 things total, sir.] in the original release)

text.Franziska: Four things...?
text._info: (Changed from [Four items...?] in the original release)

text.Edgeworth: It seems he put the last one in his coat pocket.

text.Franziska: He put it in here...? ... It doesn't matter anymore. The case is already over.

text.Edgeworth: ... What are you going to do now?

text.Franziska: ... That's none of your business.

text.Edgeworth: Are you running away?

text.Franziska: Shut up! You don't understand a thing! You can't possibly understand what it means to be "Manfred von Karma's daughter"!

text.Edgeworth: Franziska...

text.Franziska: So many expectations from everyone around me... Expectations I must fulfill! I'm expected to win no matter what. And failure? Such a thing is not an option for me! My father was a genius. There's no doubt about that! But... But me... I'm no genius. I've always known that.
But I... I had to be one. I had to.

text.Edgeworth: ... You may not be a genius like your father... But... You are a prosecutor. You have been and always will be.

text.Franziska: ...! No, I'm not... Not anymore. I've even thrown my whip away.

CHOICE.ACTION: USER SELECTS If Whip was presented to Miles Edgeworth

CHOICE.Edgeworth: Speaking of that... Wright gave me this to hold onto. ( Wright... You knew something like this would happen, didn't you...? )
I'm going to say this again. We prosecutors do not fight for personal honor or pride. I hope you will think deeply... About what you should be striking down with that whip.

CHOICE.ACTION: USER SELECTS If Whip was not presented to Miles Edgeworth

CHOICE.Edgeworth: ( Argh... Wright... You were supposed to give me the whip! )

text.Franziska: ... You haven't changed a bit... You've always... You've always left me alone and walked on ahead without me. Miles Edgeworth... I've always hated you.

And then... Finally, my chance to take my revenge on you arrived. If I could win against that man... If I could make Phoenix Wright bow down in defeat... Then this "girl" you left behind would have risen higher than you! That was supposed to be my "revenge"...

text.Edgeworth: I see...

text.Franziska: ... You know, I can't do it... I can't change who I am. I can't throw away everything I've been until today.

text.Edgeworth: I believe you can. Just like how Adrian Andrews did.

text.Franziska: Adrian Andrews...?

text.Edgeworth: You were going to use her during the trial, right? But you... You were "dependant" on your father by using his tactics. Isn't that right?

text.Franziska: Hmph!

text.Edgeworth: Today, you chased after me, after I had left you behind all these years. And that's why we're standing here now, side by side.
But I have no intention of stopping. If you say you are going to quit your walk down the prosecutor's path... ... Then, this is where we part ways, Franziska von Karma.

text.Franziska: ... I... I... I am Franziska von Karma. Don't think I'm going to walk in your shadow forever... Our battle... begins now... so you had better prepare yourself, Miles Edgeworth!
